My hobby is fishing.
It's been pouring here for the last few days.
simp: 这里近几天都在下大雨。
trad: 這裏近幾天都在下大雨。

eng: In other words, he doesn't want to do it.
simp: 也就是说，他根本不想做。
trad: 也就是說，他根本不想做。

eng: The swimming pool is open to the public.
It's fun to learn about foreign cultures.
simp: 学习外国文化是件有趣的事。
trad: 學習外國文化是件有趣的事。

eng: Betty sat in the chair with her legs crossed.
simp: Betty 翘起双腿，在椅子上坐着。
trad: Betty 翹起雙腿，在椅子上坐著。

eng: Two's company, but three's a crowd.
We stayed in Hawaii over Christmas.
simp: 我们在夏威夷渡过了圣诞。
trad: 我們在夏威夷渡過了聖誕。

eng: Thank you very much for your help.
Jim runs as fast as Ron.
simp: Jim 和 Ron 跑得一样快。
trad: Jim 和 Ron 跑得一樣快。

eng: If it is fine tomorrow, we will play baseball.
simp: 如果明天天气好，我们就去打棒球。
trad: 如果明天天氣好，我們就去打棒球。

eng: No one trusts him any more.
She didn't dare to say anything at that time.
He won't get fat on his salary.
simp: 以他的薪水不会很富裕。
trad: 以他的薪水不會很富裕。

eng: I won't lose!
Won't you go?
It is clear that he is a great artist.
simp: 他无庸置疑是个伟大的艺术家。
trad: 他無庸置疑是個偉大的藝術家。

eng: Is this your tape recorder?
Two families live in that house.
The weather forecast said tonight it will rain.
simp: 听天气预报说今晚有雨。
trad: 聽天氣預報說今晚有雨。

eng: The weather will be good tonight for sure.
You are sitting between Meg and me.
I am yet older than he is.
He cannot be trusted.
We regret his death.
simp: 我们对他的死亡表示遗憾。
trad: 我們對他的死亡表示遺憾。

eng: The way I see it, he is right.
simp: 以我的角度来看，他是对的。
trad: 以我的角度來看，他是對的。

eng: Nancy looks like my sister.
Nancy is a hard girl for me to deal with.
simp: 对我来说，Nancy是个很难相处的女孩。
trad: 對我來說，Nancy是個很難相處的女孩。

eng: Nancy was the first girl to come.
Nancy ran across an old friend of hers yesterday.
simp: Nancy昨天巧遇了她的一个老朋友。
trad: Nancy昨天巧遇了她的一個老朋友。

eng: Nancy is having a chat with her friends.
simp: Nancy正在和她的朋友们聊天。
trad: Nancy正在和她的朋友們聊天。

eng: Does Nancy have to do her homework now?
simp: Nancy一定要现在做她的作业吗？
trad: Nancy一定要現在做她的作業嗎？

eng: Does Nancy want to have a dog?
This store is opened at eight.
I went home to change clothes.
I lent the record to Ken.
Though he is clever, he isn't wise.
simp: 即使他有些小聪明，但是他并不智慧。
trad: 即使他有些小聰明，但是他並不智慧。

eng: I'll stay here until ten.
Rainy days make me depressed.
I want you to come back early.
I could see nothing but fog.
simp: 除了雾我什么都看不见。
trad: 除了霧我什麼都看不見。

eng: Even if I grant that what you say is true, it is no excuse.
simp: 即使我承认你说的是真的，但这并不是借口。
trad: 即使我承認你說的是真的，但這並不是借口。

eng: I know about this project for the most part.
Which one of these boys is Masao?
I will be free next Saturday.
My advice is predicated on my experience.
simp: 我的建议源于我的经验。
trad: 我的建議源於我的經驗。

eng: Please wait a moment.
None of his students could solve the problem.
simp: 他的学生中没有一个可以解决这个问题。
trad: 他的學生中沒有一個可以解決這個問題。

eng: My uncle bought me this book.
simp: 我舅舅给我买的这本书。
trad: 我舅舅給我買的這本書。

eng: He promised to bring new industries to the region, but politicians rarely keep their word.
simp: 他承诺给这个地区带来新的工业，但是政治家很少完成他们的承诺。
trad: 他承諾給這個地區帶來新的工業，但是政治家很少完成他們的承諾。

eng: I don't want to share the hotel room with a stranger.
simp: 我不想和一个陌生人分享旅馆房间。
trad: 我不想和一個陌生人分享旅館房間。

eng: I feel like I am being forced to help her.
simp: 我感觉我被强制帮助她。
trad: 我感覺我被強制幫助她。

eng: He knows a lot about butterflies.
The plane flew east.
They look pretty close.
I realized then that this awful cellar was the only place that could save our lives.
simp: 我意识到这个可怕的地下室是唯一可以救我们命的地方。
trad: 我意識到這個可怕的地下室是唯一可以救我們命的地方。

eng: The workers complained when their working hours were extended.
simp: 工人们抱怨他们的工作时间被延长了。
trad: 工人們抱怨他們的工作時間被延長了。

eng: Give a lecture on literature.
When writing English, she rarely makes a mistake.
simp: 她在英文书写上很少犯错。
trad: 她在英文書寫上很少犯錯。

eng: More and more women have their own careers and are economically independent of their husbands.
simp: 越来越多的女人拥有自己的事业并实现和丈夫的经济独立。
trad: 越來越多的女人擁有自己的事業並實現和丈夫的經濟獨立。

eng: Please give me a glass of water.
Overcome weakness.
It was like a bolt out of the blue.
I would like a less expensive double room.
simp: 我想要更便宜点的双人间。
trad: 我想要更便宜點的雙人間。

eng: I'll ring you up tonight.
Who is that person?
I don't know what this word means.
simp: 我不知道这个词什么意思。
trad: 我不知道這個詞什麼意思。

eng: It is not because I hate him, but because I love him.
simp: 这并不是因为我恨他，相反我爱他。
trad: 這並不是因為我恨他，相反我愛他。

eng: I regret going there.
The machine takes a lot of room.
The dream has come true.
The word is of great use to me.
She put off going to Mexico.
simp: 她推迟了去墨西哥的行程。
trad: 她推遲了去墨西哥的行程。

eng: She seldom goes to that sort of place.
simp: 她很少去像那样的地方。
trad: 她很少去像那樣的地方。

eng: She seldom goes out.
She is seldom late for school.
She seldom eats breakfast.
She is rarely late for appointments.
She kept her eyes closed.
Has the fever gone down?
Low temperatures turn water into ice.
What a lucky person he is!
This job is beyond my ability.
simp: 这份工作在我能力范围之外.
trad: 這份工作在我能力範圍之外.

eng: I want to study English.
The doctor advised me to give up smoking.
He eats a lot.
He's saving up to go to college.
Climbing this mountain is very difficult.
Their food was great last time.
simp: 上次来吃的时候是很美味的。
trad: 上次來吃的時候是很美味的。

eng: I found that she wore the same dress that I had seen her wear last time.
simp: 我记起上次见到她时，她也是穿着这条裙子的。
trad: 我記起上次見到她時，她也是穿著這條裙子的。

eng: Walk more slowly.
A honeymoon in Canada costs a lot of money.
simp: 去加拿大渡蜜月要花很多钱。
trad: 去加拿大渡蜜月要花很多錢。

eng: I worked hard in order to support my family.
I can pay no more than $50 a week for rent.
simp: 我最多只能付每周50美元的房租。
trad: 我最多只能付每周50美元的房租。

eng: I went home and Bill stayed at the office.
simp: 我回家了，但Bill继续留在办公室。
trad: 我回家了，但Bill繼續留在辦公室。

eng: I'm free.
I often spend my leisure time listening to the radio.
simp: 我常常在我的闲暇时候听广播。
trad: 我常常在我的閑暇時候聽廣播。

eng: I write poems in my free time.
I found out where to buy fruit cheaply.
simp: 我找到一个买水果很便宜的地方。
trad: 我找到一個買水果很便宜的地方。

eng: I like to sing.
I'm good at singing.
I hope to become a singer.
I will have finished reading this book by Tuesday.
simp: 到周二的时候，我就能读完这本书了。
trad: 到周二的時候，我就能讀完這本書了。

eng: I am watering the flowers.
I need not have watered the flowers. Just after I finished it started raining.
simp: 我原本是不需要给花浇水的，我刚浇完就下雨了。
trad: 我原本是不需要給花澆水的，我剛澆完就下雨了。

eng: I'm going to exhibit my roses at the flower show.
simp: 我要把我的玫瑰拿到花展上展示。
trad: 我要把我的玫瑰拿到花展上展示。

eng: In winter I wear an overcoat.
I don't know how to use an art file (.art).
simp: 我不知道如何使用.art文件。
trad: 我不知道如何使用.art文件。

eng: She decorated the wall with pictures.
I want to see them again.
I want to be more independent.
How was the universe formed?
Did you go abroad for pleasure or on business?
simp: 你去国外是玩儿还是出差？
trad: 你去國外是玩兒還是出差？

eng: I considered changing my job.
No matter how you say it, I'm not going to listen to you.
simp: 无论你怎么说，我也不会听你的。
trad: 無論你怎麼說，我也不會聽你的。

eng: Nobody is perfect.
The sky was ablaze with fireworks.
I feel secure with him.
simp: 我和他在一起时很有安全感。
trad: 我和他在一起時很有安全感。

eng: Forget it.
If there is somebody to back me up, the business will be successful.
simp: 如果有人支持的话，生意是会成功的。
trad: 如果有人支持的話，生意是會成功的。

eng: His paintings seem strange to me.
simp: 我觉得他的画有点奇怪。
trad: 我覺得他的畫有點奇怪。

eng: Those who are present are all Japanese.
He entered his room.
Children need a lot of sleep.
Be careful driving or you'll have problems.
simp: 小心点驾驶，不然你就麻烦了。
trad: 小心點駕駛，不然你就麻煩了。

eng: Many foreigners also come to Japan to learn Japanese.
simp: 为了学习日语而来日本的外国人很多。
trad: 為了學習日語而來日本的外國人很多。

eng: Do you speak Japanese?
It's really easy for me to speak Japanese.
simp: 讲日语对我来说很简单。
trad: 講日語對我來說很簡單。

eng: He was cleaning his room.
I ran as fast as I could.
I ran as fast as I could.
Mary took out the eggs one by one.
simp: 玛丽把鸡蛋一颗一颗地取了出来。
trad: 瑪麗把雞蛋一顆一顆地取了出來。

eng: Even if he is busy, he will come.
I don't know if it is true.
simp: 我不知道这是不是真的。
trad: 我不知道這是不是真的。

eng: His words convey nothing at all to me.
simp: 他的话对我来说没有任何意义。
trad: 他的話對我來說沒有任何意義。

eng: I sat at the front in order to hear the lecture clearly.
simp: 我想听清楚演讲内容，便坐在了前面。
trad: 我想聽清楚演講內容，便坐在了前面。

eng: Look up the words in your dictionary.
simp: 用你的词典查查这些生字吧。
trad: 用你的詞典查查這些生字吧。

eng: Please tell me how I can get in touch with him.
simp: 请告诉我怎样才能联络上他。
trad: 請告訴我怎樣才能聯絡上他。

eng: Every Friday night they went and got liquored up.
simp: 他们星期五每晚都去喝酒。
trad: 他們星期五每晚都去喝酒。

eng: This passport is valid for five years.
simp: 这本护照的有用期限为五年。
trad: 這本護照的有用期限為五年。

eng: The aurora is a phenomenon characteristic of the polar regions.
simp: 极光是极地特有的自然现象。
trad: 極光是極地特有的自然現象。

eng: We believe he will succeed, for he has talent.
simp: 他是个有才能的人，我们相信他会成功。
trad: 他是個有才能的人，我們相信他會成功。

eng: My son can count up to a hundred now.
I was busy with work for the term exam.
Come on any day you like.
It is a pity that you cannot come to the party.
simp: 你不能来参加派对，真是可惜。
trad: 你不能來參加派對，真是可惜。

eng: The old man looks sad.
Ted waited for her for a long time.
Eventually I'd like to settle down and have a family, but not yet.
simp: 我会找个地方安顿下来，然后结婚生子的，但这是以后的事。
trad: 我會找個地方安頓下來，然後結婚生子的，但這是以後的事。

eng: You only have to try hard.
It was you that were wrong.
The cement will set in a couple of hours.
simp: 水泥会在数个小时内凝固。
trad: 水泥會在數個小時內凝固。

eng: I would like to know how these substances are absorbed by the body.
simp: 我想知道这些物质是怎麽被人体吸收的。
trad: 我想知道這些物質是怎麼被人體吸收的。

eng: Emi danced the most beautifully of the three girls.
simp: Emi 是三个女孩中跳得最漂亮的。
trad: Emi 是三個女孩中跳得最漂亮的。

eng: As usual the peasants are busy scattering grain seeds.
simp: 农民们如常在忙着播种。
trad: 農民們如常在忙著播種。

eng: It's pretty cold.
Strictly speaking, the tomato is a fruit.
Strictly speaking, this sentence is grammatically incorrect.
simp: 严格地讲,这句话语法上有错误。
trad: 嚴格地講,這句話語法上有錯誤。

eng: Practice makes perfect.
His action is against the law.
The staff at the company tried to cover up the truth, but soon it came to light.
simp: 公司的职员设法隐瞒，但真相不久便水落石出了。
trad: 公司的職員設法隱瞞，但真相不久便水落石出了。

eng: Lay it on the table.
Do you mind if I smoke?
The picture brought back a lot of memories.
simp: 照片使我忆起了很多往事。
trad: 照片使我憶起了很多往事。

eng: The room looks different after I've changed the curtains.
simp: 我换了窗帘后，房间看起来不同了。
trad: 我換了窗簾後，房間看起來不同了。

eng: How are you getting along these days?
No matter how cold it is outside, the rooms are comfortably heated.
simp: 无论外面多麽寒冷，房间始终既舒适又温暖。
trad: 無論外面多麼寒冷，房間始終既舒適又溫暖。

eng: That is a matter of degrees.
It has some bearing on this problem.
simp: 它和这个问题有点关係。
trad: 它和這個問題有點關係。

eng: Toyota Corporation announced that it would cut 1,000 positions this year.
simp: 丰田公司宣佈将会在今年裁员一千人。
trad: 豐田公司宣佈將會在今年裁員一千人。

eng: One third of the population of that country cannot read.
simp: 那个国家三分之一的人口是文盲。
trad: 那個國家三分之一的人口是文盲。

eng: This scarf feels soft and smooth.
simp: 这条围巾摸起来又软又滑。
trad: 這條圍巾摸起來又軟又滑。

eng: The moon is behind the clouds.
The mother kissed her baby.
He often asks silly questions.
The baby is sleeping.
The baby started to cry.
You will be all right again in a couple of days.
simp: 你两三天就会回复健康了。
trad: 你兩三天就會回復健康了。

eng: She went home.
My family went to the zoo to see pandas last Sunday.
simp: 上星期天我的家庭去了动物园看熊猫。
trad: 上星期天我的家庭去了動物園看熊貓。

eng: In culture, they are on the same plane as savages.
simp: 在教养上，他们可以说是和野蛮人差不多。
trad: 在教養上，他們可以說是和野蠻人差不多。

eng: We disputed for hours about what to write.
simp: 我们为该写些甚麽而争论了好几个小时。
trad: 我們為該寫些甚麼而爭論了好幾個小時。

eng: Whose umbrella is this?
I found it difficult to get along with him.
A careless person is apt to make mistakes.
simp: 粗心大意的人很容易犯错。
trad: 粗心大意的人很容易犯錯。

eng: He became irritated.
Not only are you wrong, but I am wrong too.
simp: 错的不只是你，我自己也错了。
trad: 錯的不只是你，我自己也錯了。

eng: It looks as if he were sick.
I'll look you up when I visit New York.
simp: 我去纽约时会来看看你的。
trad: 我去紐約時會來看看你的。

eng: We have to cope with hosts of difficulties.
simp: 我们要面对许多的困难。
trad: 我們要面對許多的困難。

eng: Please tell her to call me back.
The girl did not like to wash dishes, but she made the best of it.
simp: 女孩不太喜欢洗碗，但也尽力而为。
trad: 女孩不太喜歡洗碗，但也盡力而為。

eng: This room is used by teachers.
He is fatter than when I last saw him.
simp: 他比上次见面时胖了一些。
trad: 他比上次見面時胖了一些。

eng: They named the ship the Mayflower.
simp: 他们把船命名为「五月花号」。
trad: 他們把船命名為「五月花號」。

eng: That old tradition has disappeared.
simp: 那个古老的传统已经不复存在了。
trad: 那個古老的傳統已經不復存在了。

eng: There was no choice but to sit and wait.
She was absorbed in writing a poem.
My grandfather often nods over his newspaper.
simp: 祖父常常边看报纸边点头。
trad: 祖父常常邊看報紙邊點頭。

eng: She smiled, waving her hand.
I think you'd better go on a diet.
I think you worry too much.
His quick temper will get him in trouble one day.
simp: 他的脾气早晚会给他惹麻烦的。
trad: 他的脾氣早晚會給他惹麻煩的。

eng: Kyouichi Saionji, who he supposed would win the duel, has lost.
simp: 大家都以为西园寺会胜出那场决斗的，但他却输了。
trad: 大家都以為西園寺會勝出那場決鬥的，但他卻輸了。

eng: I asked Tony a question.
simp: 我问了 Tony 一条问题。
trad: 我問了 Tony 一條問題。

eng: This class is made up of thirty-five pupils.
When did you visit Kyoto last?
simp: 你上次去京都是甚麽时候？
trad: 你上次去京都是甚麼時候？

eng: I'll go out after having dinner.
This measure is in accord with our policy.
simp: 这个议桉合符我们的政策内容。
trad: 這個議案合符我們的政策內容。

eng: We do not anticipate their buying a new car.
simp: 我们认为他们不会买新车。
trad: 我們認為他們不會買新車。

eng: A baby has no knowledge of good and evil.
simp: 婴儿不懂得分是非黑白。
trad: 嬰兒不懂得分是非黑白。

eng: Everyone is ready.
Mary and I became good friends.
I learned to play guitar when I was ten years old.
simp: 我十岁的时候学会了弹结他。
trad: 我十歲的時候學會了彈結他。

eng: Could you lend me some money? I'm short of cash at the moment.
simp: 可以借点钱给我吗？我现在有点缺钱。
trad: 可以借點錢給我嗎？我現在有點缺錢。

eng: He was destined to become a great musician.
simp: 他决心要成为一个伟大的音乐家。
trad: 他決心要成為一個偉大的音樂家。

eng: I'm glad to see you.
Mr Hirayama is a very good teacher.
simp: 平山先生是位很好的老师。
trad: 平山先生是位很好的老師。

eng: He is a good student.
They excluded John from the club.
simp: 他们把 John 踢出了俱乐部。
trad: 他們把 John 踢出了俱樂部。

eng: He pressed me for a prompt reply.
He was master of the situation.
What about going out for a meal?
Want a drink?
Did you read that thick book?
simp: 你有没有看那本厚厚的书？
trad: 你有沒有看那本厚厚的書？

eng: I think he is a very kind man.
simp: 我觉得他是个十分亲切的人。
trad: 我覺得他是個十分親切的人。

eng: I feel quite at ease when I sit in this chair.
The music is difficult for grownups to understand.
simp: 成年人很难理解那些音乐。
trad: 成年人很難理解那些音樂。

eng: Live in affluence.
Can I use your dictionary? "Yes, here you are."
simp: 「可以借你的词典一用吗？」「没问题。」
trad: 「可以借你的詞典一用嗎？」「沒問題。」

eng: I have a firm belief in his innocence.
Not a single cloud could be seen in the sky.
It's already eleven. It's high time you were in bed.
simp: 十一时了，你该上床睡觉了。
trad: 十一時了，你該上床睡覺了。

eng: Dad is a hard worker.
That's absolute nonsense.
You had better go home as soon as possible.
Danger ahead.
Man is a creature of circumstances.
There is no TV in my room.
Do you feel like going to the theater?
He will come into a large fortune.
simp: 他将会继承大笔的遗产。
trad: 他將會繼承大筆的遺產。

eng: I bet it's fine tonight.
simp: 我打赌今晚天气会很好。
trad: 我打賭今晚天氣會很好。

eng: Is my new hair style funny?
simp: 我的新髮型是不是很奇怪？
trad: 我的新髮型是不是很奇怪？

eng: I like spring the best.
The richest man in the world cannot buy everything.
simp: 就连世界首富也不可能得到一切。
trad: 就連世界首富也不可能得到一切。

eng: Well, let's start our work.
Everybody looked up to him.
A policeman came up to me.
He speaks English fairly well.
He stood there with his hat on.
simp: 他戴着帽子在那里站着。
trad: 他戴著帽子在那裏站著。

eng: We postponed the event.
He does not study hard, but does very well at school.
simp: 他并不怎麽努力读书，但成绩却很好。
trad: 他並不怎麼努力讀書，但成績卻很好。

eng: The meeting was held here.
Bill is still a legendary figure in this company.
simp: Bill 在这间公司仍然是个传奇人物。
trad: Bill 在這間公司仍然是個傳奇人物。

eng: I think that Delbert is crazy.
simp: Delbert 好像有点神不守舍。
trad: Delbert 好像有點神不守舍。

eng: I hope that you will like it.
This one is prettier.
Dorothy isn't in the office.
The wind is picking up.
There was a neat pile of books in the corner of the room.
simp: 房间的角落里整整齐齐地放着一叠书。
trad: 房間的角落裏整整齊齊地放著一疊書。

eng: Everything seems to go right with him.
simp: 他好像做甚麽事也顺顺利利的。
trad: 他好像做甚麼事也順順利利的。

eng: Now my income is twice what it was two years ago.
simp: 我现在的收入比两年前多了一倍。
trad: 我現在的收入比兩年前多了一倍。

eng: The wheel began to roll slowly.
In these countries hunger is the rule.
simp: 对于这些国家的人民来说，捱饿是很正常的事。
trad: 對於這些國家的人民來說，捱餓是很正常的事。

eng: The bridge saved us a lot of time.
simp: 那条桥为我们节省了不少时间。
trad: 那條橋為我們節省了不少時間。

eng: I will never forget your kindness as long as I live.
simp: 我一辈子也不会忘记你的大恩大德。
trad: 我一輩子也不會忘記你的大恩大德。

eng: It's very important to know how to let off steam, living in this world.
simp: 生活在这个世界里，懂得发泄是十分重要的。
trad: 生活在這個世界裏，懂得發泄是十分重要的。

eng: He is swimming in the river.
He was tired then.
He has some experience in teaching English.
simp: 他有一些教授英语的经验。
trad: 他有一些教授英語的經驗。

eng: A fire broke out during that night.
You have many caring friends.
simp: 你身边有很多关心你的朋友。
trad: 你身邊有很多關心你的朋友。

eng: The sign says "Exit."
I prefer reading to writing.
You may go swimming or fishing.
simp: 你可以去游泳或者钓鱼。
trad: 你可以去遊泳或者釣魚。

eng: Her husband intends to bring out a new monthly magazine.
It is rude to talk when your mouth is full.
simp: 边吃东西边谈话是非常没有礼貌的。
trad: 邊吃東西邊談話是非常沒有禮貌的。

eng: She did it all by herself.
simp: 那全都是她一个人做的。
trad: 那全都是她一個人做的。

eng: I owe him my life.
She is engaged to a rich man.
simp: 她和一个有钱人订了婚。
trad: 她和一個有錢人訂了婚。

eng: I always take a bath in the morning.
I can't recall her name at the moment.
simp: 我突然想不起她的名字。
trad: 我突然想不起她的名字。

eng: I heard the leaves rustling.
I don't have a CD player, but I bought the CD anyway.
simp: 我没有 CD 播放机，但还是把唱片买下来了。
trad: 我沒有 CD 播放機，但還是把唱片買下來了。

eng: Your English is too good to be in this class.
simp: 你的英文成绩很好，不会被分派到这一班。
trad: 你的英文成績很好，不會被分派到這一班。

eng: This is what I need.
John inherited a large fortune.
simp: John 继承了一大笔财产。
trad: John 繼承了一大筆財產。

eng: I want you to read this book.
This is a daily occurrence.
I don't care a bit about the future.
Will you listen to me for a few minutes?
simp: 您愿意听我说几分钟话吗？
trad: 您願意聽我說幾分鐘話嗎？

eng: He confessed that he was guilty.
He leaves for China tomorrow.
The museum is open from Monday to Friday.
simp: 博物馆周一到周五开门。
trad: 博物館周一到周五開門。

eng: He was fined 10000 yen.
George sent me a birthday card.
simp: 乔治给我寄了一张生日卡片。
trad: 喬治給我寄了一張生日卡片。

eng: I thought you had to get up by 7:30.
He admitted his mistakes.
We should have taken the schedule into consideration.
simp: 我们本该考虑一下行程。
trad: 我們本該考慮一下行程。

eng: I like to run.
I was waiting for a taxi.
He's a good person.
The hunters captured the wild animal with a strong rope net.
simp: 猎人们用坚韧的绳网把野生动物捉住了。
trad: 獵人們用堅韌的繩網把野生動物捉住了。

eng: She will get well soon.
Betty is a pretty girl, isn't she?
simp: 贝蒂真是个漂亮女孩呢，你说是不是？
trad: 貝蒂真是個漂亮女孩呢，你說是不是？

eng: Compared to a computer, a word processor has a single purpose.
simp: 文字处理软件和电脑不同的是，它只有一个用途。
trad: 文字處理軟件和電腦不同的是，它只有一個用途。

eng: The sky has gradually clouded over.
simp: 乌云逐渐佈满了整个天空。
trad: 烏雲逐漸佈滿了整個天空。

eng: He knocked his opponent out.
I'm sorry to trouble you, but could you tell me the way to the station?
simp: 不好意思，我想请问去车站怎麽走？
trad: 不好意思，我想請問去車站怎麼走？

eng: This is a nice camera.
What would you recommend we eat?
I enjoy watching soccer on TV.
simp: 我喜欢在电视上看足球比赛。
trad: 我喜歡在電視上看足球比賽。

eng: Jack decided to cancel the reservations.
If you hurry, you'll catch up with him.
simp: 你动作快点就能赶上他。
trad: 你動作快點就能趕上他。

eng: You can eat lunch here in this room.
simp: 你可以在这房间吃午饭。
trad: 你可以在這房間吃午飯。

eng: What did you come here so early for?
How were your last exams?
I was nearly hit by a car.
I will find you your lost ring.
simp: 我会帮你把戒指找回来的。
trad: 我會幫你把戒指找回來的。

eng: You had better leave at once.
John likes to trade stamps with his friends.
simp: 约翰喜欢和朋友交换邮票。
trad: 約翰喜歡和朋友交換郵票。

eng: This is too long.
It is possible that he will come to our party.
simp: 他可能会来参加我们的派对。
trad: 他可能會來參加我們的派對。

eng: I don't want to be laughed at.
Look both ways before you cross the street.
simp: 过马路前先左右看一看。
trad: 過馬路前先左右看一看。

eng: Nice seeing you, too.
He is not what he was.
I look to you for help.
She is getting prettier and prettier.
He has finally shown his true colors.
Much as I pitied him, I could not help him.
simp: 虽然我很同情他，但却帮不上忙。
trad: 雖然我很同情他，但卻幫不上忙。

eng: He caught my hand and pulled me to the second floor.
My father is always getting angry.
Sometimes being overcautious in planning could upset the apple cart.
simp: 计划时如果过于谨慎的话，可能会反把计划搞乱。
trad: 計劃時如果過於謹慎的話，可能會反把計劃搞亂。

eng: The British have a lot of respect for law and order.
simp: 英国人很尊重法序和秩序。
trad: 英國人很尊重法序和秩序。

eng: Life has been so flat since I came here.
simp: 我来到这里以后，一直过着单调乏味的生活。
trad: 我來到這裏以後，一直過著單調乏味的生活。

eng: Sam joined the army when he was eighteen.
simp: 萨姆在十八岁时加入了军队。
trad: 薩姆在十八歲時加入了軍隊。

eng: Don't tell anybody about the matter.
simp: 不要把那件事告诉别人。
trad: 不要把那件事告訴別人。

eng: If you have time, please drop in on us.
simp: 你有空就来看看我们吧。
trad: 你有空就來看看我們吧。

eng: The Greeks used to worship several gods.
simp: 希腊人以前是信奉多神的民族。
trad: 希臘人以前是信奉多神的民族。

eng: You may always use my dictionary.
simp: 你可以随时用我的词典。
trad: 你可以隨時用我的詞典。

eng: Tell those people to back off so that the helicopter can land.
simp: 叫那些人后退，直升机要着陆了。
trad: 叫那些人後退，直升機要著陸了。

eng: Your shoes do not go with the suit.
simp: 你的鞋子和衣服不合衬。
trad: 你的鞋子和衣服不合襯。

eng: That athlete won three times in a row in this tournament.
simp: 那位选手在这次比赛中取得了三连胜。
trad: 那位選手在這次比賽中取得了三連勝。

eng: Please telephone me when you have made up your mind what you want to do.
simp: 你决定好要怎麽做的时候就打个电话给我吧。
trad: 你決定好要怎麼做的時候就打個電話給我吧。

eng: The boy lost his way in the forest.
simp: 小男孩在森林中迷路了。
trad: 小男孩在森林中迷路了。

eng: I was exhausted after running the race.
We can enjoy skiing here all the year round.
simp: 在这里我们整年都能享受到滑雪的乐趣。
trad: 在這裏我們整年都能享受到滑雪的樂趣。

eng: He heard his name called from behind.
simp: 他听到有人从后面叫他的名字。
trad: 他聽到有人從後面叫他的名字。

eng: Do you listen to the radio at home every day?
simp: 你每天也在家听收音机吗？
trad: 你每天也在家聽收音機嗎？

eng: This diamond ring is too extravagant for me.
simp: 我觉得这鑽石戒指太奢侈了。
trad: 我覺得這鑽石戒指太奢侈了。

eng: It will make little difference whether you go there by taxi or on foot.
simp: 你乘出租车去和走路去也没有甚麽分别。
trad: 你乘出租車去和走路去也沒有甚麼分別。

eng: So, it isn't hot at all.
Have you finished your homework yet?
On entering a dark tunnel, we could see nothing.
simp: 走进了漆黑的隧道后，我们甚麽也看不见。
trad: 走進了漆黑的隧道後，我們甚麼也看不見。

eng: We are expecting an addition to our family.
What does this stand for?
Can we effect a compromise?
This bag is mine.
Whenever I call, he is out.
simp: 无论我甚麽时候打给他，他也不在家。
trad: 無論我甚麼時候打給他，他也不在家。

eng: I do not read his novels.
This book is smaller.
She always writes down every word her teacher says.
simp: 她总是把老师说的话一字不差地记下来。
trad: 她總是把老師說的話一字不差地記下來。

eng: We just arrived at the station.
He never takes any notice of what his father says.
simp: 他总是把父亲的话当作耳边风。
trad: 他總是把父親的話當作耳邊風。

eng: He came after you left.
Do not oversleep tomorrow morning.
He died some years since.
That's why I told you not to go by car.
simp: 这就是我叫你别乘车去的原因。
trad: 這就是我叫你別乘車去的原因。

eng: I wish you a long and happy married life.
simp: 祝你们婚姻长长久久、永浴爱河。
trad: 祝你們婚姻長長久久、永浴愛河。

eng: Children were apt to invent their own games.
simp: 孩子们总爱创作自己的游戏。
trad: 孩子們總愛創作自己的遊戲。

eng: The population has doubled in the last five years.
simp: 在过去的五年里人口增长了一倍。
trad: 在過去的五年裏人口增長了一倍。

eng: Hearing the news, he jumped out of his chair.
simp: 他听到消息后从椅子里跳了出来。
trad: 他聽到消息後從椅子裏跳了出來。

eng: From the way they look, I would say that they failed.
simp: 从他们的表情可以知道，他们大概是失败了。
trad: 從他們的表情可以知道，他們大概是失敗了。

eng: I am responsible for the mistake.
There's a Mr Kay wants to see you.
The prediction was falsified by the result.
simp: 预言被实验结果推翻了。
trad: 預言被實驗結果推翻了。

eng: He had to leave the village.
I'm afraid we can't rule out the possibility that she may have the disease.
simp: 恐怕我们不能排除她患了病的可能性。
trad: 恐怕我們不能排除她患了病的可能性。

eng: She showed me a picture of her mother as a schoolgirl.
simp: 她给我看了一张她母亲学生时代的照片。
trad: 她給我看了一張她母親學生時代的照片。

eng: This watch is meant for you.
simp: 我打算把这块手錶送给你。
trad: 我打算把這塊手錶送給你。

eng: He says what he thinks regardless of other people's feelings.
simp: 他说话从来不理别人的感受。
trad: 他說話從來不理別人的感受。

eng: I am certainly entitled to speak like this.
simp: 我当然有资格这么说啦。
trad: 我當然有資格這麼說啦。

eng: When you speak Shanghainese with your mum, I only understand a few words, so I can't join in the conversation.
simp: 你和你妈用上海话聊天的时候，我只听得懂几个词，所以我插不上话。
trad: 你和你媽用上海話聊天的時候，我只聽得懂幾個詞，所以我插不上話。

eng: I don't know what to do now.
simp: 我不知道现在该怎麽做。
trad: 我不知道現在該怎麼做。

eng: My house looks to the south.
Prices have been rising steadily.
The fox hid in the hollow tree.
simp: 狐狸躲在了空心树里面。
trad: 狐貍躲在了空心樹裏面。

eng: It's 50 yen.
Follow the street for about 50 meters, and you will see a post office.
simp: 顺着这条街走大约50米，就会看到邮局。
trad: 順著這條街走大約50米，就會看到郵局。

eng: I'd like to borrow fifty dollars from you.
She is always bright and smiling.
simp: 她的脸上总是挂着开朗的微笑。
trad: 她的臉上總是掛著開朗的微笑。

eng: Our teacher warned him not to be late again.
simp: 我们的老师警告他不要再迟到。
trad: 我們的老師警告他不要再遲到。

eng: Put back the book where you found it.
He was roused by a loud knocking at the door.
simp: 他被啪啪的敲门声吵醒了。
trad: 他被啪啪的敲門聲吵醒了。

eng: That house is much better than his house.
simp: 那房子比他那座好得多了。
trad: 那房子比他那座好得多了。

eng: It's been raining all the time recently.
I don't have the courage to ask my boss to lend me his car.
She got off at the next station.
Jack is one of my friends.
I prepared well for this examination.
simp: 我为这次考试好好准备了一番。
trad: 我為這次考試好好準備了一番。

eng: He is gifted with perfect wisdom.
simp: 他天生拥有完美的智慧。
trad: 他天生擁有完美的智慧。

eng: He sought shelter from the rain.
simp: 他四处寻找避雨的地方。
trad: 他四處尋找避雨的地方。

eng: You must work hard, if you want to succeed.
simp: 如果你想成功，就一定要努力工作。
trad: 如果你想成功，就一定要努力工作。

eng: I have the blues today.
Coffee does harm to your stomach.
He is in poor health.
I was disappointed.
They may be playing in the park.
simp: 他们也许正在公园里玩。
trad: 他們也許正在公園裏玩。

eng: She was able to cook herself dinner, after a fashion.
simp: 她勉强能自己煮晚餐吃。
trad: 她勉強能自己煮晚餐吃。

eng: The train will arrive on time without fail.
I'll be back soon.
This tower commands a full view of the city.
simp: 从这塔上可以看到城市的全貌。
trad: 從這塔上可以看到城市的全貌。

eng: The bag was too heavy for me to move.
simp: 那个袋子太重了，我拿不动。
trad: 那個袋子太重了，我拿不動。

eng: We will help him if he asks us.
simp: 如果他来找我们的话，我们是会帮忙的。
trad: 如果他來找我們的話，我們是會幫忙的。

eng: It's a dictionary.
I'm afraid there isn't any coffee left.
Unconsciously my mom took hold of the chair.
simp: 母亲无意中握住了椅子。
trad: 母親無意中握住了椅子。

eng: I think it's true.
I don't know what it is.
Japan is a beautiful country.
Mary paid five dollars for her lunch.
On his arrival at the station, he called a taxi.
simp: 他到了火车站，就叫了辆出租车。
trad: 他到了火車站，就叫了輛出租車。

eng: He left an hour ago.
You're sick. You have to rest.
He wiped the sweat from his face.
She went out of the room.
The moon was above the horizon.
simp: 月亮已从地平线升起了。
trad: 月亮已從地平線升起了。

eng: It's high time you left for school, isn't it?
You can't go out.
Look at the car made in Japan.
He always takes his time in everything that he does.
simp: 他做事总是从容不迫的。
trad: 他做事總是從容不迫的。

eng: She lay awake all night.
I am determined to carry out this plan.
simp: 我决心要推行这个计划。
trad: 我決心要推行這個計劃。

eng: Am I hungry!
He has investigated the possibility of cooperation.
simp: 他调查了两方合作的可能性。
trad: 他調查了兩方合作的可能性。

eng: What must you do now?
simp: 你现在有甚麽是一定要做的？
trad: 你現在有甚麼是一定要做的？

eng: John came to Japan yesterday.
They are going off by plane tomorrow.
simp: 他们明天就乘飞机走了。
trad: 他們明天就乘飛機走了。

eng: If your friend reminds you kindly of your faults, take what he says not only pleasantly, but thankfully.
simp: 如果有朋友对你作出善意批评，你不止应该欣然接受，还要好好的感谢他。
trad: 如果有朋友對你作出善意批評，你不止應該欣然接受，還要好好的感謝他。

eng: This place isn't convenient to public transportation.
I want to eat fresh fish.
Thirty dollars is a lot for that small room, he thought.
simp: 「这麽狭小的房间要三十元实在是太贵了。」他想。
trad: 「這麼狹小的房間要三十元實在是太貴了。」他想。

eng: She took her own life.
We are all liable to make mistakes.
What with fatigue and lack of sleep, he has fallen ill at last.
simp: 他疲劳过度，又睡眠不足，最后便病倒了。
trad: 他疲勞過度，又睡眠不足，最後便病倒了。

eng: Bad weather prevented us from starting.
simp: 天气太差，我们只好迟点出发。
trad: 天氣太差，我們只好遲點出發。

eng: Where's the bus stop?
Do I need surgery?
He made many grammatical mistakes in his composition.
simp: 他的作文有很多文法错误。
trad: 他的作文有很多文法錯誤。

eng: He wears his hair long.
I'm having some problems compiling this software.
simp: 我编译这个程序有些困难。
trad: 我編譯這個程序有些困難。

eng: Some of my classmates are pure noobs; they know nothing about computing sciences.
simp: 我的一些同学真是菜鸟，他们一点都不懂计算机。
trad: 我的一些同學真是菜鳥，他們一點都不懂計算機。

eng: Most developers hate debugging; it's more fun to create bugs than to correct them.
simp: 大部分程序员讨厌调试，设置故障比纠正它们有意思多了。
trad: 大部分程序員討厭調試，設置故障比糾正它們有意思多了。

eng: I often use SSH to access my computers remotely.
simp: 我经常使用SSH来远程连接到我的电脑。
trad: 我經常使用SSH來遠程連接到我的電腦。

eng: How did you come to know such a wonderful girl?
simp: 你是怎麽认识那个好女孩的？
trad: 你是怎麼認識那個好女孩的？

eng: He could not go on a trip for lack of money.
Have you ever heard that song sung in French?
simp: 你有听过那首歌的法文版本吗？
trad: 你有聽過那首歌的法文版本嗎？

eng: Father set the alarm for six o'clock.
We discussed gun control in social studies class.
simp: 我们上社会课的时候谈到了枪械管制的问题。
trad: 我們上社會課的時候談到了槍械管制的問題。

eng: You have nothing to fear.
He seemed to have been rich.
simp: 看来他曾经是个有钱人。
trad: 看來他曾經是個有錢人。

eng: It was foolish of her to ask him for help.
simp: 她去找他帮忙，实在不是一个明智之举。
trad: 她去找他幫忙，實在不是一個明智之舉。

eng: The important thing is to call the police at once.
I think we had better wait for another 30 minutes.
simp: 我想我们还是再多等三十分钟吧。
trad: 我想我們還是再多等三十分鐘吧。

eng: I paid 3 dollars for the book.
simp: 我用三块钱买了那本书。
trad: 我用三塊錢買了那本書。

eng: What is the good of having a car if you don't drive?
simp: 你根本不开车，有车又有甚麽用？
trad: 你根本不開車，有車又有甚麼用？

eng: Before long, she came into my room.
simp: 过了一会，她就走进了我的房间。
trad: 過了一會，她就走進了我的房間。

eng: I used to play badminton, but I do not any more.
simp: 我以前常去打羽毛球，但现在不打了。
trad: 我以前常去打羽毛球，但現在不打了。

eng: Let me get you something to drink.
Must this letter be written in English?
simp: 这封信一定要用英文写吗？
trad: 這封信一定要用英文寫嗎？

eng: I have many things to do now.
He had nothing to do with the case.
simp: 他和那件事半点关係也没有。
trad: 他和那件事半點關係也沒有。

eng: She's wearing eye shadow.
We regard him as an important man.
He has a sweet voice.
May the new year bring you happiness!
The group is made up of six members.
The handle came away from the door when I grasped it.
simp: 我握住门把，它就从门上掉了下来。
trad: 我握住門把，它就從門上掉了下來。

eng: The young man decided to propose to her.
English is spoken in a lot of countries.
simp: 英语是很多国家通用的语言。
trad: 英語是很多國家通用的語言。

eng: Regular exercise is beneficial to good health.
You needn't be ashamed because you failed the exam.
simp: 你虽然考试不及格，但也不必自卑。
trad: 你雖然考試不及格，但也不必自卑。

eng: How many cars do you have?
Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
Our club has three times as many members as yours.
simp: 我们的俱乐部的人数比你们多三倍。
trad: 我們的俱樂部的人數比你們多三倍。

eng: The house requires repairs.
Read such books as can be easily understood.
simp: 你应该从比较简单的书开始。
trad: 你應該從比較簡單的書開始。

eng: He entirely lost his temper with me.
His income is three times larger than mine.
I'll let you know when she arrives.
simp: 她来到的时候我会通知你。
trad: 她來到的時候我會通知你。

eng: We happened to meet her in the park.
I hear he's just begun looking for another job.
simp: 听说他又开始找工作了。
trad: 聽說他又開始找工作了。

eng: Strange to say, his prediction has come true.
simp: 说来奇怪，他的预言竟然真的灵验了。
trad: 說來奇怪，他的預言竟然真的靈驗了。

eng: Who broke the window?
You ought to go by taxi, or you might not get there in time.
simp: 你最好乘出租车去，不然可能会赶不及。
trad: 你最好乘出租車去，不然可能會趕不及。

eng: It happened that we were in London.
simp: 那时我们刚好就在伦敦。
trad: 那時我們剛好就在倫敦。

eng: What time will the game start?
I want to talk to him about it.
Go to your respective seats.
simp: 请回到你们各自的座位。
trad: 請回到你們各自的座位。

eng: Welcome to San Francisco.
That aim is impossible to attain.
simp: 那个目标是无法达成的。
trad: 那個目標是無法達成的。

eng: I have trouble putting up with his rude manner.
simp: 我受不了他那种无礼的态度。
trad: 我受不了他那種無禮的態度。

eng: I have tried innumerable times to contact him.
If you have a cold, you should get plenty of rest.
simp: 你患了感冒的话，一定要好好休息。
trad: 你患了感冒的話，一定要好好休息。

eng: You ought to see a doctor.
The dog waited day after day for its master's return.
simp: 那隻狗日复一日地等待着主人的归来。
trad: 那隻狗日復一日地等待著主人的歸來。

eng: I watched the news on TV after supper.
simp: 我吃过晚饭后打开电视看了一会儿新闻。
trad: 我吃過晚飯後打開電視看了一會兒新聞。

eng: This country has a mild climate.
simp: 这个国家的气候很温和。
trad: 這個國家的氣候很溫和。

eng: Can you answer this question?
The train was so crowded that none of us could get a seat.
simp: 火车挤得要命，我们都找不到位子坐。
trad: 火車擠得要命，我們都找不到位子坐。

eng: I can't afford to buy a new car.
It will be dark by the time the police come here.
simp: 等到警察来的时候，天大概也黑了吧。
trad: 等到警察來的時候，天大概也黑了吧。

eng: I'm afraid you have to work overtime.
I go every year.
I see your mind's made up.
The accident caused traffic confusion.
He contemplated taking a trip to Paris.
It is dangerous for children to play near this pond.
simp: 小孩在这个水池旁边玩会很容易发生意外的。
trad: 小孩在這個水池旁邊玩會很容易發生意外的。

eng: Stop smoking.
My daughter is to get married in June.
simp: 我女儿打算在六月结婚。
trad: 我女兒打算在六月結婚。

eng: The number of visitors to Singapore has increased year by year.
simp: 最近几年到新加坡的旅客人数不断增长。
trad: 最近幾年到新加坡的旅客人數不斷增長。

eng: I demanded that she should go.
This medicine should be taken every three hours.
simp: 这药要每三个小时服一次。
trad: 這藥要每三個小時服一次。

eng: At one time they lived in Nagoya.
simp: 他们在名古屋住过一段时间。
trad: 他們在名古屋住過一段時間。

eng: We were surprised at the news.
simp: 我们收到消息时都吓了一跳。
trad: 我們收到消息時都嚇了一跳。

eng: It is wicked of you to do such things.
simp: 你竟然做出那样的事来，你还是人吗？
trad: 你竟然做出那樣的事來，你還是人嗎？

eng: We must have respect for tradition.
To be a good batter, you've got to hang loose and follow your instincts.
simp: 想成为一个好的击球手的话，你要在球场上时刻保持镇定，还要学会相信自己的直觉。
trad: 想成為一個好的擊球手的話，你要在球場上時刻保持鎮定，還要學會相信自己的直覺。

eng: That building is our school.
simp: 那座建筑物就是我们的学校了。
trad: 那座建築物就是我們的學校了。

eng: I live within walking distance of school.
simp: 我学校离我家只是几步路的路程。
trad: 我學校離我家只是幾步路的路程。

eng: Whose books are these?
If you add 3 to 3, you get 6.
It is said that there is no life on Mars.
simp: 据说火星上是没有生物的。
trad: 據說火星上是沒有生物的。

eng: This coat is rainproof.
After I watched TV, I went to bed.
simp: 我看完电视就上床睡觉了。
trad: 我看完電視就上床睡覺了。

eng: All of a sudden, I felt a sharp pain in my stomach.
I can't do two things at a time.
How far is it from here to your house?
The ball bounded away into our neighbor's garden.
simp: 球弹呀弹呀的弹进了邻家的花园。
trad: 球彈呀彈呀的彈進了鄰家的花園。

eng: I am anxious to visit Britain once again.
You can swim, but I can't.
Please call me at this number.
simp: 请你用这个电话号码联络我。
trad: 請你用這個電話號碼聯絡我。

eng: They have a growing population; therefore they need more and more food.
simp: 那国家的人口正在增长，所以他们需要的食物量也愈来愈大。
trad: 那國家的人口正在增長，所以他們需要的食物量也愈來愈大。

eng: What did you talk about?
You might at least say "thank you."
They showed the scene in slow motion.
simp: 他们用慢动作把那一幕播了出来。
trad: 他們用慢動作把那一幕播了出來。

eng: Were you scolded by your teacher?
I have complete faith in my doctor.
Close the window, will you?
I run as fast as Jim.
He wrote a book on China.
simp: 他写了一本关于中国的书。
trad: 他寫了一本關於中國的書。

eng: He's behind the times in his methods.
How tall you are!
I tried many things but failed after all.
simp: 我尝试过很多东西，但最后都失败收场。
trad: 我嘗試過很多東西，但最後都失敗收場。

eng: You should not judge a man by his appearance.
The floor must be very clean.
He will return within 3 hours.
simp: 他会在三个小时内回来。
trad: 他會在三個小時內回來。

eng: He has lived off his parents for ten years since he graduated from college.
simp: 他大学毕业已经十年了，但还没有学会独立生活。
trad: 他大學畢業已經十年了，但還沒有學會獨立生活。

eng: I was fascinated by her sweet voice.
simp: 我被她甜美的声线迷倒了。
trad: 我被她甜美的聲線迷倒了。

eng: Can you tell me the time?
Seen from space, the earth is very beautiful.
simp: 从太空里看，地球是个十分美丽的星球。
trad: 從太空裏看，地球是個十分美麗的星球。

eng: Please do not enter the room without knocking.
simp: 请你不要不敲门就进来。
trad: 請你不要不敲門就進來。

eng: Do not take any notice of him.
An Englishman would not use such a word.
simp: 英国人是不会用这样的字的。
trad: 英國人是不會用這樣的字的。

eng: He tore up his letter into small bits and threw them out the window.
simp: 他把信撕成碎片，扔出了窗外。
trad: 他把信撕成碎片，扔出了窗外。

eng: I have been writing since two o'clock without a break.
simp: 我从两点开始写呀写呀，一分钟也没休息过。
trad: 我從兩點開始寫呀寫呀，一分鐘也沒休息過。

eng: I was about to leave when you telephoned.
simp: 你打来的时候我正准备出门。
trad: 你打來的時候我正準備出門。

eng: He speaks English better than I do.
You need to eat more fiber.
simp: 你要吃多点含膳食纤维的食物。
trad: 你要吃多點含膳食纖維的食物。

eng: He is nothing more than an egoist.
simp: 他只不过是个自私自利的人。
trad: 他只不過是個自私自利的人。

eng: We mustn't give way to these impudent demands.
simp: 我们绝不会接受这些横蛮无理的要求。
trad: 我們絕不會接受這些橫蠻無理的要求。

eng: The house did not suffer much damage because the fire was quickly put out.
simp: 火很快便被扑熄了，房子只受到轻微损坏。
trad: 火很快便被撲熄了，房子只受到輕微損壞。

eng: I took you for Mrs. Brown.
simp: 我把你认成布朗太太了。
trad: 我把你認成布朗太太了。

eng: I am not in the least interested in such a thing.
simp: 我对这样的东西半点兴趣也没有。
trad: 我對這樣的東西半點興趣也沒有。

eng: Her watch is ten minutes slow.
Happy New Year!
This is what he said.
I'm sorry, but I didn't catch what you said.
simp: 不好意思，你刚才说甚麽？
trad: 不好意思，你剛才說甚麼？

eng: May I use your phone?
simp: 可以借你的电话用用吗？
trad: 可以借你的電話用用嗎？

eng: He is a professor of English at Leeds.
simp: 他是利兹大学的英文系教授。
trad: 他是利茲大學的英文系教授。

eng: The old man sat on the bench with his eyes closed.
simp: 老人闭上双眼，在长凳上坐着。
trad: 老人閉上雙眼，在長凳上坐著。

eng: It has greatly improved compared with what it was.
simp: 和以前相比，已经进步了很多。
trad: 和以前相比，已經進步了很多。

eng: It all depends on whether they will support us.
simp: 现在只看他们会不会帮忙了。
trad: 現在只看他們會不會幫忙了。

eng: The cat didn't move a muscle.
No, I think he just does those things because he wants to please his wife.
simp: 才不呢，我想他那样做只不过是想哄老婆高兴。
trad: 才不呢，我想他那樣做只不過是想哄老婆高興。

eng: Both his sisters are beautiful.
He had various experiences in his life.
simp: 他一生中经历过很多东西。
trad: 他一生中經歷過很多東西。

eng: He could not believe his ears.
How dare you speak like that to me?
That country is rich in mineral resources.
simp: 那个国家拥有丰富的矿物资源。
trad: 那個國家擁有豐富的礦物資源。

eng: They are very kind to me.
I met her during my stay in Mexico.
simp: 我在墨西哥旅行的时候踫见了她。
trad: 我在墨西哥旅行的時候踫見了她。

eng: She turned down his proposal.
John's mother looks so young that she is often mistaken for his elder sister.
simp: 约翰的母亲看起来很年轻，别人不细看倒以为她是约翰的姐姐。
trad: 約翰的母親看起來很年輕，別人不細看倒以為她是約翰的姐姐。

eng: She closely resembles her mother.
The progress of science has brought about great change in our lives.
simp: 科技的进步为我们的生活带来了巨大的转变。
trad: 科技的進步為我們的生活帶來了巨大的轉變。

eng: I didn't greet you because I mistook you for somebody else.
simp: 我把你认成了别人，所以才没有和你打招呼。
trad: 我把你認成了別人，所以才沒有和你打招呼。

eng: A stable economy is the aim of every government.
simp: 经济繁荣稳定，是每个政府都想达到的目标。
trad: 經濟繁榮穩定，是每個政府都想達到的目標。

eng: This clock seems to be malfunctioning.
Please let me know your new address.
simp: 可以把新地址告诉我吗？
trad: 可以把新地址告訴我嗎？

eng: You may have it for the asking.
simp: 如果你喜欢，就送给你吧。
trad: 如果你喜歡，就送給你吧。

eng: I think the rumor is true.
Last night I went to bed late after writing a letter.
simp: 昨天我写信写到很晚才去睡觉。
trad: 昨天我寫信寫到很晚才去睡覺。

eng: To purchase a ticket, you need to enter your personal details.
simp: 你要先输入好个人资料，然后才能买票。
trad: 你要先輸入好個人資料，然後才能買票。

eng: Women generally live longer than men.
The teacher has a great influence on his pupils.
simp: 这个教授对他的学生有很大的影响力。
trad: 這個教授對他的學生有很大的影響力。

eng: I'd like to reserve a flight to Vancouver.
simp: 我想订一张去温哥华的机票。
trad: 我想訂一張去溫哥華的機票。

eng: You can't say no.
Your shoes are here.
Get rid of those kinds of naive ideas.
simp: 打消这种幼稚的念头吧。
trad: 打消這種幼稚的念頭吧。

eng: I found the test difficult.
We are prepared for the worst.
simp: 我们已经做好了最坏的准备。
trad: 我們已經做好了最壞的準備。

eng: I'll explain to you how to use it when I come back.
simp: ­我回来就解释给你听怎么用。
trad: ­我回來就解釋給你聽怎麼用。

eng: I'm a nice guy.
Sorry to trouble you.
Goodbye! When you have more time, come back and play!
So I'll come see you off.
I need a little help from you.
simp: 我有点儿小事情想请你帮忙。
trad: 我有點兒小事情想請你幫忙。

eng: I'm too ashamed.
Thank you!
No prob.
Stay for a while.
No problem.
Do you want to go?
My name is Wang Jiaming.
She is Li Ying.
Where are you from?
Where does he come from?
He comes from Hangzhou.
I've been here for a while.
Can you speak Shanghainese?
I understand it a little, but I can't speak it.
simp: 能听懂一点儿，但是不会讲。
trad: 能聽懂一點兒，但是不會講。

eng: What's your blood group?
Who is this person?
It used to be thought that the earth was flat.
simp: 以前的人以为地球是平的。
trad: 以前的人以為地球是平的。

eng: What he says always corresponds with what he does.
The house gave no sign of life.
We should sometimes expose our bodies to the sun.
simp: 我们閒时应该出外晒晒太阳。
trad: 我們閒時應該出外曬曬太陽。

eng: I wonder who invented it.
Mountaineering is attractive especially to young people because it is accompanied with hardships and adventures.
simp: 攀山是种既紧张刺激，又具挑战性的运动，因此特别受年青人欢迎。
trad: 攀山是種既緊張刺激，又具挑戰性的運動，因此特別受年青人歡迎。

eng: He had an accident on his way home.
simp: 他在回家途中出了意外。
trad: 他在回家途中出了意外。

eng: We carried on the discussion till late at night.
This knife won't cut well.
What season do you like the best?
Tell her to come at noon.
He went out in spite of the rain.
simp: 尽管下着雨，他还是出去了。
trad: 盡管下著雨，他還是出去了。

eng: I was lonely without her.
Few people know how to do it.
I can't agree with your opinion.
Bread is made from flour, water and yeast.
simp: 面包是用面粉、水和发酵粉做的。
trad: 面包是用面粉、水和發酵粉做的。

eng: It's a sunflower.
I am getting off at the next station.
Are you interested in politics?
I see the dog almost every day.
simp: 我几乎每天都见到那条狗。
trad: 我幾乎每天都見到那條狗。

eng: No news is good news.
See you about 7.
She gets up at seven.
He gave me food and money as well.
Man is the only animal that can speak.
simp: 人是唯一会说话的动物。
trad: 人是唯一會說話的動物。

eng: No fewer than 50 passengers were killed.
How much was your new computer?
simp: 这台电脑你用多少钱买的？
trad: 這臺電腦你用多少錢買的？

eng: I made a decision to study abroad.
This salad tastes of lemon.
simp: 这个沙拉有柠檬的味道。
trad: 這個沙拉有檸檬的味道。

eng: Your smile always makes me happy.
simp: 看见你笑，我就会高兴起来。
trad: 看見你笑，我就會高興起來。

eng: All the people present were moved by his speech.
simp: 他的演说感动了在场的每一个人。
trad: 他的演說感動了在場的每一個人。

eng: He overslept this morning.
They went along and along, but they couldn't seem to find just the right place.
simp: 他们四处找来找去，但就是找不到合适的地方。
trad: 他們四處找來找去，但就是找不到合適的地方。

eng: Such an idea is abhorrent to her.
They came at an inconvenient time.
simp: 他们在不合适的时间来了。
trad: 他們在不合適的時間來了。

eng: Excuse me, but is this the right way to the subway station?
simp: 不好意思，请问这条路通往地铁站吗？
trad: 不好意思，請問這條路通往地鐵站嗎？

eng: Emily ate tofu at dinner.
It is getting warmer and warmer.
How about adding a little bit more salt?
The more we have, the greater our desire will be.
simp: 人拥有得愈多，贪念就愈大。
trad: 人擁有得愈多，貪念就愈大。

eng: She is very fond of flowers.
She was carrying a basket full of flowers.
simp: 她提着一只满是鲜花的篮子。
trad: 她提著一只滿是鮮花的籃子。

eng: She spends as much money as she earns.
We didn't notice her sorrow.
simp: 我们没注意到她的悲伤。
trad: 我們沒註意到她的悲傷。

eng: You should distinguish between right and wrong.
Tell me why you want to go there.
simp: 告诉我你为什么要去那儿。
trad: 告訴我你為什麼要去那兒。

eng: He seems to be asleep.
As it is, prices are going up every week.
simp: 事实上，价格每个星期都在攀升。
trad: 事實上，價格每個星期都在攀升。

eng: I went to bed later than usual.
We have not had a single drop of rain for two weeks.
simp: 这两个礼拜一滴雨也没下过。
trad: 這兩個禮拜一滴雨也沒下過。

eng: It is terrible weather today.
He wasn't given any reward for his service.
He is not as young as he looks.
We may well have rain this evening.
He's a late bloomer.
I cannot recommend her as a secretary.
He put on his glasses and began to read.
My travel fees to Japan are paid for by the university.
simp: 去日本的旅费由大学替我支付。
trad: 去日本的旅費由大學替我支付。

eng: He knows every inch of this area.
She has faults, but I love her none the less.
simp: 虽然她有些缺点，但我始终还是爱她。
trad: 雖然她有些缺點，但我始終還是愛她。

eng: Water consists of hydrogen and oxygen.
However hard you try, you can't finish it in a week or so.
simp: 你就算多努力，也不可能在一两个星期内做完。
trad: 你就算多努力，也不可能在一兩個星期內做完。

eng: This mountain scenery is very beautiful.
Some day you will come to realize the importance of saving.
simp: 你现在不好好储蓄金钱的话，终有一天会后悔的。
trad: 你現在不好好儲蓄金錢的話，終有一天會後悔的。

eng: This rule doesn't apply to every case.
simp: 这条规则不是甚麽时候都适用的。
trad: 這條規則不是甚麼時候都適用的。

eng: I felt hungry.
Tom likes cheese.
Why?
When did you get up?
When will you come home?
We cleared a path through the woods.
simp: 我们在森林里开了一条路。
trad: 我們在森林裏開了一條路。

eng: What do you call your father?
simp: 你是怎麽称呼你父亲的呢？
trad: 你是怎麼稱呼你父親的呢？

eng: The reply came after three days.
simp: 我在三天之后收到了回覆。
trad: 我在三天之後收到了回覆。

eng: This is the most delicious apple.
If I had wings, I would fly to you.
simp: 如果我有翅膀的话，真想马上飞到你的身边。
trad: 如果我有翅膀的話，真想馬上飛到你的身邊。

eng: This car is like new.
simp: 这辆车是在极好的条件。
trad: 這輛車是在極好的條件。

eng: Latin is a dead language.
I have many friends.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
simp: 一天一苹果，医生远离我。
trad: 一天一蘋果，醫生遠離我。

eng: I had instant noodles as a midnight snack.
You can go if you want to.
Each child was given a present.
simp: 每个孩子都收到了份礼物。
trad: 每個孩子都收到了份禮物。

eng: Kyoto is famous for its shrines and temples.
simp: 京都的祭坛和寺院出名的。
trad: 京都的祭壇和寺院出名的。

eng: He is fond of this kind of music.
He can't do this kind of work, and she can't either.
simp: 他不会做这种工作，她也不会。
trad: 他不會做這種工作，她也不會。

eng: He keeps this gun loaded.
simp: 他在枪每时每刻有子弹。
trad: 他在槍每時每刻有子彈。

eng: He took up golf this spring.
simp: 他这春天开始玩高尔夫球。
trad: 他這春天開始玩高爾夫球。

eng: My mother will attend to the baby while I go to the dance.
simp: 我去参加舞会，母亲就帮忙照顾婴儿。
trad: 我去參加舞會，母親就幫忙照顧嬰兒。

eng: Have you made up your mind where to go for the holidays?
simp: 你想好放假去哪里玩了没有？
trad: 你想好放假去哪裏玩了沒有？

eng: It occurred to me that he might be an industrial spy.
simp: 我突然想到他可能是个商业间谍。
trad: 我突然想到他可能是個商業間諜。

eng: They quarreled.
Grandmother's ashes are in an urn at the temple.
simp: 祖母的骨灰是在骨灰瓮在寺院。
trad: 祖母的骨灰是在骨灰甕在寺院。

eng: I love you.
I have no idea what you mean.
The rocks are weathered into fantastic forms.
simp: 岩石经过风化后，形成了各种奇特的形状。
trad: 巖石經過風化後，形成了各種奇特的形狀。

eng: What the hell is this?
Foreign people are amusing.
Foreign people intrigue me.
Bottoms up!
If I were you, I would do the same.
simp: 换了是我，我也会这样做的。
trad: 換了是我，我也會這樣做的。

eng: If you want to study in the United States, you need to get a student visa.
simp: 你想去美国读书的话，一定要先申请一张学生签证。
trad: 你想去美國讀書的話，一定要先申請一張學生簽證。

eng: Human beings differ from animals in that they can think and speak.
simp: 人类有思考和说话的能力，动物却没有。这就是人和动物的分别。
trad: 人類有思考和說話的能力，動物卻沒有。這就是人和動物的分別。

eng: Don't forget to sweep the kitchen clean.
The writer is working on a new book.
My wife is always finding fault with me.
simp: 我老婆常常说我这样做不对、那样做不对。
trad: 我老婆常常說我這樣做不對、那樣做不對。

eng: He asked her to marry him, but she refused.
simp: 他向她求婚，但她却拒绝了。
trad: 他向她求婚，但她卻拒絕了。

eng: There's no point in taking a camera.
Here is your appointment card.
I think you're right.
I have an appointment with him at six.
I have no idea what you mean.
simp: 我不明白你的意思是甚麽。
trad: 我不明白你的意思是甚麼。

eng: He is tall and handsome.
He studies French and web design.
simp: 他又学法语，又学怎么做网站。
trad: 他又學法語，又學怎麼做網站。

eng: When man and woman unite, work is no longer as tiring.
Neither he nor she wants to do the dishes, and so the two of them decided to eat out.
simp: 他也不想洗碗，她也不想洗碗，所以他们决定出去吃。
trad: 他也不想洗碗，她也不想洗碗，所以他們決定出去吃。

eng: Sometimes I walk to work, and sometimes I ride my bike, because I live very close to work.
simp: 我有时候走路去上班，有时候骑自行车去上班，因为我家离单位很近。
trad: 我有時候走路去上班，有時候騎自行車去上班，因為我家離單位很近。

eng: While he was waiting for the train, he listened to music and sent text messages.
simp: 他等火车的时候，一会儿听音乐，一会儿发短信。
trad: 他等火車的時候，一會兒聽音樂，一會兒發短信。

eng: I called you, on the one hand to invite you out to eat, and on the other to tell you my son is going to get married.
simp: 我打电话给你，一来是想请你吃饭，二来是想告诉你我儿子要结婚了。
trad: 我打電話給你，一來是想請你吃飯，二來是想告訴你我兒子要結婚了。

eng: On the one hand I called you to invite you to dinner, on the other to tell you my son is getting married.
simp: 我打电话给你，一方面是想请你吃饭，另一方面是想告诉你我儿子要结婚了。
trad: 我打電話給你，一方面是想請你吃飯，另一方面是想告訴你我兒子要結婚了。

eng: The best day in one's life.
No one can tell the reason.
Dinner will be ready soon.
Thank you for sending me a nice card.
simp: 谢谢你寄给我的一张漂亮的卡片。
trad: 謝謝你寄給我的一張漂亮的卡片。

eng: I can't afford to eat in such an expensive restaurant.
simp: 我吃不起这么贵的餐馆。
trad: 我吃不起這麼貴的餐館。

eng: You should work hard.
Whoever said so, it is false.
I can hardly hear you.
She talked a lot.
She talks a lot.
May I join you?
A minute has sixty seconds.
I am eating an apple.
She was ill with heart disease.
If you didn't eat the cake I made, then your sister did.
simp: 我做的蛋糕不是被你吃了，就是被你妹妹吃了。
trad: 我做的蛋糕不是被你吃了，就是被你妹妹吃了。

eng: This isn't Mandarin, it's Shanghainese.
simp: 这不是普通话，而是上海话。
trad: 這不是普通話，而是上海話。

eng: I'd rather die than see you cry.
simp: 我宁可死，也不想看见你哭。
trad: 我寧可死，也不想看見你哭。

eng: It's better than drinking cola, though it's not as good as drinking champagne.
simp: 与其喝可乐，倒不如喝香槟。
trad: 與其喝可樂，倒不如喝香檳。

eng: I had to push my bicycle because I had a flat tire.
simp: 我得推我的自行车，因为有个轮胎漏气了。
trad: 我得推我的自行車，因為有個輪胎漏氣了。

eng: Trees give off oxygen and absorb carbon dioxide.
simp: 树木排出氧气，吸收二氧化碳。
trad: 樹木排出氧氣，吸收二氧化碳。

eng: He is a genius.
She was there in the morning.
Which do you like better, physics or chemistry?
simp: 物理和化学你更喜欢哪个？
trad: 物理和化學你更喜歡哪個？

eng: Two men were fighting on the street.
The rain shows no sign of stopping.
Corporate earnings in the first quarter improved sharply.
simp: 企业第一季度收益大幅增长。
trad: 企業第一季度收益大幅增長。

eng: I am quite ignorant of the plan.
simp: 我对这个计划一无所知。
trad: 我對這個計劃一無所知。

eng: I live in this house by myself.
simp: 我一个人住在这幢房子里。
trad: 我一個人住在這幢房子裏。

eng: Can I ride this horse for a while?
simp: 可以让我骑一会儿这匹马吗？
trad: 可以讓我騎一會兒這匹馬嗎？

eng: There must be something at the back of this matter.
Paul's success was a myth.
simp: 保罗的成功是一个神话。
trad: 保羅的成功是一個神話。

eng: I will go on foot.
She was in despair when her husband died.
simp: 丈夫去世时她十分绝望。
trad: 丈夫去世時她十分絕望。

eng: He never goes out after dark.
We walked along the shore of the lake.
We'll cross that bridge when we come to it.
She can speak Spanish.
I lost my watch.
I am a university student.
We celebrated his birthday.
Are you hungry?
Yes, you need to practice every day.
So sorry to keep you waiting so long.
I want to sleep.
Not only can he speak Mandarin, but Shanghainese as well.
simp: 他不但会说普通话，而且会说上海话。
trad: 他不但會說普通話，而且會說上海話。

eng: You're beautiful and intelligent, how is it possible that no man is chasing after you?
simp: 你这么漂亮，况且又这么聪明，怎么可能没人追你呢？
trad: 你這麼漂亮，況且又這麼聰明，怎麼可能沒人追你呢？

eng: I will tell her what to say at the meeting.
simp: 我会告诉她开会的时候说些什么。
trad: 我會告訴她開會的時候說些什麼。

eng: Due to bad weather, the plane was late.
simp: 由于天气恶劣，飞机延误了。
trad: 由於天氣惡劣，飛機延誤了。

eng: Although I have been studying Chinese for 2 years, there are still a lot of words I do not know.
simp: 虽然我学了两年中文，但是我还是有很多字不认识。
trad: 雖然我學了兩年中文，但是我還是有很多字不認識。

eng: Even though I really want to know his name, I don't have enough courage, and I'm afraid to go ask.
simp: 虽然我很想知道他的名字，只是我的胆子太小了，不敢去问。
trad: 雖然我很想知道他的名字，只是我的膽子太小了，不敢去問。

eng: If you learn Chinese well, you can go study in China.
simp: 只要你好好学中文，你就能去中国读书了。
trad: 只要你好好學中文，你就能去中國讀書了。

eng: Only if you come will she come to my birthday party.
simp: 只有你来了，她才会来我的生日派对。
trad: 只有你來了，她才會來我的生日派對。

eng: It doesn't matter whether you have money or not. I love you just the same.
simp: 不论你有没有钱，我都爱你。
trad: 不論你有沒有錢，我都愛你。

eng: That dog runs very fast.
May I bother you for a moment?
It is no joke.
This bird cannot fly.
I have a dog and two cats.
This is definitely the best way.
It is very cold here.
Was there a book on the desk a moment ago?
simp: 刚才桌子上有一本书吗？
trad: 剛才桌子上有一本書嗎？

eng: Everybody knows his name.
Why doesn't he come back?
Thank you. "You're welcome."
The company employs 500 workers.
Everyone thinks so.
Everyone had a good time at the party.
simp: 这场派对大家都玩得很开心。
trad: 這場派對大家都玩得很開心。

eng: I will start working on July first.
simp: 我会在七月一号开始上班。
trad: 我會在七月一號開始上班。

eng: John left for France yesterday.
simp: 约翰昨天出发去了法国。
trad: 約翰昨天出發去了法國。

eng: Make a copy of this report.
simp: 请你把这份报告拿去影印。
trad: 請你把這份報告拿去影印。

eng: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten.
simp: 一、二、三、四、五、六、七、八、九、十。
trad: 一、二、三、四、五、六、七、八、九、十。

eng: Have you eaten yet?
He read the letter she mailed to him over and over again, but still did not understand it.
simp: 他反复读了好几遍她寄来的信，还是没明白她的意思。
trad: 他反復讀了好幾遍她寄來的信，還是沒明白她的意思。

eng: I'm so tired that I'm going to bed as soon as I get home.
simp: 我累死了，以至于我一回家就睡觉了。
trad: 我累死了，以至於我一回家就睡覺了。

eng: I want to go abroad.
Excuse me, I'm lost.
She's at home taking care of the kids.
I like cats.
I'm not going back.
I have seen a star today.
It's twenty past six.
She was tricked yet again.
When I was 10, my brother left our home.
simp: 在我十岁的时候，我哥哥离家出走了。
trad: 在我十歲的時候，我哥哥離家出走了。

eng: She is not the victim.
Dad's always encouraging him.
I don't want to celebrate my birthday.
I am going to a distant place, you don't want to ask where.
simp: 我回去很遥远的地方，不要问我那里。
trad: 我回去很遙遠的地方，不要問我那裏。

eng: Whenever I hear this song, I think of his smile.
simp: 只要听到这首歌，我就会想起他们的笑容。
trad: 只要聽到這首歌，我就會想起他們的笑容。

eng: I have many friends.
Where is the entrance to the museum?
He needs money.
When is your birthday?
I still need to go to Pudong at 12:30.
simp: 我中午十二点半还要去浦东。
trad: 我中午十二點半還要去浦東。

eng: Excuse me, what time is it?
Excuse me, who is this woman?
simp: 请问，这位女士是什么人？
trad: 請問，這位女士是什麼人？

eng: We don't know him.
He is my friend. Do you guys know him?
simp: 他是我的朋友。你们认识吗？
trad: 他是我的朋友。你們認識嗎？

eng: This is Mr. Smith.
Finish your homework faster, so that we can play video games.
simp: 快点写完你的作业，我们好去打游戏机。
trad: 快點寫完你的作業，我們好去打遊戲機。

eng: Today I'm working a little late so as to avoid a rush in the morning.
simp: 我今天晚点下班，省得明天早上手忙脚乱。
trad: 我今天晚點下班，省得明天早上手忙腳亂。

eng: The Chinese government controlled the internet to prevent the people from knowing the truth of the Tiananmen Square Massacre.
simp: 中国政府控制了网络，以免让人民知道六四事件的真相。
trad: 中國政府控制了網絡，以免讓人民知道六四事件的真相。

eng: I want a cup of tea.
She finally fell asleep.
She is just an ordinary girl.
simp: 她只是一个平凡的小女孩。
trad: 她只是一個平凡的小女孩。

eng: Don't be too strict. They're just kids.
simp: 不要太严格，他们只是小孩。
trad: 不要太嚴格，他們只是小孩。

eng: He has three daughters.
Never have I seen such a beautiful sight.
simp: 我从来没见过这麽漂亮的景色。
trad: 我從來沒見過這麼漂亮的景色。

eng: We are the first to arrive.
Are you through with the work?
I should say he won't come.
The machine was too complicated for us to find out the cause of the trouble.
simp: 机器结构很複杂，我们找来找去也找不到故障的原因。
trad: 機器結構很複雜，我們找來找去也找不到故障的原因。

eng: There still remains much to be done.
What is happening?
Out of sight out of mind. When you're separated you lose touch.
simp: 久了不见，便会逐渐澹忘。分开以后，也就自然不会再联络了。
trad: 久了不見，便會逐漸淡忘。分開以後，也就自然不會再聯絡了。

eng: If you concentrate all your energies on the study of English, you will master the language.
simp: 你如果能把全副精力放进去，要学会英文并不是难事。
trad: 你如果能把全副精力放進去，要學會英文並不是難事。

eng: This poem was originally written in French.
simp: 这首诗本来是用法文写的。
trad: 這首詩本來是用法文寫的。

eng: I am halfway through this detective story.
simp: 这本侦探小说我才看到一半。
trad: 這本偵探小說我才看到一半。

eng: Never use a cannon to kill a fly.
No, thank you. I'm so full.
What day is it today?
How many days are you going to be visiting your hometown?
Was last month November?
What month is this?
Will the weather be good tomorrow?
It will snow tomorrow.
I need your help.
I've already been here two hours.
One of the great superstitions about education is that learning is the result of teaching.
simp: 很多人觉得有教才有学，但其实这个观念是错的。
trad: 很多人覺得有教才有學，但其實這個觀念是錯的。

eng: I've heard that if you default on the water rates your water supply will be suspended, is that true?
simp: 听说不交水费就会被停水，是真的吗？
trad: 聽說不交水費就會被停水，是真的嗎？

eng: A nail penetrated the car tyre.
I was laughed at by everyone.
No matter who it was that wrote this book, he's very clever.
simp: 我不知道这本书的作者是谁，但他肯定是个天才。
trad: 我不知道這本書的作者是誰，但他肯定是個天才。

eng: This machine is too heavy for me to carry.
simp: 这台机器太重了，我拿不动。
trad: 這臺機器太重了，我拿不動。

eng: Yokohama is the second largest city in Japan.
simp: 横滨是日本第二大的城市。
trad: 橫濱是日本第二大的城市。

eng: Welcome.
When you shake hands with somebody, you must look him in the eye.
simp: 和别人握手的时候，一定要有眼神接触。
trad: 和別人握手的時候，一定要有眼神接觸。

eng: The reason why you failed is you did not try hard enough.
simp: 因为你不够努力，所以才会失败。
trad: 因為你不夠努力，所以才會失敗。

eng: The weather varies from day to day.
That's just an excuse.
He has a house of his own.
The judge sentenced him to one year's imprisonment.
simp: 法官判了他一年有期徒刑。
trad: 法官判了他一年有期徒刑。

eng: I believe you like your job.
simp: 我想你一定很喜欢你的工作吧。
trad: 我想你一定很喜歡你的工作吧。

eng: There's no need to panic. There's plenty of time.
I broke your ashtray.
simp: 我把你的烟灰缸打破了。
trad: 我把你的煙灰缸打破了。

eng: You did not say so.
It is questionable whether this data can be relied on.
Miniskirts have gone out of fashion.
That's not standard English pronunciation.
simp: 这不是标准的英式读法。
trad: 這不是標準的英式讀法。

eng: The picture was taken by him.
He went out to see a movie. How was the movie? Good.
simp: 他出去看电影了。 电影好看吗? 好看。
trad: 他出去看電影了。 電影好看嗎? 好看。

eng: That dress seems to be very expensive.
simp: 那条裙子看起来很昂贵。
trad: 那條裙子看起來很昂貴。

eng: First of all, you should talk it over with your parents.
simp: 你应该先和你的父母谈谈。
trad: 你應該先和你的父母談談。

eng: A bad habit, once formed, is difficult to get rid of.
simp: 一旦养成了坏习惯，就很难改回来了。
trad: 一旦養成了壞習慣，就很難改回來了。

eng: This book is worth reading.
Paul telephoned just now.
Please write about your real experience.
simp: 请你把你的真实体验写下来。
trad: 請你把你的真實體驗寫下來。

eng: But he was lucky.
He took up his pen and began to write.
This watch is shock-proof.
Noise pollution could be avoided if only people were more sensitive to the environment.
simp: 如果大家都懂得关心环境的话，就不会有噪音污染了。
trad: 如果大家都懂得關心環境的話，就不會有噪音汙染了。

eng: I remember meeting him in Paris.
If you do not go fishing tomorrow, I will not either.
simp: 你明天不去钓鱼的话，我也不去了。
trad: 你明天不去釣魚的話，我也不去了。

eng: My throat burns.
simp: 我的喉咙好像被火烧一样。
trad: 我的喉嚨好像被火燒一樣。

eng: I think it is worthwhile to see this film twice.
simp: 我觉得这部电影值得一看再看。
trad: 我覺得這部電影值得一看再看。

eng: Twenty years is a long time.
simp: 二十年是一段漫长的岁月。
trad: 二十年是一段漫長的歲月。

eng: The noise is getting louder and louder.
My stomach is growling.
As I am off duty today, let's go to the beach.
simp: 我今天不用当值，不如一起去海滩玩吧。
trad: 我今天不用當值，不如一起去海灘玩吧。

eng: Walking along the street, I met an old friend.
simp: 我在街上踫见了一个老朋友。
trad: 我在街上踫見了一個老朋友。

eng: The icy road sparkled in the sunlight.
simp: 结冰的道路在阳光下闪闪发亮。
trad: 結冰的道路在陽光下閃閃發亮。

eng: She saved a hundred dollars.
This is a very important meeting. You ought not to miss it.
simp: 这个会议很重要的，你不要不来。
trad: 這個會議很重要的，你不要不來。

eng: There were not many present.
We had better go home rather than wait here.
simp: 我们别在这里等了，还是快点回家吧。
trad: 我們別在這裏等了，還是快點回家吧。

eng: If I could be reborn, I would want to be the child of a rich family, then I'd be set for life.
simp: 如果可以投胎转世的话，我想做有钱人家的儿子，一辈子衣食无忧。
trad: 如果可以投胎轉世的話，我想做有錢人家的兒子，一輩子衣食無憂。

eng: As soon as I get paid I will pay you back.
simp: 我一收到钱就马上还给你。
trad: 我一收到錢就馬上還給你。

eng: I'll tell you all I know about it.
simp: 我把我知道的都告诉你吧。
trad: 我把我知道的都告訴你吧。

eng: Please give us some examples.
Where do you want to go this summer?
simp: 今年夏天你打算去哪里玩啊？
trad: 今年夏天你打算去哪裏玩啊？

eng: The audience clapped loudly after his speech.
simp: 他的演说赢得了观众热烈的掌声。
trad: 他的演說贏得了觀眾熱烈的掌聲。

eng: May I eat a little of it?
It is you that are to blame for it.
Don't worry too much, or you'll go bald.
simp: 别太操心了，不然会掉头髮的。
trad: 別太操心了，不然會掉頭髮的。

eng: We've come to the conclusion that this is a true story.
simp: 我们的结论就是，那个传言是真的。
trad: 我們的結論就是，那個傳言是真的。

eng: I'm studying English.
You don't... you don't talk to me like that.
This box is filled with apples.
simp: 这个箱子里装满了苹果。
trad: 這個箱子裏裝滿了蘋果。

eng: What prevented him from coming?
I got up late this morning.
Have you decided to go to Japan?
I arrived here last night.
May the force be with you.
This house must be done up.
She is a very poor driver.
Hear and see and be still.
simp: 你可以看，可以听，但手脚不要乱动。
trad: 你可以看，可以聽，但手腳不要亂動。

eng: You may be right about that.
The burglar was traced by one of the things he had left on the scene.
simp: 警方根据现场遗下的证物把贼子找了出来。
trad: 警方根據現場遺下的證物把賊子找了出來。

eng: It doesn't matter whether the cat is black or white as long as it catches mice.
simp: 不论白猫黑猫，抓到老鼠就是好猫！
trad: 不論白貓黑貓，抓到老鼠就是好貓！

eng: The smallest child knows such a simple thing.
simp: 这麽简单的东西三岁小孩也会。
trad: 這麼簡單的東西三歲小孩也會。

eng: When are we eating? I'm hungry!
simp: 甚麽时候吃饭啊？我快饿死了啦！
trad: 甚麼時候吃飯啊？我快餓死了啦！

eng: The beauty of the scene was beyond description.
simp: 那里的景色美得无法以笔墨形容。
trad: 那裏的景色美得無法以筆墨形容。

eng: He has only a superficial knowledge of Japanese.
simp: 他对日文只是略懂皮毛。
trad: 他對日文只是略懂皮毛。

eng: Let us begin today's lesson by opening our books to page 156, said the teacher.
simp: 「好，我们现在开始上课。请各位打开书本的第一百五十六页。」老师说。
trad: 「好，我們現在開始上課。請各位打開書本的第一百五十六頁。」老師說。

eng: Apart from her, everybody answered the question.
The car is too expensive for me to buy.
simp: 那辆车子太贵了，我买不起。
trad: 那輛車子太貴了，我買不起。

eng: Soon after that, I began to fall asleep.
I don't know whether to cry or to laugh.
Tom went back to his hometown.
I can hardly stand his behavior.
He is a recent convert to Catholicism.
simp: 他新近皈依的天主教徒。
trad: 他新近皈依的天主教徒。

eng: You should be responsible for your actions.
simp: 你要为自己做过的事情负责。
trad: 你要為自己做過的事情負責。

eng: It was raining on and off all night long.
simp: 整晚一会下雨，一会停雨。
trad: 整晚一會下雨，一會停雨。

eng: This coat hasn't pockets.
If a high hill stood between A and B, it was important to decide whether the line should climb over it, pierce it with a tunnel, or make a detour to avoid it.
simp: 假设 A 和 B 之间有一座高山，那就要考虑一下，路线应该越过高山、穿过高山，还是直接从山旁绕过呢？
trad: 假設 A 和 B 之間有一座高山，那就要考慮一下，路線應該越過高山、穿過高山，還是直接從山旁繞過呢？

eng: I'm sorry, could you repeat that please?
simp: 不好意思，你可以再说一次吗？
trad: 不好意思，你可以再說一次嗎？

eng: I have a friend waiting for me in the lobby.
simp: 有个朋友正在大堂等我。
trad: 有個朋友正在大堂等我。

eng: It won't be long before they get married.
Somebody has been sleeping on this sofa.
simp: 有人在这张沙发上睡过。
trad: 有人在這張沙發上睡過。

eng: He regained consciousness three hours after the accident.
simp: 他在意外发生的三个小时后恢复意识。
trad: 他在意外發生的三個小時後恢復意識。

eng: Is this your umbrella?
How to say XXX in Dutch?
He's always looking at you. He must love you.
simp: 他整天盯着你看，肯定是喜欢你了。
trad: 他整天盯著你看，肯定是喜歡你了。

eng: Do you think you could lend me some of your records?
simp: 可以借几张 CD 来听听吗？
trad: 可以借幾張 CD 來聽聽嗎？

eng: It is no use blaming him for the accident now.
simp: 事情已经发生了，现在怪他也没有用。
trad: 事情已經發生了，現在怪他也沒有用。

eng: How did Barbara do on her driver's test yesterday?
simp: 芭芭拉昨天考驾照考得怎样？
trad: 芭芭拉昨天考駕照考得怎樣？

eng: By the way, what is your address?
simp: 对了，可以把你的地址告诉我吗？
trad: 對了，可以把你的地址告訴我嗎？

eng: Not a letter did I receive from her.
These old customs have been handed down from generation to generation.
simp: 这些古老习俗都是一代一代相传下来的。
trad: 這些古老習俗都是一代一代相傳下來的。

eng: I am not used to hard work.
I am afraid I must be going now.
I'm starving!
How are you doing today?
I'm happy, cause I'm learning some Dutch.
simp: 我很高兴，因为我正在学一点荷兰语。
trad: 我很高興，因為我正在學一點荷蘭語。

eng: I need to take a shower.
Beijing is the capital of China.
No, he's our business manager.
simp: 不是的，他是我们的业务主管。
trad: 不是的，他是我們的業務主管。

eng: Yes, he's our manager.
I don't really know.
Why has it been getting hotter and hotter these last two days?
simp: 为什么这两天一天比一天热？
trad: 為什麼這兩天一天比一天熱？

eng: Just joshing.
Why do so many people visit Kyoto?
simp: 为什么那么多人访问京都？
trad: 為什麼那麼多人訪問京都？

eng: Her son is a genius.
The police are checking their bags.
simp: 警察正在检查他们的包。
trad: 警察正在檢查他們的包。

eng: I am able to obtain a registration form for free.
simp: 我可以免费获取一份注册表格。
trad: 我可以免費獲取一份註冊表格。

eng: How well he played!
I hope to see you.
I don't know what to say to make you feel better.
simp: 我不知道该说什么来安慰你。
trad: 我不知道該說什麼來安慰你。

eng: Can you play the guitar?
He was scared when the monkey jumped at him.
simp: 猴子跳到他身上的时候，他受到了惊吓。
trad: 猴子跳到他身上的時候，他受到了驚嚇。

eng: Few people live to be 100 years old.
I'm going out for a while.
My house is fully insured.
He is not an American.
Will you tell me why you like her?
simp: 你能告诉我你为什么喜欢她吗？
trad: 你能告訴我你為什麼喜歡她嗎？

eng: Don't forget the ticket.
She looks pretty no matter what she wears.
Imagine that you have a time machine.
Should anyone call on me in my absence, tell him that I will be back soon.
simp: 如果我不在的时候有人来找我，麻烦你告诉他我很快回来。
trad: 如果我不在的時候有人來找我，麻煩你告訴他我很快回來。

eng: It took a lot of time and money to build the machine.
simp: 这台机器是花了不少时间和金钱才建成的。
trad: 這臺機器是花了不少時間和金錢才建成的。

eng: The houses caught fire one after another.
simp: 房子一间一间地着了火。
trad: 房子一間一間地著了火。

eng: Sometimes it's good for a married couple to go to a hot spring together—just the two of them.
simp: 两夫妇应该閒时去浸温泉，过过二人世界。
trad: 兩夫婦應該閒時去浸溫泉，過過二人世界。

eng: John has put on a lot of weight recently.
You'll find it impossible to live there.
What language do they speak in Switzerland?
simp: 瑞士人是说甚麽语言的？
trad: 瑞士人是說甚麼語言的？

eng: Please make yourself comfortable.
It is getting cooler and cooler.
simp: 最近的天气愈来愈凉爽了。
trad: 最近的天氣愈來愈涼爽了。

eng: Take whatever cake you want.
Nara is as old as Kyoto.
simp: 京都和奈良都是历史悠久的古城。
trad: 京都和奈良都是歷史悠久的古城。

eng: I made my decision.
We were attacked by swarms of bees.
simp: 我们被一大群蜜蜂攻击。
trad: 我們被一大群蜜蜂攻擊。

eng: Dark as it was, we managed to find our way home.
simp: 天色很暗，但我们还是找到路回家。
trad: 天色很暗，但我們還是找到路回家。

eng: I think it's going to rain.
Politicians are good at raising money.
No sooner had Tom turned on the TV than the fuse blew.
simp: 汤姆一打开电视，保险丝就烧了。
trad: 湯姆一打開電視，保險絲就燒了。

eng: Wine is poetry filled in bottles.
Take a book and read it.
In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But, in practice, there is.
simp: 理论上说，理论和实践没有区别。但实践上说，是有的。
trad: 理論上說，理論和實踐沒有區別。但實踐上說，是有的。

eng: I don't want to go to school.
She's really smart, isn't she?
I watched TV this morning.
I slept a little during lunch break because I was so tired.
simp: 我在午休时间睡了一会儿，因为我太累了。
trad: 我在午休時間睡了一會兒，因為我太累了。

eng: We went to London last year.
Where are you going?
He got angry.
I have a cough and a little fever.
Open the cupboard to the left, the bottles are in there.
simp: 打开左边的橱，瓶子在那儿。
trad: 打開左邊的櫥，瓶子在那兒。

eng: I am four months pregnant.
We need an ambulance.
I feed my cat every morning and every evening.
simp: 每天早晚，我给我的猫喂食。
trad: 每天早晚，我給我的貓餵食。

eng: Do you have a pen on you?
People should understand that the world is changing.
Why do you want to leave today?
It was raining when we left, but by the time we arrived, it was sunny.
simp: 我们走的时候下着雨，到的时候有太阳。
trad: 我們走的時候下著雨，到的時候有太陽。

eng: Turn right at the crossroad.
What prevented her from coming yesterday?
If you want this pen, I will lend it to you.
simp: 你想用这支笔，我就借给你吧。
trad: 你想用這支筆，我就借給你吧。

eng: I wish I had treated the girl more kindly.
simp: 我真后悔以前没有好好对她。
trad: 我真後悔以前沒有好好對她。

eng: We're thoroughly prepared for the millennium bug.
simp: 我们已经准备好应付千年虫。
trad: 我們已經準備好應付千年蟲。

eng: As a result of the war, many people died.
Steel production will increase 2% this month from last month.
simp: 今个月的钢铁产量和上个月比起来，估计会上升两个巴仙。
trad: 今個月的鋼鐵產量和上個月比起來，估計會上升兩個巴仙。

eng: Fucking hell, what idiot dare phone me in the middle of the night?
simp: 他妈的，哪个傻子敢在半夜打我电话?!
trad: 他媽的，哪個傻子敢在半夜打我電話?!

eng: He has three sons, who became musicians.
simp: 他有三个儿子，全都成了音乐家。
trad: 他有三個兒子，全都成了音樂家。

eng: His writing is very subjective.
Bread is made from flour, water, and often yeast.
simp: 麵包是用麵粉和水做的，有时还会加入发酵粉。
trad: 麵包是用麵粉和水做的，有時還會加入發酵粉。

eng: A bus driver is responsible for the safety of the passengers.
simp: 巴士司机有责任保护乘客的安全。
trad: 巴士司機有責任保護乘客的安全。

eng: There is no air in space.
Susan is a good cook.
It occurred to me that I had left my purse at home.
simp: 我突然想起钱包好像放在家中，忘了带了。
trad: 我突然想起錢包好像放在家中，忘了帶了。

eng: Actually I wanted to be a damsel in a tower guarded by seven dragons, and then a prince on a white horse would chop off the dragons' heads and liberate me.
simp: 其实我想做一个被关在高塔里的少女，然后有一天，就会有一个白马王子出现，把守卫着高塔的七条龙通通杀掉，救我出来。
trad: 其實我想做一個被關在高塔裏的少女，然後有一天，就會有一個白馬王子出現，把守衛著高塔的七條龍通通殺掉，救我出來。

eng: French is too hard, I don't want to learn it.
I planted roses in the garden.
simp: 我在花园里种了些玫瑰。
trad: 我在花園裏種了些玫瑰。

eng: You shouldn't talk about people behind their backs.
simp: 你不应该在背后说别人的坏话。
trad: 你不應該在背後說別人的壞話。

eng: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.
He is rich enough to buy that car.
Though Jim works very hard, his job does not pay very much.
simp: 吉姆很努力工作，但薪水却不高。
trad: 吉姆很努力工作，但薪水卻不高。

eng: I can't find my watch.
simp: 我的手錶不知放到哪里去了。
trad: 我的手錶不知放到哪裏去了。

eng: Illness prevented me from coming to school.
I wonder if she'll recognize me after all these years.
simp: 过了这麽多年，不知道她还认得我吗？
trad: 過了這麼多年，不知道她還認得我嗎？

eng: It's better.
Mr. Kato teaches us English.
Bob often tries to give up smoking.
When did it begin to rain?
I'm sorry to cause you all this trouble.
simp: 我很抱歉给你惹来所有的这些麻烦。
trad: 我很抱歉給你惹來所有的這些麻煩。

eng: I want a guitar.
When he was a child, he would go fishing on Sundays.
simp: 他小时候，星期天会去钓鱼。
trad: 他小時候，星期天會去釣魚。

eng: I am interested in Asian history.
simp: 我对亚洲的历史很感兴趣。
trad: 我對亞洲的歷史很感興趣。

eng: Everyone except me was invited.
simp: 除了我，每个人都受到了邀请。
trad: 除了我，每個人都受到了邀請。

eng: I can read without glasses.
My brother is as tall as me.
Jimmy often comes to see me on weekends.
How was your trip?
The girl about whom I told you lives here.
simp: 我跟你说过的那个女生住在这儿。
trad: 我跟你說過的那個女生住在這兒。

eng: Please pardon me for coming late.
I let my sister use my new computer.
simp: 我让我妹妹用我的新电脑。
trad: 我讓我妹妹用我的新電腦。

eng: Europe has a smaller population than Asia.
Do you know of any good restaurant near here?
simp: 你知道这儿附近有什么好餐馆吗?
trad: 你知道這兒附近有什麼好餐館嗎?

eng: There are too many things to do!
I am not well at all.
He is acquainted with the mayor.
Do you like Japanese food?
Do you speak Japanese?
I didn't know that he was Japanese.
Love is more powerful than death.
For one reason or another their holiday in France didn't come up to expectations.
simp: 由于种种原因，他们在法国的假期没让他们感到满意。
trad: 由於種種原因，他們在法國的假期沒讓他們感到滿意。

eng: He can't come because he's ill.
We are at school together.
I had my teeth examined at the dentist's.
simp: 我在牙医那儿检查了牙齿。
trad: 我在牙醫那兒檢查了牙齒。

eng: He is a man of few words, but he always keeps his promise.
simp: 他这个人话不多，但总是遵守诺言。
trad: 他這個人話不多，但總是遵守諾言。

eng: I know what his name is.
I'm afraid you have the wrong number.
Ken has two cats.
In his younger days he worked very hard.
My father teaches English at a high school.
simp: 我父亲是一个中学英文教师。
trad: 我父親是一個中學英文教師。

eng: The matter will be brought up at the next meeting.
simp: 这个问题留待下次开会才讨论。
trad: 這個問題留待下次開會才討論。

eng: No sooner had the child seen his mother than he burst into tears.
simp: 孩子一见到母亲就哭了起来。
trad: 孩子一見到母親就哭了起來。

eng: I caught sight of her in the crowd.
I still have not learned to drive a car.
She has a bath every morning.
Where do you live?
Can you tell me your address?
simp: 能说给我听你的地址吗？
trad: 能說給我聽你的地址嗎？

eng: Can you show me the way please?
It's at the third home in the second row of houses.
simp: 在第二排房子的第三家。
trad: 在第二排房子的第三家。

eng: Go straight down the road, and when you pass the traffic light you're there.
simp: 你一路往前走，过了红绿灯就到了。
trad: 你一路往前走，過了紅綠燈就到了。

eng: So which way is it to the People's Park?
simp: 那么去人民公园怎么走？
trad: 那麼去人民公園怎麼走？

eng: You can get there by crossing the street at the second intersection.
simp: 你从这里过去到那里，穿过第二条横马路就是。
trad: 你從這裏過去到那裏，穿過第二條橫馬路就是。

eng: It's not far from here to there.
simp: 从这儿到那儿是很近的。
trad: 從這兒到那兒是很近的。

eng: Turn here to get on the subway.
simp: 你到这儿拐弯角上去坐地铁。
trad: 你到這兒拐彎角上去坐地鐵。

eng: Whales are said to have lived on land long ago.
simp: 据说鲸鱼以前是在陆地上生活的。
trad: 據說鯨魚以前是在陸地上生活的。

eng: Without air there can be no wind or sound on the moon.
simp: 月球表面没有空气，所以没有风，也没有声音。
trad: 月球表面沒有空氣，所以沒有風，也沒有聲音。

eng: He's just a normal junior high school student, not particularly intelligent.
simp: 他只不过是个普普通通的中学生，不算特别聪明。
trad: 他只不過是個普普通通的中學生，不算特別聰明。

eng: I put my suitcase in the trunk.
simp: 我把行李放了在车尾箱里。
trad: 我把行李放了在車尾箱裏。

eng: He does not know how to drive a car.
The fresh snow looks beautiful on the hill.
simp: 刚从天上降下来的雪，铺满了整个山头，看起来美丽极了。
trad: 剛從天上降下來的雪，鋪滿了整個山頭，看起來美麗極了。

eng: I'm planning to leave for Europe next week.
simp: 我打算下个星期去欧洲。
trad: 我打算下個星期去歐洲。

eng: In Britain a truck is referred to as a lorry.
I don't feel well today. The well water is the cause of many illnesses.
simp: 我今天有点不舒服。那户井水是许多疾病的源头。
trad: 我今天有點不舒服。那戶井水是許多疾病的源頭。

eng: Rich as she is, she is not happy.
simp: 她很有钱，生活却过得不快乐。
trad: 她很有錢，生活卻過得不快樂。

eng: Not all birds can fly.
Enjoy your meal!
My father smokes a pack of cigarettes a day.
He and I are teachers.
That way is very far, so we took a taxi.
simp: 那路当然挺远的，我们打的去算了。
trad: 那路當然挺遠的，我們打的去算了。

eng: Pardon me, what place is this?
Excuse me, is Xinqiao Restaurant far from here?
simp: 请问新桥饭店离这儿远不远？
trad: 請問新橋飯店離這兒遠不遠？

eng: Can you sketch it for me on this piece of paper please?
simp: 请你帮我在这张纸上画个草图。
trad: 請你幫我在這張紙上畫個草圖。

eng: Excuse me, is there a toilet nearby?
simp: 请问这儿附近有没有厕所？
trad: 請問這兒附近有沒有廁所？

eng: This is a DVD.
Whose books are these?
Don't believe him.
Where can I find toothpaste?
You can't judge a person based on clothing.
simp: 不能根据服装来判断一个人。
trad: 不能根據服裝來判斷一個人。

eng: These green leaves turn red or yellow in fall.
simp: 这些绿叶到秋天变成红色或黄色。
trad: 這些綠葉到秋天變成紅色或黃色。

eng: I perceive by your face that you have good news.
simp: 我从你的表情猜到你有好消息。
trad: 我從你的表情猜到你有好消息。

eng: Who organized that meeting?
That movie was really moving.
I wrote this book.
A prudent bird chooses its tree. A wise servant chooses his master.
simp: 良禽择木而栖，贤臣择主而事。
trad: 良禽擇木而棲，賢臣擇主而事。

eng: Good day, how are you?
This is Room 839.
Pierre has a lot of pirated software on his computer.
simp: Pierre电脑里有很多盗版软件。
trad: Pierre電腦裏有很多盜版軟件。

eng: You must do it yourself.
The ball is that boy's prized possession.
simp: 这个球是那个男孩的宝贝。
trad: 這個球是那個男孩的寶貝。

eng: Boil some water.
My legs still hurt.
In any case, it's none of your business.
simp: 无论如何，这件是不关你的事。
trad: 無論如何，這件是不關你的事。

eng: Life's a ruin without you.
simp: 没有你的话，我的生命就毁灭了。
trad: 沒有你的話，我的生命就毀滅了。

eng: Don't sugar your tea.
Put your hands up!
You should return what you borrow.
Borrow and return, then you can borrow again. Borrow and don't return, and then the borrowing gets difficult.
simp: 有借有还，再借不难。有借不还，再借就难。
trad: 有借有還，再借不難。有借不還，再借就難。

eng: Rain, rain go away!
PLEASE give me a visa.
simp: 拜托您，请给我一张签证。
trad: 拜托您，請給我一張簽證。

eng: Finally!
When Vin Diesel does pushups, he's not pushing himself up - he's pushing the Earth down.
simp: 冯迪索在做俯卧撑时，并不是把自身往上推，而是在把地球向下推。
trad: 馮迪索在做俯臥撐時，並不是把自身往上推，而是在把地球向下推。

eng: Much better to be woken by the birds than by an alarm.
simp: 被闹钟唤醒没有被鸟唤醒的好。
trad: 被鬧鐘喚醒沒有被鳥喚醒的好。

eng: I know everything.
Speak of the devil and he is sure to appear.
Does objective history exist?
That man knows how to get on the president's good side.
It is dangerous to swim here.
Are you free on Tuesday?
I used a ribbon to tie my hair into a ponytail.
simp: 我用丝带在头上扎了一个马尾辫。
trad: 我用絲帶在頭上紮了一個馬尾辮。

eng: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
What time do we leave tomorrow?
I want you to tell me the truth.
He has no sense of humor.
I saw her five days ago, he said.
I think, therefore I am.
Some of my friends can speak English well.
simp: 我的一些朋友英语说得很好。
trad: 我的一些朋友英語說得很好。

eng: Is there anything that I should not eat?
simp: 有什么东西是我不该吃的吗?
trad: 有什麼東西是我不該吃的嗎?

eng: All men are created equal.
I love the taste of watermelon.
I'm going fishing with him.
What do you like?
Did you have breakfast this morning?
Everyone was listening very carefully.
simp: 大家都在聚精会神地听着。
trad: 大家都在聚精會神地聽著。

eng: Do you mind our leaving a little earlier?
simp: 你不介意我们早点走吧？
trad: 你不介意我們早點走吧？

eng: He'll be a good husband.
It's because I was asked to come that I'm here.
He shouted at the top of his voice, "This is a battle we cannot lose."
simp: 他声嘶力竭地叫道：「这场仗，我们不可以输！」
trad: 他聲嘶力竭地叫道：「這場仗，我們不可以輸！」

eng: She can't cook well.
So what do we do now?
His tie corresponds well with his suit.
I didn't know how to answer his question.
She held on to my hand tightly.
We have no school today.
Now that I have finished this assignment I want to go to sleep, but I have to go to school.
simp: 我做完功课，想去睡觉，可是又要上学⋯⋯
trad: 我做完功課，想去睡覺，可是又要上學⋯⋯

eng: All the furniture in the room was all worn out.
simp: 房间里面的家具都很残旧了。
trad: 房間裏面的家具都很殘舊了。

eng: Lisa speaks not only English but also French.
simp: 丽萨不但会说英文，而且会说法文。
trad: 麗薩不但會說英文，而且會說法文。

eng: I'm very happy to meet you.
I'm still single.
Did you call him up yesterday?
simp: 你昨天有没有打电话给他？
trad: 你昨天有沒有打電話給他？

eng: If you smile, I'll be happy.
simp: 只要你微笑，我就会高兴。
trad: 只要你微笑，我就會高興。

eng: I think of watching TV as a waste of time.
simp: 我觉得看电视很浪费时间。
trad: 我覺得看電視很浪費時間。

eng: Canada is larger than Japan.
He got hurt in the accident at work.
simp: 他工作时发生意外，受了伤。
trad: 他工作時發生意外，受了傷。

eng: I hope that your parents will allow us to marry.
simp: 希望你父母会让我们结婚吧。
trad: 希望你父母會讓我們結婚吧。

eng: He earns more money than he can spend.
simp: 他赚那麽多钱，根本用不完。
trad: 他賺那麼多錢，根本用不完。

eng: He walked back and forth in front of the door, hesitating to enter.
simp: 他在门前走来走去，不知道该不该进去。
trad: 他在門前走來走去，不知道該不該進去。

eng: I don't like him any more than he likes me.
simp: 我们之间已经没有感情了。
trad: 我們之間已經沒有感情了。

eng: How much is this tie?
I can't go along with you on that point.
That problem has been shelved for the time being.
simp: 这个问题暂时放在一边。
trad: 這個問題暫時放在一邊。

eng: How was the French class?
A guest should not try to make himself superior to the host.
Where do you live?
How tall are you?
He is richer than anyone else in the town.
The committee consists of scientists and engineers.
simp: 委员会是由科学家和工程师组成的。
trad: 委員會是由科學家和工程師組成的。

eng: On the one hand, you are wrong, but on the other hand, I can't blame you for that.
simp: 你固然是错了，但也不能怪你。
trad: 你固然是錯了，但也不能怪你。

eng: Where is the lost and found?
He's crazy about you.
Insatiably greedy.
I'm not the least bit scared of you.
This box is not as big as that one.
simp: 这个盒子没有那个盒子大。
trad: 這個盒子沒有那個盒子大。

eng: It would be better for both of us not to see each other anymore.
simp: 我们还是不要再见面了。
trad: 我們還是不要再見面了。

eng: Is there a post office around here?
simp: 这里附近有没有邮政局？
trad: 這裏附近有沒有郵政局？

eng: He's a hopeless case.
simp: 他是个无可救药的家伙。
trad: 他是個無可救藥的家夥。

eng: Don't worry.
I want to go abroad.
If by any chance I'm late, please don't wait for me.
simp: 万一我来晚的话，你不要等我。
trad: 萬一我來晚的話，你不要等我。

eng: Get me up at eight.
I cannot lend this book to you.
simp: 我不可以借这本书给你。
trad: 我不可以借這本書給你。

eng: He will come soon.
There is a bookstore in front of the department store.
simp: 在百货商店前有个书店。
trad: 在百貨商店前有個書店。

eng: Get me a chair, please.
I had nothing to do with that incident.
simp: 我跟那个事件没有什么关系。
trad: 我跟那個事件沒有什麼關系。

eng: China is much larger than Japan.
Let's eat out tonight.
simp: 我们今晚在外面吃饭吧。
trad: 我們今晚在外面吃飯吧。

eng: She is able to speak ten languages.
There's water in Ashland, too.
Turn down the volume, please.
simp: 麻烦你把音量调低一点。
trad: 麻煩你把音量調低一點。

eng: I simply haven't the time to do everything I want to do.
simp: 我有很多事想做，但就是没时间做。
trad: 我有很多事想做，但就是沒時間做。

eng: How do you say that in Italian?
simp: 那个用意大利语怎么说？
trad: 那個用意大利語怎麼說？

eng: I'm going to the Number Four hospital.
Switzerland needs better apples.
simp: 瑞士的苹果必须好一点才行。
trad: 瑞士的蘋果必須好一點才行。

eng: Which is more important, economic development or environmental protection?
simp: 发展经济和保护环境哪一个更重要?
trad: 發展經濟和保護環境哪一個更重要?

eng: I like that singer a lot.
You'd better see a doctor.
He is too young to go there alone.
simp: 他年纪还小，不应该自己一个人去。
trad: 他年紀還小，不應該自己一個人去。

eng: Don't trample on the grass.
You must know yourself.
Both air and water are indispensable for life.
simp: 没有空气和水，人类就无法生存。
trad: 沒有空氣和水，人類就無法生存。

eng: She is sensitive to the heat.
Please don't interrupt me while I'm talking.
simp: 我说话的时候请你不要插嘴。
trad: 我說話的時候請你不要插嘴。

eng: My father does not always walk to work.
simp: 我爸爸不是每天都走路上班的。
trad: 我爸爸不是每天都走路上班的。

eng: Many economists are ignorant of that fact.
simp: 很多经济学家都不知道这点。
trad: 很多經濟學家都不知道這點。

eng: I held my breath in excitement.
We are leaving early tomorrow morning.
His dog follows him wherever he goes.
simp: 他走到哪里，他的狗就跟到哪里。
trad: 他走到哪裏，他的狗就跟到哪裏。

eng: Cut the meat into thin slices.
Any book will do.
I'm tired; I think I'm going to go to bed.
simp: 我很累，我想我要去睡觉了。
trad: 我很累，我想我要去睡覺了。

eng: I don't have an excuse.
Cheap meat doesn't make good soup.
simp: 用便宜的肉就做不到好汤。
trad: 用便宜的肉就做不到好湯。

eng: I am in London.
Did you hear that, Mike?
I always have trouble remembering names.
simp: 我经常忘记别人的名字。
trad: 我經常忘記別人的名字。

eng: Who knows?
She writes beautifully.
The lights are out.
No one knows if he loves her or not.
simp: 谁也不知道他是否爱她。
trad: 誰也不知道他是否愛她。

eng: Show me your passport, please.
simp: 请把您的护照给我看一下。
trad: 請把您的護照給我看一下。

eng: May I ask you to call me back later?
simp: 你等一会然后再给我打电话，可以吗？
trad: 你等一會然後再給我打電話，可以嗎？

eng: The castle is beautiful.
All right.
I'd like a single with a shower, please.
simp: 我要一间有淋浴的单人间。
trad: 我要一間有淋浴的單人間。

eng: How long does it take to get to Vienna on foot? "Sorry, I'm a stranger here."
simp: “到维也纳步行要多久？”　“对不起，我是外地人。”
trad: “到維也納步行要多久？”　“對不起，我是外地人。”

eng: When I go on vacation, I'll rent a car.
simp: 去度假的时候我要租辆车。
trad: 去度假的時候我要租輛車。

eng: There was a great variety of dishes on the menu.
simp: 菜单上有各种各样的菜色。
trad: 菜單上有各種各樣的菜色。

eng: What is still better is that the house has a beautiful garden.
simp: 更棒的是房子还有一个漂亮的花园。
trad: 更棒的是房子還有一個漂亮的花園。

eng: There's a possibility that the man was murdered.
There was nothing but a desk in his room.
simp: 他的房间除了一张桌子，就甚麽也没有了。
trad: 他的房間除了一張桌子，就甚麼也沒有了。

eng: The point is whether she will come or not.
simp: 问题是她到底来还是不来。
trad: 問題是她到底來還是不來。

eng: Would you mind turning down the radio?
simp: 可以把收音机的音量调低一点吗？
trad: 可以把收音機的音量調低一點嗎？

eng: That's MY line!
It's only leaves and branches.
She took a walk before breakfast.
Yesterday I had a high fever.
Who are you?
She was out when I called.
simp: 我给她打电话的时候她不在。
trad: 我給她打電話的時候她不在。
