simp: 粗心大意可能导致严重的事故。
trad: 粗心大意可能導致嚴重的事故。

eng: It's dangerous to fool around with electricity.
It's eight miles from here to London.
simp: 从这裡到伦敦要八英里。
trad: 從這裡到倫敦要八英裏。

eng: In general, consumers prefer quantity to quality.
simp: 一般来说，消费者喜欢数量胜于质量。
trad: 一般來說，消費者喜歡數量勝於質量。

eng: Eating habits differ from country to country.
simp: 各国有不同的饮食习惯。
trad: 各國有不同的飲食習慣。

eng: There's only one store on the island.
simp: 在这个岛上只有一家商店。
trad: 在這個島上只有一家商店。

eng: Pay the cashier on the way out.
simp: 在出口处的收银台付款。
trad: 在出口處的收銀臺付款。

eng: Put the gun on the table.
Take the road on the left.
Take the road on the right.
New York is on the Hudson River.
Such a plan is bound to fail.
simp: 这样的计划注定会失败的。
trad: 這樣的計劃註定會失敗的。

eng: Some abstract art is difficult to understand.
simp: 一些抽象艺术是很难理解的。
trad: 一些抽象藝術是很難理解的。

eng: Japan depends on foreign countries for oil.
Japan depends on imports for raw materials.
Kyoto depends on the tourist industry.
School finishes before noon on Saturdays.
simp: 学校在星期六中午之前放学。
trad: 學校在星期六中午之前放學。

eng: A fly can walk on the ceiling.
Kyoko is lying on the grass.
Put it back on the desk.
Save it on the external hard drive.
simp: 把它保存在外接式硬碟。
trad: 把它保存在外接式硬碟。

eng: Not all of us can speak English.
simp: 我们并不是全部都会讲英语。
trad: 我們並不是全部都會講英語。

eng: Mother made us cheese sandwiches for lunch.
simp: 妈妈为我们做了乳酪三明治当午餐。
trad: 媽媽為我們做了乳酪三明治當午餐。

eng: Any one of us could do it.
simp: 我们之中任何一个都能做到。
trad: 我們之中任何一個都能做到。

eng: Grandmother sent us a box of apples.
simp: 奶奶送了我们一箱苹果。
trad: 奶奶送了我們一箱蘋果。

eng: Tell us what to do next.
simp: 告诉我们下一步该怎麽做。
trad: 告訴我們下一步該怎麼做。

eng: There's a big fly on the ceiling.
simp: 有一隻大苍蝇在天花板上。
trad: 有一隻大蒼蠅在天花板上。

eng: Stick a notice on the board.
simp: 把告示贴在在布告板上。
trad: 把告示貼在在布告板上。

eng: Stick a stamp on the envelope.
Stick another stamp on the envelope.
simp: 把另一张邮票贴在信封上。
trad: 把另一張郵票貼在信封上。

eng: School begins on April the tenth.
Strictly speaking, the earth is not round.
simp: 严格来说，地球不是圆的。
trad: 嚴格來說，地球不是圓的。

eng: Pilots communicate with the airport by radio.
simp: 飞行员用无线电与机场沟通。
trad: 飛行員用無線電與機場溝通。

eng: Rice is sold by the kilogram.
simp: 米以公斤为单位来出售。
trad: 米以公斤為單位來出售。

eng: Fish is sold by the pound here.
simp: 鱼在这裡是以磅为单位来出售。
trad: 魚在這裡是以磅為單位來出售。

eng: It is ten o'clock by my watch.
Lightning is usually followed by thunder.
Pull the plant up by the roots.
Try to lose weight by jogging.
Be sure to pick up some milk.
Pick up the pencil from the floor.
Trees do not grow on prairies.
Wealth does not always bring us happiness.
simp: 财富并不总是为我们带来快乐。
trad: 財富並不總是為我們帶來快樂。

eng: Speaking foreign languages is not easy.
Honesty is not always the best policy.
simp: 诚实不总是最好的策略。
trad: 誠實不總是最好的策略。

eng: It is not easy to train dogs.
There's not a moment to waste.
It's not a road, but a path.
simp: 它不是一条路，而是一条小径。
trad: 它不是一條路，而是一條小徑。

eng: It's not a suitable topic for discussion.
simp: 它不是一个适合讨论的主题。
trad: 它不是一個適合討論的主題。

eng: Lie down and rest for a while.
Bill got mad and called Dick names.
simp: 比尔生气了并用难听的话骂迪克。
trad: 比爾生氣了並用難聽的話罵迪克。

eng: Life is full of ups and downs.
Life is not all fun and games.
simp: 生活并不都是轻鬆愉快的。
trad: 生活並不都是輕鬆愉快的。

eng: Turn the knob and open the door.
Walk two blocks, and turn left.
simp: 走过两个街区，然后左转。
trad: 走過兩個街區，然後左轉。

eng: Go upstairs and bring down my trunk.
simp: 上楼把我的旅行箱拿下来。
trad: 上樓把我的旅行箱拿下來。

eng: To be always honest is not easy.
simp: 要一直诚实是不容易的。
trad: 要一直誠實是不容易的。

eng: Smiles do not always indicate pleasure.
simp: 微笑并不一定表示高兴。
trad: 微笑並不一定表示高興。

eng: Shut all the doors and windows.
Go and buy three bottles of coke.
Try and do better next time.
simp: 尝试在下一次做得更好。
trad: 嘗試在下一次做得更好。

eng: Hot and humid weather makes us lazy.
simp: 炎热潮湿的天气使我们变得懒散。
trad: 炎熱潮濕的天氣使我們變得懶散。

eng: California and Nevada border on each other.
simp: 加利福尼亚州和内华达州相互接界。
trad: 加利福尼亞州和內華達州相互接界。

eng: Animals cannot exist without air and water.
Speak clearly and make yourself heard.
simp: 讲清楚并大声地让别人听到你说话。
trad: 講清楚並大聲地讓別人聽到你說話。

eng: God created the heaven and the earth.
Astronomy deals with the stars and planets.
simp: 天文学涉及恆星和行星。
trad: 天文學涉及恆星和行星。

eng: Lie down and make yourself comfortable.
simp: 躺下来让自己舒服一点。
trad: 躺下來讓自己舒服一點。

eng: A Japanese wouldn't do such a thing.
Only Takeuchi didn't accept the invitation.
simp: 只有竹内没有接受邀请。
trad: 只有竹內沒有接受邀請。

eng: Ming wasn't dancing with Masao then.
simp: 那时明没有在和正雄跳舞。
trad: 那時明沒有在和正雄跳舞。

eng: It's okay to take it easy sometimes.
Rain prevented us from taking a walk.
simp: 雨让我们没有办法去散步。
trad: 雨讓我們沒有辦法去散步。

eng: Just take my word for it.
Let them take care of themselves.
Bill took the blame for the loss.
simp: 比尔承担了损失的过失责任。
trad: 比爾承擔了損失的過失責任。

eng: Take a deep breath and then relax.
Trim the fat off the meat.
Take the pan off the fire.
A fire broke out after the earthquake.
A fire broke out during the night.
Never forget to put out the fire.
Soldiers must carry out their orders.
simp: 军人必须履行他们的命令。
trad: 軍人必須履行他們的命令。

eng: Watch out for thieves around here.
Ten prisoners broke out of jail.
Tommy couldn't answer the last question.
simp: 汤米不会回答最后一个问题。
trad: 湯米不會回答最後一個問題。

eng: Harry couldn't keep up with the class.
simp: 哈利无法跟上班上同学。
trad: 哈利無法跟上班上同學。

eng: Just put yourself in my shoes.
simp: 你站在我的立场上考虑看看。
trad: 你站在我的立場上考慮看看。

eng: Weeds sprang up in the garden.
School starts in September in Europe.
simp: 欧洲的学校在九月开学。
trad: 歐洲的學校在九月開學。

eng: All the flowers in the garden withered.
simp: 所有花园裡的花朵都枯萎了。
trad: 所有花園裡的花朵都枯萎了。

eng: World War II ended in 1945.
simp: 第二次世界大战结束于1945年。
trad: 第二次世界大戰結束於1945年。

eng: There wasn't a soul in sight.
There weren't any roses in the garden.
There's no way off the island.
Taking off is easier than landing.
Stop putting off finding a job.
simp: 不要拖延去找工作的事。
trad: 不要拖延去找工作的事。

eng: Japan is not rich in natural resources.
simp: 日本并不拥有丰富的自然资源。
trad: 日本並不擁有豐富的自然資源。

eng: It is still fresh in my memory.
Sydney is the largest city in Australia.
simp: 雪梨是澳洲最大的城市。
trad: 雪梨是澳洲最大的城市。

eng: English is useful in diplomacy and tourism.
simp: 英语在外交和旅游业方面很有用。
trad: 英語在外交和旅遊業方面很有用。

eng: Keep it in a cool place.
Do not give in to those demands.
India gained independence from Britain in 1947.
simp: 印度于1947年脱离英国获得独立。
trad: 印度於1947年脫離英國獲得獨立。

eng: Everyone in the class climbed the hill.
simp: 班上每个人都爬上了这个山坡。
trad: 班上每個人都爬上了這個山坡。

eng: Talking in the library is not allowed.
Smoking is prohibited on the train.
Rice is grown in rainy regions.
simp: 人们在多雨地区种植水稻。
trad: 人們在多雨地區種植水稻。

eng: Yoko is interested in collecting stamps.
simp: 洋子有收集邮票的兴趣。
trad: 洋子有收集郵票的興趣。

eng: Japan is located in the Northern Hemisphere.
Smoking is not permitted on the train.
Ask at the police box over there.
School begins at 8:30 a.m.
simp: 学校在上午八点三十分开始上课。
trad: 學校在上午八點三十分開始上課。

eng: Make another appointment at the front desk.
Sue checked in at the Royal Hotel.
simp: 苏在皇家饭店登记投宿。
trad: 蘇在皇家飯店登記投宿。

eng: Bill didn't turn up at the party.
simp: 比尔没有在派对上出现。
trad: 比爾沒有在派對上出現。

eng: Send for a doctor at once.
Water freezes at 32 degrees Fahrenheit.
It happened at a quarter past eleven.
Come here by ten at the latest.
World War I broke out in 1914.
simp: 第一次世界大战于1914年爆发。
trad: 第一次世界大戰於1914年爆發。

eng: It wasn't as expensive as I expected.
simp: 它没有我想像的那麽贵。
trad: 它沒有我想像的那麼貴。

eng: When I heard the news, I cried.
simp: 当我听到这个消息，我哭了。
trad: 當我聽到這個消息，我哭了。

eng: Sunday is not a workday for me.
simp: 星期天不是我的工作日。
trad: 星期天不是我的工作日。

eng: Sunday is not a workday for me.
Now let's get down to work.
Traffic lights work all the time.
Japanese office workers work very hard.
simp: 日本上班族工作得非常辛苦。
trad: 日本上班族工作得非常辛苦。

eng: Cut the chit-chat and get to work.
It's too hot for us to work.
simp: 太热了所以我们无法工作。
trad: 太熱了所以我們無法工作。

eng: Amy worked in the yard last Saturday.
simp: 艾美上星期六在院子裡工作。
trad: 艾美上星期六在院子裡工作。

eng: I'm sorry, but can't answer right away.
simp: 我很抱歉，但我无法立即回答。
trad: 我很抱歉，但我無法立即回答。

eng: I'm sorry, I dialed the wrong number.
To tell the truth, I completely forgot.
To tell the truth, I felt lonely.
If time permits, I'll visit the museum.
simp: 如果时间允许，我会去参观博物馆。
trad: 如果時間允許，我會去參觀博物館。

eng: I'm tired of working a nine-to-five job.
simp: 我厌倦了做朝九晚五的工作。
trad: 我厭倦了做朝九晚五的工作。

eng: The vast majority of high school students I know can't read an unknown word and pronounce the letters in the right order, let alone pronounce it correctly or naturally.
simp: 绝大多数我所认识的高中学生，无法读一个他们不认识的字和以正确的顺序来发音字母，更不用说正确或自然地发音了。
trad: 絕大多數我所認識的高中學生，無法讀一個他們不認識的字和以正確的順序來發音字母，更不用說正確或自然地發音了。

eng: The robot went out of control.
Don't ask me for money.
Turn on the light, please.
Please turn off the light.
Draw me a sheep.
He was sitting on the floor.
The policeman commanded them to stop.
She asked us several questions.
simp: 她问了我们好几个问题。
trad: 她問了我們好幾個問題。

eng: It was a fabulous show which brought us an endless delight.
simp: 那是一个给我们带来无穷乐趣的传奇性的演出。
trad: 那是一個給我們帶來無窮樂趣的傳奇性的演出。

eng: It reveals local executives' ambitions of bringing the region back to the top.
simp: 这表明了地方领导恢复地区卓越水平的雄心。
trad: 這表明了地方領導恢復地區卓越水平的雄心。

eng: Her house is at the foot of a mountain.
simp: 她家在一座山的山脚下。
trad: 她家在一座山的山腳下。

eng: The exhibition has drawn much attention from the public.
simp: 展览大大地吸引了公众的注意。
trad: 展覽大大地吸引了公眾的註意。

eng: He sometimes comes to see me.
I know that money isn't everything.
simp: 我知道金钱不代表一切。
trad: 我知道金錢不代表一切。

eng: Have you tasted such good soup before?
simp: 你尝过那么好喝的汤吗？
trad: 你嘗過那麼好喝的湯嗎？

eng: The students have returned.
New Russians, you say? Wonderful! That's just what we need!
simp: 你说新俄罗斯人？太棒了！这正是我们所需要的！
trad: 你說新俄羅斯人？太棒了！這正是我們所需要的！

eng: He talked for an entire hour.
There used to be a lot of small creeks in old times Shanghai, which of them included Zhaojia Creek, Yangjing Creek, but they're all covered up nowadays.
simp: 上海以前有许多小河浜，其中有肇家浜、洋泾浜，现在都被填了。
trad: 上海以前有許多小河浜，其中有肇家浜、洋涇浜，現在都被填了。

eng: Shops are open from Monday to Saturday.
He isn't a poet; he's a prose writer.
simp: 他不是诗人；他是个散文作家。
trad: 他不是詩人；他是個散文作家。

eng: If you hear hoofbeats, don’t look for zebras.
Don't forget your money.
Don't forget your money.
He is older than Jane by two years.
He told me to wash my face.
The motel can accommodate as many as 400 guests.
simp: 汽车旅馆可以接待多达400名客人。
trad: 汽車旅館可以接待多達400名客人。

eng: The number of cars is on the increase.
The weatherman says there is a storm on the way.
simp: 气象学家说会有暴风雨。
trad: 氣象學家說會有暴風雨。

eng: Much depends upon the result.
We got lost in the fog.
All of these books are mine.
The school was established in 1650.
Absolutely nothing is permanent in life.
simp: 生活中绝对没有什么是持久的。
trad: 生活中絕對沒有什麼是持久的。

eng: Our problems are nothing compared to hers.
simp: 我们的问题和她的比起来不算什么。
trad: 我們的問題和她的比起來不算什麼。

eng: All of my attempts have failed.
simp: 我所有的尝试都失败了。
trad: 我所有的嘗試都失敗了。

eng: probitas maxima virtus est.
Honesty is a capital virtue.
He began to feel afraid.
Where is my seat?
Are you ready?
Are you ready?
Are you ready?
He did nothing but cry.
Am I pregnant?
Am I pregnant?
Sydney is the largest city in Australia.
simp: 悉尼是澳洲最大的城市。
trad: 悉尼是澳洲最大的城市。

eng: About how many English words do you know?
simp: 你大约认识多少英文词？
trad: 你大約認識多少英文詞？

eng: Who's on duty today?
I like cracking sunflower seeds.
I look down on you!
simp: 我根本不把你放在眼里！
trad: 我根本不把你放在眼裏！

eng: The old cottage had only one bed, so we all took turns sleeping in it.
simp: 那间旧屋里只有一张床，所以我们便轮流睡觉。
trad: 那間舊屋裏只有一張床，所以我們便輪流睡覺。

eng: He was about to fall asleep, when he heard his name called.
simp: 他听到有人叫他的名字的时候，正在昏昏欲睡。
trad: 他聽到有人叫他的名字的時候，正在昏昏欲睡。

eng: The Romans would never have had enough time for conquering the world if they had first been required to study Latin.
simp: 如果他们必须先学拉丁文的话，是没有时间让罗马人征服世界的对吧。
trad: 如果他們必須先學拉丁文的話，是沒有時間讓羅馬人征服世界的對吧。

eng: I walked an entire ten miles.
simp: 我足足走了十英里的路。
trad: 我足足走了十英裏的路。

eng: Newsflash: People a couple of hundred years ago didn't speak the same as we do.
simp: 新闻快报：数百多年前的人的说话方式和我们是不同的。
trad: 新聞快報：數百多年前的人的說話方式和我們是不同的。

eng: To be honest, we came to capture you.
simp: 老实说，我们是来抓你的。
trad: 老實說，我們是來抓你的。

eng: To be honest, we came to capture you.
simp: 老实说，我们是来抓您的。
trad: 老實說，我們是來抓您的。

eng: To be honest, we came to capture you.
simp: 老实说，我们是来抓你们的。
trad: 老實說，我們是來抓你們的。

eng: When Spain colonized the Philippines, they were administrated by Mexico City. So it was Mexican Spanish, not Castilian Spanish, that influenced Tagalog.
simp: 当西班牙殖民了菲律宾时，是从墨西哥城管理它的。于是他加禄语是收到了墨西哥式西班牙语的影响，而不卡斯蒂利亚式的。
trad: 當西班牙殖民了菲律賓時，是從墨西哥城管理它的。於是他加祿語是收到了墨西哥式西班牙語的影響，而不卡斯蒂利亞式的。

eng: Riding a horse is really thrilling.
Half a loaf is better than none.
Half a loaf is better than none.
Studying abroad is very common now.
simp: 现在出国留学是很常见的了。
trad: 現在出國留學是很常見的了。

eng: Mt. Aso is an active volcano.
A ball is floating down the river.
Any bed is better than no bed.
A computer is an absolute necessity now.
simp: 电脑现在是一个绝对必要的东西了。
trad: 電腦現在是一個絕對必要的東西了。

eng: Traffic downtown is all backed up.
simp: 市中心的交通都堵塞了。
trad: 市中心的交通都堵塞了。

eng: Not everyone who lives here is rich.
simp: 并不是每个住在这裡的人都是富有的。
trad: 並不是每個住在這裡的人都是富有的。

eng: Korean food is generally very spicy.
A big tree fell in the storm.
simp: 一棵大树在暴风中倒下。
trad: 一棵大樹在暴風中倒下。

eng: Scotland can be very warm in September.
simp: 苏格兰在9月可以变的很温暖。
trad: 蘇格蘭在9月可以變的很溫暖。

eng: Hemingway enjoyed big game hunting in Africa.
simp: 海明威喜欢在非洲的大狩猎。
trad: 海明威喜歡在非洲的大狩獵。

eng: Sales fell off in the third quarter.
simp: 在第三季时销售跌了下来。
trad: 在第三季時銷售跌了下來。

eng: These flowers grow in warm countries.
simp: 这些花生长在温暖的国家。
trad: 這些花生長在溫暖的國家。

eng: Only four horses competed in the race.
simp: 只有四匹马参加了比赛。
trad: 只有四匹馬參加了比賽。

eng: There's a hair in my soup.
There's a place called Kuchiwa in Hiroshima.
simp: 广岛有一个地方叫口和。
trad: 廣島有一個地方叫口和。

eng: Such a thing can't happen in Japan.
simp: 这样的事情不可能在日本发生。
trad: 這樣的事情不可能在日本發生。

eng: There's an old movie theater in town.
simp: 城裡有一家古老的电影院。
trad: 城裡有一家古老的電影院。

eng: Saudi Arabia is very rich in oil.
simp: 沙乌地阿拉伯有非常丰富的石油。
trad: 沙烏地阿拉伯有非常豐富的石油。

eng: There's bamboo growing in the garden.
It became quiet again in the forest.
simp: 森林裡又再变得安静下来了。
trad: 森林裡又再變得安靜下來了。

eng: Star began to appear in the sky.
simp: 星星开始在天空中出现。
trad: 星星開始在天空中出現。

eng: Leaves begin to fall in October.
simp: 树叶在十月开始掉落下来。
trad: 樹葉在十月開始掉落下來。

eng: It is rude to laugh at others.
It is rude to point at others.
It is rude to stare at someone.
simp: 盯着别人看是不礼貌的。
trad: 盯著別人看是不禮貌的。

eng: It is rude to stare at strangers.
simp: 盯着陌生人看是不礼貌的。
trad: 盯著陌生人看是不禮貌的。

eng: It is wrong to cheat at cards.
Keep it at a lower temperature.
Turn left at the first light.
War may break out at any moment.
War must be avoided at all costs.
simp: 战争必须不惜一切代价地去避免。
trad: 戰爭必須不惜一切代價地去避免。

eng: I'm neither an Athenian nor a Greek.
simp: 我既不是雅典人也不是希腊人。
trad: 我既不是雅典人也不是希臘人。

eng: No matter what happens, I am prepared.
simp: 不管发生什麽事，我都准备好了。
trad: 不管發生什麼事，我都準備好了。

eng: I'm not accustomed to getting up early.
I'm not responsible for what Tom did.
simp: 我不必对汤姆所做的事负责任。
trad: 我不必對湯姆所做的事負責任。

eng: I'm not satisfied with my English ability.
simp: 我不满意我的英语能力。
trad: 我不滿意我的英語能力。

eng: I'm planning to stay at the hotel.
It's really different from what I expected.
simp: 这真的跟我所预期的不同。
trad: 這真的跟我所預期的不同。

eng: I'm short of cash at the moment.
I'm sorry for the delay in responding.
simp: 我很抱歉这麽迟才回复。
trad: 我很抱歉這麼遲才回復。

eng: I'm sorry I didn't make myself clear.
I'd like to cash a travelers' check.
I'd like to check out right now.
I'd like to get home by five.
I'd like to know the exact time.
I'd like to live in New York.
I'd like to send these to Japan.
simp: 我想将这些寄送到日本。
trad: 我想將這些寄送到日本。

eng: I'd like to speak to John Warner.
I'd like to work at the cafeteria.
I'm getting farsighted as I get older.
simp: 当我年长时，我渐渐变得有远见。
trad: 當我年長時，我漸漸變得有遠見。

eng: I'm getting more and more gray hair.
I'm getting off at the next stop.
Recently I moved to another apartment.
simp: 最近我搬到另一栋公寓。
trad: 最近我搬到另一棟公寓。

eng: Can I speak to the head nurse?
Sorry, I've got my hands full now.
simp: 对不起，现在我手上都是东西了。
trad: 對不起，現在我手上都是東西了。

eng: I'm leaving for Chicago next Saturday morning.
simp: 下週六早上我要去芝加哥。
trad: 下週六早上我要去芝加哥。

eng: I'd like a room in the back.
simp: 我想要一间后面的房间。
trad: 我想要一間後面的房間。

eng: I'd like a room in the front.
simp: 我想要一间前面的房间。
trad: 我想要一間前面的房間。

eng: I'd like the sauce on the side.
New stamps will be issued next month.
simp: 新邮票将于下个月发行。
trad: 新郵票將於下個月發行。

eng: Peace talks will begin next week.
simp: 和平会谈将在下週开始。
trad: 和平會談將在下週開始。

eng: There will be a concert next Sunday.
simp: 下週日将有一场音乐会。
trad: 下週日將有一場音樂會。

eng: Coffee will be served after the meal.
What will actually happen is anyone's guess.
simp: 谁也说不准实际上将会发生什麽事。
trad: 誰也說不準實際上將會發生什麼事。

eng: It became dark before I knew it.
In case it rains, I won't go.
Queen Elizabeth I passed away in 1603.
simp: 女王伊丽莎白一世于1603年去世。
trad: 女王伊麗莎白一世於1603年去世。

eng: I'm fed up with eating in restaurants.
There was no water in the river.
There was no water in the river.
There was not a tree in sight.
Zimbabwe was once a colony of Britain.
simp: 津巴布韦曾经是英国的殖民地。
trad: 津巴布韋曾經是英國的殖民地。

eng: Africa was once called the Dark Continent.
simp: 非洲曾经被称为黑暗大陆。
trad: 非洲曾經被稱為黑暗大陸。

eng: Jealousy was the motive for the murder.
There was widespread panic after the earthquake.
simp: 地震后人们普遍觉得恐慌。
trad: 地震後人們普遍覺得恐慌。

eng: Linda Wood was standing at the door.
When I arrived, it was raining.
simp: 当我到达时，天正下着雨。
trad: 當我到達時，天正下著雨。

eng: When I awoke, it was snowing.
simp: 当我醒来时，天正下着雪。
trad: 當我醒來時，天正下著雪。

eng: Perhaps it will rain in the afternoon.
Traffic was blocked by a landslide.
Mother was busy getting ready for dinner.
America was discovered by Columbus in 1492.
simp: 美国在1492年被哥伦布发现。
trad: 美國在1492年被哥倫布發現。

eng: There was hardly anyone in the room.
It was impossible to find an answer.
Paper was invented by the Chinese.
It was Marie Curie who discovered radium.
simp: 镭是居里夫人所发现的。
trad: 鐳是居裏夫人所發現的。

eng: There wasn't anyone in the room.
There was no one left but me.
A stewardess was rescued from the wreck.
simp: 一名空姐从飞机残骸中被救出来了。
trad: 一名空姐從飛機殘骸中被救出來了。

eng: All the furniture was covered with dust.
simp: 所有的家具都佈满了灰尘。
trad: 所有的家具都佈滿了灰塵。

eng: Unfortunately the telephone was out of order.
On the whole, the event was successful.
simp: 整体而言，这个事件是成功的。
trad: 整體而言，這個事件是成功的。

eng: It was a great shock to me.
There was a shortage of fuel.
There was a steady increase in population.
There was a sudden change of plan.
Bill was able to pass the exam.
It was been raining since early morning.
A bridge was built across the river.
A card was attached to the gift.
simp: 一张卡片被附在了礼物上。
trad: 一張卡片被附在了禮物上。

eng: Sammy Davis was an excellent singer.
simp: 山米戴维斯是一个优秀的歌手。
trad: 山米戴維斯是一個優秀的歌手。

eng: A doctor was called in right away.
Clint Eastwood was elected mayor of Carmel.
simp: 克林伊斯威特当选为卡梅尔市市长。
trad: 克林伊斯威特當選為卡梅爾市市長。

eng: Henry James was an American by birth.
simp: 亨利詹姆斯出生于美国。
trad: 亨利詹姆斯出生於美國。

eng: J.F. Kennedy was buried in Arlington Cemetery.
simp: 约翰甘迺迪被安葬在阿灵顿公墓。
trad: 約翰甘迺迪被安葬在阿靈頓公墓。

eng: Each of them was given a prize.
simp: 他们每个人都被授奖了。
trad: 他們每個人都被授獎了。

eng: It's awfully hot today.
It's very hot today, isn't it?
It is especially hot today.
It's insanely hot today.
How hot it is today!
Today is the hottest day this year.
simp: 今天是今年最热的一天。
trad: 今天是今年最熱的一天。

eng: It is as hot a day as yesterday.
It isn't anything like as cold as it was yesterday.
simp: 今天没有像昨天那麽冷。
trad: 今天沒有像昨天那麼冷。

eng: It is less humid today than it was yesterday.
It is not so hot today as yesterday.
It is less muggy today than it was yesterday.
There are many more students in the classroom today than yesterday.
simp: 今天教室裡的学生比昨天还要多。
trad: 今天教室裡的學生比昨天還要多。

eng: There's more cloud today than yesterday.
You had better take an umbrella with you today.
simp: 你今天最好随身带把伞。
trad: 你今天最好隨身帶把傘。

eng: I won't work overtime today.
Aren't we going out to the park today?
simp: 我们今天不是要去公园吗？
trad: 我們今天不是要去公園嗎？

eng: Eh? We said we'd go to the park? I didn't realise.
simp: 啊？我们说过要去公园吗？我没有印象。
trad: 啊？我們說過要去公園嗎？我沒有印象。

eng: She made room for an old lady.
She made room for an old lady.
simp: 她让出个空间给一位老太太。
trad: 她讓出個空間給一位老太太。

eng: I had a feeling this might happen.
simp: 我早就有感觉到这可能会发生。
trad: 我早就有感覺到這可能會發生。

eng: I had a feeling this might happen.
simp: 我早有一种感觉这可能会发生。
trad: 我早有一種感覺這可能會發生。

eng: What's your impression of China?
simp: 你对中国的印象是什么？
trad: 你對中國的印象是什麼？

eng: I had a funny dream last night.
simp: 我昨晚做了一个有趣的梦。
trad: 我昨晚做了一個有趣的夢。

eng: My impression of America is very good.
simp: 我对美国的印象挺好的。
trad: 我對美國的印象挺好的。

eng: I had a good opinion of her.
What's your impression of that person like?
We had a conversation about baseball.
simp: 我们交谈了有关棒球的事。
trad: 我們交談了有關棒球的事。

eng: My impression of this government is that they need a more forceful economic policy, otherwise they'll encounter large problems in the future.
simp: 我对这个政府的印象是，他们需要强一点儿的经济政策，要不然将来会遇到很大的问题。
trad: 我對這個政府的印象是，他們需要強一點兒的經濟政策，要不然將來會遇到很大的問題。

eng: The teacher had a bad cold.
We had a chat for a while.
I had a chance to travel abroad.
simp: 我有个到国外旅游的机会。
trad: 我有個到國外旅遊的機會。

eng: He had a book on physics published.
simp: 他有一本关于物理学的书被出版了。
trad: 他有一本關於物理學的書被出版了。

eng: They had a baby last week.
simp: 上週他们生了一个孩子。
trad: 上週他們生了一個孩子。

eng: That day left a deep impression on me.
simp: 我对那天的印象很深刻。
trad: 我對那天的印象很深刻。

eng: We hacked a path through the forest.
simp: 我们开出了一条穿过森林的小路。
trad: 我們開出了一條穿過森林的小路。

eng: She made a serious mistake.
simp: 她犯了一个严重的错误。
trad: 她犯了一個嚴重的錯誤。

eng: I guess that would be all right.
I guess that would be all right.
I guess it depends on the weather.
I guess it depends on the weather.
simp: 我想这要看天气情况而定。
trad: 我想這要看天氣情況而定。

eng: I guess most of them went home.
simp: 我猜他们大多数回家了。
trad: 我猜他們大多數回家了。

eng: I guess I'll have to leave now.
They guarantee this clock for a year.
simp: 他们保证这个时钟可用一年。
trad: 他們保證這個時鐘可用一年。

eng: I guess I haven't made myself clear.
simp: 我想我没有把话说清楚。
trad: 我想我沒有把話說清楚。

eng: They guaranteed regular employment to their workers.
simp: 他们对他们的员工保证就业。
trad: 他們對他們的員工保證就業。

eng: The staff in that restaurant gave us a very good impression.
simp: 那家饭馆儿的服务员给我们留下很好的印象。
trad: 那家飯館兒的服務員給我們留下很好的印象。

eng: She made out the application for admission.
The old man made out his will.
simp: 这位老先生立了他的遗嘱。
trad: 這位老先生立了他的遺囑。

eng: She made no response to my question.
Words express thoughts.
Words express thoughts.
He made no mention of her request.
I made my way through the crowd.
Our team lost all of its games.
simp: 我们的队伍输了所有的比赛。
trad: 我們的隊伍輸了所有的比賽。

eng: What you said left a deep impression on me.
simp: 你说的话给我留下了很深刻的印象。
trad: 你說的話給我留下了很深刻的印象。

eng: My father made me what I am.
simp: 我父亲让我知道了我自己是谁。
trad: 我父親讓我知道了我自己是誰。

eng: My mother made me take some medicine.
He made me sing on the stage.
My uncle made me serve as interpreter.
My uncle made me serve as interpreter.
The teacher made me repeat the sentence.
simp: 老师让我重複了这句话。
trad: 老師讓我重複了這句話。

eng: They made me go there alone.
simp: 他们让我独自去了那裡。
trad: 他們讓我獨自去了那裡。

eng: He made me go against my will.
simp: 他让我违背了我的意愿。
trad: 他讓我違背了我的意願。

eng: She made me a nice dress.
simp: 她做了一件好看的衣服给我。
trad: 她做了一件好看的衣服給我。

eng: My aunt made me a new skirt.
simp: 我阿姨做了一条新裙子给我。
trad: 我阿姨做了一條新裙子給我。

eng: My aunt made me a new skirt.
simp: 我舅母做了一条新裙子给我。
trad: 我舅母做了一條新裙子給我。

eng: My aunt made me a new skirt.
simp: 我婶婶做了一条新裙子给我。
trad: 我嬸嬸做了一條新裙子給我。

eng: My aunt made me a new skirt.
simp: 我姑姑做了一条新裙子给我。
trad: 我姑姑做了一條新裙子給我。

eng: He lives in a world of fantasy.
simp: 他住在一个奇幻世界裡。
trad: 他住在一個奇幻世界裡。

eng: My mother made me a Christmas cake.
simp: 母亲做了一个圣诞蛋糕给我。
trad: 母親做了一個聖誕蛋糕給我。

eng: My sister made me a beautiful doll.
simp: 我妹妹做了一个漂亮的娃娃给我。
trad: 我妹妹做了一個漂亮的娃娃給我。

eng: My sister made me a beautiful doll.
simp: 我姊姊做了一个漂亮的娃娃给我。
trad: 我姊姊做了一個漂亮的娃娃給我。

eng: He made many excuses for being late.
simp: 他为迟到找了很多的藉口。
trad: 他為遲到找了很多的藉口。

eng: They made John chairman of the committee.
simp: 他们让约翰做了委员会的主席。
trad: 他們讓約翰做了委員會的主席。

eng: Tom made Jill a new dress.
simp: 汤姆做了一套新衣服给吉儿。
trad: 湯姆做了一套新衣服給吉兒。

eng: She made jam from the apples.
I find her very impressive.
simp: 我对她有很深刻的印象。
trad: 我對她有很深刻的印象。

eng: We made it out of there.
He knows better than to marry her.
He knows better than to marry her.
They go to church on Sunday.
Your CV has really impressed me.
simp: 你的履历给我留下深刻的印象。
trad: 你的履歷給我留下深刻的印象。

eng: He has no eye for women.
He couldn't understand the sentence.
I had a dream about him.
I had my watch stolen yesterday.
I had to go to America.
An eight-year-old car is almost worthless.
simp: 一辆车龄八年的车子几乎是毫无价值的。
trad: 一輛車齡八年的車子幾乎是毫無價值的。

eng: You can rely upon his being punctual.
simp: 你可以放心，他会准时的。
trad: 你可以放心，他會準時的。

eng: Andy must have practiced very hard.
simp: 安迪一定练习得很辛苦。
trad: 安迪一定練習得很辛苦。

eng: I'm looking for some regular work.
I'm looking forward to seeing him.
He couldn't run very fast.
I lived abroad for ten years.
I like to ride on trains.
We made inquiries into his past.
simp: 我们对他的过去进行了调查。
trad: 我們對他的過去進行了調查。

eng: He made his way to the room.
My aunt grows tomatoes in her garden.
simp: 我阿姨在她的花园种蕃茄。
trad: 我阿姨在她的花園種蕃茄。

eng: The dog growled at the strange man.
simp: 狗对着这个陌生男子咆哮。
trad: 狗對著這個陌生男子咆哮。

eng: We guarantee our products for one year.
simp: 我们保证我们的产品一年。
trad: 我們保證我們的產品一年。

eng: He made his way to the minister.
He made his way through the crowd.
He has more than five dictionaries.
My mother grows flowers in her garden.
simp: 我的母亲在她的花园裡种花。
trad: 我的母親在她的花園裡種花。

eng: We can rely on his judgement.
simp: 我们可以信赖他的判断。
trad: 我們可以信賴他的判斷。

eng: I quit smoking two years ago.
He has no manners at all.
He grew up to be an engineer.
simp: 他长大后成为了一名工程师。
trad: 他長大後成為了一名工程師。

eng: We grow a variety of crops.
They grow strawberries in their greenhouse.
simp: 他们在他们的温室裡种植草莓。
trad: 他們在他們的溫室裡種植草莓。

eng: I made his son a new suit.
simp: 我给他的儿子做了一套新西装。
trad: 我給他的兒子做了一套新西裝。

eng: The dog growled at a little boy.
simp: 这隻狗对着一个小男孩咆哮。
trad: 這隻狗對著一個小男孩咆哮。

eng: She grew up to be a veterinarian.
simp: 她长大后成为了一名兽医。
trad: 她長大後成為了一名獸醫。

eng: He grew up to be a doctor.
simp: 他长大后成为了一名医生。
trad: 他長大後成為了一名醫生。

eng: Laura Ingalls grew up on the prairie.
simp: 劳拉英戈尔斯是在草原上长大的。
trad: 勞拉英戈爾斯是在草原上長大的。

eng: They greeted me with a smile.
simp: 他们面带微笑向我打招呼。
trad: 他們面帶微笑向我打招呼。

eng: She greeted us with a smile.
simp: 她面带微笑向我们打招呼。
trad: 她面帶微笑向我們打招呼。

eng: I grew up in this small town.
simp: 我在这个小镇上长大的。
trad: 我在這個小鎮上長大的。

eng: He grasped the rope with two hands.
simp: 他用两隻手抓住了绳子。
trad: 他用兩隻手抓住了繩子。

eng: Mrs. Parker greeted him with a smile.
simp: 帕克夫人面带微笑向他打招呼。
trad: 帕克夫人面帶微笑向他打招呼。

eng: She greeted him waving her hand.
She greeted me with a big smile.
simp: 她面带大大的笑容向我招呼。
trad: 她面帶大大的笑容向我招呼。

eng: The girl greeted me with a smile.
simp: 这个女孩面带微笑向我打招呼。
trad: 這個女孩面帶微笑向我打招呼。

eng: He graduated from high school this spring.
simp: 今年春天他从高中毕业了。
trad: 今年春天他從高中畢業了。

eng: She graduated from high school last year.
I graduated from high school last year.
He graduated from Harvard University with honors.
simp: 他光荣地从哈佛大学毕业了。
trad: 他光榮地從哈佛大學畢業了。

eng: She got wet to the skin.
Mark graduated from Harvard in 1991.
simp: 马克在1991年毕业于哈佛大学。
trad: 馬克在1991年畢業於哈佛大學。

eng: We graduate from high school at eighteen.
simp: 我们在十八岁的时候从高中毕业了。
trad: 我們在十八歲的時候從高中畢業了。

eng: I got your fax the other day.
simp: 我前几天收到了你的传真。
trad: 我前幾天收到了你的傳真。

eng: I got up at six this morning.
We got together in the park.
simp: 我们在公园裡聚在一起。
trad: 我們在公園裡聚在一起。

eng: I got up at five that morning.
We got to the station at six.
I got to the station this morning.
They got to the hotel after dark.
The cat got through the hedge.
She got through her work before five.
simp: 她在五点钟前做完了她的工作。
trad: 她在五點鐘前做完了她的工作。

eng: I got this CD player for free.
simp: 我免费得到这个CD播放机。
trad: 我免費得到這個CD播放機。

eng: He got thrown out of the house.
They got thoroughly wet in the rain.
simp: 他们在雨中被淋得全身都湿了。
trad: 他們在雨中被淋得全身都濕了。

eng: I got this vacuum cleaner for nothing.
simp: 我免费得到了这个吸尘器。
trad: 我免費得到了這個吸塵器。

eng: We got there at the same time.
simp: 我们在同一时间到了那裡。
trad: 我們在同一時間到了那裡。

eng: I got these old coins from her.
simp: 我从她那裡得到这些旧钱币。
trad: 我從她那裡得到這些舊錢幣。

eng: We got the meeting over with quickly.
simp: 我们很快的结束了这个会议。
trad: 我們很快的結束了這個會議。

eng: I got the money back from him.
simp: 我拿到了他还给我的钱。
trad: 我拿到了他還給我的錢。

eng: The boy made his parents happy.
simp: 这个男孩让他的父母高兴。
trad: 這個男孩讓他的父母高興。

eng: She got the ticket for nothing.
I got the information from him directly.
simp: 我直接从他那裡得到讯息。
trad: 我直接從他那裡得到訊息。

eng: I got the roller skates for nothing.
I got scolded severely by that teacher.
simp: 我被那位老师严厉斥责了。
trad: 我被那位老師嚴厲斥責了。

eng: I got the book back from him.
I got the bicycle at a bargain.
simp: 我讨价还价地买到了这辆自行车。
trad: 我討價還價地買到了這輛自行車。

eng: I got some sand in my eye.
He got out from under the car.
The teacher got quite well again.
She got on the subway at Ginza.
She got out of the car.
They got out of the car.
Your brother got married, didn't he?
The old man got off the bus.
We got on the bus there.
simp: 我们在那裡上了公共汽车。
trad: 我們在那裡上了公共汽車。

eng: I got my friends to help me.
simp: 我请我的朋友来帮助我。
trad: 我請我的朋友來幫助我。

eng: She got married when she was twenty-five.
She got married in her teens.
My father got married in his twenties.
simp: 我父亲在他二十多岁时结婚了。
trad: 我父親在他二十多歲時結婚了。

eng: They got married and settled near Boston.
simp: 他们结了婚并定居在波士顿附近。
trad: 他們結了婚並定居在波士頓附近。

eng: She lives in a large house.
We got lost in the snow.
We got involved in a traffic accident.
simp: 我们被捲入了一场交通事故。
trad: 我們被捲入了一場交通事故。

eng: She got married against her father's will.
simp: 她违背了她父亲的意愿结了婚。
trad: 她違背了她父親的意願結了婚。

eng: The thief got in without being noticed.
simp: 小偷在没有被发现的情况下进去了。
trad: 小偷在沒有被發現的情況下進去了。

eng: He made himself heard across the room.
simp: 他让对面的房间都能听到他的声音。
trad: 他讓對面的房間都能聽到他的聲音。

eng: He got injured in a traffic accident.
simp: 他在一场交通意外中受了伤。
trad: 他在一場交通意外中受了傷。

eng: I got injured in the traffic accident.
simp: 我在这场交通意外中受了伤。
trad: 我在這場交通意外中受了傷。

eng: He got injured in the traffic accident.
simp: 他在这场交通意外中受了伤。
trad: 他在這場交通意外中受了傷。

eng: The old man got in her way.
She got in at 9 p.m.
He got hurt when he fell down.
He got hurt in the game yesterday.
simp: 他昨天在这场比赛中受了伤。
trad: 他昨天在這場比賽中受了傷。

eng: The cat is under the table.
The pen is on the desk.
The rich and the poor are afraid of death.
Is he afraid of death?
Smoking kills.
I'm not afraid of death.
She isn't afraid of death.
We aren't afraid of death.
Stir the soup.
They aren't afraid of death.
The moment I held the baby in my arms, it began to cry.
simp: 我一把孩子抱在手里，他就开始哭了。
trad: 我一把孩子抱在手裏，他就開始哭了。

eng: I'm a starved spider.
He got tired of reading.
Good luck on the test!
The jury's guilty verdict gave rise to widespread debate.
simp: 陪审团作出的犯罪判决激起了很大的争论。
trad: 陪審團作出的犯罪判決激起了很大的爭論。

eng: You know, I've never seen you with a guy before.
simp: 你知道吗，我从没过见你跟一个男人一起。
trad: 你知道嗎，我從沒過見你跟一個男人一起。

eng: They were only interested in selling books.
So you don't understand this sentence?
simp: 那你就是不懂这句句子咯？
trad: 那你就是不懂這句句子咯？

eng: You can't understand this sentence, can you?
simp: 你不懂这句句子，不是吗？
trad: 你不懂這句句子，不是嗎？

eng: Will you please explain the meaning of this sentence to me?
simp: 您能为我解释这句句子的意思吗？
trad: 您能為我解釋這句句子的意思嗎？

eng: This sentence doesn't make sense.
Put this sentence into English.
The meaning of this sentence is obscure.
Young children cannot determine what is right and what is wrong.
simp: 小孩子不能判断什么是对的，什么是错的。
trad: 小孩子不能判斷什麼是對的，什麼是錯的。

eng: She can assess investments very accurately.
simp: 投资她能判断得很正确。
trad: 投資她能判斷得很正確。

eng: Don't judge other people's traditional culture.
simp: 你不要随意评判别人的传统文化。
trad: 你不要隨意評判別人的傳統文化。

eng: We should judge him according to his actions.
simp: 我们应该根据他的作为来评判他。
trad: 我們應該根據他的作為來評判他。

eng: He judges other people time and again.
In your view, can we judge other people's religion or not?
simp: 对你来说，我们可不可以评判别人的宗教？
trad: 對你來說，我們可不可以評判別人的宗教？

eng: The purpose of this interview is to assess whether or not you are suitable for the company.
simp: 这次面试的意义是评断你适不适合这家公司。
trad: 這次面試的意義是評斷你適不適合這家公司。

eng: As he has done a lot of bad things, we can conclude that he is a bad person.
simp: 因为他做了不少坏事，我们可以断定他不是个好人。
trad: 因為他做了不少壞事，我們可以斷定他不是個好人。

eng: From this you can conclude that feminism is still necessary.
simp: 从这来看，你能因此论定女性主义还是必要的。
trad: 從這來看，你能因此論定女性主義還是必要的。

eng: After looking at the research, most of us conclude that vaccines are a good thing.
simp: 看完研究以后，我们其中大部分人论定疫苗是件好事。
trad: 看完研究以後，我們其中大部分人論定疫苗是件好事。

eng: They are both very competent judges.
simp: 他们俩都是很称职的法官。
trad: 他們倆都是很稱職的法官。

eng: This case might not get resolved for a while.
simp: 这个桉件可能不会在短时间内就解决。
trad: 這個案件可能不會在短時間內就解決。

eng: I wonder what he's up to.
simp: 他葫芦里不知卖的是什么药？
trad: 他葫蘆裏不知賣的是什麼藥？

eng: I don't trust businessmen.
I suppose I felt a little jealous.
I don't like anything like hard work.
simp: 我不喜欢任何辛苦的工作。
trad: 我不喜歡任何辛苦的工作。

eng: I will love you always.
I had a fine old time.
simp: 我有一段美好的旧时光。
trad: 我有一段美好的舊時光。

eng: Does it hurt a lot?
I was biting my nails, worrying about you.
simp: 我一面咬着指甲一面担心着你。
trad: 我一面咬著指甲一面擔心著你。

eng: I feel very sick.
What an awful lot of books you have!
simp: 你的书真是多到可怕啊!
trad: 你的書真是多到可怕啊!

eng: It's freezing.
I can't live without you.
I like you very much.
When it comes to love, women are experts and men eternal novices.
simp: 当说到爱情，女人是专家而男人永远是新手。
trad: 當說到愛情，女人是專家而男人永遠是新手。

eng: Love is the miracle of civilization.
I will be at home when she comes next.
simp: 当她下次来的时候，我会在家裡。
trad: 當她下次來的時候，我會在家裡。

eng: Didn't you get married!? "Oh, we split up. We broke our engagement."
simp: 你没结婚吧!? "哦，我们分手了。我们解除婚约了。"
trad: 你沒結婚吧!? "哦，我們分手了。我們解除婚約了。"

eng: There is no stopping a girl's tongue.
simp: 没有办法阻止一个女孩的喋喋不休。
trad: 沒有辦法阻止一個女孩的喋喋不休。

eng: When I hear this song, I think of you, and miss you.
simp: 当我听到这首歌，我想起了你，并想念着你。
trad: 當我聽到這首歌，我想起了你，並想念著你。

eng: I love Hitomi.
The poet expressed his burning passion for the woman he loved.
simp: 诗人对他爱的女人表达了他火热的激情。
trad: 詩人對他愛的女人表達了他火熱的激情。

eng: I had her sweep my room.
simp: 我让她打扫了我的房间。
trad: 我讓她打掃了我的房間。

eng: They decided to get married.
They love each other.
Do they love each other?
They talked about love.
We love each other.
Are those two going out?
I'll miss you so much.
It's you I'll always love.
I wonder if he loves me.
You can't do two things at once.
Kate glanced at Chris and then ignored him, making him feel miserable.
simp: 凯特看了克里斯一眼，然后不理睬他，使他感到痛苦。
trad: 凱特看了克裏斯一眼，然後不理睬他，使他感到痛苦。

eng: It's the animal in me that wants it.
simp: 是我内在的兽性想要它。
trad: 是我內在的獸性想要它。

eng: You can't do two things at once.
Shall we eat this Pocky from both ends?
simp: 让我们从两端吃这百吉冰好吗?
trad: 讓我們從兩端吃這百吉冰好嗎?

eng: When I saw them on a date, I asked them, "Do I hear wedding bells?"
simp: 当我看见他们在约会，我问他们:"我听到婚礼的钟声了吗?"
trad: 當我看見他們在約會，我問他們:"我聽到婚禮的鐘聲了嗎?"

eng: You make life worth living.
So I thought my date, er rather, offline-meeting was going to be just me and her but things aren't that easy.
simp: 所以之前我认为我的约会，或者更确切的说，下线后的网聚将只有我和她，但是事情并非那麽简单。
trad: 所以之前我認為我的約會，或者更確切的說，下線後的網聚將只有我和她，但是事情並非那麼簡單。

eng: He saw her and blushed.
I got pregnant from the Finnish harpist that I told you about last night.
simp: 我跟那个芬兰竖琴手怀孕了，他就是我昨晚告诉你的那个人。
trad: 我跟那個芬蘭豎琴手懷孕了，他就是我昨晚告訴你的那個人。

eng: Time is of the essence, Paul. If you don't tell her how you feel now, you'll never have another chance.
simp: 时间就是生命，保罗。如果你不告诉她你现在的感觉，你永远不会有第二次机会。
trad: 時間就是生命，保羅。如果你不告訴她你現在的感覺，你永遠不會有第二次機會。

eng: What's the difference between erotic and kinky? "Erotic is when you use a feather and kinky is when you use a whole chicken."
simp: 性爱和色情之间有什麽不同之处? "性爱是当你使用一根羽毛，色情是当你使用整隻鸡。"
trad: 性愛和色情之間有什麼不同之處? "性愛是當你使用一根羽毛，色情是當你使用整隻雞。"

eng: A woman's strength is in her tongue.
simp: 女人的力量在她的舌头。
trad: 女人的力量在她的舌頭。

eng: He married an actress.
simp: 他和一个女演员结婚了。
trad: 他和一個女演員結婚了。

eng: She looked bored while we were making love.
simp: 当我们在做爱的时候，她看起来很厌烦。
trad: 當我們在做愛的時候，她看起來很厭煩。

eng: Mind your own business!
Would you mind taking me home?, she said.
simp: 你介意送我回家吗? 她说。
trad: 你介意送我回家嗎? 她說。

eng: He wrote a book about the American Civil War.
simp: 他写了本关于美国南北战争的书。
trad: 他寫了本關於美國南北戰爭的書。

eng: I was barely able to work.
Despite Trang's constant affirmations of love, Spenser is still afraid someday she will fall out of love with him.
simp: 儘管庄不断发誓她不变的爱情，斯宾塞仍然害怕有一天她会不爱他了。
trad: 儘管莊不斷發誓她不變的愛情，斯賓塞仍然害怕有一天她會不愛他了。

eng: I love you more than you love me.
No one was late.
It is the greatest happiness in life to love and to be loved.
simp: 爱和被爱是生活中最大的幸福。
trad: 愛和被愛是生活中最大的幸福。

eng: Love me lithe, love me long.
simp: 澹澹地爱我，长久地爱我。
trad: 淡淡地愛我，長久地愛我。

eng: Love me lithe, love me long.
simp: 不求情意绵绵，但求天长地久。
trad: 不求情意綿綿，但求天長地久。

eng: As I love her, so she loved me.
simp: 正如我爱她，所以她爱我。
trad: 正如我愛她，所以她愛我。

eng: I don't love her, not even if she loves me.
simp: 即使她爱我，我也不爱她。
trad: 即使她愛我，我也不愛她。

eng: I thought he loved you, but as it is, he loved another girl.
simp: 我以为他爱你，但事实上，他爱另一个女孩。
trad: 我以為他愛你，但事實上，他愛另一個女孩。

eng: He loves her. She loves him, too.
I love her and she loves me.
She loved me in the same way that I loved her.
simp: 她爱我就像我爱她一样。
trad: 她愛我就像我愛她一樣。

eng: Are you aware of how much she loves you?
simp: 你知道她有多麽爱你吗?
trad: 你知道她有多麼愛你嗎?

eng: Let's discuss your love problems on the way back from school.
simp: 从学校回来的路上让我们来讨论你的爱情问题。
trad: 從學校回來的路上讓我們來討論你的愛情問題。

eng: Does he know that you love him?
You have lovely eyes, don't you?
simp: 你有一双可爱的眼睛，不是吗?
trad: 你有一雙可愛的眼睛，不是嗎?

eng: I'll always love you, no matter what happens.
simp: 不论发生了什麽事，我会永远爱你。
trad: 不論發生了什麼事，我會永遠愛你。

eng: The prince fell in love with a woodcutter's daughter.
simp: 王子爱上了一个樵夫的女儿。
trad: 王子愛上了一個樵夫的女兒。

eng: Scarcely an hour goes by that I don't I think of you with love.
simp: 我几乎没有一个小时不满怀爱意地想着你。
trad: 我幾乎沒有一個小時不滿懷愛意地想著你。

eng: He used to love me, she answered sadly.
simp: 他以前爱我，她伤心地回答。
trad: 他以前愛我，她傷心地回答。

eng: To write a love letter in English is not easy.
simp: 用英文写情书是不容易的。
trad: 用英文寫情書是不容易的。

eng: Love blinded him to her faults.
simp: 爱情让他盲目到看不到她的错。
trad: 愛情讓他盲目到看不到她的錯。

eng: At last, Mario managed to win the princess's love.
simp: 最后，马里奥设法赢得公主的爱。
trad: 最後，馬裏奧設法贏得公主的愛。

eng: Nothing is as precious as love.
simp: 没有什麽东西是跟爱一样珍贵的。
trad: 沒有什麼東西是跟愛一樣珍貴的。

eng: As long as we love each other, we'll be all right.
simp: 只要我们彼此相爱，我们会没事的。
trad: 只要我們彼此相愛，我們會沒事的。

eng: It was not until Lucy left me that I realized how much I loved her.
simp: 直到露西离开了我，我才意识到我是多麽爱她。
trad: 直到露西離開了我，我才意識到我是多麼愛她。

eng: In time, Tom came to love her.
Marry first and love will follow.
simp: 先结婚，那麽爱将随之而来。
trad: 先結婚，那麼愛將隨之而來。

eng: Makoto found his true love on top of Ayers Rock. She's from Osaka.
simp: 诚在艾尔斯岩上找到了自己真正的爱情。她来自大坂。
trad: 誠在艾爾斯巖上找到了自己真正的愛情。她來自大阪。

eng: Give me a different example.
You will never be too old to learn.
simp: 你永远不会太老而不能学习。
trad: 你永遠不會太老而不能學習。

eng: He often takes a defiant attitude toward us.
simp: 他常以反抗的态度对我们。
trad: 他常以反抗的態度對我們。

eng: Please help me.
The first subject that attracted my attention was philosophy.
simp: 第一个吸引我注意的科目是哲学。
trad: 第一個吸引我註意的科目是哲學。

eng: My father is too busy to take a walk.
simp: 我父亲太忙而无法去散步。
trad: 我父親太忙而無法去散步。

eng: My father does not eat much fruit.
simp: 我父亲没有吃很多的水果。
trad: 我父親沒有吃很多的水果。

eng: Father makes sure that all the lights are off before he goes to bed.
simp: 父亲确定所有的灯都关了后才去睡觉。
trad: 父親確定所有的燈都關了後才去睡覺。

eng: Father always has the tailor make his suits.
simp: 父亲总是让这位裁缝师为他做西装。
trad: 父親總是讓這位裁縫師為他做西裝。

eng: Father always says, "Do your best."
simp: 父亲总是说"你尽力而为。"
trad: 父親總是說"你盡力而為。"

eng: My father always speaks in a very loud voice.
simp: 我父亲总是说话很大声。
trad: 我父親總是說話很大聲。

eng: My father always said that heaven helps those who help themselves.
simp: 我父亲总是说天助自助者。
trad: 我父親總是說天助自助者。

eng: Father bought me the latest model motorcycle.
simp: 父亲给我买了最新型的摩托车。
trad: 父親給我買了最新型的摩托車。

eng: My father has been to Australia twice.
simp: 我父亲曾经去过澳洲两次。
trad: 我父親曾經去過澳洲兩次。

eng: My father is far from artistic.
simp: 我父亲一点也不懂艺术。
trad: 我父親一點也不懂藝術。

eng: Daddy loves to say funny things.
Father named me after his aunt.
simp: 父亲以他姑姑的名字为我命名。
trad: 父親以他姑姑的名字為我命名。

eng: Father ran short of money and had to borrow some.
simp: 父亲缺钱，所以他必须去借点钱。
trad: 父親缺錢，所以他必須去借點錢。

eng: It has been raining since last Thursday.
simp: 从上週四开始一直下雨。
trad: 從上週四開始一直下雨。

eng: I ran into Mary at a party last week.
simp: 上星期在一次派对中我遇到了玛丽。
trad: 上星期在一次派對中我遇到了瑪麗。

eng: I was very busy last week.
Last week I gained another five pounds.
Up to last week, I hadn't received a reply.
simp: 截至上週，我还没有收到答覆。
trad: 截至上週，我還沒有收到答覆。

eng: I took a day off last week.
The boy got in through the window.
simp: 这个男孩从窗户进去了。
trad: 這個男孩從窗戶進去了。

eng: The boy got his hands dirty.
simp: 这个男孩把他的手弄髒了。
trad: 這個男孩把他的手弄髒了。

eng: I got him to repair my car.
I got him to polish my shoes.
I got him to paint the fence.
simp: 我让他油漆了这个栅栏。
trad: 我讓他油漆了這個柵欄。

eng: I got him to fix my bicycle.
simp: 我让他修理了我的脚踏车。
trad: 我讓他修理了我的腳踏車。

eng: He got his meaning across to me.
simp: 他把他的意思对我讲清楚了。
trad: 他把他的意思對我講清楚了。

eng: I got her to clean my room.
simp: 我让她清扫了我的房间。
trad: 我讓她清掃了我的房間。

eng: I got her to clean my room.
simp: 我让她把我的房间弄乾淨。
trad: 我讓她把我的房間弄乾淨。

eng: She got her daughter a personal computer.
simp: 她给她的女儿买了一台个人电脑。
trad: 她給她的女兒買了一臺個人電腦。

eng: Tom got first prize, didn't he?
simp: 汤姆得了第一名，不是吗?
trad: 湯姆得了第一名，不是嗎?

eng: We got him to carry our bag.
simp: 我们让他帮我们拿袋子。
trad: 我們讓他幫我們拿袋子。

eng: Jim got down from the tree.
He got away disguised as a policeman.
The thief got away with the money.
We got an interesting piece of information.
simp: 我们得到了一份有趣的情报。
trad: 我們得到了一份有趣的情報。

eng: The man got away from the city.
simp: 这名男子逃离了这个城市。
trad: 這名男子逃離了這個城市。

eng: I got acquainted with the chief executive.
simp: 我认识了这位行政长官。
trad: 我認識了這位行政長官。

eng: We got all the materials together.
simp: 我们把所有的材料放在一起。
trad: 我們把所有的材料放在一起。

eng: I got acquainted with her in France.
I got a shave and a haircut.
I got acquainted with him in France.
I got acquainted with him last night.
I got a new pair of shoes.
She got a new CD player yesterday.
simp: 她昨天得到了一个新的CD播放机。
trad: 她昨天得到了一個新的CD播放機。

eng: I got a lot of mosquito bites.
He got a master's degree in law.
simp: 他得到了法律硕士学位。
trad: 他得到了法律碩士學位。

eng: He got a loan from the bank.
I got a letter from her today.
Jim got a job as a waiter.
simp: 吉姆得到了一份服务生的工作。
trad: 吉姆得到了一份服務生的工作。

eng: She found a job as a typist.
simp: 她找到了一份打字员的工作。
trad: 她找到了一份打字員的工作。

eng: We got a good price for that.
simp: 我们得到了一个很好的价格买那个东西。
trad: 我們得到了一個很好的價格買那個東西。

eng: He got a good grade in mathematics.
simp: 他数学得了一个好成绩。
trad: 他數學得了一個好成績。

eng: I got a hole in my jeans.
simp: 我的牛仔裤破了一个洞。
trad: 我的牛仔褲破了一個洞。

eng: I got a farewell present from everyone.
simp: 每个人都送了我一份欢送礼物。
trad: 每個人都送了我一份歡送禮物。

eng: He is good at riding a horse.
She got a beautiful dress on.
simp: 她穿上了一套漂亮的洋装。
trad: 她穿上了一套漂亮的洋裝。

eng: He is good at dealing with children.
I dare say he is right.
It may be that he likes his job.
I dare say he's not a bad boy.
simp: 我敢说他不是个坏男生。
trad: 我敢說他不是個壞男生。

eng: Many workers starved to death.
She is going to Mount Tate.
No man can serve two masters.
I shut the door quietly so as not to wake the baby.
simp: 为了不吵醒宝宝，我静静地关上了门。
trad: 為了不吵醒寶寶，我靜靜地關上了門。

eng: Being unfamiliar with foreign languages, you'll never be able to understand the foreigner's silence.
simp: 没有对外语的认识，你永远无法理解外国人的沉默。
trad: 沒有對外語的認識，你永遠無法理解外國人的沈默。

eng: I sent this drum to my father.
simp: 我送了个长鼓给我父亲。
trad: 我送了個長鼓給我父親。

eng: Has the bell rung?
Press the bell twice.
Helen and Kathy rented an apartment in a suburb of Tokyo.
simp: 海伦和凯蒂在东京郊区租了个套间。
trad: 海倫和凱蒂在東京郊區租了個套間。

eng: He is going to leave tomorrow afternoon.
He is going to run for mayor.
He goes to the office by car.
She is going to Chiba Stadium.
Pat's going to Jim's birthday party.
simp: 帕特将去吉姆的生日派对。
trad: 帕特將去吉姆的生日派對。

eng: She is going to have a baby.
Tom goes to school on foot.
She goes to school on foot.
My brother goes to college in Tokyo.
Jim goes to school by bus.
I had no choice but to accept the offer.
simp: 除了接受报价，我别无选择。
trad: 除了接受報價，我別無選擇。

eng: I accept the offer.
She goes to aerobics once a week.
simp: 她每星期去作一次健美操。
trad: 她每星期去作一次健美操。

eng: I rejected the offer.
Mrs. Smith goes to church by car.
simp: 史密斯太太坐车去教堂。
trad: 史密斯太太坐車去教堂。

eng: I want a dozen cream puffs.
My father goes jogging every morning.
simp: 我父亲每天早上去慢跑。
trad: 我父親每天早上去慢跑。

eng: The girl was afraid to jump down from the roof.
simp: 小女孩害怕从屋顶上跳下来。
trad: 小女孩害怕從屋頂上跳下來。

eng: Even now, many years after the cold war, there is still much bitterness between Germans and Russian, especially in areas which were occupied by the Soviet Union.
simp: 就是冷战几十年后的今天，德国人和俄罗斯人之间还有很多伤痛，尤其是在那些被苏联占领的地区。
trad: 就是冷戰幾十年後的今天，德國人和俄羅斯人之間還有很多傷痛，尤其是在那些被蘇聯占領的地區。

eng: We ran short of money.
He goes by the name of Kenchan.
She goes by the name of Amy.
He came home soon.
Mr Ou has come to Japan to study Japanese.
simp: 欧先生来日本是为了学日语。
trad: 歐先生來日本是為了學日語。

eng: I go to bed after I study.
simp: 我读完书之后就去睡觉。
trad: 我讀完書之後就去睡覺。

eng: When are you coming back? That all depends on the weather.
simp: 你什么时候回来？那就全看天气了。
trad: 你什麼時候回來？那就全看天氣了。

eng: I go to bed late at night.
When will we have arrived?
I'm listening to music.
My foot hurts.
The world is like a book, and those who don't travel read only one page.
simp: 世界就像一本书，不旅游的人只读了一页。
trad: 世界就像一本書，不旅遊的人只讀了一頁。

eng: The police are believed to have arrested the wrong woman.
simp: 警察被认为抓错了一个女人。
trad: 警察被認為抓錯了一個女人。

eng: We're getting a new car next month.
simp: 下个月我们会有辆新车。
trad: 下個月我們會有輛新車。

eng: I didn't get the joke.
In Italy, during summer, it doesn't get dark until about nine o'clock.
simp: 意大利到了夏季，21点前是不会天黑的。
trad: 意大利到了夏季，21點前是不會天黑的。

eng: I'd love to find out why she said so.
simp: 我很想找出她为什么这么说的原因。
trad: 我很想找出她為什麼這麼說的原因。

eng: Rooms should be left vacant by eleven a.m. on the day of departure.
simp: 走的那天，房间11点要空出来。
trad: 走的那天，房間11點要空出來。

eng: There is a television in the room.
The blossoms will be out in a few days.
Come on, Arianna, speed up or we'll never get there!
simp: 来吧，阿里亚娜号，不快点我们就永远到不了那儿!
trad: 來吧，阿裏亞娜號，不快點我們就永遠到不了那兒!

eng: The court adjudged that the will was valid.
simp: 法院判决了那个遗言是有效的。
trad: 法院判決了那個遺言是有效的。

eng: Open your eyes.
Cats love to run after balls of wool.
When I was in elementary school, my mother always fetched me from school.
simp: 我读小学的时候，我母亲常常来接我。
trad: 我讀小學的時候，我母親常常來接我。

eng: She works for a hospital.
My mother used to pick me up every day when I was at primary school.
simp: 我读小学的时候，我母亲每天来接我。
trad: 我讀小學的時候，我母親每天來接我。

eng: Here you can see beautiful colour combinations.
simp: 这里你可以看到漂亮的颜色组合。
trad: 這裏你可以看到漂亮的顏色組合。

eng: The man who I thought was my friend deceived me.
simp: 被我认作朋友的那个男人欺骗了我。
trad: 被我認作朋友的那個男人欺騙了我。

eng: I'll take your suitcase to your room.
simp: 我会把你的手提箱拿到你的房间。
trad: 我會把你的手提箱拿到你的房間。

eng: They go skiing at Nozawa every winter.
simp: 他们每年冬季去野泽滑雪。
trad: 他們每年冬季去野澤滑雪。

eng: A winter sport that many people enjoy is ice skating.
simp: 许多人爱好的一个冬季运动是熘冰。
trad: 許多人愛好的一個冬季運動是溜冰。

eng: Play Chopin for me.
She glanced briefly at the newspaper.
simp: 她很快地瞟了一眼报纸。
trad: 她很快地瞟了一眼報紙。

eng: She glanced shyly at the young man.
simp: 她羞怯地看了一眼那个年轻人。
trad: 她羞怯地看了一眼那個年輕人。

eng: We go fishing once in a while.
We go out together every weekend.
simp: 我们每个週末都一起出去。
trad: 我們每個週末都一起出去。

eng: I am glad to have her company.
I am glad to make your acquaintance.
He is glad to hear the news.
simp: 他很高兴听到这个消息。
trad: 他很高興聽到這個消息。

eng: She is giving the baby a bath.
He held his breath.
That's cheap, isn't it?
Miss Klein gives a test every Friday.
simp: 克莱因老师每个星期五出测验。
trad: 克萊因老師每個星期五出測驗。

eng: That's cheap, isn't it?
He is giving me a hard time.
Coming face to face with a dinosaur was a funny experience.
simp: 和一只恐龙面对面是一段有趣的经历。
trad: 和一只恐龍面對面是一段有趣的經歷。

eng: She is giving a party tonight.
The young girl burst into tears.
simp: 这个年轻的女孩泪流满面。
trad: 這個年輕的女孩淚流滿面。

eng: They give good service at that restaurant.
simp: 那家餐馆提供良好的服务。
trad: 那家餐館提供良好的服務。

eng: He is getting better day by day.
She is getting better day by day.
He is ashamed to ask questions.
simp: 提问对他来说是很羞耻的事。
trad: 提問對他來說是很羞恥的事。

eng: He is getting better bit by bit.
He is getting along with his neighborhood.
She gets up late on Sunday mornings.
simp: 她每週日早上很晚起床。
trad: 她每週日早上很晚起床。

eng: I was having such a good time at the party that I didn't want to come home.
simp: 我在派对玩得太尽兴，以至于不想回家了。
trad: 我在派對玩得太盡興，以至於不想回家了。

eng: He is getting along with his employees.
My mother gets up early every morning.
Old people get up very early.
I'd like to go abroad one day.
Nobody understood why the elephant suddenly turned on its owner.
simp: 没有人明白为什么大象突然攻击了它的主人。
trad: 沒有人明白為什麼大象突然攻擊了它的主人。

eng: She gets good marks in English.
simp: 她取得了优异的英语成绩。
trad: 她取得了優異的英語成績。

eng: The phone company cut me off last month.
simp: 电话公司上个月切了我的线。
trad: 電話公司上個月切了我的線。

eng: I get two hour's exercise every day.
simp: 我每天做两个小时的练习。
trad: 我每天做兩個小時的練習。

eng: I worked in a post office during the summer vacation.
simp: 暑假期间，我在邮局工作。
trad: 暑假期間，我在郵局工作。

eng: I get two hour's exercise every day.
simp: 我每天做两个小时的运动。
trad: 我每天做兩個小時的運動。

eng: You ought not to have disclosed the secret.
You get up early, don't you?
We get together once a year.
We get the materials from Malaysia.
simp: 我们从马来西亚得到材料。
trad: 我們從馬來西亞得到材料。

eng: I get a kick out of life.
We generally drink tea after a meal.
I get depressed by the slightest things.
I get scared just walking past him.
simp: 只是从他旁边走过去我就觉得害怕。
trad: 只是從他旁邊走過去我就覺得害怕。

eng: I gazed at the sea for hours.
They gave us very little trouble.
simp: 他们几乎不给我们添麻烦。
trad: 他們幾乎不給我們添麻煩。

eng: She gave us some useful information.
simp: 她给了我们一些有用的讯息。
trad: 她給了我們一些有用的訊息。

eng: We gazed at the beautiful scenery.
simp: 我们望着这美丽的风景。
trad: 我們望著這美麗的風景。

eng: The soldier gave water to me.
She gave us lots to eat.
simp: 她给了我们很多吃的东西。
trad: 她給了我們很多吃的東西。

eng: She gave us a vague answer.
simp: 她给了我们一个模煳的答桉。
trad: 她給了我們一個模糊的答案。

eng: You will have heard this story before.
simp: 您以前应该听过这个故事。
trad: 您以前應該聽過這個故事。

eng: I found the new magazine very interesting.
simp: 我发现这本新杂志非常有趣。
trad: 我發現這本新雜誌非常有趣。

eng: You will have heard this story before.
simp: 你以前应该听过这个故事。
trad: 你以前應該聽過這個故事。

eng: I found your letter in the mailbox.
simp: 我在信箱中发现了你的信件。
trad: 我在信箱中發現了你的信件。

eng: If she should come late, give her this message.
simp: 万一她回来得太晚，把这个口信带给她。
trad: 萬一她回來得太晚，把這個口信帶給她。

eng: I'll come and see you one of these days.
simp: 这些天我会抽一天来看你的。
trad: 這些天我會抽一天來看你的。

eng: I found the key underneath the mat.
simp: 我在擦鞋垫下面发现了这把钥匙。
trad: 我在擦鞋墊下面發現了這把鑰匙。

eng: I will provide you all the necessary information.
simp: 我会把所有有用的信息提供给您的。
trad: 我會把所有有用的信息提供給您的。

eng: We found the front door locked.
simp: 我们发现前门被锁上了。
trad: 我們發現前門被鎖上了。

eng: I will provide you all the necessary information.
simp: 我会把所有有用的信息给你的。
trad: 我會把所有有用的信息給你的。

eng: I found something interesting in the town.
simp: 我发现了镇上一些有趣的事。
trad: 我發現了鎮上一些有趣的事。

eng: Dare you ask him about the accident?
simp: 你敢问他有关事故的问题吗？
trad: 你敢問他有關事故的問題嗎？

eng: She gave up everything for her children.
simp: 为了孩子们她放弃了一切。
trad: 為了孩子們她放棄了一切。

eng: I gave up smoking for a year.
He had every reason for doing so.
simp: 他有充分的理由这样做。
trad: 他有充分的理由這樣做。

eng: Nobody had ever heard of it.
simp: 以前从来没有人听说过。
trad: 以前從來沒有人聽說過。

eng: Somebody had drowned her in the bathtub.
simp: 有人把她淹死在浴缸裡。
trad: 有人把她淹死在浴缸裡。

eng: I had difficulty in solving this problem.
simp: 我在解决这个问题上有困难。
trad: 我在解決這個問題上有困難。

eng: I had difficulty in solving this problem.
He gave the same answer as before.
simp: 他给了跟以前一样的回答。
trad: 他給了跟以前一樣的回答。

eng: I gave up all hope of survival.
simp: 我放弃了所有生存的希望。
trad: 我放棄了所有生存的希望。

eng: I like to travel by train.
She gave the children two apples each.
simp: 她给孩子们每人两个苹果。
trad: 她給孩子們每人兩個蘋果。

eng: You should be able to judge when you've had too much to drink.
simp: 你应该自己判断什么时候喝了太多酒。
trad: 你應該自己判斷什麼時候喝了太多酒。

eng: She gave the door a gentle push.
I gave them clothing and some food.
simp: 我给了他们衣服和一些食物。
trad: 我給了他們衣服和一些食物。

eng: A man of sense would be ashamed to do so.
simp: 聪明人会羞于干这种事。
trad: 聰明人會羞於幹這種事。

eng: The old man gave the child shelter.
simp: 这位老人收容了这个孩子。
trad: 這位老人收容了這個孩子。

eng: She was ashamed of herself for her carelessness.
simp: 她为自己的粗心感到羞耻。
trad: 她為自己的粗心感到羞恥。

eng: She is ashamed of what she's done.
simp: 她为自己所做的事感到羞耻。
trad: 她為自己所做的事感到羞恥。

eng: She gave the blouse a quick wash.
simp: 她很快地把衬衫洗一洗。
trad: 她很快地把襯衫洗一洗。

eng: She was ashamed of her children's behavior.
simp: 她为自己孩子的行为感到羞耻。
trad: 她為自己孩子的行為感到羞恥。

eng: She gave out a sigh of relief.
We gave the car a push.
Nothing is lost for asking.
simp: 问一下不会有什么损失。
trad: 問一下不會有什麼損失。

eng: We gave our mother a watch.
simp: 我们给了母亲一支手錶。
trad: 我們給了母親一支手錶。

eng: She gave me this compact disc.
He is proficient in Farsi.
Chaplin was visionary.
simp: 卓别林是有预见力的人。
trad: 卓別林是有預見力的人。

eng: I hope to graduate at the exams.
The Foreign Minister was a puppet.
simp: 外交部长是个没主见的人。
trad: 外交部長是個沒主見的人。

eng: The employment policy is a failure.
Foreign investors withdrew their money from America.
simp: 外国投资者从美国收回他们的钱。
trad: 外國投資者從美國收回他們的錢。

eng: As more paper money came into use, the value fell.
simp: 当更多的纸币投入使用，价格就下跌了。
trad: 當更多的紙幣投入使用，價格就下跌了。

eng: The Colombian government demanded more money.
simp: 哥伦比亚政府要了更多的钱。
trad: 哥倫比亞政府要了更多的錢。

eng: The cargo ship arrived four hours early.
That's my final answer.
He gave me whatever help I needed.
simp: 他给了我任何我需要的帮助。
trad: 他給了我任何我需要的幫助。

eng: I must say, his behaviour is exemplary.
simp: 我该说，他的行为是典范。
trad: 我該說，他的行為是典範。

eng: She gave me whatever help I needed.
simp: 她给了我任何我需要的帮助。
trad: 她給了我任何我需要的幫助。

eng: She gave me these old coins.
My uncle gave me the watch.
You gave me the wrong change.
She gave me some practical advice.
simp: 她给了我一些实用的建议。
trad: 她給了我一些實用的建議。

eng: She gave me some good advice.
simp: 她给了我一些很好的建议。
trad: 她給了我一些很好的建議。

eng: The board unanimously decided to appoint her as CEO.
simp: 董事会一致决定任命她为执行总裁。
trad: 董事會一致決定任命她為執行總裁。

eng: The election was unanimous.
He gave me authority to fire them.
simp: 他授权给我解僱了他们。
trad: 他授權給我解僱了他們。

eng: He gave me his stamp of approval.
There is no Nobel Prize in mathematics.
You gave me only fifty cents.
He won the Nobel Prize for Literature.
simp: 他获得了诺贝尔文学奖。
trad: 他獲得了諾貝爾文學獎。

eng: She gave me plenty to eat.
simp: 她给了我很多吃的东西。
trad: 她給了我很多吃的東西。

eng: The expansion of the building's west end is being studied.
simp: 西面大楼的扩建在研究中。
trad: 西面大樓的擴建在研究中。

eng: He has enormous potential.
She gave me a strange look.
She gave me access to her records.
simp: 她允许了我对她的访问纪录。
trad: 她允許了我對她的訪問紀錄。

eng: My aunt gave me an album.
simp: 我姑姑给了我一张唱片专辑。
trad: 我姑姑給了我一張唱片專輯。

eng: My aunt gave me an album.
simp: 我姑姑给了我一本相簿。
trad: 我姑姑給了我一本相簿。

eng: My aunt gave me an album.
simp: 我姑姑给了我一本集邮册。
trad: 我姑姑給了我一本集郵冊。

eng: Miss March gave me an English dictionary.
simp: 三月小姐给了我一本英语词典。
trad: 三月小姐給了我一本英語詞典。

eng: Mary gave me an American doll.
simp: 玛丽给了我一个美国娃娃。
trad: 瑪麗給了我一個美國娃娃。

eng: She gave me a smile of recognition.
simp: 她给了我一个认可的微笑。
trad: 她給了我一個認可的微笑。

eng: This company is listed on the Paris stock exchange.
simp: 这家公司在巴黎证券交易所上市了。
trad: 這家公司在巴黎證券交易所上市了。

eng: He gave me a smile of recognition.
simp: 他给了我一个认可的微笑。
trad: 他給了我一個認可的微笑。

eng: She gave me a shy smile.
simp: 她给了我一个腼腆的笑容。
trad: 她給了我一個靦腆的笑容。

eng: She gave me a meaningful look.
simp: 她意味深长地看了我一眼。
trad: 她意味深長地看了我一眼。

eng: My brother gave me a cute doll.
simp: 我哥哥给了我一个可爱的娃娃。
trad: 我哥哥給了我一個可愛的娃娃。

eng: He gave me a lecture on drinking.
My uncle gave me a book.
simp: 我的叔叔给了我一本书。
trad: 我的叔叔給了我一本書。

eng: My aunt gave me a camera.
simp: 我的阿姨给了我一台摄影机。
trad: 我的阿姨給了我一臺攝影機。

eng: I gave it to the little boy.
The teacher gave John a prize.
simp: 老师给了约翰一个奖品。
trad: 老師給了約翰一個獎品。

eng: He went to London in 1970.
This company and I have signed a contract of three years.
simp: 我和这家公司签了三年合同。
trad: 我和這家公司簽了三年合同。

eng: We have reached a partnership agreement.
From what school did you graduate?
simp: 您是从哪个学校毕业的？
trad: 您是從哪個學校畢業的？

eng: She gave it her personal attention.
The doctor gave it to her.
He gave it to me for nothing.
They gave in to my opinion.
simp: 他们屈服于我的看法了。
trad: 他們屈服於我的看法了。

eng: She gave in to the temptation.
We found that everyone was asleep.
simp: 我们发现每个人都睡着了。
trad: 我們發現每個人都睡著了。

eng: We found the beds quite comfortable.
simp: 我们发现这些床很舒服。
trad: 我們發現這些床很舒服。

eng: We found the boy fast asleep.
simp: 我们发现这个男孩睡得很沉。
trad: 我們發現這個男孩睡得很沈。

eng: I found the field trip very educational.
simp: 我发现实地考察很有教育意义。
trad: 我發現實地考察很有教育意義。

eng: According to custom, the bride should be compliant.
simp: 根据习俗，新娘应该循规蹈矩。
trad: 根據習俗，新娘應該循規蹈矩。

eng: I found the comic book very interesting.
simp: 我发现这本漫画书非常有趣。
trad: 我發現這本漫畫書非常有趣。

eng: We found the footprints in the sand.
simp: 我们发现了沙滩上的脚印。
trad: 我們發現了沙灘上的腳印。

eng: He gave his children a good education.
simp: 他给了他的孩子们良好的教育。
trad: 他給了他的孩子們良好的教育。

eng: He gave his life for his country.
simp: 他把他的一生献给了他的国家。
trad: 他把他的一生獻給了他的國家。

eng: She gave him a tender kiss.
simp: 她给了他一个温柔的吻。
trad: 她給了他一個溫柔的吻。

eng: They gave him up for lost.
I'm open to suggestions.
If you make a mess, clean it up.
simp: 如果你弄乱了，你来打扫。
trad: 如果你弄亂了，你來打掃。

eng: There is no knowing what he will do next.
simp: 没有人知道他接下来会干什么。
trad: 沒有人知道他接下來會幹什麼。

eng: We gave him up for dead.
He gave her a piece of advice.
I gave her a lift to town.
He gave her a piece of paper.
She gave birth to twin girls.
I gave careful consideration to the problem.
simp: 我仔细地考虑了这个问题。
trad: 我仔細地考慮了這個問題。

eng: She knows how to do the crawl.
I like to play golf.
Leaves fall in the autumn.
It is a pity you cannot come.
He knows a lot about foreign affairs.
No, I don't think so.
She gave birth to a daughter yesterday.
He gave correct answers to the questions.
simp: 他对这个问题给了正确的答桉。
trad: 他對這個問題給了正確的答案。

eng: We gave blood to help the child.
simp: 我们捐血来帮助这个孩子。
trad: 我們捐血來幫助這個孩子。

eng: She gave away all her dresses.
simp: 她把她所有的洋装都送人。
trad: 她把她所有的洋裝都送人。

eng: This point deserves special emphasis.
I like the way you smile.
My mother is beautiful.
U.S. companies are working to find a niche in the Japanese economy.
simp: 美国公司正在日本经济中努力寻找利基点。
trad: 美國公司正在日本經濟中努力尋找利基點。

eng: Will you marry me?
I know who my enemy is.
But Tatoeba Project is not a word heaven. Please stop adding words.
simp: 但是Tatoeba专桉不是文字天堂，请不要在加文字了。
trad: 但是Tatoeba專案不是文字天堂，請不要在加文字了。

eng: He adhered to the original plan.
We go to the South of France for a change of air.

I ate curry yesterday.
What he likes is jelly.
Please write down your name.
