This is the lady who wants to see you.
simp: 这位就是谁想见你的夫人。
trad: 這位就是誰想見你的夫人。

eng: Her idea is better than yours.
Mark is so honest that everyone praises him for it.
simp: 马克是如此的诚实所以每个人都称讚他。
trad: 馬克是如此的誠實所以每個人都稱讚他。

eng: Mark is so honest that everybody commends him for it.
simp: 马克是如此的诚实所以每个人都讚扬他。
trad: 馬克是如此的誠實所以每個人都讚揚他。

eng: I can't undo it.
We must respect other people's privacy.
simp: 我们必须尊重别人的私隐。
trad: 我們必須尊重別人的私隱。

eng: Give some meat to the dog.
He gives some meat to the dog.
Does one of you want to come here and redo what I just did?
simp: 是不是你们其中一个人要来这裡重做我才刚做过的？
trad: 是不是你們其中一個人要來這裡重做我才剛做過的？

eng: She is pleased at her success.
simp: 她为她的成功感到高兴。
trad: 她為她的成功感到高興。

eng: In all of the gardens in my city it is illegal to trample the flower beds.
simp: 在我的城市的所有花园裡，践踏花坛是违法的。
trad: 在我的城市的所有花園裡，踐踏花壇是違法的。

eng: I'm all ears.
Women eat lighter meals when they're eating with a guy.
simp: 当女性跟一个男人吃饭时，女性会吃得比较少。
trad: 當女性跟一個男人吃飯時，女性會吃得比較少。

eng: One out of 455 women doesn't realize she's pregnant until the twentieth week of pregnancy.
simp: 455名妇女中会有一名直到怀孕第二十週前没有意识到自己怀孕。
trad: 455名婦女中會有一名直到懷孕第二十週前沒有意識到自己懷孕。

eng: Blondes earn 7% more than women with any other hair color.
simp: 金髮女郎比其他颜色头髮的女人多赚7％。
trad: 金髮女郎比其他顏色頭髮的女人多賺7％。

eng: Grease the waffle maker.
I work for you.
Let's go out and eat dinner together from time to time.
simp: 让我们偶尔出去一起吃晚餐。
trad: 讓我們偶爾出去一起吃晚餐。

eng: I've been in China for less than a month.
simp: 我曾经在中国不到一个月。
trad: 我曾經在中國不到一個月。

eng: When using this information, I will follow any conditions you specify, whether that's anonymity or giving detailed reference.
simp: 在使用这份问卷的信息时，我会遵照您提出的条件，不留您的姓名或者关于您的任何详细信息。
trad: 在使用這份問卷的信息時，我會遵照您提出的條件，不留您的姓名或者關於您的任何詳細信息。

eng: One of the great mysteries of life is how a cat decides what to do next.
simp: 生活的伟大奥秘其中之一是猫如何决定下一步要做什麽。
trad: 生活的偉大奧秘其中之一是貓如何決定下一步要做什麼。

eng: I hate ticks!
A beard does not make a philosopher.
simp: 光有鬍鬚不能造就一位哲学家。
trad: 光有鬍鬚不能造就一位哲學家。

eng: I have a spare today.
It is not enough to do good; one must also do it well.
simp: 做好事是不够的，还必须做得很好。
trad: 做好事是不夠的，還必須做得很好。

eng: The reason the Northern and Southern Dynasties had failed in their rule was that they allowed literary splendor to surpass real substance.
simp: 南北朝在他们的统治之下失败了的原因是他们让文学的光辉超越了实质内容。
trad: 南北朝在他們的統治之下失敗了的原因是他們讓文學的光輝超越了實質內容。

eng: Literary composition is a great achievement that concerns the ruling of a state, a splendid affair of eternal standing.
simp: 文学作品是关係到一个国家统治的伟大成就，以及永恆地位的辉煌事迹。
trad: 文學作品是關係到一個國家統治的偉大成就，以及永恆地位的輝煌事跡。

eng: I'm disappointed that I wasn't able to go with her.
simp: 我很失望我没能和她一起去。
trad: 我很失望我沒能和她一起去。

eng: I regret that I couldn't go with her.
simp: 我很遗憾我不能和她一起去。
trad: 我很遺憾我不能和她一起去。

eng: Why are you crying?
Other peoples' expectations affect how we behave.
simp: 其他人的期望会影响我们的行为。
trad: 其他人的期望會影響我們的行為。

eng: I don't like teachers who like students who don't like asking questions.
simp: 我不喜欢喜欢不问问题的学生的老师。
trad: 我不喜歡喜歡不問問題的學生的老師。

eng: We played tennis yesterday.
The mind should be a good servant, but the heart should be the master.
simp: 心灵应该当一个好僕人，但心应该是主人。
trad: 心靈應該當一個好僕人，但心應該是主人。

eng: He gave me a good piece of advice.
Other people can think what they want, as long as they think like I do.
simp: 别人可以随便怎么想，只要他们的想法与我的相同。
trad: 別人可以隨便怎麼想，只要他們的想法與我的相同。

eng: What's this?
She is not as young as she looks.
simp: 她没她看上去那么年轻。
trad: 她沒她看上去那麼年輕。

eng: In places where it snows a lot, kerosene is an indispensable item.
simp: 在下雪很多的地方，煤油是不可或缺的东西。
trad: 在下雪很多的地方，煤油是不可或缺的東西。

eng: That is a criminal offense, and you will surely be punished!
simp: 那是犯罪行为，你肯定会受到惩罚的!
trad: 那是犯罪行為，你肯定會受到懲罰的!

eng: You'd better go to bed at once.
I want to do spring cleaning.
simp: 春天，我想要彻底打扫房子。
trad: 春天，我想要徹底打掃房子。

eng: It has been ten years since he died.
The missing cat has not been found yet.
Of course he's innocent.
Where does she live now?
I'm proud of my son.
Broad safety measures were put into effect.
simp: 广泛的安全措施实施了。
trad: 廣泛的安全措施實施了。

eng: The Pope has no right to marry.
This suit seems really expensive.
Keep in mind that you must die.
Something wrong?
I remember last summer's adventure.
simp: 我记得去年夏天的历险。
trad: 我記得去年夏天的歷險。

eng: The minimum wage in Okinawa is 642 yen per hour.
simp: 冲绳的最低时薪是每小时642日元。
trad: 沖繩的最低時薪是每小時642日元。

eng: The tsunami alert was cancelled.
I did not lose my mind, I sold it on eBay.
simp: 我没有失去理智，我在eBay上把它卖了。
trad: 我沒有失去理智，我在eBay上把它賣了。

eng: The Seine flows through Paris.
Everyone is anxious to know what has become of the former champion.
simp: 大家都渴望知道前冠军得主发生了什么。
trad: 大家都渴望知道前冠軍得主發生了什麼。

eng: Who was the letter written to?
She's neither rich nor famous.
The government clearly stated its intention to lower taxes.
simp: 政府明确宣布了降税的意图。
trad: 政府明確宣布了降稅的意圖。

eng: A fallen tree blocked the road.
simp: 一棵倒下的树挡住了路。
trad: 一棵倒下的樹擋住了路。

eng: With you it's summer all year round.
simp: 和你在一起，全年都是夏天。
trad: 和你在一起，全年都是夏天。

eng: Once in a while, we should take a step back and think.
simp: 有时候，我们应该后退一步想一想。
trad: 有時候，我們應該後退一步想一想。

eng: Waste not a single grain of rice!
The dog was sleeping on the mat.
George was broken-hearted.
This is difficult to believe.
He would often come to see us when I was a child.
simp: 当我还是个孩子时，他经常来看望我们。
trad: 當我還是個孩子時，他經常來看望我們。

eng: It appears that she had a nice time at the party.
simp: 看来她似乎在派对上玩得很开心。
trad: 看來她似乎在派對上玩得很開心。

eng: This was the most interesting book that she had ever read.
simp: 这是她读过最有趣的书。
trad: 這是她讀過最有趣的書。

eng: The Tigers lost the game, which was a surprise to us.
simp: 我们觉得很惊讶老虎队竟然输掉了比赛。
trad: 我們覺得很驚訝老虎隊竟然輸掉了比賽。

eng: They tried very hard to gain an advantage over one another.
simp: 他们很努力地超过对方获得优势。
trad: 他們很努力地超過對方獲得優勢。

eng: The third quarter GNP growth was 1% over the preceding quarter.
simp: 第三季国民生产总值较上一季成长了1％。
trad: 第三季國民生產總值較上一季成長了1％。

eng: Ever since she fell in the kitchen, she hasn't been all there.
simp: 自从她在厨房裡摔倒后，她不曾再到那裡。
trad: 自從她在廚房裡摔倒後，她不曾再到那裡。

eng: There was only one warden on duty when the riot started.
simp: 暴动开始时只有一位监狱长值班。
trad: 暴動開始時只有一位監獄長值班。

eng: The students were for the most part from the West Coast.
simp: 大部分的学生来自西海岸。
trad: 大部分的學生來自西海岸。

eng: There used to be a lot of frogs in this pond.
simp: 以前在这个池塘裡有许多青蛙。
trad: 以前在這個池塘裡有許多青蛙。

eng: He said he did not know the man, which was a lie.
simp: 他说他不认识那个男人，这是一个谎言。
trad: 他說他不認識那個男人，這是一個謊言。

eng: The poor people were at the mercy of the cruel dictator.
simp: 可怜的人民任凭残暴的独裁者处置。
trad: 可憐的人民任憑殘暴的獨裁者處置。

eng: His intelligence and experience enabled him to deal with the trouble.
simp: 他的智慧和经验使他能处理这个麻烦。
trad: 他的智慧和經驗使他能處理這個麻煩。

eng: The old church on the hill dates back to the twelfth century.
simp: 山上的老教堂的历史可以追溯到12世纪。
trad: 山上的老教堂的歷史可以追溯到12世紀。

eng: None of us thought he was to blame for the accident.
simp: 我们都不认为他是事故的罪魁祸首。
trad: 我們都不認為他是事故的罪魁禍首。

eng: Evan is just a little boy. How should he know what to do?
simp: 埃文只是一个小男孩。他怎麽知道该怎麽办？
trad: 埃文只是一個小男孩。他怎麼知道該怎麼辦？

eng: I'm glad that they fixed the heating system, but now it's too hot.
simp: 我很高兴他们修复了暖气系统，但现在太热了。
trad: 我很高興他們修復了暖氣系統，但現在太熱了。

eng: You should not have lent the money to such a person.
simp: 你不应该借钱给这样的人。
trad: 你不應該借錢給這樣的人。

eng: The Prime Minister's speech was calculated to anger the opposition parties.
simp: 总理的发言估计激怒了在野党。
trad: 總理的發言估計激怒了在野黨。

eng: He was an excellent scientist, and what is more, was a great poet.
simp: 他是一位优秀的科学家，更是一位伟大的诗人。
trad: 他是一位優秀的科學家，更是一位偉大的詩人。

eng: Mrs. Bruce was the first female pilot to fly between England and Japan.
simp: 布鲁斯夫人是英国和日本之间航线的第一位女性飞行员。
trad: 布魯斯夫人是英國和日本之間航線的第一位女性飛行員。

eng: She's popular, not because she's beautiful, but because she's kind to everyone.
simp: 她受欢迎不是因为她的美丽，而是因为她亲切地对待每个人。
trad: 她受歡迎不是因為她的美麗，而是因為她親切地對待每個人。

eng: He and his wife tried to work out their problems, but couldn't.
simp: 他和他的妻子试图解决他们的问题，但没有办法。
trad: 他和他的妻子試圖解決他們的問題，但沒有辦法。

eng: There's a lot of trash on the far bank of the river.
I'm a stranger here myself. I'm afraid I can't help you.
simp: 我对这裡不熟。恐怕我不能帮你。
trad: 我對這裡不熟。恐怕我不能幫你。

eng: She went over the list to see if her name was there.
simp: 她走过去看看她的名字是否在清单上。
trad: 她走過去看看她的名字是否在清單上。

eng: What do you make of his attitude towards us these days?
simp: 你做了什麽让他这些日子用这种态度对待我们？
trad: 你做了什麼讓他這些日子用這種態度對待我們？

eng: He always left the problem of his children's education to his wife.
simp: 他总是把孩子的教育问题留给他的妻子。
trad: 他總是把孩子的教育問題留給他的妻子。

eng: A barber is a man who shaves and cuts men's hair.
simp: 理髮师是为男人刮鬍子和剪头髮的人。
trad: 理髮師是為男人刮鬍子和剪頭髮的人。

eng: A beautiful woman was seated one row in front of me.
simp: 一个美丽的女人坐在我前面一排。
trad: 一個美麗的女人坐在我前面一排。

eng: A bicycle will rust if you leave it in the rain.
simp: 如果你把自行车留在雨中，它会生鏽的。
trad: 如果你把自行車留在雨中，它會生鏽的。

eng: A bookstore in that location wouldn't make enough money to survive.
simp: 那个地点的书店无法赚足够的钱生存下去。
trad: 那個地點的書店無法賺足夠的錢生存下去。

eng: A boy of seventeen is often as tall as his father.
simp: 十七岁的男孩常常长得和他父亲一样高。
trad: 十七歲的男孩常常長得和他父親一樣高。

eng: A capital letter is used at the beginning of a sentence.
simp: 一个句子以一个大写字母开始。
trad: 一個句子以一個大寫字母開始。

eng: A capital letter is used at the beginning of a sentence.
simp: 一个大写字母被使用在一个句子的开头。
trad: 一個大寫字母被使用在一個句子的開頭。

eng: According to my calculation, she should be in India by now.
simp: 根据我的估计，她现在应该在印度了。
trad: 根據我的估計，她現在應該在印度了。

eng: According to newspaper reports, there was an airplane accident last evening.
simp: 根据报载，有一架飞机昨天晚上发生了意外。
trad: 根據報載，有一架飛機昨天晚上發生了意外。

eng: According to the guidebook, this is the best restaurant around here.
simp: 根据指南，这是这附近最好的餐馆。
trad: 根據指南，這是這附近最好的餐館。

eng: According to the newspaper, there was a big fire last night.
simp: 根据报导，昨晚有一场很大的火灾。
trad: 根據報導，昨晚有一場很大的火災。

eng: A change of air will do you a lot of good.
simp: 改变环境将对你有很多好处。
trad: 改變環境將對你有很多好處。

eng: A considerable amount of time and effort have been spent already.
simp: 已经花费了很多的时间和精力。
trad: 已經花費了很多的時間和精力。

eng: A couch potato is something that I don't want to be.
simp: 我不想成为整天泡在沙发上看电视的人。
trad: 我不想成為整天泡在沙發上看電視的人。

eng: A couple of flights were delayed on account of the earthquake.
simp: 一些航班由于地震被延误了。
trad: 一些航班由於地震被延誤了。

eng: A few days after his thirteenth birthday, Tony left school, too.
simp: 在他13岁生日后几天，汤尼也离开了学校。
trad: 在他13歲生日後幾天，湯尼也離開了學校。

eng: A few years ago, our room had little furniture in it.
simp: 几年前，我们的房间裡没有什麽家具。
trad: 幾年前，我們的房間裡沒有什麼家具。

eng: A fire broke out at the inn where they were staying.
simp: 火警发生在他们住的旅馆。
trad: 火警發生在他們住的旅館。

eng: A foreign language cannot be mastered in a year or so.
simp: 一个外国语言无法在一年左右就被掌握。
trad: 一個外國語言無法在一年左右就被掌握。

eng: Afraid of hurting his feelings, I didn't tell him the truth.
simp: 怕伤害了他的感情，我没有告诉他真相。
trad: 怕傷害了他的感情，我沒有告訴他真相。

eng: A friend of mine asked me to send her a postcard.
simp: 我的一位朋友要求我寄给她一张明信片。
trad: 我的一位朋友要求我寄給她一張明信片。

eng: A friend of mine came to see me during the day.
simp: 我的一个朋友在白天的时候来看我。
trad: 我的一個朋友在白天的時候來看我。

eng: After a couple of drinks, the guy was feeling no pain.
simp: 喝了几杯酒后，这个傢伙就感觉不痛了。
trad: 喝了幾杯酒後，這個傢夥就感覺不痛了。

eng: After a long argument, I finally persuaded her to go camping.
simp: 经过长久的争论，我终于说服了她去露营。
trad: 經過長久的爭論，我終於說服了她去露營。

eng: After climbing Mt. Fuji, I got the inspiration for a poem.
simp: 攀登富士山后，我得到了一首诗的灵感。
trad: 攀登富士山後，我得到了一首詩的靈感。

eng: After I cleaned the window, I could see through it clearly.
simp: 清洁窗户后，我能很清楚的从窗户看出去。
trad: 清潔窗戶後，我能很清楚的從窗戶看出去。

eng: After I talked with my teacher, I decided to work hard.
simp: 跟我的老师谈过后，我决定认真努力。
trad: 跟我的老師談過後，我決定認真努力。

eng: After reading his books I feel I can construct a house.
simp: 读完他的书后，我觉得我可以构建一栋房子。
trad: 讀完他的書後，我覺得我可以構建一棟房子。

eng: After running up the hill, I was completely out of breath.
simp: 跑上山后，我完全喘不过气来。
trad: 跑上山後，我完全喘不過氣來。

eng: After she had lunch, she got ready to go out.
simp: 吃过午饭后，她准备好要出门了。
trad: 吃過午飯後，她準備好要出門了。

eng: After she had read the letter, she tore it to pieces.
simp: 看了信之后，她把它撕成碎片。
trad: 看了信之後，她把它撕成碎片。

eng: After walking for an hour, we stopped to take a rest.
simp: 走了一个小时后，我们停下来休息。
trad: 走了一個小時後，我們停下來休息。

eng: After winning the Nobel prize, she remained as modest as ever.
simp: 获得诺贝尔奖后，她仍谦虚如昔。
trad: 獲得諾貝爾獎後，她仍謙虛如昔。

eng: After you have read it, give the book back to me.
simp: 在你读完后，把书还给我。
trad: 在你讀完後，把書還給我。

eng: A good many people have told me to take a holiday.
simp: 很多人都跟我说要我休假。
trad: 很多人都跟我說要我休假。

eng: A group of young men are playing handball in the playground.
simp: 一群年轻人在操场上打手球。
trad: 一群年輕人在操場上打手球。

eng: Alan Tate and I looked at one another for a while.
simp: Alan Tate和我看了彼此一会儿。
trad: Alan Tate和我看了彼此一會兒。

eng: Alice might have been there yesterday, but we didn't see her.
simp: 爱丽丝昨天可能已经来过这裡，但我们并没有看到她。
trad: 愛麗絲昨天可能已經來過這裡，但我們並沒有看到她。

eng: A little bit of luck sometimes leads to an unexpected success.
simp: 一点点的运气有时会导致意想不到的成功。

trad: 你有任何其他的問題嗎？

eng: She married Tom last month.
Debbie, is your school near here?
simp: 黛比，你的学校在这附近吗？
trad: 黛比，你的學校在這附近嗎？

eng: This coat fits you perfectly.
You should eat more vegetables.
Do you have a driver's license?
She gave me several books.
He doesn't like traveling by air.
She finished reading the letter.
Taro, could you help me?
This makes me very angry.
Which way is Central Park?
Will he be here soon?
He failed to follow our advice.
simp: 他没有遵循我们的忠告。
trad: 他沒有遵循我們的忠告。

eng: Please close the door quietly.
Yumi will become a teacher.
Can't you stay a little longer?
There's a soccer match tomorrow.
The shooting started around noon.
simp: 拍摄是在中午十二时左右开始。
trad: 拍攝是在中午十二時左右開始。

eng: The shooting started around noon.
simp: 枪击是在中午十二时左右开始的。
trad: 槍擊是在中午十二時左右開始的。

eng: Everyone in his family is tall.
Bob can drive a car, too.
Have you seen my glasses anywhere?
simp: 你曾在哪裡看到过我的眼镜吗？
trad: 你曾在哪裡看到過我的眼鏡嗎？

eng: We ran down the hill.
You should emphasize that fact.
He has just become a principal.
Change trains at the next station.
Are you finished with your work?
Has she finished the book yet?
You should have worked harder.
Could you call me tonight, please?
simp: 今晚你能打电话给我吗？
trad: 今晚你能打電話給我嗎？

eng: Could you show me this bag?
simp: 你能给我看看这个包吗？
trad: 你能給我看看這個包嗎？

eng: She spent all afternoon cooking.
The air conditioner doesn't work.
Do what you think is right.
Wash your hands before eating.
There's no need to hurry.
You don't have to eat it.
You shouldn't have gone there.
Don't put books on the table.
simp: 不要把书放在那张桌子上。
trad: 不要把書放在那張桌子上。

eng: That pasture is ten acres.
The red dress suited her.
simp: 这件红色的洋装适合她。
trad: 這件紅色的洋裝適合她。

eng: She looked after the children.
Aoi is a very good dancer.
simp: 葵是一个非常好的舞者。
trad: 葵是一個非常好的舞者。

eng: This isn't what I ordered.
You should see a doctor.
Could you please drive me home?
Ow！It hurts so much, I'm itchy all over.
simp: 哎呦好难受啊，全身发痒！
trad: 哎呦好難受啊，全身發癢！

eng: Please take off your shoes.
Swimming is easy for me.
Don't blame the mistake on her.
simp: 不要把这个错误归咎于她。
trad: 不要把這個錯誤歸咎於她。

eng: Who painted this beautiful picture?
simp: 谁画了这幅美丽的图画？
trad: 誰畫了這幅美麗的圖畫？

eng: Have you ever been to France?
He did not eat anything yesterday.
simp: 他昨天没有吃任何东西。
trad: 他昨天沒有吃任何東西。

eng: Could you send me a brochure?
Did you leave the window open?
Have you read this book yet?
Tom is growing a mustache.
Don't do anything like that again.
simp: 不要再做那样的事情了。
trad: 不要再做那樣的事情了。

eng: Why did you come here?
Do you believe what he said?
He calls her up every night.
simp: 他每天晚上打电话给她。
trad: 他每天晚上打電話給她。

eng: She plays tennis every Sunday.
He comes here every three days.
The conference ended at five.
Give me a light, would you?
You shouldn't have done it.
We heard him come downstairs.
simp: 我们听见了他下楼的声音。
trad: 我們聽見了他下樓的聲音。

eng: He arrived after the bell rang.
Have you heard about the accident?
She speaks English very fluently.
Tom kept talking all night.
Tell me what you want.
Stay out of the rain.
Stay out of the rain.
Seiko accepted his dinner invitation.
Can she endure a long trip?
Did you watch TV last night?
You may go home now.
Bobby may watch TV until 7:00.
simp: 鲍比直到七点钟前可以看电视。
trad: 鮑比直到七點鐘前可以看電視。

eng: The meeting lasted until 5.
Do you understand what I'm saying?
Turn the flame down low.
The man robbed her bag.
simp: 这名男子抢走了她的包包。
trad: 這名男子搶走了她的包包。

eng: Do you know what I mean?
Who told you the news?
You're very brave, aren't you?
You are in my way.
Today is my sister's birthday.
This message doesn't make sense.
Stand back from the rope.
A truck ran over our dog.
She studies English every day.
Are you brushing your teeth properly?
He does well in physics.
I'm feeling blue today.
She woke up in the early morning.
I'll wait till four o'clock.
Fever flushed his cheeks.
simp: 他因为发烧而满脸通红。
trad: 他因為發燒而滿臉通紅。

eng: I had a long talk with her.
I can't thank you enough.
simp: 我无法表达我对你的感谢。
trad: 我無法表達我對你的感謝。

eng: Better late than never.
She is always dressed in black.
simp: 她总是穿着黑色的衣服。
trad: 她總是穿著黑色的衣服。

eng: The street is slippery.
I had nan with tea for breakfast.
simp: 我早饭吃了馕再喝了茶。
trad: 我早飯吃了饢再喝了茶。

eng: The damage will cost us a lot of money.
simp: 这破坏会花费我们很多钱。
trad: 這破壞會花費我們很多錢。

eng: When we learn languages, we learn fixed expressions.
simp: 当我们学外语时，我们学熟语。
trad: 當我們學外語時，我們學熟語。

eng: Those present were all moved to tears.
simp: 在座的人全都被感动得流下了泪来。
trad: 在座的人全都被感動得流下了淚來。

eng: Have you ever been to Canada?
There is a proverb that goes "time is money", but there is another one that goes "money can't buy you time".
simp: 俗话说：一寸光阴一寸金；可俗话又说：寸金难买寸光阴！
trad: 俗話說：一寸光陰一寸金；可俗話又說：寸金難買寸光陰！

eng: As the saying goes: "good always triumphs over evil". But there's another saying that: "the fight against evil is a constant struggle".
simp: 俗话说：邪不压正；可俗话又说：道高一尺，魔高一丈！
trad: 俗話說：邪不壓正；可俗話又說：道高一尺，魔高一丈！

eng: There’s a saying that goes, “the coming of fortune in pairs”. But there’s another saying that says, “Fortune comes but never in pairs and misfortune always”.
simp: 俗话说：双喜临门；可俗话又说：福无双进，祸不单行！
trad: 俗話說：雙喜臨門；可俗話又說：福無雙進，禍不單行！

eng: Don't look down on yourself, because people have limitless possibilities.
simp: 不要小看自己，因为人有无限的可能。
trad: 不要小看自己，因為人有無限的可能。

eng: Acknowledge your own faults before criticizing others.
simp: 要批评别人时，先想想自己是否完美无缺。
trad: 要批評別人時，先想想自己是否完美無缺。

eng: Only with wisdom can one distinguish between good and evil; only with humility can one build a happy life.
simp: 有智慧才能分辨善恶邪正；有谦虚才能建立美满人生。
trad: 有智慧才能分辨善惡邪正；有謙虛才能建立美滿人生。

eng: The most beautiful thing in the sky are the stars, the most beautiful thing in life is kindness.
simp: 天上最美是星星，人生最美是温情。
trad: 天上最美是星星，人生最美是溫情。

eng: Don't be afraid of having tigers for enemies; be afraid of having pigs for friends.
simp: 不怕虎一样的敌人，就怕猪一样的队友。
trad: 不怕虎一樣的敵人，就怕豬一樣的隊友。

eng: Do you really think that I will simply watch you walk into trouble? I'd close my eyes.
simp: 你以为我会眼睁睁地看着你去送死？我会闭上眼睛的。
trad: 你以為我會眼睜睜地看著你去送死？我會閉上眼睛的。

eng: Please don't speak English when I am around, OK?
simp: 请你以后不要在我面前说英文了，OK?
trad: 請你以後不要在我面前說英文了，OK?

eng: Problems that can be solved with money are not real problems.
simp: 钱可以解决的问题都不是问题。
trad: 錢可以解決的問題都不是問題。

eng: Quitting smoking is easy, quitting you is too hard.
You can't please everybody, because not everyone is human.
simp: 你不能让所有人都满意，因为不是所有的人都是人。
trad: 你不能讓所有人都滿意，因為不是所有的人都是人。

eng: Optimists see opportunities in disasters while pessimists find disasters in every opportunity.
simp: 乐观者在灾祸中看到机会，悲观者在机会中看到灾祸。
trad: 樂觀者在災禍中看到機會，悲觀者在機會中看到災禍。

eng: Don't fear being put upon. Fear instead being unable to help.
simp: 不怕被人利用，就怕你没用。
trad: 不怕被人利用，就怕你沒用。

eng: Even if one is to "believe", there is still a "lie" in the midst.
simp: 就算是believe，中间也藏着一个lie。
trad: 就算是believe，中間也藏著一個lie。

eng: Real friendship doesn't mean that you will never run out of things to say, but that you don't get embarrassed when you don't have anything to say.
simp: 真正的好朋友，并不是在一起就有聊不完的话题，而是在一起，就算不说话，也不会觉得尴尬。
trad: 真正的好朋友，並不是在一起就有聊不完的話題，而是在一起，就算不說話，也不會覺得尷尬。

eng: Any problem that can be resolved with money isn't a problem, but the problem is that I'm poor.
simp: 能用钱解决的问题都不是问题，可问题是我是穷人。
trad: 能用錢解決的問題都不是問題，可問題是我是窮人。

eng: What are you unhappy about? Let it out and let everyone cheer you up a bit.
simp: 你有什麽不开心的事? 说出来让大家开心一下。
trad: 你有什麼不開心的事? 說出來讓大家開心一下。

eng: Those two are exactly alike.
We start class at 9am, but he came as early as 8 o’clock.
simp: 我们早上九点上课，可是他八点就来了。
trad: 我們早上九點上課，可是他八點就來了。

eng: She was only 18 when she graduated from university.
simp: 她十八岁就大学毕业了。
trad: 她十八歲就大學畢業了。

eng: Have you heard from her recently?
One of our players scored a goal just five minutes after the match started.
simp: 我们班的球员比赛开始五分钟后就得了一分。
trad: 我們班的球員比賽開始五分鐘後就得了一分。

eng: We start class at nine o’clock, but he didn’t come until quarter past.
simp: 我们九点上课，可是他九点一刻才来。
trad: 我們九點上課，可是他九點一刻才來。

eng: Last night my daughter didn’t come home until half past one.
simp: 昨天晚上我的女儿一点半才回家。
trad: 昨天晚上我的女兒一點半才回家。

eng: The thunder scared the children.
He didn’t get a driving licence until he was twenty-eight.
simp: 他二十八岁才拿到驾照。
trad: 他二十八歲才拿到駕照。

eng: Are you staying at this hotel?
Do you have a non-smoking section?
Could you check the tire pressure?
simp: 你能检查一下这个轮胎的气压吗？
trad: 你能檢查一下這個輪胎的氣壓嗎？

eng: Hang your coat on the hook.
simp: 把你的外套挂在钩子上。
trad: 把你的外套掛在鉤子上。

eng: She is a wonderful woman.
The clouds are getting darker.
Please add up the bill.
He could not answer that question.
Have you ever had food poisoning?
What's your home phone number?
Have they ever come on time?
That's my younger sister's photograph.
That bridge is very beautiful.
Where is the nearest telephone box?
Would you like another apple?
Susan left an hour ago.
simp: 苏珊一个小时前离开了。
trad: 蘇珊一個小時前離開了。

eng: This is Uncle Tom's farm.
Tom is good at cooking.
Did you enjoy your winter holidays?
Do you have any light beer?
Wine is made from grapes.
simp: 葡萄酒是用葡萄做成的。
trad: 葡萄酒是用葡萄做成的。

eng: Tom gave me a pen.
They are having breakfast now.
We enjoyed singing songs together.
Will it be much longer?
You'd better not go out.
Are you planning to help them?
What he said embarrassed me.
Are you going out with Sachiko?
They live across the river.
He grows tomatoes in his garden.
You're on the right track.
You're on the right track.
You should have studied harder.
simp: 你本应该更努力学习的。
trad: 你本應該更努力學習的。

eng: He goes to Karuizawa every year.
Where's the nearest travel agency?
Today is my sixteenth birthday.
simp: 今天是我十六岁的生日。
trad: 今天是我十六歲的生日。

eng: What time does boarding begin?
He failed to answer the letter.
Dorothy sent him a nice present.
simp: 桃乐丝送给他一个不错的礼物。
trad: 桃樂絲送給他一個不錯的禮物。

eng: This car isn't worth repairing.
She attempted to kill herself.
Please pass me the salt.
The bridge is being repainted.
Summer vacation begins next Monday.
Have you eaten your lunch yet?
You should have known better.
Where is the Japanese Embassy?
Some people questioned his honesty.
I walked to school.
He comes back from Sydney today.
Have you turned in your report?
Our school begins at eight-thirty.
simp: 我们学校在八点半开始上课。
trad: 我們學校在八點半開始上課。

eng: He drives a car, doesn't he?
You'd better go by bus.
Are you students at this school?
simp: 你是这所学校的学生吗？
trad: 你是這所學校的學生嗎？

eng: Do you have any Japanese magazines?
Our train leaves at eight-thirty.
simp: 我们的火车在八点半出发。
trad: 我們的火車在八點半出發。

eng: She eyed the stranger suspiciously.
simp: 她盯着可疑的陌生人看。
trad: 她盯著可疑的陌生人看。

eng: There are almost no books.
Have you handed in your homework?
He dropped in at the bookstore.
Could you wrap this separately, please?
You can take today off.
Have you ever eaten Japanese food?
Tom isn't watching TV now.
Do you know what he said?
The truth?
The interpreter tries to give the most detail and information possible.
simp: 翻译正在试图给尽可能多的细节和消息。
trad: 翻譯正在試圖給盡可能多的細節和消息。

eng: He rang me up at midnight.
You should take care not to catch cold.
It is clearly shown in Johnson's investigation that passive smoking is very harmful.
simp: 在Johnson的调查里，明确地证明了二手烟是很有害的。
trad: 在Johnson的調查裏，明確地證明了二手煙是很有害的。

eng: When you're done with the book, put it back where you found it.
simp: 你一用完了这本书，就把它放回原来找到的地方。
trad: 你一用完了這本書，就把它放回原來找到的地方。

eng: Please fill this water bottle.
We play football every Saturday.
simp: 我们每个星期六踢足球。
trad: 我們每個星期六踢足球。

eng: You were late, weren't you?
Where is the nearest station?
Who's your most interesting friend?
She always smiles at me.
Any student can answer that question.
simp: 任何学生都可以回答这个问题。
trad: 任何學生都可以回答這個問題。

eng: Shake the bottle before using.
Don't argue with an idiot, or else people might not be sure which of you is really the idiot.
simp: 不要同一个傻瓜争辩、否则别人会搞不清到底谁是傻瓜。
trad: 不要同一個傻瓜爭辯、否則別人會搞不清到底誰是傻瓜。

eng: Prices have gone up these three months.
simp: 最近三个月，价钱涨高了。
trad: 最近三個月，價錢漲高了。

eng: The job looked quite simple, but it took me a week.
simp: 这份工作看起来很简单，但它花了我一个星期。
trad: 這份工作看起來很簡單，但它花了我一個星期。

eng: Please forgive me asking such a personal question.
simp: 请原谅我问了这样一个私人的问题。
trad: 請原諒我問了這樣一個私人的問題。

eng: Prices have gone up these three months.
simp: 最近三个月，物价上昇了。
trad: 最近三個月，物價上昇了。

eng: Jessie accepted the invitation at once.
They have no impact on the environment.
simp: 它们对环境一点都没有影响。
trad: 它們對環境一點都沒有影響。

eng: He cut some branches off the tree.
simp: 他割掉了树上的几根树枝。
trad: 他割掉了樹上的幾根樹枝。

eng: This damp match won't light.
simp: 这根湿掉的火柴点不出火的。
trad: 這根濕掉的火柴點不出火的。

eng: When I opened the curtains, it was snowing.
simp: 当我拉开了窗帘时，在下雪呢。
trad: 當我拉開了窗簾時，在下雪呢。

eng: What kind of man was he?
simp: 他是什么样子的男人啊？
trad: 他是什麼樣子的男人啊？

eng: If I knew that, I'd tell you.
simp: 如果我知道的，会告诉你的。
trad: 如果我知道的，會告訴你的。

eng: The girl closed her eyes and listened to the pastor.
simp: 小女孩闭上了眼睛听了牧师。
trad: 小女孩閉上了眼睛聽了牧師。

eng: Who was that you were with last night?
simp: 和你昨晚在一起的人是谁？
trad: 和你昨晚在一起的人是誰？

eng: She doesn't need to work.
You alone can do it, but you can't do it alone.
simp: 只有你一个人能做到，但你独自一个人是做不到的。
trad: 只有你一個人能做到，但你獨自一個人是做不到的。

eng: Give me a bottle of wine.
The soccer game is tomorrow.
Have you finished reading the book?
Could you call a doctor, please?
We celebrate Christmas every year.
simp: 我们每年都庆祝圣诞节。
trad: 我們每年都慶祝聖誕節。

eng: Physics is my favorite subject.
simp: 物理是我最喜欢的科目。
trad: 物理是我最喜歡的科目。

eng: The pianist played two encores.
simp: 这位钢琴家演奏了两首安可曲。
trad: 這位鋼琴家演奏了兩首安可曲。

eng: Why did you do that?
Feel free to ask any questions.
simp: 随时问任何问题都可以。
trad: 隨時問任何問題都可以。

eng: Father bought me a new bicycle.
simp: 父亲买了一辆新自行车给我。
trad: 父親買了一輛新自行車給我。

eng: She'll love her husband forever.
Have you done all your homework?
He divorced his wife last month.
simp: 上个月他和妻子离婚了。
trad: 上個月他和妻子離婚了。

eng: There's nothing good on television.
He denied having written to me.
The bride looked very beautiful.
Why are you angry with him?
She eats nothing but vegetables.
Where are you from, Karen?
He advised her to stop drinking.
Brian went to school with Kate.
simp: 布莱恩和凯特去上学了。
trad: 布萊恩和凱特去上學了。

eng: They are very big apples.
Tell me which you want.
Your work is below average.
simp: 你的工作表现低于平均水平。
trad: 你的工作表現低於平均水平。

eng: It seems that Mr. Tanaka has taken his exam.
He doesn't know English at all.
What does your aunt do?
Bob will be home at six.
Don't put it on my desk.
simp: 不要把它放在我的桌子上。
trad: 不要把它放在我的桌子上。

eng: Have you washed the car yet?
Did you see him go out?
They named their child Thomas.
simp: 他们为他们的孩子命名为托马斯。
trad: 他們為他們的孩子命名為托馬斯。

eng: Please bring me my bill.
Children love playing on the beach.
simp: 孩子们喜欢在沙滩上玩。
trad: 孩子們喜歡在沙灘上玩。

eng: Have you heard from him recently?
Please send us more information.
She finally reached the hotel.
Could we have a table outside?
simp: 我们在外面可以有一张桌子吗？
trad: 我們在外面可以有一張桌子嗎？

eng: She talked as she walked.
Speaking English is a lot of fun.
Bill is on the editorial staff.
The policemen arrested the burglar.
This is all I know.
Can you lend me 10,000 yen?
Yumi speaks English very well.
Our house is conveniently located.
simp: 我们的房子位于交通便利的地方。
trad: 我們的房子位於交通便利的地方。

eng: You should wear a coat.
Dick plans to go by himself.
What are you doing here?
You should study English harder.
simp: 你应该更努力学习英语。
trad: 你應該更努力學習英語。

eng: They are discussing the problem.
simp: 他们正在讨论这个问题。
trad: 他們正在討論這個問題。

I'm going to change my shirt.
My internet connection was cut off.
simp: 我的网路连线被切断了。
trad: 我的網路連線被切斷了。

eng: Put it on one bill, please.
Something is wrong with my watch.
Something is wrong with my watch.
Something may have happened to him.
simp: 他可能发生了什麽事情。
trad: 他可能發生了什麼事情。

eng: My mother likes tea very much.
They changed the system.
This job pays 10,000 yen a day.
simp: 这个工作一天有10,000日圆的报酬。
trad: 這個工作一天有10,000日圓的報酬。

eng: We must get up at dawn.
Sam has already done his homework.
simp: 山姆已经做他的功课了。
trad: 山姆已經做他的功課了。

eng: Put some water into the vase.
I played tennis with my brother.
I wish you had been there.
My mother washes clothes every day.
Please wait till he comes back.
She planted roses in the garden.
Please remember to mail the letter.
I'll clean up the kitchen later.
I'm tired of all his complaints.
simp: 我厌倦了他所有的抱怨。
trad: 我厭倦了他所有的抱怨。

eng: I will be busy this afternoon.
I'm going to America this summer.
Pass me the salt, will you?
I've been studying in China for ten months.
simp: 我在中国学习了十个月了。
trad: 我在中國學習了十個月了。

eng: What I have learnt is not just the Chinese language, but something about the country itself as well.
simp: 我学习的不只是中国的语言，也是一些关于这个国家的东西。
trad: 我學習的不只是中國的語言，也是一些關於這個國家的東西。

eng: That's to say, I have a better understanding of the Chinese nation.
simp: 也就是说，我更加地了解了中国。
trad: 也就是說，我更加地了解了中國。

eng: She knows your mother very well.
Of course, I learnt about China from textbooks when I was in Japan, but what I see for myself in China is completely different from what is described in those textbooks.
simp: 当然，我在日本时透过课本了解中国，可是我自己在中国看到的跟那些课本描述的完全不一样。
trad: 當然，我在日本時透過課本了解中國，可是我自己在中國看到的跟那些課本描述的完全不一樣。

eng: Today's Beijing has given me a very deep impression and aroused my curiosity.
simp: 现代的北京给了我深刻的印象，也激起了我的好奇心。
trad: 現代的北京給了我深刻的印象，也激起了我的好奇心。

eng: I can describe China, especially in relation to big cities like Beijing, in one sentence - China is a country whose pace of life is both fast and leisurely.
simp: 我能用一句话描述中国，尤其是关于北京那样的大城市：中国是一个有悠闲生活并有快速生活的国家。
trad: 我能用一句話描述中國，尤其是關於北京那樣的大城市：中國是一個有悠閑生活並有快速生活的國家。

eng: When I first came to Beijing, I loved to stroll everywhere, but Beijing was not like what I had imagined.
simp: 我先来北京时，就去哪里都爱逛街，可是北京跟我想象的不一样。
trad: 我先來北京時，就去哪裏都愛逛街，可是北京跟我想象的不一樣。

eng: Its modernization was far beyond my expectations.
simp: 它现代化的程度远远超乎我的预料。
trad: 它現代化的程度遠遠超乎我的預料。

eng: New buildings are being built here, there and everywhere.
simp: 到处都是新建造的楼房。
trad: 到處都是新建造的樓房。

eng: The small restaurant of today may be a big hotel tomorrow.
simp: 今天的小饭馆明天就可以变成大饭店了。
trad: 今天的小飯館明天就可以變成大飯店了。

eng: Beijing is changing so rapidly.
On seeing this, I can't help thinking: Can the residents of Beijing keep up with such a pace?
simp: 看到这个以后，我不得不想到：北京的居民能跟上那么快的速度吗？
trad: 看到這個以後，我不得不想到：北京的居民能跟上那麼快的速度嗎？

eng: Jim wrote the letter for Betty.
Do they all enjoy such high speed development?
simp: 他们都享受那么快的发展吗？
trad: 他們都享受那麼快的發展嗎？

eng: Is there any leisure in China?
It has: it is in the heart of the Chinese people.
simp: 有了，在中国人民的心里。
trad: 有了，在中國人民的心裏。

eng: Jessie's long hair was completely wet.
simp: 杰西的长头髮完全湿透了。
trad: 傑西的長頭髮完全濕透了。

eng: She dived into the swimming pool.
While walking, I used to feel somewhat in a hurry.
simp: 以前，我散步的时候感觉有点匆忙。
trad: 以前，我散步的時候感覺有點匆忙。

eng: My boss made me work overtime.
At first, I had no idea why.
simp: 首先，我跟本不知道为什么是这样的。
trad: 首先，我跟本不知道為什麼是這樣的。

eng: I later realized that Beijing people walk slowly.
simp: 后来我意识到北京人比较慢地散步。
trad: 後來我意識到北京人比較慢地散步。

eng: What's more, Chinese people like taking naps.
simp: 此外，中国人喜欢睡午觉。
trad: 此外，中國人喜歡睡午覺。

eng: This isn't my opinion, it's just what I've translated.
simp: 这不是我的观点，只是我翻译的！
trad: 這不是我的觀點，只是我翻譯的！

eng: Now, I also enjoy it.
I have come to realize that China is developing quickly but the Chinese people live a relatively leisurely life.
simp: 我意识到虽然中国发展得很快，中国人还有比较悠闲的生活。
trad: 我意識到雖然中國發展得很快，中國人還有比較悠閑的生活。

eng: I later realized that Beijing people walk slowly.
simp: 后来我明白北京人走路走得慢。
trad: 後來我明白北京人走路走得慢。

eng: At first, I had no idea why.
I have come to realize that China is developing quickly but the Chinese people live a relatively leisurely life.
simp: 我意识到了中国正在快速地发展，但是相对而言中国人却过着悠閒的生活。
trad: 我意識到了中國正在快速地發展，但是相對而言中國人卻過著悠閒的生活。

eng: It was in Beijing that I studied Chinese.
Mike eats out almost every night.
simp: 麦克几乎每天晚上出去吃饭。
trad: 麥克幾乎每天晚上出去吃飯。

eng: I'd like an aisle seat, please.
She can speak English very well.
She can speak English very well.
My brother wants to study abroad.
It's going to rain this evening.
Please show me your driver's license.
simp: 请让我看看您的驾驶执照。
trad: 請讓我看看您的駕駛執照。

eng: I just ate sushi and drank beer.
simp: 我刚才吃了寿司喝了啤酒。
trad: 我剛才吃了壽司喝了啤酒。

eng: I want to buy this dictionary.
Lend me some books to read.
I'm staying at the Sheraton Hotel.
He's an interpreter in an international bank.
simp: 他是个国际银行的翻译。
trad: 他是個國際銀行的翻譯。

eng: I took the children to school.
She lived there about five years.
It isn't polite to stare at people.
Quite a few Americans like sushi.
simp: 不少的美国人喜欢寿司。
trad: 不少的美國人喜歡壽司。

eng: I usually get up at 6:00.
She went upstairs to her bedroom.
Please give me your permanent address.
I want something sweet to eat.
Linda came home late at night.
I saw him looking at me.
Jane can sing some Japanese songs.
Ken goes to school by bus.
It was very cold this morning.
She visits us every other day.
It never rains but it pours.
simp: 不下雨则矣，一下一定是倾盆大雨。
trad: 不下雨則矣，一下一定是傾盆大雨。

eng: It never rains but it pours.
I saw Shin'ichi in Kakogawa yesterday.
simp: 我昨天在加古川看到真一。
trad: 我昨天在加古川看到真一。

eng: She hired him as a programmer.
simp: 她聘请他作程式设计师。
trad: 她聘請他作程式設計師。

eng: I've got to shave before leaving.
My son is tired of hamburgers.
simp: 我的儿子厌烦了汉堡包。
trad: 我的兒子厭煩了漢堡包。

eng: I'll see you again this afternoon.
simp: 今天下午我会再见到你。
trad: 今天下午我會再見到你。

eng: I walked three-fourths of a mile.
I will write to you soon.
None of the telephones are working.
Mother stays at home every day.
Jessie urged the little donkey forward.
Meg didn't even look at me.
Please close the door behind you.
Nancy told me about the fire.
simp: 南希告诉了我有关火灾的事。
trad: 南希告訴了我有關火災的事。

eng: Kumiko runs as fast as Tom.
simp: 久美子跑得跟汤姆一样快。
trad: 久美子跑得跟湯姆一樣快。

eng: It's hard to speak English well.
Someone has brought us some grapes.
simp: 有人带了一些葡萄给我们。
trad: 有人帶了一些葡萄給我們。

eng: She mistook me for my brother.
simp: 她把我误认为是我的兄弟。
trad: 她把我誤認為是我的兄弟。

eng: My brother is small but strong.
simp: 我哥哥虽然矮小可是很强壮。
trad: 我哥哥雖然矮小可是很強壯。

eng: Keep an eye on the bags.
It seldom snows here in winter.
My mother doesn't like watching TV.
Never be afraid of making mistakes.
Stop making a fool of yourself.
Lots of famous people come here.
May I speak to Mike, please?
simp: 我可以和麦克说话吗，谢谢。
trad: 我可以和麥克說話嗎，謝謝。

eng: It wasn't very hot last night.
Is that a picture of me?
Nagoya is between Tokyo and Osaka.
simp: 名古屋在东京和大坂之间。
trad: 名古屋在東京和大阪之間。

eng: Someone tapped me on the shoulder.
She believes that he is innocent.
Please excuse me for being rude.
I wonder why he did that.
simp: 我不知道他为什麽那样做？
trad: 我不知道他為什麼那樣做？

eng: Ken climbed down from the tree.
My nephew is allergic to eggs.
I'd like to see a doctor.
I'd like to see a doctor.
Mike said that he would come.
I'd like three pounds of chicken.
I think jogging is good exercise.
simp: 我认为慢跑是很好的运动。
trad: 我認為慢跑是很好的運動。

eng: Sentences begin with a capital letter.
simp: 句子以一个大写字母开头。
trad: 句子以一個大寫字母開頭。

eng: May I see the wine list?
Masaru claims that he is innocent.
My brother is a first-year student.
simp: 我弟弟是个一年级的学生。
trad: 我弟弟是個一年級的學生。

eng: I work every day except Sunday.
simp: 我除了星期天外每天都上班。
trad: 我除了星期天外每天都上班。

eng: Ken was in Japan last year.
I'm not as tall as you.
She wants to attend the party.
Please take good care of yourself.
Please speak a little more slowly.
I'll leave when she comes back.
simp: 当她回来的时后，我就离开。
trad: 當她回來的時後，我就離開。

eng: Our school is near the station.
simp: 我们学校在车站的附近。
trad: 我們學校在車站的附近。

eng: I want to sing a song.
Please give me something to drink.
She gets up early every morning.
It's fun to ride a motorcycle.
Jill saw the movie with Ken.
My older brother is a teacher.
It was very cold yesterday morning.
What is the capital of Haiti?
She aspired to become an actress.
Mt. Fuji was covered with snow.
Ken has been looking for you.
My wallet and passport are missing.
simp: 我的钱包和护照不见了。
trad: 我的錢包和護照不見了。

eng: She cooked us a wonderful meal.
simp: 她为我们煮了丰盛的一餐。
trad: 她為我們煮了豐盛的一餐。

eng: She has put on weight recently.
She looks pretty in that dress.
simp: 她穿上那件衣服看起来很漂亮。
trad: 她穿上那件衣服看起來很漂亮。

eng: Kelly will appear on TV.
It will cost around 10,000 yen.
I thought the questions were easy.
simp: 我认为这些问题很容易。
trad: 我認為這些問題很容易。

eng: She asked a very good question.
simp: 她问了一个非常好的问题。
trad: 她問了一個非常好的問題。

eng: She remained single all her life.
She visited Kanazawa two years ago.
She tore the letter into pieces.
It is already past five o'clock.
I should've brought my camera.
simp: 我应该把我的相机带来。
trad: 我應該把我的相機帶來。

eng: My father is an office worker.
simp: 我父亲是一名办公室职员。
trad: 我父親是一名辦公室職員。

eng: She is good at speaking English.
My uncle lives in an apartment.
Put away your books and notebooks.
simp: 把你的书和笔记本收起来。
trad: 把你的書和筆記本收起來。

eng: I was absent from work yesterday.
Mr. Wilson is angry at Dennis.
simp: 威尔逊先生对丹尼斯很生气。
trad: 威爾遜先生對丹尼斯很生氣。

eng: Please fill out this form first.
Clean the room.
John is in the swimming club.
My parents live in the country.
I should have taken the money.
I've studied English for five years.
simp: 我已经学习了五年的英文。
trad: 我已經學習了五年的英文。

eng: I'm going to attend the meeting.
I'm going to meet him tomorrow.
I will be free tomorrow afternoon.
Is Miss Smith an English teacher?
simp: 史密斯小姐是英语老师吗？
trad: 史密斯小姐是英語老師嗎？

eng: My mother made a sweater for me.
simp: 我妈妈为我做了一件毛衣。
trad: 我媽媽為我做了一件毛衣。

eng: I'm Alan Tate, Terry Tate's son.
She was in America last month.
I was shocked by yesterday's news.
simp: 昨天的消息让我感到震惊。
trad: 昨天的消息讓我感到震驚。

eng: Some boys came into the classroom.
I want to join Joe's group.
I spent my vacation in Hakone.
May I have some more coffee?
John is much taller than Mary.
She takes care of my children.
My uncle is possessed of great wealth.
simp: 我叔叔拥有很多的财富。
trad: 我叔叔擁有很多的財富。

eng: Last summer we went to Hokkaido.
simp: 去年夏天我们去了北海道。
trad: 去年夏天我們去了北海道。

eng: It has been raining since Sunday.
simp: 从週日开始一直在下雨。
trad: 從週日開始一直在下雨。

eng: I'm used to getting up early.
Jim doesn't like apples, does he?
I think that Yumi is sick.
Mr. Green is a history teacher.
simp: 格林先生是一位历史老师。
trad: 格林先生是一位歷史老師。

eng: My mother is reading a magazine.
simp: 我妈妈正在读一本杂志。
trad: 我媽媽正在讀一本雜誌。

eng: You have such beautiful, hazel eyes.
simp: 你有如此美丽的澹褐色眼睛。
trad: 你有如此美麗的淡褐色眼睛。

eng: I work for an oil company.
simp: 我为一家石油公司工作。
trad: 我為一家石油公司工作。

eng: She didn't feel like eating lunch.
I wonder what happened to him.
simp: 我想知道他发生了什麽事。
trad: 我想知道他發生了什麼事。

eng: My mother left me a message.
She studied English in the morning.
Let's not discuss the matter today.
simp: 今天让我们不要讨论这件事。
trad: 今天讓我們不要討論這件事。

eng: He had his head in the clouds in class.
I'd like to pay in cash.
She wrapped herself in a blanket.
simp: 她用一条毯子把自己裹起来。
trad: 她用一條毯子把自己裹起來。

eng: I remember giving him the key.
Please mail this letter for me.
She'll be getting married next year.
I've got everything that you want.
simp: 我已经得到了一切你想要的东西。
trad: 我已經得到了一切你想要的東西。

eng: Sadako wanted to forget about it.
I'd like to rent a car.
I'm sure that he'll get angry.
She helped me pack my suitcase.
simp: 她帮我打包我的手提箱。
trad: 她幫我打包我的手提箱。

eng: She is good at playing tennis.
Kate hardly ever celebrates her birthday.
simp: 凯特几乎从未庆祝她的生日。
trad: 凱特幾乎從未慶祝她的生日。

eng: She thanked us for our help.
She was only frightened, not injured.
simp: 她只是被吓到了并没有受伤。
trad: 她只是被嚇到了並沒有受傷。

eng: My sister went to Kobe yesterday.
Please return the book by tomorrow.
I want to drink something cold.
She took the entrance exam yesterday.
simp: 她昨天参加了入学考试。
trad: 她昨天參加了入學考試。

eng: Please tell me about your trip.
simp: 请告诉我有关你旅行的事。
trad: 請告訴我有關你旅行的事。

eng: It all depends on the weather.
She must have done it yesterday.
simp: 她昨天一定已经做过了。
trad: 她昨天一定已經做過了。

eng: Let's sing the song in English.
Jay picked up the old scissors.
simp: 杰伊捡起了这把旧剪刀。
trad: 傑伊撿起了這把舊剪刀。

eng: Meg bought a can of tomatoes.
Lincoln was elected President in 1860.
simp: 林肯在1860年当选为美国总统。
trad: 林肯在1860年當選為美國總統。

eng: It's great! You'll laugh for sure.
Mike doesn't practice basketball on Monday.
simp: 麦克星期一不练习篮球。
trad: 麥克星期一不練習籃球。

eng: I've just arrived at the airport.
She was wearing dark brown shoes.
I will come earlier next time.
I watched him cross the street.
Playing cards is a popular pastime.
simp: 打牌是一种流行的消遣方式。
trad: 打牌是一種流行的消遣方式。

eng: I'll come back to Japan tomorrow.
I'll meet to you at eight.
Please pick up my dry cleaning.
She appears to have a headache.
I would like to see it.
My father often washes the dishes.
It's your birthday, isn't it, Yuri?
simp: 今天是你的生日，不是吗，尤里？
trad: 今天是你的生日，不是嗎，尤裏？

eng: I sometimes play tennis with her.
My camera is different from yours.
Is there a hospital near here?
I wonder if this is love.
She must be angry with me.
Last summer I traveled to Italy.
simp: 去年夏天我去意大利旅行。
trad: 去年夏天我去意大利旅行。

eng: My father is in his room.
I was afraid I'd be late.
Prices depend on supply and demand.
simp: 价格取决于供给和需求。
trad: 價格取決於供給和需求。

eng: I'm going out with Lisa tonight.
She is practicing the violin now.
simp: 她现在正在练习拉小提琴。
trad: 她現在正在練習拉小提琴。

eng: Does a dog have a Buddha-nature or not ?
Please fill this bottle with water.
She was reading a gardening manual.
simp: 她正在读一本园艺手册。
trad: 她正在讀一本園藝手冊。

eng: My brother named his cat Hanako.
simp: 我的兄弟把他的猫取名为"花子"。
trad: 我的兄弟把他的貓取名為"花子"。

eng: Smoking is bad for your health.
Is there a supermarket near here?
My father lives in the country.
I wonder when Anne will come.
She helped him overcome his sadness.
simp: 她帮助他平抚了他的悲伤。
trad: 她幫助他平撫了他的悲傷。

eng: Kumiko is as tall as Tom.
She changed her name to Ann.
She put sheets on her bed.
simp: 她在她的床上铺了床单。
trad: 她在她的床上鋪了床單。

eng: Maybe you'd better come with us.
simp: 也许你最好和我们一起来。
trad: 也許你最好和我們一起來。

eng: Please tell me about your problem.
She bought two pounds of butter.
I saw tears in her eyes.
simp: 我在她的眼睛裡看到泪水。
trad: 我在她的眼睛裡看到淚水。

eng: It looks like snow, doesn't it?
simp: 看起来要下雪了，不是吗?
trad: 看起來要下雪了，不是嗎?

eng: Please wait a little while longer.
She complained about my low salary.
She resented being called a coward.
simp: 她对被称为懦夫很反感。
trad: 她對被稱為懦夫很反感。

eng: Mary, this is Joe's brother David.
simp: 玛丽，这是乔的兄弟大卫。
trad: 瑪麗，這是喬的兄弟大衛。

eng: I won't talk to him anymore.
I will go to Hokkaido tomorrow.
My father's hobby is growing roses.
simp: 我父亲的嗜好是种玫瑰花。
trad: 我父親的嗜好是種玫瑰花。

eng: She employed him as a programmer.
simp: 她僱用他作程式设计师。
trad: 她僱用他作程式設計師。

eng: She appears to have many friends.
simp: 她看起来好像有很多朋友。
trad: 她看起來好像有很多朋友。

eng: I'm sure he will come tomorrow.
I'm looking for a part-time job.
simp: 我正在找一份兼职的工作。
trad: 我正在找一份兼職的工作。

eng: She taught music for thirty years.
She can speak English, of course.
Either you or I am right.
Open up.
Open up.
He was drunk and forgot to shut the back door.
The students stood waiting for a bus.
It is because light travels faster than sound that some people look brilliant before sounding stupid.
simp: 光速比音速快，所以某些人在开口前，看起来还挺聪明的。
trad: 光速比音速快，所以某些人在開口前，看起來還挺聰明的。

eng: Glass breaks easily.
It is because light travels faster than sound that some people look brilliant before sounding stupid.
simp: 光速比音速快，所以有些人乍看之下很聪明，等到听到他们开口说话，愚笨的本性才表露无遗。
trad: 光速比音速快，所以有些人乍看之下很聰明，等到聽到他們開口說話，愚笨的本性才表露無遺。

eng: It must bother you to have taken a bad master. "I'm stupid too. So, it's all right."
simp: “拜个不够行的师父，很伤脑筋吧？”　“我也很笨，所以没关系。”
trad: “拜個不夠行的師父，很傷腦筋吧？”　“我也很笨，所以沒關系。”

eng: A good cook doesn't throw out yesterday's soup.
simp: 一个好的厨师不会丢掉昨天的汤。
trad: 一個好的廚師不會丟掉昨天的湯。

eng: I dived into the river.
He was treated with great cruelty.
Without water, nothing could live on this earth.
simp: 没有水，没有东西能生活在这个地球上。
trad: 沒有水，沒有東西能生活在這個地球上。

eng: Our school is across the river.
They implemented a communication policy so as to promote their new concept.
simp: 他们到位了实行新概念的广告策略。
trad: 他們到位了實行新概念的廣告策略。

eng: She assigned him to the job.
I wish they would stop fighting.
simp: 我希望他们会停止战斗。
trad: 我希望他們會停止戰鬥。

eng: One more bottle of wine, please.
My father likes pizza very much.
She decided to quit her job.
She might be taller than you.
He is gross, man!
I was in London last month.
I'd like to talk to John.
He was suffering from a bad headache.
simp: 他正遭受严重头痛的困扰。
trad: 他正遭受嚴重頭痛的困擾。

eng: School begins at half past eight.
She can sing and dance beautifully.
simp: 她会唱歌而且舞跳得很美。
trad: 她會唱歌而且舞跳得很美。

eng: She sent this book to me.
He is suffering from a bad cold in the nose.
I wish to go to Hawaii.
May I go out to play?
Harry fell seriously ill.
Phoenix is the capital of Arizona.
simp: 凤凰城是亚利桑那州的首府。
trad: 鳳凰城是亞利桑那州的首府。

eng: He has recovered from his bad cold.
simp: 他从重感冒中恢复了过来。
trad: 他從重感冒中恢復了過來。

eng: She usually sleeps for eight hours.
None of my friends drink coffee.
She left home ten minutes ago.
I was invited to Sachiko's party.
simp: 我被邀请去幸子的派对。
trad: 我被邀請去幸子的派對。

eng: Please help me with my homework.
simp: 请帮我做我的家庭作业。
trad: 請幫我做我的家庭作業。

eng: I'm going to climb Mt. Kitadake.
I saw him wash the car.
She went shopping with her mother.
She will be seventeen next year.
She makes all her own clothes.
simp: 她的衣服全部都是她自己做的。
trad: 她的衣服全部都是她自己做的。

eng: I saw her clean the room.
Should I buy something for him?
simp: 我应该买些东西给他吗？
trad: 我應該買些東西給他嗎？

eng: Let's find something to sit on.
simp: 让我们找些可以坐在上面的东西。
trad: 讓我們找些可以坐在上面的東西。

eng: My father objected to our marriage.
simp: 我的父亲反对我们的婚姻。
trad: 我的父親反對我們的婚姻。

eng: May I speak to Mr. Sato?
simp: 我可以和佐藤先生说话吗？
trad: 我可以和佐藤先生說話嗎？

eng: I suggested that she go alone.
I'd like to make a reservation.
The mountain is 2000 meters above sea level.
My grandfather died five years ago.
Mary is studying in her room.
simp: 玛丽在她的房间裡读书。
trad: 瑪麗在她的房間裡讀書。

eng: She plays tennis in the morning.
Mary wants to become a teacher.
She lives in a two-story house.
simp: 她住在一栋两层楼的房子。
trad: 她住在一棟兩層樓的房子。

eng: Please show me your injured arm.
simp: 请让我看看你受伤的手臂。
trad: 請讓我看看你受傷的手臂。

eng: She lives just across from us.
My father can speak English well.
simp: 我父亲能把英语讲得很好。
trad: 我父親能把英語講得很好。

eng: Ken has been to England before.
I visited Fukuoka ten years ago.
Robert enjoyed talking with his girlfriend.
simp: 罗伯特喜欢和他的女朋友谈话。
trad: 羅伯特喜歡和他的女朋友談話。

eng: Mary had to go to school.
She cooked herself a good meal.
simp: 她为自己煮了好吃的一餐。
trad: 她為自己煮了好吃的一餐。

eng: She visited her husband in prison.
simp: 她探望了她在监狱裡的丈夫。
trad: 她探望了她在監獄裡的丈夫。

eng: I went camping with my family.
Only a few people understood me.
She felt like taking a walk.
My house has a small yard.
simp: 我的房子有一个小院子。
trad: 我的房子有一個小院子。

eng: Sorry to have kept you waiting.
I was disappointed with his speech.
simp: 我对他的演说感到失望。
trad: 我對他的演說感到失望。

eng: Let's go, he said to me.
She must have studied very hard.
I wrote down his phone number.
simp: 我写下他的电话号码了。
trad: 我寫下他的電話號碼了。

eng: Jim is crazy about his girlfriend.
simp: 吉姆为他的女朋友疯狂。
trad: 吉姆為他的女朋友瘋狂。

eng: My brother is now in Australia.
I remember seeing you last year.
I'm a little angry with you.
I go to school.
I can't live that kind of life.
simp: 那种生活方式不适合我。
trad: 那種生活方式不適合我。

eng: The rumor turned out false.
I'd rather stay home than go out in this weather.
simp: 我宁愿呆在家里也不要在这种天气中出门。
trad: 我寧願呆在家裏也不要在這種天氣中出門。

eng: Don't pull my leg!
We must pay a toll to drive on this road.
simp: 我们必得缴通行税才能在这条道路上行驶。
trad: 我們必得繳通行稅才能在這條道路上行駛。

eng: A cooking course should be mandatory in schools.
simp: 烹饪课程应该作为学校的必修课。
trad: 烹飪課程應該作為學校的必修課。

eng: Which is better, red thread or white thread?
simp: 哪个更好，红线呢还是白线？
trad: 哪個更好，紅線呢還是白線？

eng: She taught me how to write a poem.
He could do nothing but give up his plan against his will.
simp: 他无能为力，只好放弃计划
trad: 他無能為力，只好放棄計劃

eng: He thought to himself, "No!" Aloud he said, "Yes."
simp: 他心里对自己说“不！”。他大声说出“是。”。
trad: 他心裏對自己說“不！”。他大聲說出“是。”。

eng: He turned over the matter in his mind.
simp: 他在心里反复思量这件事。
trad: 他在心裏反復思量這件事。

eng: You're very pretty.
She is absorbed in rock music.
Now Marina was a romantic, she had not yet fallen into that passive state of mind which accepts that one should find a corner to live, anywhere, and then arrange one's whole life around it.
simp: 玛丽娜现在仍是个浪漫的人，她还没有陷入消极的精神状态 -- 那是一种认为一个人必须找一个角落活着，不管哪儿，然后一生就回绕着那个角落的的精神状态。
trad: 瑪麗娜現在仍是個浪漫的人，她還沒有陷入消極的精神狀態 -- 那是一種認為一個人必須找一個角落活著，不管哪兒，然後一生就回繞著那個角落的的精神狀態。

eng: She was wearing long boots.
She is our next best pianist after Mr Long.
simp: 她是继龙先生之后最出色的钢琴家。
trad: 她是繼龍先生之後最出色的鋼琴家。

eng: She went either to London or to Paris.
simp: 她不是去了伦敦就是巴黎。
trad: 她不是去了倫敦就是巴黎。

eng: She went from London to Paris.
She would often go to the theater when she was in London.
simp: 她在伦敦的时候，曾经常去剧院。
trad: 她在倫敦的時候，曾經常去劇院。

eng: She took full advantage of her stay in London to improve her English.
simp: 她充分利用她住在伦敦的优势，提高英语。
trad: 她充分利用她住在倫敦的優勢，提高英語。

eng: She prefers beer to wine.
simp: 她喜欢啤酒胜过葡萄酒。
trad: 她喜歡啤酒勝過葡萄酒。

eng: Meg found a four leaf clover.
simp: 梅格发现了四片叶子的三叶草。
trad: 梅格發現了四片葉子的三葉草。

eng: My mother never gets up early.
I'll give you anything that you want.
simp: 我会给你任何你想要的东西。
trad: 我會給你任何你想要的東西。

eng: I'm leaving for Chicago next week.
simp: 我下週将离开去芝加哥。
trad: 我下週將離開去芝加哥。

eng: Please fill this bucket with water.
It's obvious why his stomach hurts.
simp: 他为什麽会胃痛的原因很明显。
trad: 他為什麼會胃痛的原因很明顯。

eng: She speaks both English and French.
It was too difficult for me.
She left early in the morning.
The time has come when I must tell you the truth.
simp: 现在是我必须告诉你真相的时候了。
trad: 現在是我必須告訴你真相的時候了。

eng: Nancy, here's a letter for you.
simp: 南希，这裡有一封你的信。
trad: 南希，這裡有一封你的信。

eng: Stop talking and listen to me.
I wonder if he'll come tonight.
simp: 我不知道他今晚会不会来。
trad: 我不知道他今晚會不會來。

eng: I've worked here for ten years.
simp: 我已经在这裡工作了十年。
trad: 我已經在這裡工作了十年。

eng: She filled the glass with wine.
simp: 她在玻璃杯裡装满了酒。
trad: 她在玻璃杯裡裝滿了酒。

eng: Mike goes to school by bus.
I ordered some books from London.
simp: 我从伦敦订购了一些书。
trad: 我從倫敦訂購了一些書。

eng: Please give me something to eat.
I wish I earned more money.
Please tell me what you think.
She is as tall as you.
Our mother bought us a puppy.
simp: 我们的妈妈买了一隻小狗给我们。
trad: 我們的媽媽買了一隻小狗給我們。

eng: My sister sometimes makes our dinner.
simp: 我的妹妹有时为我们做晚餐。
trad: 我的妹妹有時為我們做晚餐。

eng: I want a quart of milk.
My opinion is similar to yours.
I want to see your mother.
She has already left the office.
Ken will be fifteen next year.
Where did you get this?
She doesn't live there any more.
She's been working all day long.
I still haven't heard from him.
My brother is a college student.
Mike went to Kyoto last summer.
simp: 麦克去年夏天去了京都。
trad: 麥克去年夏天去了京都。

eng: She wrote a book about birds.
simp: 她写了一本关于鸟类的书。
trad: 她寫了一本關於鳥類的書。

eng: Steve is getting on the bus.
Prince William is second in line to the English throne.
simp: 威廉王子是英国王位第二顺位继承人
trad: 威廉王子是英國王位第二順位繼承人

eng: My hobby is making model planes.
simp: 我的嗜好是做模型飞机。
trad: 我的嗜好是做模型飛機。

eng: She picked flowers in the garden.
Please wait until I come back.
My parents sent me a postcard.
simp: 我父母给我寄了一张明信片。
trad: 我父母給我寄了一張明信片。

eng: She saddled him with the work.
I ordered those books from Germany.
simp: 我从德国订购了那些书。
trad: 我從德國訂購了那些書。

eng: More than twenty boys went there.
simp: 超过二十个男孩去了那裡。
trad: 超過二十個男孩去了那裡。

eng: Mariko is good at speaking English.
She took care of the children.
Please enjoy yourself at the dance.
I recognized your voice right away.
simp: 我立刻认出了你的声音。
trad: 我立刻認出了你的聲音。

eng: She was arrested by the police.
She doesn't speak Japanese at home.
My father is an electric engineer.
simp: 我父亲是个电子工程师。
trad: 我父親是個電子工程師。

eng: My most interesting friend is Jessie.
Study hard so you don't fail.
simp: 努力学习，这样你就不会失败。
trad: 努力學習，這樣你就不會失敗。

eng: I'd like you to go there.
It was raining when we arrived.
simp: 我们到的时候正在下雨。
trad: 我們到的時候正在下雨。

eng: Please have someone else do it.
Sally met Harry at the station.
simp: 莎莉在车站遇见了哈利。
trad: 莎莉在車站遇見了哈利。

eng: Mary is sitting at the desk.
Nowadays many people travel by car.
simp: 现在很多人开车去旅行。
trad: 現在很多人開車去旅行。

eng: Please help yourself to the fruit.
Mary went down to the kitchen.
She assigned the work to him.
simp: 她把这个工作派给他做。
trad: 她把這個工作派給他做。

eng: I'm three years younger than you.
Let's leave the decision to Tom.
I'd like for you to go.
I'm busy getting ready for tomorrow.
simp: 我正忙着为明天作准备。
trad: 我正忙著為明天作準備。

eng: She was crying as she answered.
She was sick in bed yesterday.
Ruriko is a high school student.
Jane didn't play tennis, did she?
Speaking Japanese is easy for me.
simp: 说日语对我来说很容易。
trad: 說日語對我來說很容易。

eng: Meg is as tall as Ken.
She is very pretty, isn't she?
My dog goes everywhere with me.
She said that he was handsome.
Lucy is a student from America.
simp: 露西是一名来自美国的学生。
trad: 露西是一名來自美國的學生。

eng: Please forgive me for being late.
He eats lunch at a cafeteria.
New York bristles with towering buildings.
Truth is difficult to find at the bottom of a well.
She was buried in her hometown.
She didn't want to get involved.
The police held him in custody.
What grade is your sister in?
We won't start till Bob comes.
simp: 鲍伯来前我们不会开始。
trad: 鮑伯來前我們不會開始。

eng: The muscles in his legs had atrophied during the seven months he was bedridden.
simp: 他的腿部肌肉在他卧床不起的七个月中萎缩了。
trad: 他的腿部肌肉在他臥床不起的七個月中萎縮了。

eng: Bob usually goes to bed at ten.
Bob has a lot of books in his room.
simp: 鲍勃在他房间里有很多书。
trad: 鮑勃在他房間裏有很多書。

eng: Bob gave Tina almost all the stamps he had collected, and kept only a few for himself.
simp: 鲍勃几乎把他所收集的所有邮票给了缇娜，只留了一点给他自己。
trad: 鮑勃幾乎把他所收集的所有郵票給了緹娜，只留了一點給他自己。

eng: Bob has too many books to read.
Bob could not control his anger.
simp: 鲍勃无法控制他的愤怒。
trad: 鮑勃無法控制他的憤怒。

eng: What would you like for supper?
This train leaves at nine o'clock.
Kumi is the girl whose father likes dogs.
simp: 库米是父亲喜欢狗的那个女孩。
trad: 庫米是父親喜歡狗的那個女孩。

eng: Tom will paint the fence tomorrow.
The men are wearing short sleeves.
You and I are good friends.
Bob worked as a clerk in the grocery store on Saturday.
simp: 每周六鲍勃在杂货店做店员。
trad: 每周六鮑勃在雜貨店做店員。

eng: Which road goes to city hall?
Bob forgot to bring the pass, which made him late for school.
simp: 鲍勃忘记带通行证，这使得他上学迟到了。
trad: 鮑勃忘記帶通行證，這使得他上學遲到了。

eng: Bob met her grandfather early in the morning.
simp: 清晨，鲍勃遇见了她的祖父。
trad: 清晨，鮑勃遇見了她的祖父。

eng: Please tell me your phone number.
simp: 请告诉我你的电话号码。
trad: 請告訴我你的電話號碼。

eng: Are you a doctor?
Can you move this desk by yourself?
simp: 你能自己搬这张桌子吗?
trad: 你能自己搬這張桌子嗎?

eng: The police accused him of murder.
You certainly play the piano well.
According to the newspaper, he committed suicide.
A group of young men were fighting.
What do you call this bird?
You look as healthy as ever.
What she bought was very expensive.
I'll give these kittens to whoever likes cats.
simp: 我会把这些小猫给喜欢的人
trad: 我會把這些小貓給喜歡的人

eng: To what degree can we trust him?
The lack of money is the root of all evil.
simp: 所有的罪恶源于金钱的不足
trad: 所有的罪惡源於金錢的不足

eng: Language is one of the most important inventions of mankind.
simp: 语言是人类最重大的发明之一。
trad: 語言是人類最重大的發明之一。

eng: He has an abhorrence of snakes.
He is sure of passing the examination.
simp: 他很确信他可以通过考试。
trad: 他很確信他可以通過考試。

eng: Thanks to his help, my work is going well now.
simp: 得到他的帮助，我的工作现在很顺利。
trad: 得到他的幫助，我的工作現在很順利。

eng: This medicine may cure him.
simp: 这个药可能可以治到他的病。
trad: 這個藥可能可以治到他的病。

eng: I don't believe you've met him.
simp: 我不相信你已经遇到了他。
trad: 我不相信你已經遇到了他。

eng: It is impossible to do it.
She may not come.
I left Japan ten years ago.
He is not content with his present salary.
simp: 他不满意他现在的工资。
trad: 他不滿意他現在的工資。

eng: I want to know if he'll come here.
simp: 我想知道他会不会来这里。
trad: 我想知道他會不會來這裏。

eng: The station is two meters away.
I don't have any money.
Do good to those who hate you.
We tried to come up to the standard.
We agreed to share the housework.
This song was written by Foster.
simp: 这首歌曲是由福斯特所写的。
trad: 這首歌曲是由福斯特所寫的。

eng: Can you explain why you were late?
simp: 你能解释一下你为什麽迟到吗？
trad: 你能解釋一下你為什麼遲到嗎？

eng: You don't like sashimi, do you?
A lot of soldiers were killed here.
Dick played the piano and Lucy sang.
Would you mind closing the window?
What he said really hurt me.
simp: 他说的话真的伤害了我。
trad: 他說的話真的傷害了我。

eng: Was this letter written by Ken?
You remind me of your brother.
What do you plan to do?
All things considered, I think you should go back home and take care of your parents.
simp: 全盘考虑后，我觉得你应该回家，照顾你的父母。
trad: 全盤考慮後，我覺得你應該回家，照顧你的父母。

eng: Will you lend me your dictionary?
simp: 把你的字典借给我好吗？
trad: 把你的字典借給我好嗎？

eng: Tom and Sue love each other.
You should have been more careful.
You'll find this map very useful.
simp: 你会发现这张地图非常有用。
trad: 你會發現這張地圖非常有用。

eng: Who is taller, you or Ken?
We will play soccer after school.
simp: 我们放学后会去踢足球。
trad: 我們放學後會去踢足球。

eng: At last, she gave in to him and told him the secret.
