eng: Would you please open the door?
You've put on weight, haven't you?
simp: 你的体重增加了，不是吗？
trad: 你的體重增加了，不是嗎？

eng: They are proud of their daughter.
simp: 他们以他们的女儿为荣。
trad: 他們以他們的女兒為榮。

eng: This book belongs to the library.
There are exceptions to every rule.
Tom is playing the violin now.
Where can I get a taxi?
simp: 我在哪裡可以搭到计程车？
trad: 我在哪裡可以搭到計程車？

eng: You should keep your mouth shut.
Add the honey, lemon juice, chopped almonds and the chopped apples.
simp: 加入蜂蜜，柠檬汁，切碎的杏仁和切碎的苹果。
trad: 加入蜂蜜，檸檬汁，切碎的杏仁和切碎的蘋果。

eng: It cost me ten thousand yen to have my television set repaired.
simp: 把我的电视机修好花了我一万日元。
trad: 把我的電視機修好花了我一萬日元。

eng: Why did you get up so early?
The value of the yen has soared.
He gave him a book.
Who is that girl? "That's Keiko."
simp: 那个女孩是谁？ "那是惠子。"
trad: 那個女孩是誰？ "那是惠子。"

eng: Hi! How are you?
It is two miles from here to the park.
simp: 从这裡到公园距离两英里。
trad: 從這裡到公園距離兩英裏。

eng: If you want to read this page later, just know that you can access it from the "Help" link at the very bottom of the website.
simp: 如果你之后想要读这个网页，只要知道你可以从这个网站最底下"帮助"的这个连结进入到这个网页。
trad: 如果你之後想要讀這個網頁，只要知道你可以從這個網站最底下"幫助"的這個連結進入到這個網頁。

eng: She gave us a present.
Fathers in cities spend eight hours in the office and another two hours traveling to and from their work on trains full of people every morning and evening.
simp: 都市裡的父亲每天花八个小时在办公室裡，而且每天早上和晚上另外再花两个小时在往返于工作并挤满了人的火车上。
trad: 都市裡的父親每天花八個小時在辦公室裡，而且每天早上和晚上另外再花兩個小時在往返於工作並擠滿了人的火車上。

eng: Everyone admires the pictures painted by him.
simp: 每个人都很欣赏他所画的图画。
trad: 每個人都很欣賞他所畫的圖畫。

eng: Happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
simp: 幸福的家庭都是相似的，不幸的家庭却各有各的不幸。
trad: 幸福的家庭都是相似的，不幸的家庭卻各有各的不幸。

eng: If you can't make it, call us as soon as possible.
simp: 如果你做不到，儘快连络我们。
trad: 如果你做不到，儘快連絡我們。

eng: They would capture as many people as possible.
simp: 他们会尽可能地抓更多的人。
trad: 他們會盡可能地抓更多的人。

eng: In some countries, the punishment for treason can be life in prison.
simp: 在一些国家，叛国罪的惩罚可以是终身监禁。
trad: 在一些國家，叛國罪的懲罰可以是終身監禁。

eng: Think before you act!
I saw him after ten years.
I was born into the Hebrew persuasion, but when I got older I converted to narcissism.
simp: 我天生具有希伯来人的说服才能，但当我年纪大了的时候，我把它转换成了自恋。
trad: 我天生具有希伯來人的說服才能，但當我年紀大了的時候，我把它轉換成了自戀。

eng: Everyone loves that place.
simp: 每一个人都喜欢那个地方。
trad: 每一個人都喜歡那個地方。

eng: Just as he was speaking, a fire broke out.
simp: 当他说话的时候，发生了火灾。
trad: 當他說話的時候，發生了火災。

eng: We know him.
I can probably give you seven minutes.
simp: 也许我可以给你七分钟。
trad: 也許我可以給你七分鐘。

eng: There was an earthquake this morning.
You really are tall, aren't you?
They have been here since 1989.
simp: 他们自1989年以来一直在这裡。
trad: 他們自1989年以來一直在這裡。

eng: Bob did not agree to the plan.
Did you call your friend in Canada?
simp: 你打电话给你在加拿大的朋友了吗?
trad: 你打電話給你在加拿大的朋友了嗎?

eng: Would you care for more coffee?
Where are you planning to stay?
That's a bad day for me.
We'll go when it quits raining.
Both my parents are at home now.
According to dentists, decayed teeth are not always caused by sweets.
simp: 根据牙医，蛀牙并不总是甜食所引起的。
trad: 根據牙醫，蛀牙並不總是甜食所引起的。

eng: He rescued the child from the fire.
simp: 他从火场中救了这个孩子。
trad: 他從火場中救了這個孩子。

eng: My sister can play the piano better than I can.
simp: 我妹妹钢琴可以弹得比我好。
trad: 我妹妹鋼琴可以彈得比我好。

eng: One day in July, we went to the sea.
simp: 七月的某一天，我们去了海边。
trad: 七月的某一天，我們去了海邊。

eng: I would like to go home now.
They sent their son to Europe to acquire culture.
simp: 他们送他们的儿子到欧洲去学习文化。
trad: 他們送他們的兒子到歐洲去學習文化。

eng: You should keep your promise.
Among the five of us, he's surely the one who can speak the most languages.
simp: 我们五个人当中，他一定是那个会说最多种语言的人。
trad: 我們五個人當中，他一定是那個會說最多種語言的人。

eng: Jim sometimes has disagreements with his wife.
simp: 吉姆有时与他的妻子意见分歧。
trad: 吉姆有時與他的妻子意見分歧。

eng: He crowded the books into the shelves.
Why do you need change?
He towers above the rest of the class.
Red, as opposed to green, is a sign of danger.
simp: 红色，相对于绿色，是危险的标志。
trad: 紅色，相對於綠色，是危險的標誌。

eng: How long will this rope hold?
Not everything can be bought with money.
simp: 不是所有的东西都可以用金钱买到。
trad: 不是所有的東西都可以用金錢買到。

eng: Do you have this in a bigger size?
simp: 你有比这个再大一点的尺寸吗?
trad: 你有比這個再大一點的尺寸嗎?

eng: They will tear down the old building in two days.
simp: 他们将在两天内拆除这栋旧的建筑物。
trad: 他們將在兩天內拆除這棟舊的建築物。

eng: This dog is the biggest in this town.
simp: 这隻狗是这个镇上最大的狗。
trad: 這隻狗是這個鎮上最大的狗。

eng: The bus should be coming soon.
simp: 公车应该很快就会来了。
trad: 公車應該很快就會來了。

eng: Could you please get me a taxi?
simp: 你可以帮我叫一辆计程车吗?
trad: 你可以幫我叫一輛計程車嗎?

eng: We will stay here until Sunday.
simp: 星期天前我们将会待在这裡。
trad: 星期天前我們將會待在這裡。

eng: Where do you want to go?
We went swimming at the beach.
Would you pass me the salt?
The meeting will be held tomorrow.
We often played chess after school.
simp: 我们常常在放学后下棋。
trad: 我們常常在放學後下棋。

eng: There was a car accident yesterday.
Tom showed interest in the plan.
simp: 汤姆对这个计划有兴趣。
trad: 湯姆對這個計劃有興趣。

eng: This book isn't interesting at all.
We accept all major credit cards.
simp: 我们接受所有主要的信用卡。
trad: 我們接受所有主要的信用卡。

eng: The war lasted nearly ten years.
simp: 这场战争持续了将近十年。
trad: 這場戰爭持續了將近十年。

eng: When did you change your address?
simp: 你什麽时候更改了你的地址?
trad: 你什麼時候更改了你的地址?

eng: Almost all the work is done now.
simp: 几乎所有的工作都完成了。
trad: 幾乎所有的工作都完成了。

eng: The children went out to play.
Bill brought me a glass of water.
Did you get the package I sent you?
simp: 你收到我寄给你的包裹了吗？
trad: 你收到我寄給你的包裹了嗎？

eng: You may come if you like.
This is a very beautiful flower.
simp: 这是一朵非常美丽的花。
trad: 這是一朵非常美麗的花。

eng: All the boys in class worked hard.
simp: 课堂上所有的男生都很用功。
trad: 課堂上所有的男生都很用功。

eng: They go to church every Sunday.
simp: 他们每个星期天上教堂。
trad: 他們每個星期天上教堂。

eng: We haven't known each other long.
simp: 我们彼此认识没有很久。
trad: 我們彼此認識沒有很久。

eng: They stole apples from my orchard.
simp: 他们从我的果园偷了苹果。
trad: 他們從我的果園偷了蘋果。

eng: They usually sleep in this room.
simp: 他们通常在这个房间裡睡觉。
trad: 他們通常在這個房間裡睡覺。

eng: The cat is adorable.
It is well known that up to the middle of the last century Japan was a feudal state.
simp: 众所周知，直到上个世纪中叶日本是一个封建国家。
trad: 眾所周知，直到上個世紀中葉日本是一個封建國家。

eng: This homework is difficult for me.
simp: 这个家庭作业对我来说很困难。
trad: 這個家庭作業對我來說很困難。

eng: This letter is addressed to you.
A penny saved is a penny earned.
simp: 省下了一分钱，就等于赚了一分钱。
trad: 省下了一分錢，就等於賺了一分錢。

eng: Could I see you a minute, please?
Do you know how to play mahjong?
That's a nice car you're driving.
Why don't you join our party?
simp: 你为什麽不参加我们的派对？
trad: 你為什麼不參加我們的派對？

eng: All of them agreed to the proposal.
simp: 他们所有的人都同意这项建议。
trad: 他們所有的人都同意這項建議。

eng: You can't use this washing machine.
simp: 您不能使用这台洗衣机。
trad: 您不能使用這臺洗衣機。

eng: Two for the lunch buffet, please.
What do you call this flower?
The building is seven stories high.
simp: 这栋建筑物有七层楼高。
trad: 這棟建築物有七層樓高。

eng: Tom and I are good friends.
I have read many modern authors.
simp: 我读过许多现代作家的作品。
trad: 我讀過許多現代作家的作品。

eng: Where should I put my laundry?
simp: 我应该把我要洗的衣服放在哪裡?
trad: 我應該把我要洗的衣服放在哪裡?

eng: That program is now being broadcast.
simp: 那个节目现在正在播出。
trad: 那個節目現在正在播出。

eng: Carol has just returned to her hotel.
simp: 卡罗刚刚回到她住的旅馆。
trad: 卡羅剛剛回到她住的旅館。

eng: This car is easy to handle.
Can I borrow some money from you?
We work every day but Sunday.
simp: 我们除了週日每一天都工作。
trad: 我們除了週日每一天都工作。

eng: Why did you open the box?
simp: 你为什麽打开这个盒子？
trad: 你為什麼打開這個盒子？

eng: Tom is taller than I am.
They should arrive by ten o'clock.
There's only a little milk left.
What is it that you want?
Whose house is across from yours?
simp: 你家对面的房子是谁的?
trad: 你家對面的房子是誰的?

eng: They must have made a mistake.
Are there many animals in the zoo?
simp: 动物园裡有很多动物吗？
trad: 動物園裡有很多動物嗎？

eng: You are free to go home.
Would you like to go abroad?
Why can't he play tennis today?
simp: 为什麽他今天不能打网球呢？
trad: 為什麼他今天不能打網球呢？

eng: Are there any apples in the box?
What did you say to Paula?
You must always tell the truth.
Tom did well considering his age.
simp: 考虑到他的年纪，他做得很好。
trad: 考慮到他的年紀，他做得很好。

eng: We sometimes swim in the lake.
This movie is worth seeing again.
simp: 这部电影值得再看一遍。
trad: 這部電影值得再看一遍。

eng: Because of his wealth, he was able to become a member of that club.
simp: 由于他的财富，他能够成为这个俱乐部的成员。
trad: 由於他的財富，他能夠成為這個俱樂部的成員。

eng: When did you begin playing golf?
simp: 你什麽时候开始打高尔夫球？
trad: 你什麼時候開始打高爾夫球？

eng: Yumi is good at playing tennis.
Why don't you have a party?
Would you mind opening the window?
We picked flowers in the garden.
Are you going to attend the meeting?
You'd better go home at once.
Would you pass the salt, please?
Why didn't you follow my advice?
simp: 你为什麽不听我的忠告？
trad: 你為什麼不聽我的忠告？

eng: They believe that Jane is honest.
They were not listening to music.
They were alone in the library.
What is the population of Japan?
For some reason I feel more alive at night.
simp: 不知道为什麽我夜裡觉得比较有活力。
trad: 不知道為什麼我夜裡覺得比較有活力。

eng: I really look forward to your visit in the near future.
simp: 我很期待在不久的将来您的光临。
trad: 我很期待在不久的將來您的光臨。

eng: Watch out for cars when you cross the street.
simp: 当你过马路的时候要当心汽车。
trad: 當你過馬路的時候要當心汽車。

eng: This desk is designed for children.
simp: 这张书桌是专门为儿童设计的。
trad: 這張書桌是專門為兒童設計的。

eng: Did you visit the Tower of London?
Do you have a table on the patio?
We soon caught up with them.
simp: 我们很快就追上了他们。
trad: 我們很快就追上了他們。

eng: As long as you're here, I'll stay.
simp: 只要你在这儿，我就会留下来。
trad: 只要你在這兒，我就會留下來。

eng: Wet clothes stick to your skin.
We should have taken his advice.
simp: 我们应该接受他的忠告的。
trad: 我們應該接受他的忠告的。

eng: Are you sure you haven't forgotten anything?
simp: 你确定你没有忘记什麽吗？
trad: 你確定你沒有忘記什麼嗎？

eng: Both Ken and Meg are my friends.
simp: 麦格和肯都是我的朋友。
trad: 麥格和肯都是我的朋友。

eng: What time is it in London now?
The enemy attacked us at night.
simp: 敌人在夜间攻击了我们。
trad: 敵人在夜間攻擊了我們。

eng: You should come home before six.
Ten years is a long time.
Didn't you write a letter to him?
We caught some large fish there.
simp: 我们在那裡抓了一些大鱼。
trad: 我們在那裡抓了一些大魚。

eng: Your mother is in critical condition.
Your composition has a few mistakes.
The monkey fell from the tree.
You can use my car if you like.
simp: 如果你喜欢你可以用我的车。
trad: 如果你喜歡你可以用我的車。

eng: The dog walked across the street.
When can we eat, I wonder.
simp: 我不知道我们什麽时候可以吃。
trad: 我不知道我們什麼時候可以吃。

eng: Talking during a concert is rude.
simp: 在音乐会中说话是不礼貌的。
trad: 在音樂會中說話是不禮貌的。

eng: What do you eat for breakfast?
When did you begin learning German?
simp: 你什麽时候开始学习德文?
trad: 你什麼時候開始學習德文?

eng: They made him sign the contract.
Would you please come again later?
Would you please take my picture?
You have to come with me.
Did he tell you what to do?
simp: 他告诉过你要做什麽吗？
trad: 他告訴過你要做什麼嗎？

eng: Come to my house whenever you like.
simp: 只要你喜欢，你随时可以来我家。
trad: 只要你喜歡，你隨時可以來我家。

eng: Did you buy her something for Christmas?
simp: 你圣诞节买东西给她了吗?
trad: 你聖誕節買東西給她了嗎?

eng: Will you take a personal check?
They broke into the jewelry shop.
That mountain is easy to climb.
Would you please lock the door?
We visited the museum last week.
simp: 我们上週参观了博物馆。
trad: 我們上週參觀了博物館。

eng: One language is never enough.
simp: 一种语言是永远不够的。
trad: 一種語言是永遠不夠的。

eng: I got up today with a pain in my neck.
simp: 我今天起床的时候脖子很痛。
trad: 我今天起床的時候脖子很痛。

eng: He is always yelling at his children.
They announced that a storm was coming.
simp: 他们宣布了暴风雨即将来临。
trad: 他們宣布了暴風雨即將來臨。

eng: We've received a lot of applications in answer to our advertisements.
simp: 我们已经收到了很多回应我们广告的申请。
trad: 我們已經收到了很多回應我們廣告的申請。

eng: Please scrape the skin off the potatoes.
All that has happened before, and will happen again.
simp: 所有以前发生过的事，都将会再次发生。
trad: 所有以前發生過的事，都將會再次發生。

eng: When did she break the window?
simp: 她什麽时候打破了窗户？
trad: 她什麼時候打破了窗戶？

eng: The girl did not say anything.
We have to pull the weeds.
You should have attended the meeting.
simp: 你应该参加这个会议的。
trad: 你應該參加這個會議的。

eng: They always go skiing in winter.
simp: 他们总是在冬天去滑雪。
trad: 他們總是在冬天去滑雪。

eng: You should follow the doctor's advice.
simp: 你应该遵照医生的忠告。
trad: 你應該遵照醫生的忠告。

eng: The train leaves in ten minutes.
I hope he'll be able to come! I'd like to see him.
simp: 我希望他能来！我想见他。
trad: 我希望他能來！我想見他。

eng: The news of his death spread.
simp: 他去世的消息传开来了。
trad: 他去世的消息傳開來了。

eng: You may leave your bag here.
simp: 你可以把你的袋子留在这裡。
trad: 你可以把你的袋子留在這裡。

eng: You really are rude, aren't you?
When do you want to go?
Could you send it to this address?
simp: 你能把它送到这个地址吗？
trad: 你能把它送到這個地址嗎？

eng: What's the point in doing that?
What's the point in doing that?
Your bicycle is better than mine.
He killed him to avenge his dead father.
simp: 他杀了他，以为他父亲的死报仇。
trad: 他殺了他，以為他父親的死報仇。

eng: He killed him to avenge his dead father.
simp: 他为了替死去的父亲报仇而杀了他。
trad: 他為了替死去的父親報仇而殺了他。

eng: Wearing a suit, he stood out.
You are very early this morning.
Bob missed the last train and had to take a taxi.
simp: Bob错过了最后一班火车，所以他必须搭计程车。
trad: Bob錯過了最後一班火車，所以他必須搭計程車。

eng: Tom's friends called him Mr Money Bags.
simp: 汤姆的朋友们叫他财神爷。
trad: 湯姆的朋友們叫他財神爺。

eng: Stella really is dead!
Number unobtainable.
It has just struck eight, hasn't it?
simp: 刚刚敲过了八点钟，不是吗？
trad: 剛剛敲過了八點鐘，不是嗎？

eng: The teacher asked me which book I liked.
simp: 老师问我我喜欢哪本书。
trad: 老師問我我喜歡哪本書。

eng: I heard someone in the crowd outside the station call my name.
simp: 我听到车站外的人群中有人在叫我的名字。
trad: 我聽到車站外的人群中有人在叫我的名字。

eng: We cannot see the other side of the moon.
simp: 我们看不到月亮的另一边。
trad: 我們看不到月亮的另一邊。

eng: The soldier kept a sharp lookout in the darkness.
simp: 这名士兵在黑暗中保持戒备。
trad: 這名士兵在黑暗中保持戒備。

eng: I prefer riding to walking.
The room was illuminated with red lights.
simp: 这个房间被红色的灯照亮了。
trad: 這個房間被紅色的燈照亮了。

eng: She is politeness itself.
Water freezes at 0 degrees Centigrade.
You are suitable for the job.
Why don't we have lunch together?
simp: 为什麽我们不一起吃午饭呢？
trad: 為什麼我們不一起吃午飯呢？

eng: Wait here till I come back.
simp: 在这儿等着，直到我回来。
trad: 在這兒等著，直到我回來。

eng: Yamamoto is one of my friends.
They are breaking down the wall.
The visitor sat across from me.
The old man starved to death.
You should be ashamed of your ignorance.
simp: 你应该为你的无知感到羞耻。
trad: 你應該為你的無知感到羞恥。

eng: I wish you were all mine! said the little black rabbit.
simp: 我希望你全都是我的! 小黑兔说。
trad: 我希望你全都是我的! 小黑兔說。

eng: In Wales we have a proverb.
simp: 在威尔斯，我们有一个句谚语。
trad: 在威爾斯，我們有一個句諺語。

eng: Look at me with your books closed.
simp: 把你的书閤起来看着我。
trad: 把你的書閤起來看著我。

eng: He likes finding faults in others.
We plan to climb that mountain.
We often play cards on Sunday.
Did he draw this picture by himself?
Which is heavier, lead or gold?
simp: 哪个比较重，铅还是黄金？
trad: 哪個比較重，鉛還是黃金？

eng: When did your father come home?
Your book is on the desk.
They waited for him for hours.
simp: 他们等了他好几个小时。
trad: 他們等了他好幾個小時。

eng: Tom is as tall as Jack.
You should stay at home today.
Where will you have lunch today?
simp: 你今天将在哪裡吃午餐?
trad: 你今天將在哪裡吃午餐?

eng: They may have missed the train.
There are many shrines in Kyoto.
What do you do before breakfast?
I don't have any money on me.
You have to make a reservation.
Carol studies very hard. So does Henry.
simp: 卡罗非常用功，亨利也是。
trad: 卡羅非常用功，亨利也是。

eng: Would you care for some tea?
Do you ever study in the library?
simp: 你曾经在图书馆读书吗?
trad: 你曾經在圖書館讀書嗎?

eng: Yumiko belongs to the tennis club.
simp: 由美子是网球俱乐部的成员。
trad: 由美子是網球俱樂部的成員。

eng: Andy is never late for a date.
We are going to leave tomorrow.
Betty talks as if she knew everything.
simp: 贝蒂说话的口气像是她知道了一切。
trad: 貝蒂說話的口氣像是她知道了一切。

eng: Would you like to come along?
I was much confused by his questions.
simp: 我对他的问题感到很困惑。
trad: 我對他的問題感到很困惑。

eng: He has not written to us since last February.
simp: 他从去年二月开始就没写信给我们。
trad: 他從去年二月開始就沒寫信給我們。

eng: The car overtook me.
He has a round face.
Resignation is the first lesson of life.
He had a hungry look.
We receive many telephone calls from abroad.
simp: 我们接到许多来自国外的电话。
trad: 我們接到許多來自國外的電話。

eng: She was envious of her cousin's success.
The Japanese Parliament today officially elected Ryoutarou Hashimoto as the country's 52nd prime minister.
simp: 日本国会今天正式选举了桥本龙太郎作为全国第52届总理。
trad: 日本國會今天正式選舉了橋本龍太郎作為全國第52屆總理。

eng: Before this car, I drove a Nissan.
simp: 在这辆车之前，我开的是辆日产汽车。
trad: 在這輛車之前，我開的是輛日產汽車。

eng: Can you tell silver and tin apart?
The meal satisfied his hunger.
simp: 这顿饭让他充饥解饿了。
trad: 這頓飯讓他充饑解餓了。

eng: Did you have a fight with Ken?
Don't put your elbows on the table.
simp: 不要把你的手肘放在桌子上。
trad: 不要把你的手肘放在桌子上。

eng: I want to talk with your uncle.
I am positive that he is wrong.
I went to the park last Sunday.
simp: 上个星期天我去了公园。
trad: 上個星期天我去了公園。

eng: Halley's Comet will come back in 2061.
I didn't really feel like going out.
He wants to work in a hospital.
He isn't my brother. He's my cousin.
simp: 他不是我的兄弟。他是我的表弟。
trad: 他不是我的兄弟。他是我的表弟。

eng: I want to keep my car there.
simp: 我想把我的车停放在那裡。
trad: 我想把我的車停放在那裡。

eng: I got up at six-thirty this morning.
simp: 我今天早上六点半起床。
trad: 我今天早上六點半起床。

eng: He walks in the park every morning.
simp: 他每天早上在公园裡散步。
trad: 他每天早上在公園裡散步。

eng: He may have missed the last train.
simp: 他可能错过了最后一班火车。
trad: 他可能錯過了最後一班火車。

eng: Don't make noise while eating soup.
simp: 当你喝汤的时候不要发出声音。
trad: 當你喝湯的時候不要發出聲音。

eng: He looks a bit tired, doesn't he?
simp: 他看起来有点累，不是吗？
trad: 他看起來有點累，不是嗎？

eng: I know the man sitting over there.
simp: 我认识坐在那裡的那个男人。
trad: 我認識坐在那裡的那個男人。

eng: He waited for me until I arrived.
He'll do whatever you ask him to.
simp: 他会做任何你要求他做的事。
trad: 他會做任何你要求他做的事。

eng: He is in London on business now.
I have two daughters and two sons.
simp: 我有两个女儿和两个儿子。
trad: 我有兩個女兒和兩個兒子。

eng: I am looking forward to seeing you.
How long will we have to wait?
I managed to catch the last train.
simp: 我设法赶上了最后一班火车。
trad: 我設法趕上了最後一班火車。

eng: I want to go there once more.
He did not appear until about noon.
simp: 直到快要中午前他都没出现。
trad: 直到快要中午前他都沒出現。

eng: He's a friend of my brother's.
simp: 他是我弟弟的一个朋友。
trad: 他是我弟弟的一個朋友。

eng: I was watching TV when Yumi came.
simp: 当由美来的时候我正在看电视。
trad: 當由美來的時候我正在看電視。

eng: His mother came to pick him up.
He stepped on my foot on purpose.
He has ambition, so he works hard.
simp: 他有抱负，所以他很努力工作。
trad: 他有抱負，所以他很努力工作。

eng: Do you like any of these pictures?
simp: 你喜欢这些照片裡的任何一张吗?
trad: 你喜歡這些照片裡的任何一張嗎?

eng: Do you like any of these pictures?
simp: 你喜欢这些画裡的任何一幅吗?
trad: 你喜歡這些畫裡的任何一幅嗎?

eng: He took a picture of the koala.
He was killed in a car accident.
I didn't know what to do, then.
simp: 那时我不知道该怎麽办。
trad: 那時我不知道該怎麼辦。

eng: He's three inches taller than I am.
I want to travel around the world.
I want to go wherever you're going.
I know that boy who is running.
simp: 我认识那个正在跑步的男孩。
trad: 我認識那個正在跑步的男孩。

eng: He has to take two science classes.
He found a ball in the garden.
simp: 他在花园裡找到了一颗球。
trad: 他在花園裡找到了一顆球。

eng: I study about two hours every day.
simp: 我每天读书大约两个小时。
trad: 我每天讀書大約兩個小時。

eng: I have no objection to your plan.
I don't know anything about their relationship.
simp: 我对他们的关係一无所知。
trad: 我對他們的關係一無所知。

eng: I will not go to school tomorrow.
I often go swimming in the river.
I can't make any sense of this.
I got up early in the morning.
He has dozens of books about Japan.
simp: 他有几十本关于日本的书。
trad: 他有幾十本關於日本的書。

eng: I can't figure out what he means.
Few students could understand what he said.
simp: 很少有学生能了解他说的话。
trad: 很少有學生能了解他說的話。

eng: Few students could understand what he said.
simp: 几乎没有学生能懂他所说的话。
trad: 幾乎沒有學生能懂他所說的話。

eng: He is a teacher at our school.
Her red dress made her stand out.
simp: 她的红色礼服使她引人注目。
trad: 她的紅色禮服使她引人註目。

eng: I have nothing in common with her.
He wasn't able to attend the party.
He asked if I liked Chinese food.
simp: 他问我是否喜欢中国菜。
trad: 他問我是否喜歡中國菜。

eng: I don't have an ear for music.
I don't really like the stores there.
simp: 我不是很喜欢那裡的商店。
trad: 我不是很喜歡那裡的商店。

eng: I'm old enough to support myself.
simp: 我年纪够大可以养活我自己。
trad: 我年紀夠大可以養活我自己。

eng: He grew up in a little village.
simp: 他在一个小村庄裡长大。
trad: 他在一個小村莊裡長大。

eng: I don't know where he comes from.
He asked for a drink of water.
I have been here for many years.
simp: 我在这裡已经很多年了。
trad: 我在這裡已經很多年了。

eng: I went there because I wanted to.
simp: 我去了那裡，因为我想去。
trad: 我去了那裡，因為我想去。

eng: I opened the box and looked inside.
I can't do anything but obey him.
simp: 我除了听从他之外什麽也不能做。
trad: 我除了聽從他之外什麼也不能做。

eng: He was in America at that time.
I met Meg in Kyoto last week.
simp: 我上週在京都遇到了梅格。
trad: 我上週在京都遇到了梅格。

eng: His wife gave birth to twin boys.
simp: 他的妻子生下了一对双胞胎男孩。
trad: 他的妻子生下了一對雙胞胎男孩。

eng: He drank very little of the water.
He has decided to become a teacher.
simp: 他已经决定要成为一名教师。
trad: 他已經決定要成為一名教師。

eng: He has been teaching for 20 years.
Five years is too long to wait.
simp: 五年太漫长而无法等待。
trad: 五年太漫長而無法等待。

eng: He managed to get there in time.
simp: 他设法及时到达那裡了。
trad: 他設法及時到達那裡了。

eng: What's your favorite climate?
And even outside these nations, English is perhaps more widely used as a medium of international communication than any other language.
simp: 甚至在这些国家以外，英语也许比其他任何语言更广泛地被使用来当作国际交流的媒介。
trad: 甚至在這些國家以外，英語也許比其他任何語言更廣泛地被使用來當作國際交流的媒介。

eng: That child has few friends.
I'm your flatmate Paul.
I had my composition corrected by the teacher.
simp: 我把我的作文拿给老师订正。
trad: 我把我的作文拿給老師訂正。

eng: The path zigzagged up the steep slope.
simp: 这条小路沿着陡峭的斜坡蜿蜒而上。
trad: 這條小路沿著陡峭的斜坡蜿蜒而上。

eng: Send me a letter when you arrive.
simp: 当你到达时寄封信给我。
trad: 當你到達時寄封信給我。

eng: I'm going on vacation next week.
This boat sails through the Strait of Gibraltar.
simp: 这艘船航行通过了直布罗陀海峡。
trad: 這艘船航行通過了直布羅陀海峽。

eng: What happened? The car's slowing down.
simp: 发生了什麽事？车子慢下来了。
trad: 發生了什麼事？車子慢下來了。

eng: They burst into tears.
She's got a good eye for paintings.
simp: 她对绘画有很好的鑑赏力。
trad: 她對繪畫有很好的鑑賞力。

eng: She bought six yards of cloth for a dress.
simp: 她买了六码的布做衣服。
trad: 她買了六碼的布做衣服。

eng: Shall I close the door?
The path zigzagged up the steep slope.
simp: 蜿蜒的小路爬上了陡坡。
trad: 蜿蜒的小路爬上了陡坡。

eng: I don't think she can speak French.
Every door in the house is locked.
simp: 这房子裡的每一扇门都被锁上了。
trad: 這房子裡的每一扇門都被鎖上了。

eng: I got sick from drinking too much.
simp: 因为喝酒喝太多，所以我生病了。
trad: 因為喝酒喝太多，所以我生病了。

eng: I have heard nothing from him yet.
Graham Greene is a favorite author of mine.
simp: 格雷厄姆葛林是我最喜欢的作家之一。
trad: 格雷厄姆葛林是我最喜歡的作家之一。

eng: This classroom is separated from that one by a wall.
simp: 这间教室与那间隔着一堵墙。
trad: 這間教室與那間隔著一堵墻。

eng: He thinks he's so great.
China and Mongolia are separated by the Great Wall of China.
simp: 中国与蒙古隔着万里长城。
trad: 中國與蒙古隔著萬裏長城。

eng: Is this "giving sermons" or "sticking one's nose in someone else's business"?
Hi, Bill. How are you?
He went on reading the book as if nothing had happened.
simp: 他继续读书，好像什麽事也没有发生。
trad: 他繼續讀書，好像什麼事也沒有發生。

eng: She made cookies for the children.
My home is separated from his by a river.
simp: 我的家与他的隔着一条江。
trad: 我的家與他的隔著一條江。

eng: Which ocean separates China and America?
simp: 中国与美国隔着哪个大洋？
trad: 中國與美國隔著哪個大洋？

eng: They are separated by a great distance.
simp: 他们之间隔着很远的距离。
trad: 他們之間隔著很遠的距離。

eng: What separates Guangdong from Guangxi?
simp: 广东与广西之间隔着什么？
trad: 廣東與廣西之間隔著什麼？

eng: We are only separated by the Pacific Ocean.
simp: 我们之间不只隔着太平洋。
trad: 我們之間不只隔著太平洋。

eng: Genius and madness are separated only by success.
simp: 天才与精神错乱之间只隔着成功。
trad: 天才與精神錯亂之間只隔著成功。

eng: One day apart seems like a separation of three years.
He's of the type "do as I say, not as I do".
simp: 他是"说一套，做一套" 的人。
trad: 他是"說一套，做一套" 的人。

eng: He must have taken the wrong train.
I was brought up by my grandmother.
simp: 我被我的祖母抚养长大。
trad: 我被我的祖母撫養長大。

eng: I saw Julie off at the airport.
He often laughs at his own jokes.
simp: 他常常因他自己的笑话而笑。
trad: 他常常因他自己的笑話而笑。

eng: I think you're sitting in my seat.
simp: 我想你坐到我的座位了。
trad: 我想你坐到我的座位了。

eng: He has all but finished the work.
simp: 他几乎已经完成这个工作了。
trad: 他幾乎已經完成這個工作了。

eng: I forgot the date of the meeting.
I don't know what day he'll come.
simp: 我不知道他星期几会来。
trad: 我不知道他星期幾會來。

eng: How about a drink after the game?
simp: 比赛结束后喝一杯怎麽样？
trad: 比賽結束後喝一杯怎麼樣？

eng: I know those tall girls quite well.
simp: 我跟那些高个子的女孩很熟稔。
trad: 我跟那些高個子的女孩很熟稔。

eng: I can hardly see without my glasses.
simp: 没有了我的眼镜我几乎看不到。
trad: 沒有了我的眼鏡我幾乎看不到。

eng: How long ago did the bus leave?
simp: 这辆公车多久前离开的?
trad: 這輛公車多久前離開的?

eng: He usually goes to school by bus.
I think that fact is very important.
He read a book written in English.
simp: 他读了一本用英文写的书。
trad: 他讀了一本用英文寫的書。

eng: I was born on October 10, 1972.
I hope I'll see you again soon.
simp: 我希望我会很快再见到你。
trad: 我希望我會很快再見到你。

eng: I usually go to school by bus.
I go to the country every summer.
He lives by himself in the woods.
He stuck his pencil behind his ear.
simp: 他把他的铅笔放在他的耳朵后面。
trad: 他把他的鉛筆放在他的耳朵後面。

eng: He scraped the mud off his boots.
I will give you anything you want.
simp: 我会给你任何你想要东西。
trad: 我會給你任何你想要東西。

eng: I went for a walk after breakfast.
He didn't know what to do next.
simp: 他不知道下一步要做什麽。
trad: 他不知道下一步要做什麼。

eng: I forgot to bring my I.D. card.
He lived in Matsue for seven years.
I hear that she's a famous actress.
simp: 我听说她是个有名的演员。
trad: 我聽說她是個有名的演員。

eng: I had my brother repair my bicycle.
simp: 我让我的哥哥修理我的脚踏车。
trad: 我讓我的哥哥修理我的腳踏車。

eng: He told the students to be quiet.
He hit the ball with his racket.
I have a large collection of stamps.
I waited for him all day long.
He used to meditate in the morning.
simp: 他过去时常在早上的时候冥想。
trad: 他過去時常在早上的時候冥想。

eng: He likes to sing in the bathtub.
I stayed with my uncle last week.
simp: 我上週跟我叔叔住在一起。
trad: 我上週跟我叔叔住在一起。

eng: I spoke with him about the matter.
I don't like any of these records.
simp: 我不喜欢这些唱片中的任何一张。
trad: 我不喜歡這些唱片中的任何一張。

eng: He had no luck in finding work.
He had no luck in finding work.
How many people are in this room?
simp: 在这个房间裡有多少人？
trad: 在這個房間裡有多少人？

eng: Helen got off at the next stop.
He came from a tiny mountain town.
I don't know which button to push.
simp: 我不知道要按哪个按钮。
trad: 我不知道要按哪個按鈕。

eng: Good morning. It's time to wake up.
simp: 早安。是该醒来的时候了。
trad: 早安。是該醒來的時候了。

eng: He was hurt in a car accident.
simp: 他在一次车祸中受伤了。
trad: 他在一次車禍中受傷了。

eng: I have almost no money with me.
He is afraid of getting lung cancer.
His office is on the eighth floor.
I like to walk in the country.
I hear that Nancy is very pretty.
I am happy to see you here.
simp: 我很高兴在这裡看到你。
trad: 我很高興在這裡看到你。

eng: I walked as slowly as I could.
Do you like to drive?
He lives across the street from us.
He kissed his daughter on the forehead.
simp: 他亲了亲他女儿的额头。
trad: 他親了親他女兒的額頭。

eng: He was late because of the snow.
simp: 他因为下雪所以迟到了。
trad: 他因為下雪所以遲到了。

eng: He is going to be an engineer.
I want to brush up my English.
simp: 我要温习一下我的英文。
trad: 我要溫習一下我的英文。

eng: I told the policeman what I knew.
simp: 我告诉了警察我所知道的。
trad: 我告訴了警察我所知道的。

eng: He left his son a large fortune.
simp: 他留给了他的儿子一大笔财富。
trad: 他留給了他的兒子一大筆財富。

eng: I helped my brother move his desk.
simp: 我帮我弟弟搬了他的书桌。
trad: 我幫我弟弟搬了他的書桌。

eng: How long are you staying in Japan?
He works from nine to five-thirty.
simp: 他从早上九点工作到下午五点半。
trad: 他從早上九點工作到下午五點半。

eng: He bought a small house in Kyoto.
simp: 他在京都买了一个小房子。
trad: 他在京都買了一個小房子。

eng: He's not as tall as you are.

eng: I would like to eat.
I want to sleep.
I'm hungry!
Now I am free.
Now I am free.
I have nothing more to do today.

eng: I heard the news on the radio.

eng: But I don't think it's strange at all.

eng: He fell asleep with the radio on.

eng: He was able to solve the problem.

He has been very busy this week.

trad: 他這個星期一直很忙碌。

eng: I don't think I'll ever meet him.

eng: He usually went to bed at eleven.

eng: I felt hungry after the long walk.

eng: I have to take the test again.

eng: He will be coming to the party.

eng: He has been to Europe many times.
He got up at five as usual.

eng: I don't know what time it is.

I don't believe such things exist.
simp: 我不相信这样的事情存在。

eng: They bought a box of cookies.
I usually go to bed before ten.

eng: I didn't notice the light turn red.

eng: He was caught cheating in the exam.

eng: I take a bath every other day.

eng: I am not going anywhere on Sunday.
Except for one person, everybody went home.
simp: 除了一人，大家都回家了。

eng: I couldn't get him to stop smoking.

eng: He will make a good team captain.

I feel like getting some fresh air.

eng: I paid five dollars for the book.

I don't want to hurt his feelings.

eng: I always catch colds in the winter.

eng: Though passion may have strained, it must not break our bonds of affection.

trad: 雖然激情可能會褪去，卻不容它破壞我們感情上的聯繫。

eng: Until when will you stay in Japan?

eng: He tried to unify the various groups.

eng: I bumped into him at the station.

eng: How much is your monthly gas bill?

eng: I don't like the taste of tomatoes.

eng: Hang on a minute. I'll call Jimmy.

eng: I put some cream in my coffee.

eng: When I was in London last year, someone broke into my room and stole my wallet.

trad: 當我去年在倫敦的時候，有人闖進了我的房間，偷走了我的錢包。

eng: I expect her back by six o'clock.

I saw grandfather last week.
They can fish.

simp: 我们应该努力做到生活的哲学；获得的财富也会烟消云散。
trad: 我們應該努力做到生活的哲學；獲得的財富也會煙消雲散。

eng: How long does it take to go from here to the Hilton Hotel?

eng: I owe my success to him.

eng: Not a few people think that all foreign-made articles are superior to ones made in this country.
simp: 不少人认为，所有外国製造的物品均优于那些在本国所製造的。

eng: He is out of control when drunk.

trad: 我們ACME有限公司，特此宣布，我們將盡我們的力量抵制這種惡意收購。

eng: Father has now got a superior position in his office.

eng: She resembles her mother in every respect.
simp: 她在各方面都像她的母亲。

eng: He lost his eyesight in the accident.
I went there by bus and train.

eng: I want him to play the guitar.

eng: He was born on July 28th, 1888.

eng: I don't know anything about their plan.

eng: He wanted to get his shirts washed.

eng: How long have you known Miss Smith?

eng: I helped my father with the work.
simp: 我帮我父亲做这个工作。

eng: How do you like your eggs done?

eng: I studied for a while this morning.

eng: Hollywood isn't what it used to be.

eng: I have to find a part-time job.

eng: He has at least one thousand books.

eng: I warned him not to be late.

eng: We couldn't open the door because it was locked from within.

eng: Let's finish up in a hurry.

simp: 我叔叔住在国外很多年了。

eng: He has a good grasp of English.

simp: 修饰名词的东西（形容词，或形容词相等语）。
trad: 修飾名詞的東西（形容詞，或形容詞相等語）。

eng: I'm tired of dancing.
You will soon hear from him.

trad: 你很快就會收到他的信。

eng: We spent the entire day on the beach.
You shouldn't tell him anything about her.
simp: 你不应该告诉他任何关于她的事。
trad: 你不應該告訴他任何關於她的事。

I feel sad every now and then.
I feel sad every now and then.
She is as beautiful as Snow White.

eng: You're welcome.
You are welcome.

It looks like the dog wants something to eat.

eng: Neither of those two students passed the test.

eng: Life would be impossible without the sun.

eng: No one can control him.

Please help me.
Shall we rest a bit?
She's only a child.
Remember!
Lonely people perpetuate their own loneliness through their fear of others.
simp: 孤独的人会孤独，是因为他畏惧他人。
trad: 孤獨的人會孤獨，是因為他畏懼他人。

eng: I heard you.
This is the very book you wanted.
He is old enough to understand it.
simp: 他已经到了能瞭解它的年纪。
trad: 他已經到了能瞭解它的年紀。

eng: He is old enough to understand it.
simp: 他年纪够大可以瞭解它。
trad: 他年紀夠大可以瞭解它。

eng: He is an excellent fixer, and has always been regarded as such.
simp: 他是一个出色的调停者，并一直被人认为如此。
trad: 他是一個出色的調停者，並一直被人認為如此。

eng: Since then he had put his whole soul into his work.
simp: 从那时起，他就把他整个灵魂投入到他的工作。
trad: 從那時起，他就把他整個靈魂投入到他的工作。

eng: Since then he had put his whole soul into his work.
simp: 从那时起，他就全心全意地投入到他的工作。
trad: 從那時起，他就全心全意地投入到他的工作。

eng: An intellectual is a man who says a simple thing in a difficult way; an artist is a man who says a difficult thing in a simple way.
simp: 知识分子就是用困难的方式说一件简单的事情的人；艺术家就是用简单的方法说一件困难的事情的人。
trad: 知識分子就是用困難的方式說一件簡單的事情的人；藝術家就是用簡單的方法說一件困難的事情的人。

eng: Prove it by experiment.
He extended his right arm.
This has been the driest six months in thirty years.
simp: 这是三十年代以来最乾旱的六月。
trad: 這是三十年代以來最乾旱的六月。

eng: I run.
The sun went below the horizon.
We know that all men are mortal.
simp: 我们知道人皆难免一死。
trad: 我們知道人皆難免一死。

eng: No students were absent.
We were all greatly amused by his jokes.
simp: 我们都被他的笑话逗得很开心。
trad: 我們都被他的笑話逗得很開心。

eng: I know a guy named Smith.
simp: 我认识一位史密斯先生。
trad: 我認識一位史密斯先生。

eng: He is very much of a scholar.
simp: 他是一位非常了不起的学者。
trad: 他是一位非常了不起的學者。

eng: He is confronted by many difficulties.
He came at three in the afternoon.
simp: 他在下午三点钟的时候来了。
trad: 他在下午三點鐘的時候來了。

eng: I am a Japanese high school girl.
simp: 我是一个日本的高中女生。
trad: 我是一個日本的高中女生。

eng: I listened to some CDs last night.
simp: 我昨晚了听一些唱片光碟。
trad: 我昨晚了聽一些唱片光碟。

eng: I was angry because he was late.
simp: 因为他迟到了，所以我很生气。
trad: 因為他遲到了，所以我很生氣。

eng: I was tired, but I couldn't sleep.
He was laughed at by his friends.
He often takes me for a drive.
He visited her house the other day.
How long has Ken lived in Kobe?
simp: 肯已经在神户住了多久？
trad: 肯已經在神戶住了多久？

eng: I have lived in Tokyo since 1985.
simp: 我从1985年开始就一直住在东京。
trad: 我從1985年開始就一直住在東京。

eng: Everyone can help ensure that sentences sound correct, and are correctly spelled.
simp: 每个人都可以协助确保句子唸起来正确且拼写正确。
trad: 每個人都可以協助確保句子唸起來正確且拼寫正確。

eng: Coffee ends a meal.
simp: 以咖啡来作一顿饭的结束。
trad: 以咖啡來作一頓飯的結束。

eng: We give here a list of the usual Esperanto-related questions.
simp: 我们在这裡罗列了通常有关世界语的问题。
trad: 我們在這裡羅列了通常有關世界語的問題。

eng: Helen graduated from high school last year.
simp: 海伦去年从高中毕业了。
trad: 海倫去年從高中畢業了。

eng: I have been in Kobe since 1980.
simp: 我从1980年开始一直在神户。
trad: 我從1980年開始一直在神戶。

eng: He is still sitting on the bench.
I was born in Hiroshima in 1945.
I was almost hit by a car.
He seldom, if ever, goes to church.
simp: 他很少，如果有的话，去教堂。
trad: 他很少，如果有的話，去教堂。

eng: He was run over by a car.
He may have taken the wrong train.
I saw you driving your new car.
simp: 我看到你开着你的新车。
trad: 我看到你開著你的新車。

eng: I enjoyed driving on the new highway.
simp: 我很喜欢在新的高速公路上开车。
trad: 我很喜歡在新的高速公路上開車。

eng: I met her late in the evening.
He built a new house for himself.
simp: 他给自己盖了一栋新房子。
trad: 他給自己蓋了一棟新房子。

eng: I'll be back at seven o'clock.
He painted a picture of a dog.
How do you spell your family name?
How do you want your hair cut?
How do you want your hair cut?
He went to New York on business.
He broke up the chair for firewood.
I intend to go to the barbershop.
I'm afraid I must say goodbye.
The child has a case of chicken pox.
Do you speak Klingon?
A word is enough to a wise man.
simp: 对聪明人说话，一语即足。
trad: 對聰明人說話，一語即足。

eng: Your mother must have been beautiful when she was young.
simp: 你母亲年轻的时候一定很美。
trad: 你母親年輕的時候一定很美。

eng: My wife's part-time job brings in a little extra money.
simp: 我太太兼职的工作赚进了一些额外的钱。
trad: 我太太兼職的工作賺進了一些額外的錢。

eng: Hello, are you Mr Ogawa?
Do you want to be an actor in a movie?
simp: 你想成为一名电影演员吗？
trad: 你想成為一名電影演員嗎？

eng: Will he be able to catch the train?
She presumes him to be innocent.
A cup of coffee relieved me of my headache.
simp: 一杯咖啡纾解了我的头痛。
trad: 一杯咖啡紓解了我的頭痛。

eng: Seen from a plane, that island is very beautiful.
simp: 从飞机上看，那是个非常美丽的岛屿。
trad: 從飛機上看，那是個非常美麗的島嶼。

eng: The police will soon arrive on the scene.
She is watering the flowers.
He had the illusion that he was a genius.
Look at that tall building.
As soon as I left home, I ran into her.
simp: 我一离开家就遇见了她。
trad: 我一離開家就遇見了她。

eng: This animal is bigger than that one.
You obtained more than me.
To my surprise, the door was unlocked.
simp: 令我惊讶的是，门没上锁。
trad: 令我驚訝的是，門沒上鎖。

eng: Was the baby crying then?
We live in the United States.
I don't want to talk about the weather.
I got it free.
My mother took me to the park.
I have been reading this for a few hours.
simp: 我一直读这个读了几个小时。
trad: 我一直讀這個讀了幾個小時。

eng: That's nonsense. Nobody but a fool would believe it.
simp: 那是无稽之谈。只有傻瓜才会相信。
trad: 那是無稽之談。只有傻瓜才會相信。

eng: His words surprised me.
Those houses are 500 years old.
The miser opened the box to find his money stolen.
simp: 这个守财奴打开了盒子，发现他的钱被偷了。
trad: 這個守財奴打開了盒子，發現他的錢被偷了。

eng: I can dispense with her help.
Those pictures were painted by him.
Water is much needed.
One of the dogs is alive.
simp: 这些狗中的其中一隻是活的。
trad: 這些狗中的其中一隻是活的。

eng: Those chairs are in the way.
Please put those chairs away.
These flowers should be sheltered from the rain.
simp: 应该为这些花遮挡风雨。
trad: 應該為這些花遮擋風雨。

eng: I'll gladly pay you anytime.
We were more or less disappointed about the election.
simp: 我们或多或少对这次的选举感到失望。
trad: 我們或多或少對這次的選舉感到失望。

eng: It rained on and off all day.
simp: 雨断断续续地下了一整天。
trad: 雨斷斷續續地下了一整天。

eng: May they live long!
Who is this, please?
Actions speak louder than words.
Actions speak louder than words.
Actions speak louder than words.
She showed us a beautiful hat.
simp: 她给我们看了一顶漂亮的帽子。
trad: 她給我們看了一頂漂亮的帽子。

eng: His answer depends on his mood.
simp: 他的答桉取决于他的心情。
trad: 他的答案取決於他的心情。

eng: His answer depends on his mood.
simp: 他的答桉要看他的心情而定。
trad: 他的答案要看他的心情而定。

eng: She surpasses me in English.
He is now either in Rome or in Paris.
simp: 他不是在罗马，就是在巴黎。
trad: 他不是在羅馬，就是在巴黎。

eng: He has a lot of original ideas.
He failed to pass his driving test.
simp: 他没有通过他的驾驶考试。
trad: 他沒有通過他的駕駛考試。

eng: He saw a dog near the door.
simp: 他在门附近看到了一隻狗。
trad: 他在門附近看到了一隻狗。

eng: I am always at home on Sundays.
I don't blame you for hitting him.
I was out of town on vacation.
How are you going to get home?
Have you finished writing the letter yet?
How long have you been in Kushiro?
He likes taking care of the garden.
I spent last Sunday reading a novel.
simp: 我上週日花时间看了一本小说。
trad: 我上週日花時間看了一本小說。

eng: I think you're a really nice guy.
simp: 我认为你真的是一个好人。
trad: 我認為你真的是一個好人。

eng: He said that you had better go.
He gave us the signal to begin.
simp: 他给了我们开始的信号。
trad: 他給了我們開始的信號。

eng: He gave us the signal to begin.
simp: 他给了我们信号让我们开始。
trad: 他給了我們信號讓我們開始。

eng: I didn't go to school last month.
He quickly went out of the room.
He has a large family to support.
He has a large family to support.
I told you to stop, didn't I?
simp: 我告诉了你停下来，不是吗？
trad: 我告訴了你停下來，不是嗎？

eng: He was admitted without taking the exam.
Do you know why she couldn't come?
simp: 你知道她为什麽不能来吗？
trad: 你知道她為什麼不能來嗎？

eng: I need a good pair of sunglasses.
simp: 我需要一副好的太阳眼镜。
trad: 我需要一副好的太陽眼鏡。

eng: He stayed there a couple of days.
He found the box under the table.
simp: 他在桌子底下发现了这个盒子。
trad: 他在桌子底下發現了這個盒子。

eng: Give this book to whoever wants it.
I'll call as soon as I am at the airport.
simp: 我一到机场就会打电话。
trad: 我一到機場就會打電話。

eng: I bought this book the other day.
I don't blame you for doing that.
I can't remember how to go there.
simp: 我不记得怎麽去那裡了。
trad: 我不記得怎麼去那裡了。

eng: He lived to be seventy years old.
He introduced me to a pretty girl.
simp: 他把我介绍给了一个漂亮的女孩。
trad: 他把我介紹給了一個漂亮的女孩。

eng: I was unable to complete the task.
Interest in baseball cuts across classes and ages in this country.
simp: 这个国家裡不同年龄阶级的人都减少了对棒球的兴趣。
trad: 這個國家裡不同年齡階級的人都減少了對棒球的興趣。

eng: He backed his car into the garage.
He is very good at playing violin.
He was tired, but he kept working.
simp: 他累了，但是他继续工作。
trad: 他累了，但是他繼續工作。

eng: He bought his daughter a new dress.
simp: 他买了新衣服给他的女儿。
trad: 他買了新衣服給他的女兒。

eng: I must hand in the report today.
I want to buy something to eat.
I went skiing at Zao last winter.
simp: 我去年冬天去藏王滑雪。
trad: 我去年冬天去藏王滑雪。

eng: I want to eat some cake first.
I don't mind walking in the rain.
I think this book is worth reading.
simp: 我觉得这本书值得一读。
trad: 我覺得這本書值得一讀。

eng: He is the father of two children.
I was delayed by a traffic jam.
I don't like the way he talks.
simp: 我不喜欢他讲话的样子。
trad: 我不喜歡他講話的樣子。

eng: He would not listen to my advice.
He dropped the cup and broke it.
simp: 他把杯子掉到地板上打碎了。
trad: 他把杯子掉到地板上打碎了。

eng: I arrived at Narita Airport this morning.
simp: 我今天早上抵达了成田机场。
trad: 我今天早上抵達了成田機場。

eng: For that reason, he lost his job.
simp: 因为那个原因，他失去了工作。
trad: 因為那個原因，他失去了工作。

eng: I asked Tom about his new book.
simp: 我问了汤姆关于他的新书的事。
trad: 我問了湯姆關於他的新書的事。

eng: I was tired, so I didn't go.
I have known him for ten years.
He often stays up late at night.
He comes to Tokyo once a year.
I found a coin on the sidewalk.
simp: 我在人行道上发现了一枚硬币。
trad: 我在人行道上發現了一枚硬幣。

eng: I had him write it.
Many TV programs have a bad influence on children.
simp: 许多电视节目对儿童有不良的影响。
trad: 許多電視節目對兒童有不良的影響。

eng: It was so still that you would have heard a pin drop.
simp: 安静到连针掉在地上的声音你都会听得到。
trad: 安靜到連針掉在地上的聲音你都會聽得到。

eng: It took me half an hour to work out this problem.
simp: 我花了一个半小时的时间解决这个问题。
trad: 我花了一個半小時的時間解決這個問題。

eng: I was born in the winter.
How do you spend the New Year?
Does it sound like I'm in love?
simp: 听起来像是我恋爱了吗？
trad: 聽起來像是我戀愛了嗎？

eng: Do you know when she will come?
simp: 你知道她什麽时候会来吗？
trad: 你知道她什麼時候會來嗎？

eng: Her mother made her a new dress.
simp: 她的妈妈给她做一件新衣服。
trad: 她的媽媽給她做一件新衣服。

eng: He arrived in time for the meeting.
I need some help with my work.
simp: 我在我的工作上需要一些帮助。
trad: 我在我的工作上需要一些幫助。

eng: He put his hands in his pockets.
I want to get rid of it.
I am expecting a letter from her.
He got off at the next station.
He won't go on to graduate school.
simp: 他不会继续去上研究所。
trad: 他不會繼續去上研究所。

eng: I am in favor of your proposal.
He thought that he was a genius.
I agree with your opinion about taxes.
simp: 我同意你对于税的意见。
trad: 我同意你對於稅的意見。

eng: He is very stingy with his money.
Hurry up, or you'll miss the bus.
simp: 快点，否则你会错过公车。
trad: 快點，否則你會錯過公車。

eng: I will play the guitar for you.
Hokkaido is to the north of Honshu.
simp: 北海道在日本本州的北部。
trad: 北海道在日本本州的北部。

eng: He lost his eyesight in an accident.
simp: 他在一次意外中失去了他的视力。
trad: 他在一次意外中失去了他的視力。

eng: I expected him to offer some help.
simp: 我期待他提供一些帮助。
trad: 我期待他提供一些幫助。

eng: He was afraid of being laughed at.
He's a little taller than you are.
I usually got to bed about eleven.
simp: 我通常约十一点钟上床睡觉。
trad: 我通常約十一點鐘上床睡覺。

eng: I advise you to give up drinking.
Even with all his money, he's unhappy.
simp: 儘管他有那麽多钱，他并不快乐。
trad: 儘管他有那麼多錢，他並不快樂。

eng: I forgot to give him the message.
simp: 我忘了告诉他这个消息。
trad: 我忘了告訴他這個消息。

eng: I don't know when he'll come again.
simp: 我不知道他什麽时候会再来的。
trad: 我不知道他什麼時候會再來的。

eng: He is studying in the library now.
To me, there aren't any fundamental differences between the cultures of these two countries.
simp: 对我而言，这两个国家的文化没有什么根本的区别。
trad: 對我而言，這兩個國家的文化沒有什麼根本的區別。

eng: We're all human beings, so in my opinion each country's culture is 90% the same.
simp: 因为我们都是人类，所以我的观点是每个国家的文化其实百分之九十一样。
trad: 因為我們都是人類，所以我的觀點是每個國家的文化其實百分之九十一樣。

eng: Although people like to focus on the differences, I think that on the whole it's the same.
simp: 虽然人们喜欢集中于不同的方面，但是我认为大部分的差不多。
trad: 雖然人們喜歡集中於不同的方面，但是我認為大部分的差不多。

eng: When answering this question, some people might put forward this kind of example: "Chinese people are very hospitable, whilst English people are more reserved."
simp: 回答这个问题时，有的人可能提出“中国人很好客而英国人比较矜持的”这样的例子。
trad: 回答這個問題時，有的人可能提出“中國人很好客而英國人比較矜持的”這樣的例子。

eng: Maybe this opinion is correct.
simp: 这个看法可能是正确的。
trad: 這個看法可能是正確的。

eng: However, I've never been a guest in an English household that wasn't generous.
simp: 不过，我从来没有在一个小气的英国家庭做过客。
trad: 不過，我從來沒有在一個小氣的英國家庭做過客。

eng: It seems that everyone likes to be generous in welcoming guests to their home.
simp: 好像所有的人喜欢大方地欢迎客人来他们家。
trad: 好像所有的人喜歡大方地歡迎客人來他們家。

eng: If there are genuine differences between these two cultures, I think that the largest are certainly in what you think about foreigners studying your native language.
simp: 如果这两个文化有真实的不同，我认为最大的准是在关于外国人学习自己的母语的意见。
trad: 如果這兩個文化有真實的不同，我認為最大的準是在關於外國人學習自己的母語的意見。

eng: I think that English people might be more used to language learners than people in other countries.
simp: 我觉得英国人可能比别的国家习惯跟语言学习者说话。
trad: 我覺得英國人可能比別的國家習慣跟語言學習者說話。

eng: This is due to English being a world language.
simp: 这是因为英语是全球性的语言。
trad: 這是因為英語是全球性的語言。

eng: There are many people in the world studying English, so English people are used to learners' non-standard accents, their grammatical errors and so on.
simp: 世界上学习英语的人很多，所以英国人习惯学习者的不标准的口音、语法错误等等。
trad: 世界上學習英語的人很多，所以英國人習慣學習者的不標準的口音、語法錯誤等等。

eng: The result is that English people usually have no problem understanding what foreigners say.
simp: 结果是英国人平时没问题听得懂外国人说的话。
trad: 結果是英國人平時沒問題聽得懂外國人說的話。

eng: Of course, another explanation of this situation is that Chinese is harder to learn than English.
simp: 当然，对这个情况的另一个解释是中文比英文难学。
trad: 當然，對這個情況的另一個解釋是中文比英文難學。

eng: Furthermore, I still don't think this a huge cultural difference.
simp: 而且，我还是认为这准不是个巨大的文化区别。
trad: 而且，我還是認為這準不是個巨大的文化區別。

eng: I hung my hat on the peg.
simp: 我把我的帽子挂在挂钩上。
trad: 我把我的帽子掛在掛鉤上。

eng: He works hard all the year round.
He has a lot of foreign stamps.
He has lived here for one week.
simp: 他已经住在这裡一个星期了。
trad: 他已經住在這裡一個星期了。

eng: Don't forget to put out the fire.
How often have you been to Europe?
I rented a house with a garage.
simp: 我租了一间有车库的房子。
trad: 我租了一間有車庫的房子。

eng: I can understand what she is saying.
I took a cab to the station.
I asked him where he was going.
He was brought up by his uncle.
simp: 他被他的叔叔抚养长大。
trad: 他被他的叔叔撫養長大。

eng: He is used to getting up early.
He consented to help the old lady.
simp: 他同意帮助这位老太太。
trad: 他同意幫助這位老太太。

eng: I came to Japan two years ago.
He held a package under his arm.
simp: 他把一个包裹挟在腋下。
trad: 他把一個包裹挾在腋下。

eng: He held a package under his arm.
He didn't come to the last meeting.
Don't judge a man by his clothes.
simp: 不要以穿着来判断一个人。
trad: 不要以穿著來判斷一個人。

eng: I will live in Sasayama next year.
I have been here for two hours.
simp: 我在这裡已经两个小时了。
trad: 我在這裡已經兩個小時了。

eng: He did not work on Sunday night.
I slipped and fell down the stairs.
simp: 我滑了一跤并从楼梯上摔下来。
trad: 我滑了一跤並從樓梯上摔下來。

eng: I am sick and tired of him.
I have been warned against going there.
simp: 我已经被警告过不要去那裡。
trad: 我已經被警告過不要去那裡。

eng: I want to breathe some fresh air.
simp: 我想呼吸一下新鲜空气。
trad: 我想呼吸一下新鮮空氣。

eng: I hear my uncle died of cancer.
simp: 我听到我叔叔死于癌症的消息。
trad: 我聽到我叔叔死於癌癥的消息。

eng: I look forward to your next visit.
simp: 我期待着您的再次光临。
trad: 我期待著您的再次光臨。

eng: They came to John and told him.
simp: 他们来到约翰面前，并告诉了他。
trad: 他們來到約翰面前，並告訴了他。

eng: He said that it would probably rain.
I caused him a lot of trouble.
simp: 我给他带来了很多麻烦。
trad: 我給他帶來了很多麻煩。

eng: I heard a knock at the door.
Do you know why she's so angry?
simp: 你知道她为什麽这麽生气吗？
trad: 你知道她為什麼這麼生氣嗎？

eng: I think he will do his best.
I don't want to do anything risky.
simp: 我不想做任何冒险的事。
trad: 我不想做任何冒險的事。

eng: How did you get to know Mary?
I gave her just what she needed.
simp: 我给她的正是她所需要的。
trad: 我給她的正是她所需要的。

eng: I was terribly confused by his question.
simp: 我对他的问题感到非常迷惑。
trad: 我對他的問題感到非常迷惑。

eng: He was forced to sign the document.
I thought it best to remain silent.
simp: 我想最好还是保持沉默。
trad: 我想最好還是保持沈默。

eng: I have a dog and a cat.
He left the book on the table.
simp: 他在桌子上留下了这本书。
trad: 他在桌子上留下了這本書。

eng: He is not qualified for the job.
I want to go abroad next year.
I am positive that he has finished.
Let's carry on the discussion.
You can come in.
My brother would often stay up all night reading novels.
simp: 我哥哥经常熬夜看小说。
trad: 我哥哥經常熬夜看小說。

eng: In the Edo period, moon-viewing parties were very popular.
simp: 在江户时代赏月的宴会非常受欢迎。
trad: 在江戶時代賞月的宴會非常受歡迎。

eng: Here is a photograph of my family.
simp: 这裡有一张我全家的照片。
trad: 這裡有一張我全家的照片。

eng: He isn't less clever than his brother.
I don't know anything about his past.
simp: 我不知道任何有关他过去的事。
trad: 我不知道任何有關他過去的事。

eng: I live on the outskirts of Tokyo.
He bumped his head against a post.
simp: 他的头撞到了一根柱子。
trad: 他的頭撞到了一根柱子。

eng: I know that you did your best.
Flies and mosquitoes interfered with his meditation.
simp: 苍蝇和蚊子干扰了他的冥想。
trad: 蒼蠅和蚊子幹擾了他的冥想。

eng: I had a strange dream last night.
simp: 我昨晚做了一个奇怪的梦。
trad: 我昨晚做了一個奇怪的夢。

eng: I can't do any more than this.
simp: 我无法做比这更多的了。
trad: 我無法做比這更多的了。

eng: I can't do any more than this.
He hit his head against a rock.
simp: 他的头撞到了一块岩石。
trad: 他的頭撞到了一塊巖石。

eng: He lived to be eighty years old.
I want something cold to drink now.
He left his luggage at the station.
simp: 他把他的行李留在车站。
trad: 他把他的行李留在車站。

eng: I look forward to seeing you again.
I don't have the address with me.
He bored us with his long stories.
simp: 他长长的故事让我们觉得厌烦了。
trad: 他長長的故事讓我們覺得厭煩了。

eng: I want to be a baseball player.
simp: 我想成为一名棒球运动员。
trad: 我想成為一名棒球運動員。

eng: He's busy with his homework now.
simp: 他现在正忙着做他的家庭作业。
trad: 他現在正忙著做他的家庭作業。

eng: She was advised by him to go to the police.
Do we care?
I passed the city hall on my way to the station.
simp: 我去车站的路上路过了市政厅。
trad: 我去車站的路上路過了市政廳。

eng: He has been dead for three years.
I spent my vacation at the beach.
I hope you will get well soon.
I want you to stay here longer.
simp: 我希望你留在这儿久一点。
trad: 我希望你留在這兒久一點。

eng: I'm busy looking for an apartment.
I can solve the problem by myself.
simp: 我可以自己解决这个问题。
trad: 我可以自己解決這個問題。

eng: His wife opened the door for him.
He was the first person to arrive.
He got married to Ann last month.
I helped my father wash his car.
He is doing very well at school.
I hear you are good at cooking.
I have been a teacher for 15 years.
Take as many peaches as you like.
simp: 你想拿多少桃子就拿多少。
trad: 你想拿多少桃子就拿多少。

eng: I interpreted her silence as a refusal.
simp: 我认为她的沉默就是表示拒绝。
trad: 我認為她的沈默就是表示拒絕。

eng: I went without food for a week.
I don't like living in the country.
I will pay you the money tomorrow.
I haven't been getting enough sleep lately.
I heard our dog barking all night.
simp: 我听到我们的狗叫了一整夜。
trad: 我聽到我們的狗叫了一整夜。

eng: I hope he hasn't had an accident.
I will give you the money tomorrow.
He had his socks on inside out.
He lost his eyesight in that accident.
simp: 他在那次意外中失去了他的视力。
trad: 他在那次意外中失去了他的視力。

eng: I can't put up with this smell.
I think his opinion is very important.
simp: 我认为他的意见非常重要。
trad: 我認為他的意見非常重要。

eng: He helped the lady into the car.
He likes to cook for his family.
He has been waiting for an hour.
Don't show your face around here again.
simp: 你不要再出现在这裡了。
trad: 你不要再出現在這裡了。

eng: He was named Horatio after his uncle.
simp: 他被以他叔叔的名字Horatio来命名。
trad: 他被以他叔叔的名字Horatio來命名。

eng: I was embarrassed by what she said.
simp: 她说的话让我觉得很尴尬。
trad: 她說的話讓我覺得很尷尬。

eng: I used to swim in this river.
simp: 我以前在这条河裡游泳。
trad: 我以前在這條河裡遊泳。

eng: He has been sick since last Sunday.
simp: 他从上週日开始就生病了。
trad: 他從上週日開始就生病了。

eng: He's not at all afraid of snakes.
I want to play tennis with Judy.
He is not ashamed of being poor.
simp: 他不因贫穷而感到羞愧。
trad: 他不因貧窮而感到羞愧。

eng: I had hoped to meet you there.
simp: 我曾希望在那裡遇见你。
trad: 我曾希望在那裡遇見你。

eng: I will find you a good doctor.
I learned a lot from his books.
simp: 我从他的书学到了很多。
trad: 我從他的書學到了很多。

eng: He is very afraid of his mother.
I don't know and neither does he.
I like taking a walk in the forest.
Since that time we have not seen him.
simp: 从那个时候开始，我们就没见过他了。
trad: 從那個時候開始，我們就沒見過他了。

eng: He had kept the secret to himself.
I had a good time last evening.
simp: 昨天晚上我玩得很开心。
trad: 昨天晚上我玩得很開心。

eng: His house is not far from here.
I'll be seeing Mary this afternoon.
simp: 我今天下午会看到玛丽。
trad: 我今天下午會看到瑪麗。

eng: She is always well made up.
If you want to learn a language well, learn it by yourself.
simp: 如果你想学习好一种语言，自己学习它。
trad: 如果你想學習好一種語言，自己學習它。

eng: Play the Humppa!
In U.S. bakeries, a "baker's dozen" is 13, not 12.
simp: 在美国的麵包店，"麵包师傅的一打"是13，不是12。
trad: 在美國的麵包店，"麵包師傅的一打"是13，不是12。

eng: She always gets her own way.
That girl is good-looking.
In other words, you're stupid.
This is a strange sentence.
Mom is preparing a meal in the kitchen.
The man ate the bread.
Hi, my name is Omid.
He doesn't speak our language.
I am not the least bit worried.
I asked him what his name was.
I don't like either tea or coffee.
simp: 我不喜欢茶也不喜欢咖啡。
trad: 我不喜歡茶也不喜歡咖啡。

eng: I have a friend living in Nara.
simp: 我有一个朋友住在奈良。
trad: 我有一個朋友住在奈良。

eng: I asked Nancy to stay at home.
He goes to London once a month.
I am going to major in French.
I don't like the taste of onions.
He came to Japan seven years ago.
His mother used to be a singer.
simp: 他的妈妈以前是个歌手。
trad: 他的媽媽以前是個歌手。

eng: He is the richest man on earth.
simp: 他是世界上最有钱的人。
trad: 他是世界上最有錢的人。

eng: His father eats there twice a week.
simp: 他爸爸一週在那裡吃两次。
trad: 他爸爸一週在那裡吃兩次。

eng: He caught a boy stealing his watch.
simp: 他抓到了一个男孩正在偷他的錶。
trad: 他抓到了一個男孩正在偷他的錶。

eng: My father goes to church on Sunday.
Let me introduce my mother to you.
simp: 让我向你介绍我的母亲。
trad: 讓我向你介紹我的母親。

eng: She tends to be late for school.
My wife has just cleared the table.
simp: 我太太刚刚清理了桌子。
trad: 我太太剛剛清理了桌子。

eng: My mother is busy in the kitchen.
simp: 我的母亲在厨房裡正忙着。
trad: 我的母親在廚房裡正忙著。

eng: Kate got some money from her father.
simp: 凯特从她的父亲那裡得到了一些钱。
trad: 凱特從她的父親那裡得到了一些錢。

eng: There's no possibility of his coming.
Paul ran his hand through his hair.
simp: 保罗用手从头髮间梳过。
trad: 保羅用手從頭髮間梳過。

eng: My father made me a delicious lunch.
simp: 我父亲为我做了一顿美味的午餐。
trad: 我父親為我做了一頓美味的午餐。

eng: Kate listened to the radio all day.
Jane is as old as I am.
She can swim further than I can.
She is going to France next week.
Peter didn't intend to break the vase.
simp: 彼得不是有意打破花瓶。
trad: 彼得不是有意打破花瓶。

eng: It's illegal to park your car here.
simp: 把车停在这裡是违法的。
trad: 把車停在這裡是違法的。

eng: It was Tom that saved the girl.
simp: 是汤姆救了这个小女孩。
trad: 是湯姆救了這個小女孩。

eng: You don't have to work so hard.
simp: 你不必这麽辛苦地工作。
trad: 你不必這麼辛苦地工作。

eng: My brother is living in San Diego.
simp: 我哥哥是住在圣地亚哥。
trad: 我哥哥是住在聖地亞哥。

eng: Make sure you get plenty of rest.
John doesn't know what to do next.
simp: 约翰不知道下一步要做什麽。
trad: 約翰不知道下一步要做什麼。

eng: She came from Canada to see me.
I'm not always at home on Sundays.
simp: 我星期天并不总是在家。
trad: 我星期天並不總是在家。

eng: I'd like a glass of water, please.
I'd like a glass of water, please.
May I ask you some more questions?
simp: 我可以问你一些问题吗？
trad: 我可以問你一些問題嗎？

eng: I will wait for my sister here.
She is as beautiful as her mother.
I'm reading a novel by Sidney Sheldon.
simp: 我在读一本西德尼谢尔顿写的小说。
trad: 我在讀一本西德尼謝爾頓寫的小說。

eng: Mac knows how to use this computer.
simp: Mac知道如何使用这台电脑。
trad: Mac知道如何使用這臺電腦。

eng: I live in Canton.
He wrote a lot of books on China.
simp: 他写了很多关于中国的书。
trad: 他寫了很多關於中國的書。

eng: I'm always busy these days.
My dream is to go to Japan.
The man you see over there is my uncle.
simp: 你在那边见到的男人是我伯伯。
trad: 你在那邊見到的男人是我伯伯。

eng: Please keep an eye on my suitcase.
simp: 请留神看着我的手提箱。
trad: 請留神看著我的手提箱。

eng: She can't play the piano very well.
simp: 她无法把钢琴弹得很好。
trad: 她無法把鋼琴彈得很好。

eng: I'm tired of him bawling me out.
I'm on vacation.
She held her baby in her arms.
simp: 她把她的孩子抱在怀裡。
trad: 她把她的孩子抱在懷裡。

eng: I've just been to the post office.
I would like to order drinks now.
Laura is very particular about her clothes.
She is fluent in English and French.
simp: 她能说流利的英语和法语。
trad: 她能說流利的英語和法語。

eng: If you don't go, I won't, either.
simp: 如果你不去，那我也不会去。
trad: 如果你不去，那我也不會去。

eng: Let us know when you'll arrive.
simp: 让我们知道你什麽时候会到。
trad: 讓我們知道你什麼時候會到。

eng: I wrote a letter to my mother.
simp: 我写了一封信给我的母亲。
trad: 我寫了一封信給我的母親。

eng: My brother took me to the museum.
She complained that my salary was low.
She patted her son on the shoulder.
Many friends came to see me off.
She may realize later what I meant.
simp: 她可能以后会明白我的意思。
trad: 她可能以後會明白我的意思。

eng: She extended her stay by five days.
She extended her stay by five days.
My father takes a bath before supper.
simp: 我的父亲在晚饭前洗澡。
trad: 我的父親在晚飯前洗澡。

eng: Maria takes piano lessons once a week.
simp: 玛丽亚每週上一次钢琴课。
trad: 瑪麗亞每週上一次鋼琴課。

eng: Is this your first visit to Japan?
simp: 这是你第一次到日本吗？
trad: 這是你第一次到日本嗎？

eng: It's ten minutes' walk to the station.
simp: 步行到车站要花十分钟。
trad: 步行到車站要花十分鐘。

eng: Maybe he will be a good teacher.
simp: 也许他会是一个很好的老师。
trad: 也許他會是一個很好的老師。

eng: It's warm here all the year round.
It seems obvious that he is sick.
How romantic!
She made coffee for all of us.
simp: 她为我们所有的人煮咖啡。
trad: 她為我們所有的人煮咖啡。

eng: She hung a curtain over the window.
Please wait for me at the station.
Ken learned many Japanese songs by heart.
John should be here any minute now.
simp: 约翰现在应该随时会在这裡。
trad: 約翰現在應該隨時會在這裡。

eng: She looks as if she were drunk.
Put the book back on the shelf.
Moderate exercise is necessary for good health.
simp: 适度运动对身体健康是必要的。
trad: 適度運動對身體健康是必要的。

eng: Many kinds of birds live in Japan.
I worked on the farm all day.
Maybe I'll go, and maybe I won't.
simp: 也许我会去，也许我不会。
trad: 也許我會去，也許我不會。

eng: Quite a few people have two cars.
I'll be at home in the morning.
My joints ache when it gets cold.
simp: 当天气变冷的时候，我的关节疼痛。
trad: 當天氣變冷的時候，我的關節疼痛。

eng: It looks like Tom won the race.
simp: 看起来像是汤姆赢得了比赛。
trad: 看起來像是湯姆贏得了比賽。

eng: Keiko, do you have any buttered toast?
My father made me wash the car.
It's a long way to the station.
Mike is the youngest in his family.
simp: 迈克是他家裡最年轻的。
trad: 邁克是他家裡最年輕的。

eng: Jane may not be at home now.
Sally made her brother clean the bathroom.
simp: 莎莉要她的弟弟打扫浴室。
trad: 莎莉要她的弟弟打掃浴室。

eng: I wish you the best of luck.
She didn't like living in the city.
My father is suffering from a cold.
I'm not used to speaking in public.
simp: 我不习惯在公众场合说话。
trad: 我不習慣在公眾場合說話。

eng: It is getting dark. Let's go home.
simp: 天渐渐黑了。我们回家吧。
trad: 天漸漸黑了。我們回家吧。

eng: I'm afraid she may have the mumps.
simp: 我怕她可能得了腮腺炎。
trad: 我怕她可能得了腮腺炎。

eng: It is going to rain very soon.
Sadako Sasaki died on October 25, 1955.
simp: 佐佐木贞子死于1955年10月25日。
trad: 佐佐木貞子死於1955年10月25日。

eng: Hi.
I told her that you're a nice girl.
simp: 我告诉她你是个很好的女孩。
trad: 我告訴她你是個很好的女孩。

eng: How cold it is!
Every year, the organisation organises a number of meetings of volunteers who go door-to-door to sell Frisian books.
simp: 每年，这个机构组织很多会议的志工挨家挨户地卖菲仕兰书。
trad: 每年，這個機構組織很多會議的誌工挨家挨戶地賣菲仕蘭書。

eng: He works at a scientific institute where linguists, literature scholars, historians, sociologists, economists, and other scholars investigate everything that has to do with gnomes.
simp: 他在一家科学机构工作，在那裡有语言学家，文学学者，历史学家，社会学家，经济学家和其他学者探讨一切有关侏儒的事。
trad: 他在一家科學機構工作，在那裡有語言學家，文學學者，歷史學家，社會學家，經濟學家和其他學者探討一切有關侏儒的事。

eng: In the morning I always wake up around seven o'clock.
simp: 我早上总是大约七点钟醒来。
trad: 我早上總是大約七點鐘醒來。

eng: A perfect map would have to be as big as the territory it represents.
simp: 一个完美的地图必须要像它所代表的领土一样大。
trad: 一個完美的地圖必須要像它所代表的領土一樣大。

eng: How cold it is!
Nothing seems to grow in this soil.
simp: 这个土壤似乎长不出任何东西来。
trad: 這個土壤似乎長不出任何東西來。

eng: She accused me of being a liar.
My grandmother made me a new dress.
simp: 我的祖母做了一套新衣服给我。
trad: 我的祖母做了一套新衣服給我。

eng: My sister washes her hair every morning.
simp: 我妹妹每天早上洗头髮。
trad: 我妹妹每天早上洗頭髮。

eng: Please put the book on the shelf.
Tangerines contain a lot of vitamin C.
simp: 柳丁含有大量的维生素 C。
trad: 柳丁含有大量的維生素 C。
