She has two uncles; one lives in Kyoto and the other in Osaka.
simp: 她有两个叔叔；一个住在京都，一个住在大坂。
trad: 她有兩個叔叔；一個住在京都，一個住在大阪。

eng: If you quit the job, you'll be burning your bridges.
simp: 如果你辞掉这份工作，你将在自毁后路
trad: 如果你辭掉這份工作，你將在自毀後路

eng: The mother was quieting her crying baby.
simp: 母亲安抚着她在哭的婴儿
trad: 母親安撫著她在哭的嬰兒

eng: A man's happiness doesn't depend on what he has, but on what he is.
simp: 人的幸福不在于他拥有什么，而在于他是什么样的人。
trad: 人的幸福不在於他擁有什麼，而在於他是什麼樣的人。

eng: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, but today is a gift. That is why it is called the "present".
simp: 昨天是历史，明天是谜团，只有今天是天赐的礼物。那就是它为什麽被称作「当下」的原因。
trad: 昨天是歷史，明天是謎團，只有今天是天賜的禮物。那就是它為什麼被稱作「當下」的原因。

eng: I have ten pens.
She has no more than twelve puppies.
simp: 它没有超过十二个孩子少。
trad: 它沒有超過十二個孩子少。

eng: En, Does he have any children?
She was wearing a thick coat against the chill.
simp: 她穿着一件厚外套以防止冷。
trad: 她穿著一件厚外套以防止冷。

eng: Is it going to rain tomorrow?
We heard this song before.
Do you prefer red or white wine?
simp: 你比较喜欢红酒还是白酒？
trad: 你比較喜歡紅酒還是白酒？

eng: Say hello to your friends.
His house is by a river.
I'm freezing!
I can't tell you any more, I've already said too much.
simp: 我不能再向你多说什么了。我已经透露太多了。
trad: 我不能再向你多說什麼了。我已經透露太多了。

eng: I saw a friend.
To be honest, I don't like you at all.
I eat and read at the same time.
Man proposes, God disposes.
God died. We killed Him.
simp: 上帝死了。我们杀死了他。
trad: 上帝死了。我們殺死了他。

eng: God created the world.
I believe in God.
Do you believe in God?
God bless you!
Oh, my God!
I am working at Alibaba.
This issue has nothing to do with you.
Friendship and happiness cannot be separated.
England and Scotland are neighbours.
Dad says the most important thing is that I'm alive.
simp: 爸爸说，最重要的是我活着。
trad: 爸爸說，最重要的是我活著。

eng: Fear comes from the unknown.
Can you speak a little slower please?
We've really been missing him since he left.
simp: 他走后，我们都很想念他。
trad: 他走後，我們都很想念他。

eng: I have thirteen cats.
Where programmers use semi-colons every day, the majority of people only use them in emoticons.
simp: 尽管程序设计师天天都会用到分号，大多数人只把分号用在表情中。
trad: 盡管程序設計師天天都會用到分號，大多數人只把分號用在表情中。

eng: The Federal Republic of Germany was established in 1949.
simp: 德意志联邦共和国建立于1949年。
trad: 德意誌聯邦共和國建立於1949年。

eng: Tears fell from his eyes.
I lost the watch dad gave me.
simp: 我把爸爸给我的表弄丢了。
trad: 我把爸爸給我的表弄丟了。

eng: Can I help you at all?
If you would talk less and listen more, you might learn something.
simp: 如果你少说多听的话，你一定能学到点什么。
trad: 如果你少說多聽的話，你一定能學到點什麼。

eng: I've been waiting for him since early this morning.
simp: 我从今天一大早起就在等他。
trad: 我從今天一大早起就在等他。

eng: Where do you want to go?
Is this a flower?
I can't judge distance.
He's contemplating the complexity of contemporary life.
simp: 他思考着现代生活的复杂性。
trad: 他思考著現代生活的復雜性。

eng: Do you know where he lives?
simp: 你们知道他住在哪里么？
trad: 你們知道他住在哪裏麼？

eng: I'm a huge fan of golf.
I cycle to work.
We'll leave in an hour.
He's an excellent author.
They're professional singers.
He's the tallest amongst the boys.
simp: 他算是男孩子中最高的了。
trad: 他算是男孩子中最高的了。

eng: Should I give you those books to look at?
simp: 我是不是应该给你那些书看？
trad: 我是不是應該給你那些書看？

eng: I don't want to be involved in this affair.
simp: 我可不想卷入这场纷争中去。
trad: 我可不想卷入這場紛爭中去。

eng: Rest time's over!
Even though it sounds strange, what she said is true.
simp: 虽然听起来很奇怪，但是她说的的确是真的。
trad: 雖然聽起來很奇怪，但是她說的的確是真的。

eng: What are you looking for?
Can I open this box?
simp: 我能把这个箱子打开么？
trad: 我能把這個箱子打開麼？

eng: I can't sleep.
I'm eating.
You really should quit smoking.
What's your favorite soft drink?
simp: 你最喜欢的软饮料是什么？
trad: 你最喜歡的軟飲料是什麼？

eng: That boy is running.
He has an egg and is eating it.
simp: 他有一个鸡蛋，他在吃鸡蛋。
trad: 他有一個雞蛋，他在吃雞蛋。

eng: The man is eating bread.
The boy is eating bread.
The cat is eating.
Somebody is eating.
She's not a child.
Where's my box of chocolates?
I love her.
I'm a forty-year-old student at Hyogo University.
simp: 我是来自兵库大学四十岁的大学生。
trad: 我是來自兵庫大學四十歲的大學生。

eng: All these things serve to add to our happiness.
simp: 所有这些都有助于增加我们的幸福。
trad: 所有這些都有助於增加我們的幸福。

eng: Through the lens the image was inverted.
I get on very well with your cousin.
simp: 我与你的表亲相处甚好。
trad: 我與你的表親相處甚好。

eng: Chris swung his sword!

When we come to die, we shall be alone. From all our worldly possessions we shall be about to part. Worldly friends — the friends drawn to us by our position, our wealth, or our social qualities, — will leave us as we enter the dark valley. From those bound to us by stronger ties — our kindred, our loved ones, children, brothers, sisters, and from those not less dear to us who have been made our friends because they and we are the friends of the same Saviour, — from them also we must part. Yet not all will leave us. There is One who "sticketh closer than a brother" — One who having loved His own which are in the world loves them to the end.
simp: 当我们濒临死亡，我们应该独处。我们将摒离所有身外之物。世间的朋友们-跟我们的地位，财富和社会层次息息相关的朋友，都将离我们而去，只因我们即将步入黑暗的山谷。那些与陌生人紧紧相连的关系网-我们的亲属、我们的爱人、孩子、兄弟姐妹，还有那些不太亲却有共同朋友的人们，我们也必须要分开。现在，他们并没用离开我们。有一个比兄弟更亲的人-爱他自己也爱世间直到尽头。
trad: 當我們瀕臨死亡，我們應該獨處。我們將摒離所有身外之物。世間的朋友們-跟我們的地位，財富和社會層次息息相關的朋友，都將離我們而去，只因我們即將步入黑暗的山谷。那些與陌生人緊緊相連的關系網-我們的親屬、我們的愛人、孩子、兄弟姐妹，還有那些不太親卻有共同朋友的人們，我們也必須要分開。現在，他們並沒用離開我們。有一個比兄弟更親的人-愛他自己也愛世間直到盡頭。

eng: He works in the planning section.
The balance of public opinion remains in his favor.
simp: 公众意见的平衡仍是他的关切。
trad: 公眾意見的平衡仍是他的關切。

eng: She is reading a book in the library.
She cannot work this machine.
She accused him of stealing her money.
You had better not walk around in such a place.
simp: 你最好别在那种地方走来走去。
trad: 你最好別在那種地方走來走去。

eng: All of the flowers are paper.
I'm annoyed by their impudence.
simp: 我对他们无耻的行径感到厌恶。
trad: 我對他們無恥的行徑感到厭惡。

eng: In adolescence, I hated life and was continually on the verge of suicide, from which, however, I was restrained by the desire to know more mathematics.
simp: 在青春期，我厌倦生活，并持续陷入自杀的边缘。然而，在那期间，对数学知识的渴望，使我抑制住了那些负面情绪。
trad: 在青春期，我厭倦生活，並持續陷入自殺的邊緣。然而，在那期間，對數學知識的渴望，使我抑制住了那些負面情緒。

eng: Tom has gotten older and he doesn't go out as often as he used to.
simp: 汤姆已渐老去，不像从前那样常常出门了。
trad: 湯姆已漸老去，不像從前那樣常常出門了。

eng: He acted on the matter.
I plan to work in a brothel.
Ewondo is the language spoken by the Ewondo tribe of Cameroon.
simp: 埃翁多语是客麦隆埃翁多部落所说的语言。
trad: 埃翁多語是客麥隆埃翁多部落所說的語言。

eng: In many countries, buying or smoking cannabis is forbidden by law.
simp: 在很多国家，购买和吸食大麻是违法的。
trad: 在很多國家，購買和吸食大麻是違法的。

eng: She said that she would dance with me if I brought her red roses.
simp: 她说，若我送她红玫瑰，她将与我跳舞。
trad: 她說，若我送她紅玫瑰，她將與我跳舞。

eng: Looking out the window, I saw a car coming.
simp: 向窗外望去，我看到一辆车驶来。
trad: 向窗外望去，我看到一輛車駛來。

eng: I asked twenty people to my party but not all of them came.
simp: 我邀请了二十人参加我们的聚会，但不是所有人都来。
trad: 我邀請了二十人參加我們的聚會，但不是所有人都來。

eng: The audience applauded his efforts.
simp: 观众们为他的付出的努力而鼓掌。
trad: 觀眾們為他的付出的努力而鼓掌。

eng: In my world everyone’s a pony and they all eat rainbows and poop butterflies.
simp: 在我的世界上，人人都是小马驹，他们吃了彩虹之后就会啪地一下变成蝴蝶。
trad: 在我的世界上，人人都是小馬駒，他們吃了彩虹之後就會啪地一下變成蝴蝶。

eng: Bear in mind what he said.
Jesus hates you.
What chocolate do you like to eat?
I'm rarely this angry.
How am I supposed to know this?
Are you tired?
The elephant is an enormous creature.
Those are my trousers.
He's really drunk.
Sorry, what's your name?
simp: 不好意思，你叫什么名字？
trad: 不好意思，你叫什麼名字？

eng: He didn't do it on purpose.
Everyone should bring their own lunch.
simp: 每个人都应该带自己的午餐。
trad: 每個人都應該帶自己的午餐。

eng: Who does the car belong to when the owner dies?
I'm not used to walking long distances.
I was burnt by the iron.
What do you think of Japan's economy?
simp: 您怎样看日本的经济呢？
trad: 您怎樣看日本的經濟呢？

eng: Are you available tonight?
He finally became the president of IBM.
We're here!
You shouldn't trust people like this.
simp: 您不应该信任这样的人。
trad: 您不應該信任這樣的人。

eng: He did everything he could for his child.
simp: 他为自己的孩子能做的都做了。
trad: 他為自己的孩子能做的都做了。

eng: Old people were tricked by the shop assistant.
This is the church where we got married.
simp: 这裡是我们结婚的教堂。
trad: 這裡是我們結婚的教堂。

eng: Call the police!
If a person has not had a chance to acquire his target language by the time he's an adult, he's unlikely to be able to reach native speaker level in that language.
simp: 如果一个人在成人前没有机会习得目标语言，他对该语言的认识达到母语者程度的机会是相当小的。
trad: 如果一個人在成人前沒有機會習得目標語言，他對該語言的認識達到母語者程度的機會是相當小的。

eng: Sir, can we quickly inspect your luggage please?
simp: 先生，我们可以检查一下您的行李吗？
trad: 先生，我們可以檢查一下您的行李嗎？

eng: Ah, that reminds me of the old days!
Does anyone know how to pronounce this character?
simp: 有人会发这个字的音吗？
trad: 有人會發這個字的音嗎？

eng: Houses made of wood are the easiest to catch on fire.
simp: 木造的房子最容易失火。
trad: 木造的房子最容易失火。

eng: This is ice.
The tigers escaped from the zoo.
simp: 老虎从动物园中逃出来了。
trad: 老虎從動物園中逃出來了。

eng: Are you happy at your own home?
simp: 你在自己的家裡开心吗？
trad: 你在自己的家裡開心嗎？

eng: I went there yesterday.
Getting addicted to something and having too much of something are two different things.
simp: 过瘾一个东西和过于那个东西是两回事。
trad: 過癮一個東西和過於那個東西是兩回事。

eng: Excessive use of the Internet is not a medical or psychiatric issue.
simp: 过于上网不是跟医学或精神病有关的事情。
trad: 過於上網不是跟醫學或精神病有關的事情。

eng: Compare it to other enjoyable activities: going to the cinema, reading books, going for walks, chatting to friends etc.
simp: 把它相较于其他有意思的活动：去电影院，看书，散步，跟朋友聊天等等。
trad: 把它相較於其他有意思的活動：去電影院，看書，散步，跟朋友聊天等等。

eng: There are plenty of examples of people who do these things “excessively”, but no-one says those are “addictions”.
simp: 做这些事做得太多的人的例子多的是，可是没有说是“瘾症”。
trad: 做這些事做得太多的人的例子多的是，可是沒有說是“癮癥”。

eng: The concept doesn’t make sense.
The concept of “Internet addiction” implies that “the Internet” is some sort of definable activity.
simp: “网络成瘾症”这个理念将意味着“网络”是一种可以下定义的活动。
trad: “網絡成癮癥”這個理念將意味著“網絡”是一種可以下定義的活動。

eng: In fact, there are countless, varied uses for the Internet.
simp: 实际上，网络的作用有着无数的多种多样的。
trad: 實際上，網絡的作用有著無數的多種多樣的。

eng: It’s a communication medium, not a substance or specific activity.
simp: 网络是一个相通的渠道，而不是物质或具体的活动。
trad: 網絡是一個相通的渠道，而不是物質或具體的活動。

eng: It’s like saying that someone is addicted to “transport”, “art” or “politics”.
simp: 这个好像说一个人上瘾了“交通”，“艺术”或“政治”。
trad: 這個好像說一個人上癮了“交通”，“藝術”或“政治”。

eng: I’ve heard the example of the parents in Korea who let their child die because they were too busy playing video games.
simp: 我听过在韩国的父母因为忙于玩游戏而让他们的孩子死了的那个例子。
trad: 我聽過在韓國的父母因為忙於玩遊戲而讓他們的孩子死了的那個例子。

eng: I’m not denying that that happened, but one example doesn’t count as evidence.
simp: 我不否认这件事发生了，可是一个例子算不上证据。
trad: 我不否認這件事發生了，可是一個例子算不上證據。

eng: Those people did not neglect their child because they used the Internet too much.
simp: 那两个人不是因为过于上网而忽视他们的孩子。
trad: 那兩個人不是因為過於上網而忽視他們的孩子。

eng: They used the Internet too much because they had some underlying problem that also caused them to neglect their child.
simp: 他们是因为患有一种使他门忽视孩子的基础精神病而过于上网。
trad: 他們是因為患有一種使他門忽視孩子的基礎精神病而過於上網。

eng: This is an example of confusing two things that have a common cause with one thing that causes another.
simp: 这显然是将属并列关系的两件事误解成为因果关系了。
trad: 這顯然是將屬並列關系的兩件事誤解成為因果關系了。

eng: People “diagnosed” with “Internet addiction” are nearly always diagnosed with other difficulties as well.
simp: 诊断患有“网络成瘾症”的人差不多总是也有其他的困难。
trad: 診斷患有“網絡成癮癥”的人差不多總是也有其他的困難。

eng: I don't love you.
How would you like your hair done?
He was heard singing in the shower.
simp: 有人听到了他洗澡的时候唱歌。
trad: 有人聽到了他洗澡的時候唱歌。

eng: She was seen at a restaurant with her lover.
simp: 有人看到了她在饭馆跟她爱人在一起。
trad: 有人看到了她在飯館跟她愛人在一起。

eng: They are considered the greatest rock band in history.
simp: 有人认为他们是历史上最伟大的乐队。
trad: 有人認為他們是歷史上最偉大的樂隊。

eng: It was once thought that there was intelligent life on Mars.
simp: 以前有人以为火星上有智能生物。
trad: 以前有人以為火星上有智能生物。

eng: They were treated for hypothermia.
simp: 医生治疗了他们的降低体温。
trad: 醫生治療了他們的降低體溫。

eng: English is spoken in many countries.
We were shown all of their family photos.
simp: 他们给我们看他们全部的家庭图片。
trad: 他們給我們看他們全部的家庭圖片。

eng: A satellite was launched in Russia last year.
simp: 俄罗斯去年发射了一个卫星。
trad: 俄羅斯去年發射了一個衛星。

eng: Over ten thousand messages are sent every second on Facebook.
simp: Facebook的用户每一秒发一万以上个信息。
trad: Facebook的用戶每一秒發一萬以上個信息。

eng: In Christianity, Jesus is believed to be the son of God.
simp: 基督徒认为耶稣是上帝的儿子。
trad: 基督徒認為耶穌是上帝的兒子。

eng: Many poor students are given bursaries.
simp: 很多贫穷的学生得到会计科。
trad: 很多貧窮的學生得到會計科。

eng: It has been found that smoking is bad for your health.
simp: 查出了抽烟对身体不好。
trad: 查出了抽煙對身體不好。

eng: It is said that the war will end soon.
It is rumoured that the prime-minister will resign next month.
simp: 据传总统下个月要辞职了。
trad: 據傳總統下個月要辭職了。

eng: There would be no New China without the communist party.
simp: 没有共产党就没有新中国
trad: 沒有共產黨就沒有新中國

eng: There are three trees in the yard.
There are so few things like this.
The wind is really strong outside.
Children love to sing.
Was it cold last night?
My grandma just drank a bit of soup.
His younger brother went to Shanghai the day before yesterday.
I want to buy a few pairs of trousers.
Where's your watch?
None of them are drivers.
My grandfather takes medicine every day.
That restaurant's too expensive.
My daughter sleeps eight hours a day.
simp: 我女儿每天睡八个钟头。
trad: 我女兒每天睡八個鐘頭。

eng: In front of you, you can see Tiananmen Square.
My brother gets up every morning at 7.
simp: 我哥哥每天早上七点起床。
trad: 我哥哥每天早上七點起床。

eng: His son doesn't work at a bank.
What book do you plan on reading?
My boyfriend still hasn't been to the Great Wall.
simp: 我男朋友还没有去过长城。
trad: 我男朋友還沒有去過長城。

eng: Where do you feel uncomfortable?
There are about ten to twenty students in total.
Welcome.
Take care!
Bon voyage!
Long time no see!
Please drink tea.
Please sit down!
I'm really sorry!
Sorry to bother you!
Good work!
Forgive me!
You speak Esperanto, don't you?
These are the decisions we've made.
simp: 这些就是我们做出的决定。
trad: 這些就是我們做出的決定。

eng: She's way taller than me.
Are you being served?
We'll arrive there within an hour.
simp: 我们会在一小时内到达。
trad: 我們會在一小時內到達。

eng: Nature is full of mystery.
Did that lady just swear?
simp: 那个小姐刚才说粗话啊？
trad: 那個小姐剛才說粗話啊？

eng: She and I hold the same position in the company, but she earns more than I do.
simp: 我和她在公司里职位相同，但她赚的钱比我多。
trad: 我和她在公司裏職位相同，但她賺的錢比我多。

eng: There is no sugar left in the pot.
Autumn is here.
They're playing chess.
Read!
But I have no money.
What's the boarding time?
Drink some coffee. It tastes very good, I think.
simp: 喝咖啡吧。我觉得很好喝。
trad: 喝咖啡吧。我覺得很好喝。

eng: I don't want to live like this.
I guess what I've said isn't all that clear, but that's the only way I can explain it.
simp: 总觉得解释的不是很清楚...但我只知道这样...
trad: 總覺得解釋的不是很清楚...但我只知道這樣...

eng: I took a taxi from the station to the hotel.
simp: 我从车站搭了一班到旅馆的计程车。
trad: 我從車站搭了一班到旅館的計程車。

eng: I didn't know the woman at all.
Easier said than done.
It's none of your business!
I used to smoke a lot, but now I've quit.
simp: 我以前常抽菸，但现在我戒掉了。
trad: 我以前常抽菸，但現在我戒掉了。

eng: Don't use "discover" when you mean "invent".
simp: 当你在指「发明」的时候，不要用「发现」这个字。
trad: 當你在指「發明」的時候，不要用「發現」這個字。

eng: You are doing it the wrong way.
I'm going to visit him next week.
simp: 下礼拜我要去拜访她一下。
trad: 下禮拜我要去拜訪她一下。

eng: The professor scolded John for skipping class.
simp: 教授骂了约翰一顿因为他翘了几堂课。
trad: 教授罵了約翰一頓因為他翹了幾堂課。

eng: He might be young but he's trustworthy.
simp: 他虽然年轻却很值得信赖。
trad: 他雖然年輕卻很值得信賴。

eng: It might rain.
There are so many people at this concert.
What would you like to eat for dinner?
No matter what happens, I'm not changing my mind.
simp: 无论如何，我不会改变我的想法。
trad: 無論如何，我不會改變我的想法。

eng: Fish and red wine don't go well together.
I hope I can see you soon.
simp: 我希望很快就能见到你。
trad: 我希望很快就能見到你。

eng: I'm under so much pressure, I just want to cry.
She is far better today than yesterday.
simp: 她今天比昨天要好很多。
trad: 她今天比昨天要好很多。

eng: Can you please shut up?
She tried to break her child of the habit of lying.
simp: 她试着打破她孩子说谎的习惯。
trad: 她試著打破她孩子說謊的習慣。

eng: What time do you wake up every day?
Let go of your negative outlook on life.
simp: 请抛开你那些负面的人生观。
trad: 請拋開你那些負面的人生觀。

eng: You can watch TV after supper.
simp: 晚餐之后你才可以看电视。
trad: 晚餐之後你才可以看電視。

eng: She can sing better than anybody else in her class.
simp: 她唱歌唱得比班上任何一个人好。
trad: 她唱歌唱得比班上任何一個人好。

eng: Your chair is identical to mine.
They obtained a yield of 8 percent on their investment.
simp: 他们在这次的投资中得到百分之八的收益。
trad: 他們在這次的投資中得到百分之八的收益。

eng: After many years of thinking, I came to a conclusion that everyone's meaning of life is actually: to find the meaning of life. Every one of us is a unique individual. And every one of us has his own capibility to find in his life one particular mission to fulfill.
simp: 在多年的思索之下，我终于了解人生的意义就是去寻找人生的意义。我们每个人都是独特的个体。我们每个人都能找到属于自己的人生目标。
trad: 在多年的思索之下，我終於了解人生的意義就是去尋找人生的意義。我們每個人都是獨特的個體。我們每個人都能找到屬於自己的人生目標。

eng: The pharmacy is near the hospital.
He is good at rugby.
If he's fluent in English, I'll hire him.
simp: 如果他说得一口流利的英文，我就请他为我工作。
trad: 如果他說得一口流利的英文，我就請他為我工作。

eng: We cannot sleep well on summer nights.
simp: 在夏天的晚上，我们睡得不是很好。
trad: 在夏天的晚上，我們睡得不是很好。

eng: Are you doing what you think is right?
simp: 你在做你觉得对的事吗?
trad: 你在做你覺得對的事嗎?

eng: Bess is simply a child.
Shall we start the meeting now?
You're terrible.
He has a test next week.
Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
You don't need to work on Sundays.
simp: 星期天的时候，你不用工作。
trad: 星期天的時候，你不用工作。

eng: You have to leave home at six.
simp: 你必须在六点钟时从家中出发。
trad: 你必須在六點鐘時從家中出發。

eng: He suspects me of telling a lie.
She is more pretty than beautiful.
I like to eat.
Please advise me what to do.
Tom heard this and got angry.
simp: 听到这事之后，汤姆为之色变。
trad: 聽到這事之後，湯姆為之色變。

eng: Change is the only constant.
How long are you going to be in Oxford for?
You have no right to interfere in other people's affairs.
simp: 你没有干涉他人事务的权力。
trad: 你沒有幹涉他人事務的權力。

eng: I have a special relationship with my aunt.
simp: 我和我阿姨有种特别的情谊。
trad: 我和我阿姨有種特別的情誼。

eng: I'm waiting for him.
You may use my dictionary.
This room has two closets for clothing.
Having a slight headache, I went to bed early.
simp: 因为我有点头疼，所以我早早上床睡觉。
trad: 因為我有點頭疼，所以我早早上床睡覺。

eng: Let's play hide-and-seek!
I sometimes still think about her.
simp: 有时候，我还是会想起她。
trad: 有時候，我還是會想起她。

eng: No one answered my question.
That's what I thought too.
We don't want any freeloaders around here.
simp: 我们不希望有人在这裡吃霸王餐。
trad: 我們不希望有人在這裡吃霸王餐。

eng: This is the first time.
The unicorn is a fabulous monster.
simp: 独角兽是一种美丽的怪物。
trad: 獨角獸是一種美麗的怪物。

eng: I filled up the vase with water.
What kind of people do you like best?
You are the devil incarnate.
Your shoes are here. Where are mine?
simp: 你的鞋子在这儿。我的呢？
trad: 你的鞋子在這兒。我的呢？

eng: The moon's so bright.
I'll give him the letter.
You can go home.
You're tired. I'm also tired.
He came back at five o'clock.
A great many students were absent from school.
simp: 有好多学生都没来学校。
trad: 有好多學生都沒來學校。

eng: I felt an impulse to cry out loud.
You must not speak loudly.
Bob was washing the dishes at that time.
Tom was admiring my new car at the time the truck crashed into it.
simp: 在汤姆欣赏我的新车的同时，一辆卡车撞了过来。
trad: 在湯姆欣賞我的新車的同時，一輛卡車撞了過來。

eng: Tom was able to make himself understood in French when he visited Paris.
simp: 在巴黎，没有人能够理解汤姆的法文。
trad: 在巴黎，沒有人能夠理解湯姆的法文。

eng: The kidnappers showed no sign of giving up.
simp: 这些绑匪没有放弃的迹象。
trad: 這些綁匪沒有放棄的跡象。

eng: You must not yield to temptation.
simp: 你不应该屈服在诱惑之下。
trad: 你不應該屈服在誘惑之下。

eng: More play will mean less time to study.
simp: 玩的时间一多，读书的时间便少。
trad: 玩的時間一多，讀書的時間便少。

eng: Play or study - the choice is yours.
simp: 玩乐还是读书，全在你一念之间。
trad: 玩樂還是讀書，全在你一念之間。

eng: Wearing second-hand clothes is now popular among young people.
simp: 二手服饰在时下年轻人之间蔚为风潮。
trad: 二手服飾在時下年輕人之間蔚為風潮。

eng: I'm not good at carpentry.
Water will freeze at zero Celsius, right?
simp: 摄氏零度时水会结冰，对吧？
trad: 攝氏零度時水會結冰，對吧？

eng: They referred to Chaucer as the father of English poetry.
simp: 他们视乔叟为英诗之父。
trad: 他們視喬叟為英詩之父。

eng: I've been going out with her for months.
I like sweets.
It's a bit slow, can you wait for a bit?
simp: 现在有点慢，能不能等一下？
trad: 現在有點慢，能不能等一下？

eng: Tom certainly has a better understanding of this matter than I do.
The various dialects of China are what 'Chinese' really is.
simp: 我们中国的各地方言才是真正的中国话。
trad: 我們中國的各地方言才是真正的中國話。

eng: She can speak a type of Chinese, but she can't speak Mandarin.
simp: 她会说中文，却不会说普通话。
trad: 她會說中文，卻不會說普通話。

eng: I moved here yesterday.
If you like it, you can keep it!
simp: 这个东西，要是你喜欢，就拿去吧！
trad: 這個東西，要是你喜歡，就拿去吧！

eng: All the things I bought have already arrived.
simp: 我买的东西已经都送来了。
trad: 我買的東西已經都送來了。

eng: You may go in now.
You ran back here.
You should stand up to speak.
Stand up.
Put it down.
Go away.
Put it on.
Take away.
Sit down! Don't stand up.
He put his things down and left.
I still need to use these things, so please don't take them away.
simp: 这些东西，我还要用，请你别拿走。
trad: 這些東西，我還要用，請你別拿走。

eng: Get out! Don't play here!
It's really cold tonight.
There's a policeman outside who wants to see you.
simp: 外面有一个警察想见你。
trad: 外面有一個警察想見你。

eng: That just goes to show that you are a liar.
simp: 这正可以说明你是个骗子。
trad: 這正可以說明你是個騙子。

eng: This is proof that you're the murderer.
We went to the café that I told you about.
simp: 我们去了我告诉过你的咖啡店。
trad: 我們去了我告訴過你的咖啡店。

eng: I've never met someone who doesn't like chocolate.
simp: 我从来没有认识过一个不喜欢巧克力的人。
trad: 我從來沒有認識過一個不喜歡巧克力的人。

eng: This is the best cake that I have ever eaten.
simp: 这是我从来吃过最好吃的蛋糕。
trad: 這是我從來吃過最好吃的蛋糕。

eng: From the moment that I met her, I hated her.
simp: 自从我认识她的时候，我就恨她。
trad: 自從我認識她的時候，我就恨她。

eng: I never know what to say to people who have absolutely no grasp of the basic facts and are too ignorant to realise it.
simp: 对于那些连基本事实都搞不清楚而且又盲目得无法了解到这一点的人，我从来都不知道对他们说些什么。
trad: 對於那些連基本事實都搞不清楚而且又盲目得無法了解到這一點的人，我從來都不知道對他們說些什麼。

eng: She applied for a job at the company that had not only bribed local officials but also caused huge problems for her own family.
simp: 虽然她知道那家公司不但对当地官员行贿而且也给她的家人带了了极大的麻烦，可她还是应聘了那家公司的一份工作。
trad: 雖然她知道那家公司不但對當地官員行賄而且也給她的家人帶了了極大的麻煩，可她還是應聘了那家公司的一份工作。

eng: Nothing is foolproof to a talented fool.
simp: 对天才的傻瓜来说没有什么不可出乱的。
trad: 對天才的傻瓜來說沒有什麼不可出亂的。

eng: My grandmother has a green thumb.
He never gave up hope that he would reach that goal.
simp: 他从没放弃达成那个目标的希望。
trad: 他從沒放棄達成那個目標的希望。

eng: I used to read novels at random.
simp: 我从前有空时便会读读小说。
trad: 我從前有空時便會讀讀小說。

eng: Would you like some cream in your coffee?
simp: 你要在咖啡上加些奶油吗？
trad: 你要在咖啡上加些奶油嗎？

eng: Death is the point at which you can't be alive again. You can't die and then come back to life. If you think that happened, you weren't really dead.
simp: 死亡之后你便不会再复活。你不能死过之后又重回生命。如果你以为那会发生，你并非真正死去。
trad: 死亡之後你便不會再復活。你不能死過之後又重回生命。如果你以為那會發生，你並非真正死去。

eng: It's an artificial flower.
A great responsibility lies on his shoulders.
I think you've mistaken me for someone else.
simp: 我想你将我认成别人了。
trad: 我想你將我認成別人了。

eng: I called at my uncle's house yesterday.
simp: 昨天，我去我叔叔家作客。
trad: 昨天，我去我叔叔家作客。

eng: As I didn't have time to go shopping today, I had to make do with a sandwich for dinner.
simp: 因为今天我没法上街购物，只好做点三明治将就将就。
trad: 因為今天我沒法上街購物，只好做點三明治將就將就。

eng: We had bad weather yesterday.
He does not come here every day.
Where's your book? "On the table."
How old are you? "I'm sixteen."
How many sisters do you have? How many brothers?
simp: 你有几个姊妹？几个兄弟？
trad: 你有幾個姊妹？幾個兄弟？

eng: Bigfoot is not a pet. For one thing, they don't like being called 'bigfoot'.
simp: 大脚怪并非宠物。首先，他们并不喜欢被人叫做「大脚怪」。
trad: 大腳怪並非寵物。首先，他們並不喜歡被人叫做「大腳怪」。

eng: You are a panda.
You are a panda.
The boy feared the dark.
The boy took the radio apart.
simp: 这个男孩把收音机折散架了。
trad: 這個男孩把收音機折散架了。

eng: The word is unfamiliar to me.
Tom has known Mary since childhood.
simp: 汤姆从小就认识玛丽了。
trad: 湯姆從小就認識瑪麗了。

eng: Teach me how to fold a paper crane. I forgot how to fold it.
simp: 教我怎么折纸鹤吧。我忘记怎么折了。
trad: 教我怎麼折紙鶴吧。我忘記怎麼折了。

eng: He is a man after my own heart.
simp: 他就是我中意的那个男人。
trad: 他就是我中意的那個男人。

eng: My grandfather is fond of taking a walk early in the morning.
simp: 我的爷爷喜欢大清早的散步。
trad: 我的爺爺喜歡大清早的散步。

eng: I'm glad we didn't go there because there were some localized heavy rain showers.
simp: 我很庆幸我们没有去那儿，因为当时那儿有局部大暴雨。
trad: 我很慶幸我們沒有去那兒，因為當時那兒有局部大暴雨。

eng: The vase on my desk overturned when I jumped up in surprise.
simp: 我突然跳起来的时候把花瓶桌子上的打翻了。
trad: 我突然跳起來的時候把花瓶桌子上的打翻了。

eng: She cared for her father until his death.
simp: 她照顾她的父亲直到他去世。
trad: 她照顧她的父親直到他去世。

eng: The accident happened on Sunday at about 3:00.
simp: 此事故发生在周日3点左右。
trad: 此事故發生在周日3點左右。

eng: There on the top of a high mountain they built a small town of their own and lived in peace.
simp: 他们在高山顶上建了自己的小城镇在那里过着宁静的生活。
trad: 他們在高山頂上建了自己的小城鎮在那裏過著寧靜的生活。

eng: Wait, wait just a little while.
I noticed she was wearing a new hat.
simp: 我注意到她当时戴了顶新帽子。
trad: 我註意到她當時戴了頂新帽子。

eng: There is no cause for worry.
They welcomed me warmly, so I felt at home.
simp: 他们这么热情的欢迎我，让我感觉家人一样。
trad: 他們這麼熱情的歡迎我，讓我感覺家人一樣。

eng: I am very much surprised to hear that he got badly injured in a motorcar accident.
simp: 他因车祸受了重伤的消息让我震惊万分。
trad: 他因車禍受了重傷的消息讓我震驚萬分。

eng: It is very expensive to keep up with the latest fashions.
simp: 跟上最近潮流时尚是件非常花钱的事儿。
trad: 跟上最近潮流時尚是件非常花錢的事兒。

eng: Tom came to see if Mary needed any help.
simp: 汤姆过来看看玛丽有没有什么需要帮忙的。
trad: 湯姆過來看看瑪麗有沒有什麼需要幫忙的。

eng: Although it is snowing, I must go.
simp: 虽然正在下雪，但是我也非去不可。
trad: 雖然正在下雪，但是我也非去不可。

eng: Jim is above any of his classmates in English.
simp: 杰米的英语比他班上任何一个同学的都好。
trad: 傑米的英語比他班上任何一個同學的都好。

eng: You should behave carefully.
That is mine. I don't know where yours is.
simp: 那个是我的。我不知道你的在哪里。
trad: 那個是我的。我不知道你的在哪裏。

eng: Tom definitely looks younger than Mary.
simp: 汤姆看起来的确比玛丽年轻。
trad: 湯姆看起來的確比瑪麗年輕。

eng: You're always criticizing me!
Dog is man's best friend.
She remained silent all day.
She rides a motorcycle well.
simp: 她骑摩托车的技术不错！
trad: 她騎摩托車的技術不錯！

eng: I am looking for a present for my mother.
simp: 我正在为我的妈妈寻找礼物。
trad: 我正在為我的媽媽尋找禮物。

eng: It's been hot this month, but today's an exception.
simp: 这个月一直都很热，但今天是个例外。
trad: 這個月一直都很熱，但今天是個例外。

eng: Tom doesn't think so.
Tom can't get his car started.
Tom doesn't like to wear a watch.
I am sure that he is an honest man.
Tom is afraid to go out alone at night.
simp: 汤姆害怕晚上一个人出门儿。
trad: 湯姆害怕晚上一個人出門兒。

eng: It's rare to find big yards in Japan.
simp: 能在日本找到这样的大的院子实属罕见。
trad: 能在日本找到這樣的大的院子實屬罕見。

eng: I help my mother with the housework every day.
simp: 我每天都帮我妈做家务。
trad: 我每天都幫我媽做家務。

eng: If you heard her speak English, you would take her for an American.
simp: 如果你听到她讲的英语，你会以为她是美国人呢。
trad: 如果你聽到她講的英語，你會以為她是美國人呢。

eng: You don't have to kick yourself.
That's not a grasshopper. It's a locust!
You're such an idiot!
He bought a Honda.
You had better not see her now.
My friends invited me to supper.
This conference is very important. Don't miss it.
simp: 这场会议很重要，不要错过了！
trad: 這場會議很重要，不要錯過了！

eng: Excuse me, let me point out three mistakes in the above article.
simp: 不好意思，让我指出先前文章的三个错误。
trad: 不好意思，讓我指出先前文章的三個錯誤。

eng: Please tell me when to go.
simp: 请告诉我什麽时候该走。
trad: 請告訴我什麼時候該走。

eng: When was it built?
simp: 它是什麽什麽时候盖的？
trad: 它是什麼什麼時候蓋的？

eng: Love is a trick.
Love doesn't exist.
Love is only an invention.
We accept checks.
The supermarkets are now closed, so we'll have to make do with what is left in the refrigerator.
simp: 超市现在已经关了，我们只能加减用一下冰箱裡剩的食物。
trad: 超市現在已經關了，我們只能加減用一下冰箱裡剩的食物。

eng: He often complains that he has a toothache.
The hunter chases the rabbit in the fields.
In spring, everyone wakes up early.
I played tennis after school.
What does he want to do?
She has attractive eyes.
Tom certainly is an interesting person.
simp: 汤姆这人确实很有意思。
trad: 湯姆這人確實很有意思。

eng: All you have to do is take advantage of this rare opportunity.
simp: 你所要做的便是好好把握这千载难逢的机会。
trad: 你所要做的便是好好把握這千載難逢的機會。

eng: Visiting all the tourist sights really wore me out.
simp: 参观所有观光胜地累坏了我。
trad: 參觀所有觀光勝地累壞了我。

eng: The tourists were fascinated with the exquisite scenery.
simp: 观光客被独特的景致所吸引。
trad: 觀光客被獨特的景致所吸引。

eng: Apparently, they nest in a tree in front of the house.
simp: 很明显的，他们房前的树上筑巢。
trad: 很明顯的，他們房前的樹上築巢。

eng: I am thankful to have been given the experience of life.
simp: 我很感激我能够领受到这样的人生体验。
trad: 我很感激我能夠領受到這樣的人生體驗。

eng: One is not born a woman, one becomes one.
simp: 我们生来并非女儿身：我们成为她们的一份子。
trad: 我們生來並非女兒身：我們成為她們的一份子。

eng: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive.
simp: 带着希望旅行比达到目的地更为美好。
trad: 帶著希望旅行比達到目的地更為美好。

eng: Gentleness and cheerfulness, these come before all morality; they are the perfect duties.
simp: 良善和喜乐比道德更加重要，是我们所应尽的绝对义务。
trad: 良善和喜樂比道德更加重要，是我們所應盡的絕對義務。

eng: The business is in the red.
simp: 这场生意正面临着赤字。
trad: 這場生意正面臨著赤字。

eng: I always have to wear a tie because of my job.
simp: 因为我这份工作的缘故，我总是要打领带。
trad: 因為我這份工作的緣故，我總是要打領帶。

eng: Don't touch the goods.
The goods were transported by ship.
simp: 这批货物是由船隻运送的。
trad: 這批貨物是由船隻運送的。

eng: I've found a way to make him really jealous. "Oh, do tell!"
simp: 「我已经找到令他嫉妒的方法了。」「喔，说吧！」
trad: 「我已經找到令他嫉妒的方法了。」「喔，說吧！」

eng: It is a stereotype that police officers always eat doughnuts.
simp: 警察总吃甜甜圈是一种刻板印象。
trad: 警察總吃甜甜圈是一種刻板印象。

eng: I don't understand why pepperoni pizza is so popular.
simp: 我不懂为何义式辣肠披萨如此受欢迎。
trad: 我不懂為何義式辣腸披薩如此受歡迎。

eng: It seems that most people only barbeque in the summer.
simp: 人们似乎只在夏天烤肉。
trad: 人們似乎只在夏天烤肉。

eng: Don't ask her any questions about her marriage.
simp: 不要问她任何有关婚姻的问题。
trad: 不要問她任何有關婚姻的問題。

eng: He built an observatory to study the stars.
simp: 为了观测星象，他建了一座瞭望台。
trad: 為了觀測星象，他建了一座瞭望臺。

eng: We climbed a sharp slope.
Even his teacher didn't understand him.
simp: 连他的老师都不了解他。
trad: 連他的老師都不了解他。

eng: It's so nice to stay at home.
I stopped smoking for the sake of my health.
I take my health seriously.
I want to put an end to the quarrel.
I call architecture frozen music.
simp: 我将建筑称作被冻结的音乐。
trad: 我將建築稱作被凍結的音樂。

eng: I tried very hard to put an end to their heated argument.
simp: 我努力地平息他们不断加温的争执。
trad: 我努力地平息他們不斷加溫的爭執。

eng: I went to the hospital to have my eyes tested.
simp: 我到医院去检查了眼睛。
trad: 我到醫院去檢查了眼睛。

eng: I like dogs, but my sister likes cats.
simp: 我喜欢狗，但我姊喜欢猫。
trad: 我喜歡狗，但我姊喜歡貓。

eng: I saw a dog swim across the river.
This tunnel is twice as long as that one.
simp: 这条隧道是那条的两倍长。
trad: 這條隧道是那條的兩倍長。

eng: The sky is blue.
I shook hands with her.
You're not busy, right?
I'll ask him if he's busy or not.
You have a really good sense of direction.
Are you busy?
Will you go on foot or by bus?
simp: 你要用走的还是搭公车？
trad: 你要用走的還是搭公車？

eng: There's no need for you to study.
I want to stay in a hotel near the airport.
simp: 我想住在机场附近的旅馆裡。
trad: 我想住在機場附近的旅館裡。

eng: Maybe at the time she accidentally left her car key in her room.
simp: 也许当时她将车钥匙忘在自己的房间裡了。
trad: 也許當時她將車鑰匙忘在自己的房間裡了。

eng: There are many kinds of insurance such as: health insurance, fire insurance, life insurance, etc.
simp: 保险有很多种，例如健康保险、火灾保险、人寿保险等等。
trad: 保險有很多種，例如健康保險、火災保險、人壽保險等等。

eng: Now they have three children.
If not for music, the world would be a dull place.
simp: 如果没有了音乐，这个世界一定会变得十分枯燥乏味。
trad: 如果沒有了音樂，這個世界一定會變得十分枯燥乏味。

eng: The little girl has a doll in her hands.
simp: 小女孩手上拿着一个洋娃娃。
trad: 小女孩手上拿著一個洋娃娃。

eng: At last, the truth became known to us.
Their small protest triggered a mass demonstration.
simp: 他们小型的示威引发了一场大规模的游行。
trad: 他們小型的示威引發了一場大規模的遊行。

eng: To tell the truth, that actor is married.
simp: 其实那个演员已经结婚了。
trad: 其實那個演員已經結婚了。

eng: Such a plan will give rise to many problems.
simp: 这样的计划会引发很多问题。
trad: 這樣的計劃會引發很多問題。

eng: Eat noodles.
We unexpectedly found a cat in the box.
simp: 我们意外地在箱子里找到了一只猫。
trad: 我們意外地在箱子裏找到了一只貓。

eng: I will send it by email this afternoon.
Last week I quickly read four books in my room.
simp: 我上个星期匆匆地在我的房间里看了四本书。
trad: 我上個星期匆匆地在我的房間裏看了四本書。

eng: Everyone likes big pizzas.
simp: 所有人都喜欢大的比萨。
trad: 所有人都喜歡大的比薩。

eng: The thin man killed the fat man.
simp: 瘦的男人杀死了胖的男人。
trad: 瘦的男人殺死了胖的男人。

eng: That red car hit the blue van.
simp: 那辆红色的汽车撞到了蓝色的卡车。
trad: 那輛紅色的汽車撞到了藍色的卡車。

eng: Sometimes I say "yes," even though I want to say "no."
simp: 我有时候说「是」儘管我想说「不是」。
trad: 我有時候說「是」儘管我想說「不是」。

eng: No music, no life.
Why do humans smile? This is a very difficult question to answer.
simp: 为何人会笑，这个问题是一个很难解决的问题。
trad: 為何人會笑，這個問題是一個很難解決的問題。

eng: For several years I've been in the habit of, when I'm at home, only leaving my desk when it's time to eat.
simp: 这是我数年的习惯了，在家里除了吃饭以外我很少离开我的桌子。
trad: 這是我數年的習慣了，在家裏除了吃飯以外我很少離開我的桌子。

eng: When you arrive in Osaka, please contact me.
simp: 你来到大坂的时候请跟我联络。
trad: 你來到大阪的時候請跟我聯絡。

eng: Who touched my gun?
She is always dressed in black.
She always lets her children do what they want to.
simp: 她总是让自己的小孩做自己想做的事。
trad: 她總是讓自己的小孩做自己想做的事。

eng: She always takes care of her children.
simp: 她毫无间断地照顾自己的孩子。
trad: 她毫無間斷地照顧自己的孩子。

eng: The test result showed how much he had studied.
simp: 测验结果显示他有多发愤上学。
trad: 測驗結果顯示他有多發憤上學。

eng: How I wish I could swim.
The Catholic Church is opposed to divorce.
I immediately thought of you!
Ten years is a really long period of time.
simp: 十年是一段漫长的岁月。
trad: 十年是一段漫長的歲月。

eng: Novels? I hate novels. Oh muse, forgive her blasphemy.
simp: 「小说啊？我就讨厌看小说。」天哪，请原谅她的亵渎行为。
trad: 「小說啊？我就討厭看小說。」天哪，請原諒她的褻瀆行為。

eng: Novels? I hate novels. Oh muse, forgive her blasphemy.
simp: 「小说啊？我就讨厌看小说。」缪斯，请原谅她的亵渎行为。
trad: 「小說啊？我就討厭看小說。」繆斯，請原諒她的褻瀆行為。

eng: Block it!
The dodo is an already extinct species.
simp: 渡渡鸟是已灭绝的动物。
trad: 渡渡鳥是已滅絕的動物。

eng: The dodo is an already extinct species.
The Golden Age of the Romans is in the past.
simp: 罗马人的黄金时代已过去了。
trad: 羅馬人的黃金時代已過去了。

eng: Do you have a bag?
I don't like beer that much.
I haven't been to America.
The tall man left in a hurry.
That is Xiaoli's book.
That's why I'm telling you not to go alone.
simp: 所以我叫你不要一个人去咯。
trad: 所以我叫你不要一個人去咯。

eng: I don't like big dogs.
Please wake me for breakfast.
simp: 麻烦你叫我起床吃早餐啦。
trad: 麻煩你叫我起床吃早餐啦。

eng: He was born in this very room.
simp: 他就是在这间屋子里出生的。
trad: 他就是在這間屋子裏出生的。

eng: You say Nessie is an imaginary being, but I think she exists.
simp: 你说尼斯湖水怪是虚构的，但我觉得它真实存在。
trad: 你說尼斯湖水怪是虛構的，但我覺得它真實存在。

eng: Something you should know about me is that I'm afraid of heights.
simp: 关于我，有一点你应该了解，我恐高。
trad: 關於我，有一點你應該了解，我恐高。

eng: I'll look after your child while you are away.
simp: 你离开时我会照看你的孩子
trad: 你離開時我會照看你的孩子

eng: An increase in customer complaints could signal a decline in business.
simp: 顾客投诉量增加，可能代表生意正在走下坡。
trad: 顧客投訴量增加，可能代表生意正在走下坡。

eng: The doctor used X-rays to examine my stomach.
The strong wind indicates that a storm is coming.
simp: 强风暗示着即将到来的暴雨。
trad: 強風暗示著即將到來的暴雨。

eng: I take full responsibility for the action.
simp: 我会为这次行动负起全责。
trad: 我會為這次行動負起全責。

eng: The chances are he's already heard the news.
simp: 他有可能已经得知这消息。
trad: 他有可能已經得知這消息。

eng: My vacation went by quickly.
simp: 我的假期一下就过完了。
trad: 我的假期一下就過完了。

eng: The Swiss consume a large amount of beer.
How much money do you owe Tom?
How much money do I owe you?
Volcanic ash disrupted air travel.
All plants need water and light.
simp: 所有的植物都需要阳光和水。
trad: 所有的植物都需要陽光和水。

eng: We observed this plant closely for a few weeks.
simp: 我们密切地关注这家工厂几个星期了.
trad: 我們密切地關註這家工廠幾個星期了.

eng: Workers of the world, unite!
simp: 全世界无产者，联合起来！
trad: 全世界無產者，聯合起來！

eng: It is a lot of fun to drive a car.
Will he come? I don't think he will come.
simp: 他会来吗?我觉得他不会来。
trad: 他會來嗎?我覺得他不會來。

eng: Jim put the key into the lock.
He is telling a lie.
He came back not because he was homesick, but because he was running short of money.
simp: 他不是因为想家，而是因为没钱才回来的。
trad: 他不是因為想家，而是因為沒錢才回來的。

eng: Winter is here, and the weather's getting cold.
simp: 冬天到了， 天气变冷了。
trad: 冬天到了， 天氣變冷了。

eng: I haven't finished reading this book.
The concert will probably last three hours.
simp: 演唱会大概持续三个小时。
trad: 演唱會大概持續三個小時。

eng: The prices of raw materials such as oil or coal continue to rise.
simp: 原材料的价格如石油或者煤的不停地上升。
trad: 原材料的價格如石油或者煤的不停地上升。

eng: Nail polish remover stinks a lot.
I like classical music.
I just had a quick look. It wasn't interesting at all.
simp: 我刚才瞧了一眼，一点没意思。
trad: 我剛才瞧了一眼，一點沒意思。

eng: There are a lot of books in the library.
She is a true witch!
Tom is used to cooking on a campfire.
Whose shirt is this?
This shirt doesn't go with that tie at all.
simp: 这件衬衫跟那条领带不搭。
trad: 這件襯衫跟那條領帶不搭。

eng: This shirt costs ten dollars.
Put this jacket on, and you'll be much warmer.
simp: 穿上外套吧！你会暖一些。
trad: 穿上外套吧！你會暖一些。

eng: Can I try on this jacket?
simp: 我可以试穿这件外套吗？
trad: 我可以試穿這件外套嗎？

eng: Is this jacket right for me?
This jacket sets well.
Do you have this jacket in different colors?
simp: 你有不同颜色的外套吗？
trad: 你有不同顏色的外套嗎？

eng: This jacket is a tight fit.
This blot can't be wiped out.
This zipper doesn't zip smoothly.
The stew smells delicious.
simp: 这锅墩汤闻起来真美味。
trad: 這鍋墩湯聞起來真美味。

eng: This system has obvious defects.
simp: 这个系统有些明显的缺陷。
trad: 這個系統有些明顯的缺陷。

eng: We went to Russia.
Do you have a coat and a hat?
Do you have a gift shop here?
Do you have a list of hotels?
Do you have a map?
Do you have a match? I'm sorry, but I don't smoke.
simp: 你有火柴吗？很抱歉，我不抽菸。
trad: 你有火柴嗎？很抱歉，我不抽菸。

eng: I have never gone to America.
Do you have a petting zoo area?
simp: 你们这裡有可爱动物区吗？
trad: 你們這裡有可愛動物區嗎？

eng: He gave me some money.
The boy is over there.
The boy is over there.
What's the name of my doctor?
How's the weather in New York?
He was busy when I called him up.
simp: 我给他打电话的时候， 他正忙。
trad: 我給他打電話的時候， 他正忙。

eng: I climb mountains.
From reading good books we can derive pleasure, friendship, experience and instruction.
simp: 读书，可以获得乐趣、友谊、经验和指导。
trad: 讀書，可以獲得樂趣、友誼、經驗和指導。

eng: A good book can completely absorb your attention, to the extent that you forget your surroundings and even your existence.
simp: 一本好书会令你全神贯注，甚至忘掉周围和自己。
trad: 一本好書會令你全神貫註，甚至忘掉周圍和自己。

eng: Reading is one of life's great pleasures.
When you are cheerful, books can increase your happiness; when you are sad, books can lessen your sorrow.
simp: 开心时，书可以给你增加快乐；忧伤时，书可以给你减少哀愁。
trad: 開心時，書可以給你增加快樂；憂傷時，書可以給你減少哀愁。

eng: No matter what your main purpose is in reading, books should never fail to provide contentment and satisfaction.
simp: 无论读书的目的是什么，书总会带给我们乐趣和满足。
trad: 無論讀書的目的是什麼，書總會帶給我們樂趣和滿足。

eng: With a good book in your hands you need never feel lonely.
simp: 一本好书在手，我们不必孤单。
trad: 一本好書在手，我們不必孤單。

eng: Whether the characters in a book are real or completely imaginary, they can become your friends and companions.
simp: 无论书中的人物是真实的还是完全假想的，他们能成为你的伙伴和朋友。
trad: 無論書中的人物是真實的還是完全假想的，他們能成為你的夥伴和朋友。

eng: By reading books we can walk with the great and the good from every place and every era.
simp: 在书中，我们可以跟各个时代、各个地方的智者仁人同行。
trad: 在書中，我們可以跟各個時代、各個地方的智者仁人同行。

eng: The people we meet in books can delight us either because they resemble the friends we hold dear in real life, or because they are unfamiliar people that we are pleased to get to know.
simp: 我们在书中认识的人可以带给我们愉悦或是他们与我们生活中挚爱的朋友相似，或是因为他们是我们所不熟悉却乐于结识的人。
trad: 我們在書中認識的人可以帶給我們愉悅或是他們與我們生活中摯愛的朋友相似，或是因為他們是我們所不熟悉卻樂於結識的人。

eng: Our real life friends may sometimes bore us, but the friends we find in books would never do that.
simp: 我们生活中的朋友有时会让我们觉得无聊，而我们书中的朋友永远不会这样。
trad: 我們生活中的朋友有時會讓我們覺得無聊，而我們書中的朋友永遠不會這樣。

eng: By turning the page, we can dismiss the characters in a book without fear of hurting their feelings.
simp: 书页翻动之间，我们可以对书中的人物不予理会而不伤及他们的情感。
trad: 書頁翻動之間，我們可以對書中的人物不予理會而不傷及他們的情感。

eng: When real life friends desert us, books are always ready to offer friendship, sympathy and motivation.
simp: 生活中的朋友弃我们不顾之时，书随时给我们送来友谊、同情和鼓励。
trad: 生活中的朋友棄我們不顧之時，書隨時給我們送來友誼、同情和鼓勵。

eng: She can sing very well.
We can see things in the distance using a telescope.
simp: 我们可以用望远镜来观察远方的事物。
trad: 我們可以用望遠鏡來觀察遠方的事物。

eng: There is an apple under the desk.
He is one of my best friends.
simp: 他是我其中一个最要好的朋友。
trad: 他是我其中一個最要好的朋友。

eng: He must have drunk too much last night.
It was a very traditional ceremony.
simp: 那是一个十分传统的仪式。
trad: 那是一個十分傳統的儀式。

eng: If mankind doesn't take care of the environment, the environment may eliminate mankind.
simp: 如果人类不好好保护大自然，大自然说不定会反过来把人类毁灭。
trad: 如果人類不好好保護大自然，大自然說不定會反過來把人類毀滅。

eng: We're just about finished here.
There will be snow tomorrow.
You've been late for school more often than before.
simp: 你比以前更容易上课迟到了。
trad: 你比以前更容易上課遲到了。

eng: I fought against sleep.
My throat feels dry and raw and scratchy.
simp: 我的喉咙又乾又红、又痛又痒。
trad: 我的喉嚨又乾又紅、又痛又癢。

eng: I don't know if my money is enough.
simp: 我不知道我是否有足够多的钱。
trad: 我不知道我是否有足夠多的錢。

eng: Don't kid yourself.
I awoke from a dream.
He lost a book.
She lost a book.
We haven't finished eating the watermelon yet.
simp: 我们还没吃完这个西瓜。
trad: 我們還沒吃完這個西瓜。

eng: The weather today is great, but lately it's been raining all the time.
simp: 今天天气很好，但是最近总是下雨。
trad: 今天天氣很好，但是最近總是下雨。

eng: They eat these things.
They eat these things.
They eat these things.
Today I went to university to study. Tomorrow I will go again.
simp: 我今天去大学读书，明天我会再去。
trad: 我今天去大學讀書，明天我會再去。

eng: I'm friends with him.
My house is here.
This is easy!
I've heard Italian is a tricky language.
simp: 听说意大利语是一门很难的语言 。
trad: 聽說意大利語是一門很難的語言 。

eng: Please send me a picture of yourself.
simp: 请寄给我一张你的照片。
trad: 請寄給我一張你的照片。

eng: If you pass this test, you could graduate next month.
simp: 如果你通过这个考试，你下个月就可以毕业了。
trad: 如果你通過這個考試，你下個月就可以畢業了。

eng: She is very busy.
That's a lie!

Have some ham.
She's busy.

simp: 你曾是一宗司法桉件的证人？
trad: 你曾是一宗司法案件的證人？

eng: Such behavior can cause an accident.

eng: I haven't used Anki for a week, and now I'm behind by 500 cards.

trad: 我有一星期沒用Anki了，現在我有五百張卡片滯後。

eng: And I'm in Lvov now!
This book will give you a clear idea of the American way of life.
simp: 这书会教给你一个明了的美式人生观。
trad: 這書會教給你一個明了的美式人生觀。

eng: He became wiser as he grew older.
simp: 随着年龄的增长，他变得更加聪明。
trad: 隨著年齡的增長，他變得更加聰明。

eng: What is a god?

Thanks, I'm full.
Is it raining?
What languages do you speak?

simp: 在打网球方面，他和我势均力敌。
trad: 在打網球方面，他和我勢均力敵。

eng: I am in a tight place.
There are many galaxies in the universe.
Tom asked Mary to help him reinstall Windows.
simp: 汤姆要玛丽帮他重装Windows系统。
trad: 湯姆要瑪麗幫他重裝Windows系統。

eng: He'll play golf even if it rains.
simp: 即使在下雨天，他也打高尔夫球。
trad: 即使在下雨天，他也打高爾夫球。

eng: He suggested to us that we should stay.
I like to take a hot bath every night before bed.

trad: 我喜歡在每晚睡覺前洗個熱水澡。

eng: There is sand at the bottom of the ocean.

simp: 他的办公室离车站很近。
trad: 他的辦公室離車站很近。

eng: It may sound strange, but what she said is true.
simp: 听起来或许有点怪，但她说的是真的。
trad: 聽起來或許有點怪，但她說的是真的。

eng: People love to talk.
I'm a make-up artist. I can turn any girl into a beautiful woman.
simp: 我是个化妆师，每当我把一个姑娘变成大美女。
trad: 我是個化妝師，每當我把一個姑娘變成大美女。

eng: I'm really jealous of your life right now.
simp: 我很羡慕你现在的生活。
trad: 我很羨慕你現在的生活。

eng: The job is interesting, and then again, the pay is good.
simp: 那份工作挺有趣味，而且薪金也不错。
trad: 那份工作挺有趣味，而且薪金也不錯。

eng: It looks like they have made up again.
simp: 他们两人好像又和好如初了。
trad: 他們兩人好像又和好如初了。

eng: He treats me as if I am a stranger.
simp: 他把我当成陌生人来看待。
trad: 他把我當成陌生人來看待。

eng: Fear always springs from ignorance.
simp: 恐惧永远都是由无知所造成的。
trad: 恐懼永遠都是由無知所造成的。

eng: My parents taught me to respect my elders.
simp: 我的父母教育我应该尊敬老人。
trad: 我的父母教育我應該尊敬老人。

eng: We live near the large library.
I asked her for her address.
Our dorm's heating system isn't working properly.
simp: 宿舍里的暖气系统出毛病了。
trad: 宿舍裏的暖氣系統出毛病了。

eng: That red-roofed house is my uncle's.
simp: 那座红楼顶的房子是我叔叔的。
trad: 那座紅樓頂的房子是我叔叔的。

eng: What a beautiful night!
He had just arrived.
He has a white cat.
One should respect his teachers.
Push the red button if something strange happens.
simp: 发生意外的话按这个红按钮。
trad: 發生意外的話按這個紅按鈕。

eng: Who are you talking to?
This cell phone is really expensive.
simp: 这只手机实在是太贵了。
trad: 這只手機實在是太貴了。

eng: Play there.
Failing the examination means waiting for another year.
simp: 考试不及格意味着再等待一年。
trad: 考試不及格意味著再等待一年。

eng: Do you have rice?
Don't exaggerate now.
Let's go to the field and fly kites, what do you say?
simp: 咱们到田园去放风筝怎么样？
trad: 咱們到田園去放風箏怎麼樣？

eng: Do you think of me as a cool guy?
Do you think I'm cool?
Ants and giraffes are distant cousins.
We have our evening meal at 9 here.
simp: 我们在晚上九点时吃晚餐。
trad: 我們在晚上九點時吃晚餐。

eng: Lunch is on.
He was hit by a car and died instantly.
simp: 他被车撞了之后便过世了。
trad: 他被車撞了之後便過世了。

eng: I wish you a speedy recovery!
Who has come?

simp: 我们公司今季的赤字上涨了差不多一成。
trad: 我們公司今季的赤字上漲了差不多一成。

eng: What time do you usually go to bed?
simp: 你通常甚麽时候上床睡觉？
trad: 你通常甚麼時候上床睡覺？

eng: Is he busy?
Eggs should be boiled for at least five minutes.
We could go travelling for a few days.

He can borrow my moped for a few days.
simp: 他可以借我的摩托车几天。
trad: 他可以借我的摩托車幾天。

eng: The police will pursue her for a long time.
simp: 警察会追捕她很长时间。
trad: 警察會追捕她很長時間。

eng: She goes online for several hours every day.
You should sleep for eight hours a day.
simp: 你应该每天睡八个小时觉。
trad: 你應該每天睡八個小時覺。

eng: Waiting for too long makes most people annoyed.
simp: 等太长时间让大部分的人觉得心烦。
trad: 等太長時間讓大部分的人覺得心煩。

eng: Not seeing them for a whole month makes me sad.
simp: 一整个月没看到他们让我感觉很难过。
trad: 一整個月沒看到他們讓我感覺很難過。

eng: Giving up drinking for a year is healthy.
I watched TV for two hours yesterday.
simp: 我昨天看了两个小时电视。
trad: 我昨天看了兩個小時電視。

eng: When you get there, wait for a while.
I’ll go out after I’ve rested for a while.
simp: 我休息了一会儿再要出去。
trad: 我休息了一會兒再要出去。

eng: I slept for eight hours last night.
simp: 我昨晚睡了八个小时觉。
trad: 我昨晚睡了八個小時覺。

eng: We’ve been waiting for hours.
simp: 我们已经等了好几个小时了。
trad: 我們已經等了好幾個小時了。

eng: I’ve known him for ten years.
They’ve been watching that film for ages.
simp: 他们看了那部电影半天了。
trad: 他們看了那部電影半天了。

eng: They haven’t slept for forty-eight hours.
simp: 他们已经四十八个小时没睡觉了。
trad: 他們已經四十八個小時沒睡覺了。

eng: We haven’t seen him for over ten years.
simp: 我们已经十多年没看过他了。
trad: 我們已經十多年沒看過他了。

eng: My wife is Chinese.
My wife is Chinese.
This room is used as a kitchen.
Do you want to sit down?
Do you want to sit down?

simp: 这幅画被估价数百万元。
trad: 這幅畫被估價數百萬元。

eng: Tom is three years older than Mary is.
My shoulder hurts so much, I don't know what to do.
simp: 我的肩膀很痛，我不知道怎么办。
trad: 我的肩膀很痛，我不知道怎麼辦。

eng: I miss you. I need to see you. Could I come over?
simp: 我想你。我需要见你。我能来吗？
trad: 我想你。我需要見你。我能來嗎？

eng: Is it yours?
Love is blind, but jealousy can see even nonexistent things.
simp: 爱是盲目的，但是嫉妒却可以看到即使并不存在的东西。
trad: 愛是盲目的，但是嫉妒卻可以看到即使並不存在的東西。

eng: Your shirt button is coming off.
Do you know where I live?
The boy throws a stone.
I miss you so much.
Reading a book can be compared to a journey.
simp: 阅读一本书可以比作一次旅行。

eng: I don't think television will take the place of books.

eng: She insisted that I should see the doctor.
That young lady is a nurse.

trad: 你們怎麼得出這個結論的？

eng: You'll need a special tool to do it.
simp: 你会需要一个特殊的工具来做这件事。
trad: 你會需要一個特殊的工具來做這件事。

eng: He doesn't know how to write a letter in English.
simp: 他不知道如何用英语写信。
trad: 他不知道如何用英語寫信。

eng: You should set a good example to your children.
simp: 你应该给你的孩子们树立好的榜样。
trad: 你應該給你的孩子們樹立好的榜樣。

eng: She comes from Germany.
I'm ready to leave.

I must buy a new winter coat.
simp: 我得买一件新冬天外套
trad: 我得買一件新冬天外套

eng: This is just what I wanted.
Knowledge is power.
I don't know any of the five ladies.
simp: 这五个女人我一个都不认识。
trad: 這五個女人我一個都不認識。

eng: As far as I'm concerned, things are going well.
Language is the means by which people communicate with others.
simp: 语言是人们与他人交流的手段。
trad: 語言是人們與他人交流的手段。

eng: He painted the ceiling blue.
simp: 他把天花板刷成了蓝色。

simp: 这是我得到过的最好的礼物。
trad: 這是我得到過的最好的禮物。

eng: The boy went to bed with his socks on.
simp: 男孩穿着袜子就上床睡觉了。
trad: 男孩穿著襪子就上床睡覺了。

eng: You remind me of a boy I used to know.
simp: 你让我想起我过去认识的一个男孩。
trad: 你讓我想起我過去認識的一個男孩。

eng: I know almost nothing about it.
simp: 这件事我算是都不了解。
trad: 這件事我算是都不了解。

eng: I know almost nothing about it.
simp: 关于这个我几乎没什么概念。
trad: 關於這個我幾乎沒什麼概念。

eng: There's no chance that he'll recover.
simp: 对于他的康复没有任何希望。
trad: 對於他的康復沒有任何希望。

eng: Paper was invented in China.
You are the most important person in my life.
simp: 你是我的生命当中最重要的人。
trad: 你是我的生命當中最重要的人。

eng: He often sits for many hours reading books.
simp: 他常常坐着看书一连好几个小时。
trad: 他常常坐著看書一連好幾個小時。

eng: He sleeps during the day and works at night.
He secretly showed me her photograph.
simp: 他给我偷偷地展示了她的照片。
trad: 他給我偷偷地展示了她的照片。

eng: He's been sick in bed for four days.
How long does it take for the airport shuttle to get to the airport?
simp: 穿梭班车到机场需要多长时间？
trad: 穿梭班車到機場需要多長時間？

eng: The terrible scene made him tremble in fear.
simp: 令人震惊的光景让了他吓得发抖。
trad: 令人震驚的光景讓了他嚇得發抖。

eng: The terrible scene made him shudder.
simp: 恐怖的场面让了他颤抖。
trad: 恐怖的場面讓了他顫抖。

eng: He was so angry he couldn't speak.
He always keeps his word.
Only sixteen percent of the teachers at the school are female.
simp: 这所学校的老师只有百分之十六是女性。
trad: 這所學校的老師只有百分之十六是女性。

eng: Do you have anything to eat?
This is just a hypothesis.
I'm not as stupid as you think I am.
Christmas is so close now.
He was like a ninja hiding behind one of our cars!
simp: 他像忍者藏着在我们车的旁边。
trad: 他像忍者藏著在我們車的旁邊。

eng: I tried to stay on friendly terms with her, but it was impossible.
simp: 我企图与她保持友好的关系，不过那是不可能的。
trad: 我企圖與她保持友好的關系，不過那是不可能的。

eng: I think you need to think about the future.
simp: 我觉得你应该考虑到未来。
trad: 我覺得你應該考慮到未來。

eng: I made a serious mistake on the test.
simp: 考试的时候我犯了很严重的错误。
trad: 考試的時候我犯了很嚴重的錯誤。

eng: By the way, how many of you keep a diary?
simp: 对了，你们当中写日记的有几位？
trad: 對了，你們當中寫日記的有幾位？

eng: I have decided to keep a diary this year.
simp: 这一年我下了决心写日记。
trad: 這一年我下了決心寫日記。

eng: I broke a nail.
You must have stayed up late.
She is used to staying up late.
Women like to talk.
It is likely to rain today.
You may be surprised to receive this letter.
simp: 你收到这封信可能会有点惊讶。
trad: 你收到這封信可能會有點驚訝。

eng: The medicine cured him of his illness.
I'm going to sit on the bench over there next to the street lamp.
simp: 我会在那盏街灯旁边的长凳上坐下来。
trad: 我會在那盞街燈旁邊的長凳上坐下來。

eng: To my surprise, he had a beautiful voice.
simp: 他的歌声出乎意料之外地好听。
trad: 他的歌聲出乎意料之外地好聽。

eng: On behalf of the company, I welcome you.
simp: 我代表公司欢迎你的来临。
trad: 我代表公司歡迎你的來臨。

eng: If you're not sweating when you do cardio, then you're not doing it hard enough.
simp: 如果你做带氧运动的时候没有流汗，那就代表你做得不够剧烈。
trad: 如果你做帶氧運動的時候沒有流汗，那就代表你做得不夠劇烈。

eng: You have expensive taste! the shopkeeper exclaimed. "Are you sure you don't want to look through our cheaper variants first?"
simp: 「您的品味真高！」店员叹道。「不过我们还有一些价钱比较相宜的款式，您真的不要先看一下吗？」
trad: 「您的品味真高！」店員嘆道。「不過我們還有一些價錢比較相宜的款式，您真的不要先看一下嗎？」

eng: I'm in a terrible hurry... for reasons I can't say, Dima replied to the woman. "Please, just let me try on that suit there."
simp: 「我正在忙着办一些⋯⋯事情，」狄马回应道。「就当我求求你吧，让我试穿一下那套西装吧。」
trad: 「我正在忙著辦一些⋯⋯事情，」狄馬回應道。「就當我求求你吧，讓我試穿一下那套西裝吧。」

eng: Do you like to be alone?
The basic job of an advertising agency is to figure out how to turn a desire into a need.
simp: 广告商最基本的工作就是把人的慾望转化成需要。
trad: 廣告商最基本的工作就是把人的慾望轉化成需要。

eng: She's learning to swim.
I love how you think of other people's needs before your own.
simp: 我很喜欢你为人设想的性格。
trad: 我很喜歡你為人設想的性格。

eng: Have you ever donated blood?
Do you study every day?
The amount of people on Facebook is greater than the population of the United States of America.
simp: Facebook用户数量超过美国人口。
trad: Facebook用戶數量超過美國人口。

eng: After hearing the news, she cheered up.
simp: 听到这个消息，她开心了起来。
trad: 聽到這個消息，她開心了起來。

eng: Something is better than nothing.
I didn't want to surprise you.
Do you like apples?
The bus was ten minutes late.
Do you think animals have souls?
What are we having for dinner?
I'm very tired, but I can't get to sleep.
simp: 我很累，但我还是没办法入睡。
trad: 我很累，但我還是沒辦法入睡。

eng: I was born in 1988.
You haven't changed at all.
He does not like tennis.
He obtained a picture which Picasso had painted in his later years.
simp: 他获得了一幅毕卡索晚年的画作。
trad: 他獲得了一幅畢卡索晚年的畫作。

eng: What is his daily goal?
A doctor told me that eating eggs was bad for me.
simp: 一位医生告诉过我，吃鸡蛋对我的健康有害。
trad: 一位醫生告訴過我，吃雞蛋對我的健康有害。

eng: If you hurry you can still make the train.
simp: 如果你抓紧，你还能赶上火车。
trad: 如果你抓緊，你還能趕上火車。

eng: The dictionary is of great use to me.
I recognize that what he says is the truth.
I knew he would accept.
5000 yuan is a lot of money.
We're drinking tea and waiting.
Tom wants to marry Marie.
Some people eat sushi with their hands.
Huizi asked Zhuangzi: "If you're not a fish, how do you know what fish enjoy?"
simp: 惠子问庄子：「子非鱼，安知鱼之乐？」
trad: 惠子問莊子：「子非魚，安知魚之樂？」

eng: She came close to falling off the platform.
simp: 她差点从台上掉了下来。
trad: 她差點從臺上掉了下來。

eng: My leg was broken in a traffic accident.
simp: 我在一场交通意外中折断了腿。
trad: 我在一場交通意外中折斷了腿。

eng: It's only a fifteen minute bus ride from here to the airport.
simp: 坐公车从这里到机场只不过是十五分钟的路程。
trad: 坐公車從這裏到機場只不過是十五分鐘的路程。

eng: Come on in!
She bought some vegetables yesterday.
The distance between stars is measured in light years.
simp: 星体和星体之间的距离是用光年来量度的。
trad: 星體和星體之間的距離是用光年來量度的。

eng: All happy families resemble each other, each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
simp: 幸福家庭的幸福原因全都大同小异，但悲惨的家庭却往往各自有各自的惨法。
trad: 幸福家庭的幸福原因全都大同小異，但悲慘的家庭卻往往各自有各自的慘法。

eng: He loses his temper so easily that everybody avoids him.
simp: 他动不动就发脾气，所以人人都怕了他。
trad: 他動不動就發脾氣，所以人人都怕了他。

eng: It warms your heart when, while listening to a song in a (seemingly!) foreign language — Slovak, Macedonian, or Slovenian — you hear words that you have known since your childhood and even understand whole phrases.
simp: 当你在听外语（或者不能说是外语吧！）的歌曲时 ﹣ 例如是斯洛伐克语、马其顿语或者是斯洛文尼亚语的歌曲时 ﹣ 你会听见一些你从小就懂得的字词，有时甚至会听懂一整句句子，然后，你的心里就会泛起一阵温暖的感觉。
trad: 當你在聽外語（或者不能說是外語吧！）的歌曲時 ﹣ 例如是斯洛伐克語、馬其頓語或者是斯洛文尼亞語的歌曲時 ﹣ 你會聽見一些你從小就懂得的字詞，有時甚至會聽懂一整句句子，然後，你的心裏就會泛起一陣溫暖的感覺。

eng: How about a cup of coffee? "I'd like to, but I have a previous engagement."
simp: 「赏面一起去喝杯咖啡吗？」「真不好意思，我已经约了人了。」
trad: 「賞面一起去喝杯咖啡嗎？」「真不好意思，我已經約了人了。」

eng: That's why ostrich meat costs more than twice as much as beef and pork.
simp: 这就是驼鸟肉比牛肉和猪肉贵两倍多的原因了。
trad: 這就是駝鳥肉比牛肉和豬肉貴兩倍多的原因了。

eng: They shone like stars in the dark, dirty building.
simp: 在又黑又髒的大厦里，它们就像星星一样地闪耀着。
trad: 在又黑又髒的大廈裏，它們就像星星一樣地閃耀著。

eng: The load of the truck was in excess of three tons.
simp: 货车的载货量超过了三吨。
trad: 貨車的載貨量超過了三噸。

eng: The more people you know, the less time you have to see them.
simp: 认识的人愈多，见面的时间就愈少。
trad: 認識的人愈多，見面的時間就愈少。

eng: She is proud of her husband being rich.
simp: 她因为丈夫是有钱人而感到自豪。
trad: 她因為丈夫是有錢人而感到自豪。

eng: My boss tried to cop a feel but I slapped his hand before he got any further.
simp: 我老闆想佔我便宜，我便一掌拍了在他的手上，让他不能再毛手毛脚。
trad: 我老闆想佔我便宜，我便一掌拍了在他的手上，讓他不能再毛手毛腳。

eng: There's nothing more I can teach you.
simp: 我懂得的都已经倾囊相授了。
trad: 我懂得的都已經傾囊相授了。

eng: There's nothing more I can teach you.
simp: 我能够教你的就这麽多了。
trad: 我能夠教你的就這麼多了。

eng: John is as old as my brother.
The boy was naked to the waist.
This year's fashions are completely different from last year's.
simp: 今年的时尚潮流完全不同于去年。
trad: 今年的時尚潮流完全不同於去年。

eng: He has in his possession films that were never distributed to cinemas to protect them against piracy.
simp: 为了防止盗版，他有些电影从未在影院上映。
trad: 為了防止盜版，他有些電影從未在影院上映。

eng: I don't have time for a vacation this year.
Death is often compared to sleep.
simp: 我们常常把死亡比作睡眠。
trad: 我們常常把死亡比作睡眠。

eng: When was the castle built?
simp: 这座城堡是甚麽时候建成的？
trad: 這座城堡是甚麼時候建成的？

eng: What is the depth of the lake?
Only my mother really understands me.
simp: 母亲是唯一一个真正理解我的人。
trad: 母親是唯一一個真正理解我的人。

eng: In the end, because of the disease, he became unable to walk and had to use a motorized wheelchair to get around.
simp: 最后，他的病夺去了他走路的能力，想去哪儿也要用电动轮椅来代步。
trad: 最後，他的病奪去了他走路的能力，想去哪兒也要用電動輪椅來代步。

eng: I wonder whether man could live with only two hours' sleep a night.
simp: 不知道人每晚只睡两个小时，能不能生存下去呢？
trad: 不知道人每晚只睡兩個小時，能不能生存下去呢？

eng: During droughts, farmers are barely able to eke out a living.
simp: 发生旱灾的时候，农民很难维持生计。
trad: 發生旱災的時候，農民很難維持生計。

eng: Tom drank too much.
She had the courage to go and inquire about the results of the exam.
simp: 她有勇气去查询考试的结果。
trad: 她有勇氣去查詢考試的結果。

eng: It is not easy to learn a foreign language.
She's my wife.
I overslept because my alarm didn't go off.
simp: 因为闹铃没有响，所以我继续睡下去了。
trad: 因為鬧鈴沒有響，所以我繼續睡下去了。

eng: He's not very strict about this.
simp: 他在这方面不是很严格。
trad: 他在這方面不是很嚴格。

eng: My opinion is the opposite.
The room originally had no furniture.
simp: 本来这间房间里没有家具。
trad: 本來這間房間裏沒有家具。

eng: This is an adverb.
The amount of time someone is willing to spend on something may communicate how important it is to him.
simp: 从一个人在某件事上肯花多少时间，就能看出这件事对这个人有多重要。
trad: 從一個人在某件事上肯花多少時間，就能看出這件事對這個人有多重要。

eng: I can't quite figure out what that chord around 1:58 is. Can somebody help me out?
simp: 我听来听去也听不到一分五十八秒左右的那个和弦是甚麽和弦，有人可以帮帮我吗？
trad: 我聽來聽去也聽不到一分五十八秒左右的那個和弦是甚麼和弦，有人可以幫幫我嗎？

eng: I have been a keyboardist at a local band for three years.
simp: 我在一队本地乐队中担任键琴手已有三年的时间。
trad: 我在一隊本地樂隊中擔任鍵琴手已有三年的時間。

eng: Egg tarts, when freshly baked, are a real delicacy.
simp: 新鲜出炉的蛋挞味道一流。
trad: 新鮮出爐的蛋撻味道一流。

eng: I've never had Chinese food.
Do you like eating fish?
Could you show me the way to the bus stop?
She kept walking about the room.
simp: 她不断在房间里走来走去。
trad: 她不斷在房間裏走來走去。

eng: I have no more money in my wallet.
simp: 我的钱包里已经没有钱了。
trad: 我的錢包裏已經沒有錢了。

eng: She resides in New York.
Human beings communicate in many ways.
simp: 人和人之间沟通的方法有很多种。
trad: 人和人之間溝通的方法有很多種。

eng: That is no business of yours.
There must be some misunderstanding between us.
She and I are in the same class.
He wrote a book about a jungle adventure.
simp: 他写了一本关于丛林冒险的书。
trad: 他寫了一本關於叢林冒險的書。

eng: We should pass on our culture to the next generation.
simp: 我们应当把文化传承到下一代。
trad: 我們應當把文化傳承到下一代。

eng: He promised to come, but he didn't come.
simp: 他保证过会来却没有来。
trad: 他保證過會來卻沒有來。

eng: I can't find my girlfriend's clitoris.
simp: 我找不到我女朋友的阴蒂。
trad: 我找不到我女朋友的陰蒂。

eng: Does the room have air conditioning?
I don't think it'll rain this afternoon.
simp: 我想今天下午不会下雨。
trad: 我想今天下午不會下雨。

eng: Please refer to page ten.
As soon as we are born, the world gets to work on us and transforms us from merely biological into social units.
simp: 我们一出生在这个世界上，就会开始受到周遭环境的影响，从生物单位慢慢进化成社会单位。
trad: 我們一出生在這個世界上，就會開始受到周遭環境的影響，從生物單位慢慢進化成社會單位。

eng: Tom often goes shopping alone.
simp: 汤姆常常一个人去买东西。
trad: 湯姆常常一個人去買東西。

eng: Once you have begun to do anything, never give it up.
I'm not a magician.
Don't look down on him merely because he is poor.
simp: 不要因为他穷就看不起他。
trad: 不要因為他窮就看不起他。

eng: They knelt down and prayed that the war would end soon.
simp: 他们跪了下来祈祷，希望战争快点结束。
trad: 他們跪了下來祈禱，希望戰爭快點結束。

eng: Some national parks offer showers and even baby-sitting services.
simp: 有些国家公园设有淋浴间，甚至还会提供託儿服务。
trad: 有些國家公園設有淋浴間，甚至還會提供託兒服務。

eng: Silvio Berlusconi is an Italian politician, the current Prime Minister of Italy, as well as a successful entrepreneur.
simp: 西尔维奥·贝卢斯科尼除了是一位意大利政治家和现任的意大利总理，也是一个成功的商人。
trad: 西爾維奧·貝盧斯科尼除了是一位意大利政治家和現任的意大利總理，也是一個成功的商人。

eng: This is the best dictionary that I have.
simp: 这本是我拥有的字典之中最好的一本。
trad: 這本是我擁有的字典之中最好的一本。

eng: He wrenched the letter from my hand.
simp: 他把信从我的手中抢了过去。
trad: 他把信從我的手中搶了過去。

eng: We will deal with this problem in Chapter Three.
simp: 我们在第三章讨论这个问题。
trad: 我們在第三章討論這個問題。

eng: I've seen a lot of him recently.
Never say never.
Promises are made to be broken.
He doesn't know the difference between right and wrong.
I like China.
Tomorrow I'm going to Paris.
I am vegan.
I don't eat pork, beef or eggs.
simp: 猪肉，牛肉，鸡蛋我都不吃。
trad: 豬肉，牛肉，雞蛋我都不吃。

eng: Have you eaten?
Hello, I'm so hungry!
But, I don't eat even a little bit of meat.
simp: 但是，我一点儿肉也不吃。
trad: 但是，我一點兒肉也不吃。

eng: Why don't you give me a few suggestions?
As long as there's no meat, anything is fine.
Did you already eat at home?
Don't let others do what you yourself don't like.
simp: 别让他人干你自己不喜欢的事。
trad: 別讓他人幹你自己不喜歡的事。

eng: You are my mother.
Put the tomato salad in the refrigerator.
simp: 把蕃茄沙拉放进冰箱里。
trad: 把蕃茄沙拉放進冰箱裏。

eng: If you don't eat, you die.
She asked me to continue writing to your father.
simp: 她叫我继续写信给你的父亲。
trad: 她叫我繼續寫信給你的父親。

eng: I had two cups of coffee.
She has beautiful eyes.
At what time did you hear the gunshot?
simp: 你是在甚麽时候听到那一下枪声的？
trad: 你是在甚麼時候聽到那一下槍聲的？

eng: I'm too tired to do anything right now.
simp: 我现在累得甚麽也不想做了。
trad: 我現在累得甚麼也不想做了。

eng: We have enough time to catch the train.
simp: 我们有足够的时间赶上那班火车。
trad: 我們有足夠的時間趕上那班火車。

eng: Could you repeat that?
Sometimes we need to look back to know where we are going to.
simp: 有时我们必须回望过去，才能看清前程。
trad: 有時我們必須回望過去，才能看清前程。

eng: Do I have to be hospitalized?
How is the weather today?
It seems that the policeman in this TV series is a dirty cop who abuses his authority.
simp: 这套电视剧里的惊察似乎是个滥用职权的坏蛋。
trad: 這套電視劇裏的驚察似乎是個濫用職權的壞蛋。

eng: You have to acquire real skills, not just superficial knowledge.
simp: 你要学的是实实在在的技能，而不单是表面的知识。
trad: 你要學的是實實在在的技能，而不單是表面的知識。

eng: In many cases, the image that comes to mind when you listen to music is that of the CD's artwork.
simp: 听歌时脑海里浮起的图像，许多时候都是唱片的封面。
trad: 聽歌時腦海裏浮起的圖像，許多時候都是唱片的封面。

eng: She seems timid, but she's actually a strong-willed person.
simp: 她看起来可能有点畏首畏尾的，但她的意志其实十分坚强。
trad: 她看起來可能有點畏首畏尾的，但她的意誌其實十分堅強。

eng: He wiped his hands on a handkerchief.
Are these all your belongings?
simp: 这些东西全都是你的吗？
trad: 這些東西全都是你的嗎？

eng: I have much in common with him.
The passing car splashed muddy water on me.
simp: 车子经过的时候把泥水溅到了我的身上。
trad: 車子經過的時候把泥水濺到了我的身上。

eng: How many hats do you own?
The patient is getting worse and worse day by day.
The hearing acuity of dogs is superior by far to that of humans.
simp: 狗的听觉比人类灵敏不知多少倍。
trad: 狗的聽覺比人類靈敏不知多少倍。

eng: He placed emphasis on the importance of education.
simp: 他强调了教育的重要性。
trad: 他強調了教育的重要性。

eng: The first thing you have to take into consideration is time.
simp: 你应该考虑的第一件事是时间。
trad: 你應該考慮的第一件事是時間。

eng: Wolves won't usually attack people.
simp: 一般来说，狼不会攻击人。
trad: 一般來說，狼不會攻擊人。

eng: We'll have a barbecue at the beach.
Mario is an Italian citizen.
You have already eaten.
You have already eaten.
He has already eaten.
She has already eaten.
The frog in the well.
Where is Mississippi?
I gave the house to you.
She is a noted singer.
I found a beautiful shell on the shore.
simp: 我在海滩上发现了一个漂亮的贝壳。
trad: 我在海灘上發現了一個漂亮的貝殼。

eng: Get out of my house!
I never spoke to him after that.
simp: 之后我再也没跟他说过话。
trad: 之後我再也沒跟他說過話。

eng: I was frightened by the sight.
I'm sleepy.
Tom doesn't have a microwave oven.
He ran into the room.
This product claims to help you lose weight.
simp: 这个产品称它能帮助你减肥。
trad: 這個產品稱它能幫助你減肥。

eng: The boy is full of promise.
You gain nothing by speaking ill of others.
simp: 通过诋毁别人，你得不到什么。
trad: 通過詆毀別人，你得不到什麼。

eng: This is a beautiful flower.
The entire world desires peace.
Mary is going to help us tomorrow.
We can not be too careful in operating a nuclear power plant.
simp: 我们再怎么认真管理核电站也不为过。
trad: 我們再怎麼認真管理核電站也不為過。

eng: Harvard was founded in 1636.
See you at the party.
Let's ask if it's true.
simp: 让我们来问问这是不是真的。
trad: 讓我們來問問這是不是真的。

eng: This is the town I told you about.
simp: 这就是我跟你说的那个镇。
trad: 這就是我跟你說的那個鎮。

eng: Let's get started.
He pulled up the weed and threw it away.
How do you feel now?
His greatest fault is talking too much.
simp: 他最大的缺点就是话太多。
trad: 他最大的缺點就是話太多。

eng: Meat or fish?
They came all the way from Brazil.
Tom hugged Mary.
He asked the man to help him.
I've worked here for ten years.
simp: 我在这里已经工作十年了。
trad: 我在這裏已經工作十年了。

eng: All you need to do is just sit here.
simp: 你要做的只是坐在这儿。
trad: 你要做的只是坐在這兒。

eng: He made me a suit.
You should come visit us!
It'll soon be time for dinner.
We study music.
I hear that you play the piano.
The book was published in 1689.
I hope your wishes will come true.
Beware of the dog!
We went skiing in Canada.
There was only a little milk left in the bottle.
simp: 瓶子里只剩下一丁点牛奶。
trad: 瓶子裏只剩下一丁點牛奶。

eng: He was still in his teens when he founded a company.
simp: 他成立了自己的公司的时候还不到二十岁。
trad: 他成立了自己的公司的時候還不到二十歲。

eng: In reality black is not a color; it is the absence of color.
simp: 黑色其实不是一种颜色，而是一种没有颜色的状态。
trad: 黑色其實不是一種顏色，而是一種沒有顏色的狀態。

eng: Would you please lend me some money?
She used to live with him.
I'm glad to meet you, too, Mr Ito.
simp: 我也很高兴见到你，伊藤先生。
trad: 我也很高興見到你，伊藤先生。

eng: Coffee does harm to your stomach.
The wild beasts all gather.
What a stupid boy he is!
simp: 他是多傻的一个男孩啊！
trad: 他是多傻的一個男孩啊！

eng: He had no idea why his wife left him.
simp: 他不知道为什么他的妻子要离开他。
trad: 他不知道為什麼他的妻子要離開他。

eng: Please bring an ice bag.
Tom doesn't know how to have fun.
simp: 汤姆不知道怎样玩得开心。
trad: 湯姆不知道怎樣玩得開心。

eng: You can't see the forest behind the trees.
Tom encouraged Mary to learn how to speak French.
simp: 汤姆鼓励玛丽学着说法语。
trad: 湯姆鼓勵瑪麗學著說法語。

eng: He is getting along with his neighborhood.
The soldiers occupied the building.
simp: 士兵们占领了这个建筑。
trad: 士兵們占領了這個建築。

eng: She decided to marry him.
Ask him what to do next.
All good things must come to an end.
Achoo!
No student went to the party.
My parents' generation went through the war.
simp: 我父母那一代经历过战争。
trad: 我父母那一代經歷過戰爭。

eng: Tom wanted to take a shower.
You see what I mean?
The train for Cambridge leaves from Platform 5.
simp: 前往剑桥的列车将于五号月台开出。
trad: 前往劍橋的列車將於五號月臺開出。

eng: He had one daughter.
We ought to buy some new office equipment: the stuff we've got is out of date.
simp: 我们现在的办公室用品都过时了，得去买点新的了。
trad: 我們現在的辦公室用品都過時了，得去買點新的了。

eng: Sooner or later, his luck will run out.
simp: 他的运气迟早会用尽的。
trad: 他的運氣遲早會用盡的。

eng: You must not give up hope.
Who likes insects?
Brush your teeth before going to bed.
Tom began talking.
He is very tall.
The exhibition is now open.
He hit his head against a rock.
simp: 他的头撞倒了一块岩石。
trad: 他的頭撞倒了一塊巖石。

eng: She need not have paid the money.
I wanted to ask Tom how long he had lived in India.
simp: 我想问汤姆他在印度生活了多久。
trad: 我想問湯姆他在印度生活了多久。

eng: She cooked us a delicious dinner.
simp: 她为我们煮了一顿美味的晚餐。
trad: 她為我們煮了一頓美味的晚餐。

eng: You need not do it at once.
It is likely to rain again.
He doesn't exist.
I'm very happy.
The sun sets earlier in the winter.
simp: 在冬天，太阳下山比往常更早。
trad: 在冬天，太陽下山比往常更早。

eng: They tied the thief to the tree.
simp: 他们把小偷绑到了树上。
trad: 他們把小偷綁到了樹上。

eng: They left one after another.
simp: 他们一个接着一个地离开了。
trad: 他們一個接著一個地離開了。

eng: Don't leave the room.
We can't tell which is better.
simp: 我们无法辨别哪个更好。
trad: 我們無法辨別哪個更好。

eng: He's afraid that he might be late.
Please speak more clearly.
I don't like this.
Can I carry this on the plane?
simp: 我能把这个东西带到飞机上吗？
trad: 我能把這個東西帶到飛機上嗎？

eng: You may choose whichever you want.
simp: 你可以选择任何你想要的。
trad: 你可以選擇任何你想要的。

eng: They don't always obey their parents.
simp: 他们并不总是服从父母。
trad: 他們並不總是服從父母。

eng: He's pale because he's sick.
simp: 他病了，所以脸色显得苍白。
trad: 他病了，所以臉色顯得蒼白。

eng: Where is the cafeteria?
We happened to get on the same bus.
simp: 我们恰巧上了同一辆公交车。
trad: 我們恰巧上了同一輛公交車。

eng: He cannot afford to buy a car, much less a house.
simp: 他买不起一辆汽车，更不要说一套房子了。
trad: 他買不起一輛汽車，更不要說一套房子了。

eng: Why are you feigning innocence!
It's not you that she loves, it's me.
He isn't here because he's ill.
simp: 他不在这儿，因为他病了。
trad: 他不在這兒，因為他病了。

eng: The best way to predict the future is to create it yourself.
simp: 预知未来的最好方法就是自己创造未来。
trad: 預知未來的最好方法就是自己創造未來。

eng: I spent the whole day cleaning up the room.
simp: 我花了一整天来打扫房间。
trad: 我花了一整天來打掃房間。

eng: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
simp: 人人都想改变世界，但却没人打算过要改变自己。
trad: 人人都想改變世界，但卻沒人打算過要改變自己。

eng: No women like to wear a dress that another discarded. With men, they're not so choosy.
simp: 没有女人会喜欢穿二手裙子；可是二手男人呢，她们却照要不误。
trad: 沒有女人會喜歡穿二手裙子；可是二手男人呢，她們卻照要不誤。

eng: It is such a nice thing to say that I felt the need to say it.
simp: 这是多好的一件事，以至于我不吐不快。
trad: 這是多好的一件事，以至於我不吐不快。

eng: When will you come back to Italy?
She was absent from class.
Sixty minutes make an hour, and a minute is made up of sixty seconds.
simp: 六十分钟为一小时，一分钟由六十秒组成。
trad: 六十分鐘為一小時，一分鐘由六十秒組成。

eng: I'd like to discuss something with you.
simp: 我想和你讨论一些事情。
trad: 我想和你討論一些事情。

eng: It is a lot of fun to drive a car.
He married for money.
Enjoy your holidays.
George is five years senior to me.
The scientist is working on atomic energy.
simp: 这个科学家正在研究原子能。
trad: 這個科學家正在研究原子能。

eng: Is he Japanese?
Could you tell me where I can get a bus?
simp: 你能告诉我能在哪里上公交车吗？
trad: 你能告訴我能在哪裏上公交車嗎？

eng: Your question has no answer.
I tried to escape.
It's under the table.
The company went bankrupt.
His letter makes me uneasy.
A long day has passed on.
My father has been engaged in foreign trade for many years.
I prefer being poor to being rich.
simp: 我更愿意贫穷而不是富裕。
trad: 我更願意貧窮而不是富裕。

eng: A light bulb gives light.
They require me to work harder.
simp: 他们要求我更努力地工作。
trad: 他們要求我更努力地工作。

eng: I must go through the task by tomorrow.
simp: 我必须在明天之前完成任务。
trad: 我必須在明天之前完成任務。

eng: They have been married for four years.
He will assist this project.
Children need loving.
I had my brother repair my bicycle.
simp: 我让我哥修理我的自行车。
trad: 我讓我哥修理我的自行車。

eng: I haven't eaten lunch yet.
simp: 我现在还没有吃过午饭。
trad: 我現在還沒有吃過午飯。

eng: He knew he could not win.
simp: 他早就知道自己不会赢。
trad: 他早就知道自己不會贏。

eng: Have you ever seen such a nice film?
simp: 你看过这么好看的电影吗？
trad: 你看過這麼好看的電影嗎？

eng: Your book is on the desk.
That house is big.
Can he write this character?
She has asked the person at the front desk to connect her to that number.
simp: 她请了前台的人为她打那个号码。
trad: 她請了前臺的人為她打那個號碼。

eng: Sea turtles have a long lifespan.
He was under suspicion of being a spy.
This is smaller than that.
The rumor proved to be true.
The curtains make this room beautiful.
The monkey climbed up a tree.
Tom happened to meet Mary at the supermarket.
Apart from cats, I like animals.
Ow, the coffee is very hot!
I shouldn't have done it.
Tom has three older sisters.
All life is a dream, and dreams themselves are only dreams.
I dreamed a strange dream.
Once, Zhuangzi dreamed he was a butterfly, but when he woke up, he wasn't sure whether he was Zhuangzi who had dreamed being a butterfly or if he was a butterfly now dreaming he was Zhuangzi.
simp: 庄子曾梦见自己化身为蝶，当他醒来，他分不清是自己刚刚梦见自己变成蝴蝶呢，还是蝴蝶正梦见它变成了庄子。
trad: 莊子曾夢見自己化身為蝶，當他醒來，他分不清是自己剛剛夢見自己變成蝴蝶呢，還是蝴蝶正夢見它變成了莊子。

eng: She dreamed a strange dream.
I want to buy this dictionary.
He tried many different methods.
simp: 他尝试了许多不同的方法。
trad: 他嘗試了許多不同的方法。

eng: I was amazed at the fluency with which the boy spoke French.
simp: 那个男孩的一口法语流利得有点儿不可置信。
trad: 那個男孩的一口法語流利得有點兒不可置信。

eng: This function takes two parameters, the first one is the title of the window, the second one will be the title of the icon.
simp: 这个函数有两个参数，第一个是窗体的标题，另一个是图标的标题。
trad: 這個函數有兩個參數，第一個是窗體的標題，另一個是圖標的標題。

eng: If you want to use Chinese characters, be sure you've saved your files in the UTF-8 encoding.
simp: 如果你想使用中文字符，你应该以UTF-8编码来保存你的文件。
trad: 如果你想使用中文字符，你應該以UTF-8編碼來保存你的文件。

eng: Don't shut your eyes.
The letter is inside the envelope.
The next day, Isabela came back home.
simp: 伊莎贝拉第二天回家了。
trad: 伊莎貝拉第二天回家了。

eng: My pet is sick.
I feel smart... Pity... It's just a feeling...
simp: 我感觉自己很聪明。。。可惜。。。这只是个感觉。。。
trad: 我感覺自己很聰明。。。可惜。。。這只是個感覺。。。

eng: You don't need to go unless you want to.
Even a child knows right from wrong.
simp: 就连小孩子也会分辨是非黑白。
trad: 就連小孩子也會分辨是非黑白。

eng: What time did you arrive there?
simp: 你是在甚麽时候到达的？
trad: 你是在甚麼時候到達的？

eng: It's about time for dinner.
You can get it at a bookstore.
My father is rich.
My brother is rich.
My brother is rich.
Do you speak Chinese well?
The train tickets can be ordered online in a few days.
simp: 过两天就可以在网上订火车票了。
trad: 過兩天就可以在網上訂火車票了。

eng: After, cook it on a low flame for 30 minutes and you're done.
simp: 然后用慢火煮约三十分钟即成。
trad: 然後用慢火煮約三十分鐘即成。

eng: Everything has an end.
Are you full?
I have never tried Chinese food.
simp: 我从来没有吃过中国菜。
trad: 我從來沒有吃過中國菜。

eng: The restaurant can't be matched for good service.
simp: 这家餐馆的服务没有其它餐馆可以比得上。
trad: 這家餐館的服務沒有其它餐館可以比得上。

eng: I don't want to get my hands dirty.
The eye is the window of the soul.
I am not the least bit happy with this e-book revolution.
simp: 我完全不觉得书籍电子化是一件好事。
trad: 我完全不覺得書籍電子化是一件好事。

eng: Yesterday I read an interesting story.
simp: 我昨天看了一个挺有趣的故事。
trad: 我昨天看了一個挺有趣的故事。

eng: The interface of this website is somewhat pedestrian, but it’s simple.
simp: 这个网站的介面没有甚麽新意，但是却很简洁。
trad: 這個網站的介面沒有甚麼新意，但是卻很簡潔。

eng: I'm not going to hurt you.
I don't like being treated like a child.
simp: 我不喜欢给人当成小孩子般看待。
trad: 我不喜歡給人當成小孩子般看待。

eng: You can't attend? Why not?
Tom doesn't believe a word of what Mary just said.
simp: 玛莉刚才说的话汤姆一句也不信。
trad: 瑪莉剛才說的話湯姆一句也不信。

eng: To rule a country is no easy task.
simp: 统治一个国家不是一件简单的工作。
trad: 統治一個國家不是一件簡單的工作。

eng: Use your own words to retell the content of the lesson.
simp: 用自己的语言把课文内容复述。
trad: 用自己的語言把課文內容復述。

eng: We are anxious about her safety.
John was tired from working overtime.
If you had left home a little earlier you would have been in time.
simp: 如果你早点出门的话，你就能赶上了。
trad: 如果你早點出門的話，你就能趕上了。

eng: Tom did an excellent job.
I'm on your side.
The garbage-can gave off a bad smell.
The leaves of the trees in the garden have turned completely red.
simp: 花园里树上的叶子已经完全变红了。
trad: 花園裏樹上的葉子已經完全變紅了。

eng: Luckily he had enough money to pay the bill.
simp: 幸运的是他有足够的钱来付账。
trad: 幸運的是他有足夠的錢來付賬。

eng: We weren't told where he came from.
simp: 我们没有被告知他从哪里来。
trad: 我們沒有被告知他從哪裏來。

eng: They came up with a plan after a long discussion.
simp: 他们终于在漫长的讨论之后得出了一个计划。
trad: 他們終於在漫長的討論之後得出了一個計劃。

eng: I will be a doctor someday.
simp: 我有朝一日会成为一名医生。
trad: 我有朝一日會成為一名醫生。

eng: She lives a block away and her name is Susan.
simp: 她住在一个街区之外，名叫苏珊。
trad: 她住在一個街區之外，名叫蘇珊。

eng: I'll be in my office from ten tomorrow.
simp: 我明天十点起会在办公室里。
trad: 我明天十點起會在辦公室裏。

eng: Tom tried to kill Mary.
Making this matter public would have an effect on our sales, so we're going to overlook it this once.
simp: 公开此事会影响我们的销售，所以我们将忽略它一次。
trad: 公開此事會影響我們的銷售，所以我們將忽略它一次。

eng: The island lies to the west of Japan.
simp: 这个岛屿位于日本的西边。
trad: 這個島嶼位於日本的西邊。

eng: The meeting will take place next Sunday.
She is a singer without equal.
simp: 她是一名无人能敌的歌手。
trad: 她是一名無人能敵的歌手。

eng: Thousands of candles illuminated the church during the ceremony.
simp: 数以千计的蜡烛点亮了仪式中的教堂。
trad: 數以千計的蠟燭點亮了儀式中的教堂。

eng: I was at home.
My mother did nothing but weep.
simp: 我的母亲只是默默地哭泣。
trad: 我的母親只是默默地哭泣。

eng: She managed to finish the work on her own.
simp: 她想方设法以一己之力完成了工作。
trad: 她想方設法以一己之力完成了工作。

eng: Columbus argued that he could reach India by going west.
simp: 哥伦布提出，向西航行可以到达印度。
trad: 哥倫布提出，向西航行可以到達印度。

eng: He made over the interior of his house.
Although Hiroko dislikes cigarette smoke, she readily goes out drinking with friends.
simp: 虽然弘子不喜欢香烟的烟雾，她却乐意和朋友出去喝酒。
trad: 雖然弘子不喜歡香煙的煙霧，她卻樂意和朋友出去喝酒。

eng: Don't blame Tom for what Mary did.
simp: 别为玛丽犯的错责备汤姆。
trad: 別為瑪麗犯的錯責備湯姆。

eng: You can't count on their help.
simp: 你不能指望他们的帮助。
trad: 你不能指望他們的幫助。

eng: My sleep was disturbed by the sound.
Why is he hiding?
I am glad to hear that you know how she is called.
simp: 我很高兴听到你知道她叫什么。
trad: 我很高興聽到你知道她叫什麼。

eng: He has a heart of stone.
If he is innocent, it follows that his wife is guilty.
simp: 如果他是清白的，那他妻子就有罪。
trad: 如果他是清白的，那他妻子就有罪。

eng: That house appears deserted.
simp: 那幢房子看起来被遗弃了。
trad: 那幢房子看起來被遺棄了。

eng: I am very, very sorry.
The movie called "Paranormal Activity" was not that much good.
simp: 那部叫“鬼影实录”的电影并没那么好。
trad: 那部叫“鬼影實錄”的電影並沒那麼好。

eng: Bees are flying among the flowers.
It was before dawn that they got the fire under control.
simp: 他们在黎明前控制住了火势。
trad: 他們在黎明前控制住了火勢。

eng: He had plenty of fight left in him.
simp: 他的胸中还有足够的斗志。
trad: 他的胸中還有足夠的鬥誌。

eng: Many pupils are poor at algebra.
simp: 很多小学生学不好代数。
trad: 很多小學生學不好代數。

eng: I have climbed Mt. Fuji three times.
She continued that you should keep your promise.
simp: 她接下来说你应该遵守你的承诺。
trad: 她接下來說你應該遵守你的承諾。

eng: The ceremony began with his speech.
There is nothing worse than doing something in a half-hearted manner.
simp: 没有什么比做事缺乏热情更糟。
trad: 沒有什麼比做事缺乏熱情更糟。

eng: Leaving something unfinished is the worst thing you can do.
simp: 半途而废是你所能做的最糟糕的事情。
trad: 半途而廢是你所能做的最糟糕的事情。

eng: Are you a wizard?
He caught her by the arm.
You had better relax a bit.
Mary got the nod among some 500 applicants.
simp: 玛丽从大约500名申请者中脱颖而出。
trad: 瑪麗從大約500名申請者中脫穎而出。

eng: The number of people who go abroad has been increasing.
simp: 出国的人数一直在增加。
trad: 出國的人數一直在增加。

eng: Lucy might be able to help you, if you can't cook dinner for ten people alone.
simp: 露西也许能帮你的忙，如果你一人做不来十个人的晚饭。
trad: 露西也許能幫你的忙，如果你一人做不來十個人的晚飯。

eng: I know that it is highly unlikely that anyone knows me.
simp: 我知道有人认识我的可能性微乎其微。
trad: 我知道有人認識我的可能性微乎其微。

eng: When you go to Romania, you will visit Dracula's Castle.
simp: 当你去罗马尼亚的时候，你将会造访吸血鬼之王的城堡。
trad: 當你去羅馬尼亞的時候，你將會造訪吸血鬼之王的城堡。

eng: He wore a dark sweater.
It worried me that she looked pale.
simp: 她虚弱的样子让我捏了一把汗。
trad: 她虛弱的樣子讓我捏了一把汗。

eng: He will eventually ruin himself.
I must excuse myself from the task, because I am unequal to it.
simp: 我必须推掉这任务，因为我不能胜任。
trad: 我必須推掉這任務，因為我不能勝任。

eng: Our bodies respond to our feelings.
simp: 我们的身体会对我们的感情做出反应。
trad: 我們的身體會對我們的感情做出反應。

eng: You are our only hope.
He read the letter over and over.
simp: 他把信读了一遍又一遍。
trad: 他把信讀了一遍又一遍。

eng: Gulliver traveled in quest of adventure.
simp: 格列佛为寻求探险而旅行。
trad: 格列佛為尋求探險而旅行。

eng: That boy used to drop in on me.
He makes it a rule to take a walk every morning.
simp: 他给自己定下每天早上散步的规矩。
trad: 他給自己定下每天早上散步的規矩。

eng: I can't make out what he wants.
Iron the inside of collars first, and then the outside.
simp: 先熨烫领子的里面，然后是外面。
trad: 先熨燙領子的裏面，然後是外面。

eng: A policeman ran past.
Having no will is the worst handicap.
simp: 没有愿望是最大的障碍。
trad: 沒有願望是最大的障礙。

eng: Education is the path to happiness, peace, righteousness, and success.
simp: 教育是通往幸福、和平、正义与成功的道路。
trad: 教育是通往幸福、和平、正義與成功的道路。

eng: He is the law.
Just because it's in Tatoeba.org's database, doesn't mean it's a sentence.
simp: 在Tatoeba.org的数据库里并不意味着它是一个句子。
trad: 在Tatoeba.org的數據庫裏並不意味著它是一個句子。

eng: Tom understands what it takes to survive.
She lives in abundance.
I can't remember the meaning of the word that I looked up yesterday.
simp: 我记不起昨天查的那个词的意思了。
trad: 我記不起昨天查的那個詞的意思了。

eng: The capital of Brazil is Brasilia.
simp: 巴西的首都是巴西利亚。
trad: 巴西的首都是巴西利亞。

eng: The weather is nice tonight.
He may well be proud of his sons.
simp: 他完全可以为他的儿子们感到骄傲。
trad: 他完全可以為他的兒子們感到驕傲。

eng: Oh please!
Tom can't get over Mary.
Mother boiled ten eggs.
I found out where she was.
He lived a moral life.
Nobody else offered to help.
In her home, kitchen garbage was fed to the pigs.
simp: 在她家，泔水被喂给猪吃。
trad: 在她家，泔水被餵給豬吃。

eng: He has been ill in bed for four days.
Tom had no reason to be angry.
She beckoned me to come in.
All the members made much of her opinion.
simp: 所有成员都极为重视她的意见。
trad: 所有成員都極為重視她的意見。

eng: Later he wrote to the president.
He came to my house on the pretext of seeing me.
simp: 他打着见我的幌子来了我家。
trad: 他打著見我的幌子來了我家。

eng: When did your friend leave for America?
simp: 你朋友是什么时候出发去美国的？
trad: 你朋友是什麼時候出發去美國的？

eng: Samuel helps anyone that asks him.
simp: 萨缪尔帮助所有拜托他帮忙的人。
trad: 薩繆爾幫助所有拜托他幫忙的人。

eng: She finds it a little distasteful.
simp: 她发现这有点令她不快。
trad: 她發現這有點令她不快。

eng: I had lost a camera the previous day.
simp: 我前一天丢了一台相机。
trad: 我前一天丟了一臺相機。

eng: I don't care a rap.
Oh, OK. See you. But drive carefully.
simp: 哦，好吧。再见。但是开车要小心。
trad: 哦，好吧。再見。但是開車要小心。

eng: But the farmer smiled at him.
He said Davis must be captured.
simp: 他说戴维斯必须被抓住。
trad: 他說戴維斯必須被抓住。

eng: The statue of Hachiko, the faithful dog, stands in front of Shibuya Station.
simp: 忠犬八公的凋像伫立在涩谷站前。
trad: 忠犬八公的雕像佇立在澀谷站前。

eng: He is as great a scientist as ever lived.
simp: 他是一位前无古人的大科学家。
trad: 他是一位前無古人的大科學家。

eng: He watched from away.
Sorry, I was dining and I didn't see the message.
simp: 抱歉，我刚才在吃饭，没有看到信息。
trad: 抱歉，我剛才在吃飯，沒有看到信息。

eng: He amassed a fortune in stock trading during the last boom.
simp: 他在上个景气时期炒股攒下了一笔钱。
trad: 他在上個景氣時期炒股攢下了一筆錢。

eng: We arrived at a small town in Hokkaido.
simp: 我们到达了北海道的一个小镇。
trad: 我們到達了北海道的一個小鎮。

eng: While we were discussing the problem, I hit upon a good idea.
simp: 在我们讨论问题的过程中，我想到了一个好主意。
trad: 在我們討論問題的過程中，我想到了一個好主意。

eng: We went all out to get the job done.
simp: 我们全力以赴来完成工作。
trad: 我們全力以赴來完成工作。

eng: Suddenly the horse began to run about wildly.
I heard the manager's wife is on vacation. And, well, when the cat's away, the mice play. Now he's out partying every night.
simp: 我听说经理的妻子出去度假了。这时就是山中无老虎，猴子称大王了。现在经理他夜夜笙箫。
trad: 我聽說經理的妻子出去度假了。這時就是山中無老虎，猴子稱大王了。現在經理他夜夜笙簫。

eng: Sicily is hot in summer.
The whole audience erupted in laughter.
His house isn't far from this store.
It is generally accepted that a person cannot be successful in life without a lot of hard work.
simp: 人们普遍认为吃得苦中苦，方为人上人。
trad: 人們普遍認為吃得苦中苦，方為人上人。

eng: Put a record on the stereo.
simp: 往立体声音响上放一枚唱片。
trad: 往立體聲音響上放一枚唱片。

eng: Tom made a list of places he wants to visit.
simp: 汤姆把他想去的地方列成了一张清单。
trad: 湯姆把他想去的地方列成了一張清單。

eng: The name rang a bell in me.
The emigrants have endured physical and mental pain.
simp: 移民们忍受着肉体和精神的痛苦。
trad: 移民們忍受著肉體和精神的痛苦。

eng: Let me buy you another one.
How are you keeping off this intense heat?
simp: 你是怎么避开这酷暑的？
trad: 你是怎麼避開這酷暑的？

eng: His behavior is worthy of respect.
These apples look very fresh.
simp: 这些苹果看起来很新鲜。
trad: 這些蘋果看起來很新鮮。

eng: He has completely lost all sense of duty.
This road will lead you to the airport.
They started in spite of the heavy rain.
simp: 他们冒着倾盆大雨出发了。
trad: 他們冒著傾盆大雨出發了。

eng: As for me, I have nothing to say.
I am sorry. I am not from here.
I've not seen him in a long time.
All right! You will be sorry for this.
I don't have the slightest intention of retiring.
simp: 我没有一点退休的念头。
trad: 我沒有一點退休的念頭。
